Everyone is trading simultaneously, so act fast to get the cards you need, and bluff your opponents into taking the bad cards from your hand.
The second phase is the Build Phase, where you use the cards you received in the previous phase to build your Tall Tower. Of course it is not as easy as it sounds. You must play the cards in the order you received them, you cannot rearrange your hand. Some cards are good and will help you finish up the next floor of your Tower, or they could be bad and send cracks through a few of the stones you gathered during the Resource Phase.
The Players go through 8 Rounds (of 5 cards each) alternating between these 2 phases, and the one with the Tallest Tower wins. There is lots of chaos during trading, lots of speculation between players as they try to talk each other into taking their cards, and lots of fun as you flip over your resources and see how good you did or how bad you crumbled.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Medieval, Real-time

name: Expat-Abenteuer
description:
Expat-Abenteuer is designed to prepare players, particularly families with children, for moving abroad. There are several expansions for specific countries.

The players roll and move along a track. The goal is to earn "expat points". The points are awarded by cards, other cards send the players forward or back. The cards can be kept for future use, but when certain points on the track are reached, the players have to discard them and receive negative points for them.
Whenever a player draws a card, another player can also force one of his/her cards on him/her, making the "trip" less predictable.
The first player to reach the end of the track gets some bonus points. The player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset Japan
description: Japan expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to Japan.

name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset China
description: China expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to China.

name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset Korea
description: Korea expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to Korea.

name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset Tschechien
description: Czech Republic expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to the Czech Republic.

name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset Indien
description: India expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to India.

name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset USA
description: USA expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to the USA.

name: Round-A-Corner
description: A simple spin-and-move game in which the object is to advance both of one's tokens from "Start" to "Home". One twist is that the spinner's numbers are divided into "Up", "Down", and "Round-A-Corner" zones. The players must spin within the appropriate zone to advance one of their pieces.

name: Sold!
description:
A new town has recently been developed near your neighborhood, full of office towers, shopping malls and housing estates. Can you outbid the other tycoons and be the one to cash in on this prospering town?

Sold! is an extremely mean auction game where players vie for control over the new properties in town. Over a series of 25 rounds, players bid for coloured cubes which are used to exert influences over the sales of individual properties. Will you channel your financial might on the office towers? Or will you bet on monopolizing the retail scene? Only the most cunning and opportunistic businessman will stand a chance to win!

Be wary though, there plenty of opportunities for your competitors to foil your most well laid plans!
categories: Card Game, Economic, Negotiation, Print & Play

name: Blazing Skies
description:
Flying Officer Stumpy Prangsworthy’s handlebar moustache streamed behind him in the 280mph wind as he craned his head round trying to locate where Von Strudels Focke Wulf 190 A8 had gone to. Deep within the cloud, the spineless Boche had shown his true colours and escaped Stumpys righteous justice. The growling Merlin engine sang a new song as he side-slipped his trusty Supermarine Spitfire down towards the now helpless Dornier 17.
The Dornier was almost at the target and in scant moments would land at the brewery and snatch No14 Squadrons Claret from under their noses. Well Stumpy would see about that. He loosed the safety off of his eight .303’s and aimed at the Dorniers port engine.
Suddenly from behind screaming out of a wingunder manoeuvre the FW 190 appeared in Stumpys vanity mirror, its cannons sparkling motes of fire. A shell smashed into the Spits wing and tore the aileron. “Blast you, Von Strudel “yelled Stumpy as he realised that he had been sold a duffer and was gone for a burton. Only one trick could save him. Feathering his Kites prop, he hit the airbrakes and was rewarded with the bright green FW 190 flashing under him. Dropping the nose Stumpy let rip a corking burst which caught the Jerry a treat. Flames poured from the FW 190’s engine and Von Strudel Hit the Silk.
Von Strudel shook his fist as Stumpy flashed past. “Verdammt Englander! Finish me now! The shame is too great!”
“Not a chance old pip,” grinned Stumpy; “A Englishman flies by the rules of the game, and potting a Chap on his chute is defiantly not playing the game.”
So what is playing the game? You are about to find out!

Blazing Skies is a Tactical WW2 Flight combat game. Each player takes control of a WW2 aircraft and battles his/her opponents in fast paced duels to the death. The roar of engines, the rattle of dice , the contrails streaming from wingtips and the chugging down of pints of claret. Its all here in Blazing Skies.

45 full colour pages of rules, background, templates, charts, diagrams and quick reference sheets
Six exciting scenarios and one boring one.
A physics model that simulates the effects of gravity, engine power, high energy manouvers.
A campaign game that rewards skillful pilots
Take offs!
Landings!
Prangings!
Collisions!
Gongs!
Random Events!
A huge list of literally hundreds of WW2 and interwar aircraft.Evrything from the mundane to the mad with more on the way!
Support via email and forums
Clouds
Flack
Bombing
Pilots personal skill
Idiosyncratic Aircraft that behave like their real life counterparts! Except in model form! if its a avro Manchester, it will handle like slop and struggle at altitude, its engines will also overheat!
Updates to new kites and scenarios as and when I get round to doing em.
This is a truely epic set of WW2 rules and is set to become the benchmark for Air Combat games. it is designed for 1/144 or 1/72 scale aircraft and a dogfight is easily playable in 30 mins. Multiplane fights are easily fought to a conclusion in a hour.

The Luftwaffe trained its best pilots in WW2 using these rules.*

The rules are easy to pick up and play and have plenty of examples. in fact, you start off at RAF Debden where the Sq ldr will take you through your first flight.


Not actually true


Dust off your old airfix kits or FOW 1/144 planes and put in an order to Topgunmarketing for some flightstands.

Chocks Away!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Humor, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Chessapeak Porta-Checkers
description:
[From the back cover]

Basic things you need to understand and then you can play Checkers with a partner.

Partners: face each other and each player plays in turn in a clockwise direction.

All checker pieces: move or jump according to the Standard Rules of Checkers

...Except...


each single checker changes its forward direction only once...when it moves or lands in or beyond a square with double lines. NOW, the checker piece is directed to its nearest opponent..."very easy" to follow on the game board.



Double lines have no meaning to KINGS.


Object of the game:
Each player will try to jump and capture all of his two opponents' pieces.

To Win:
All opponents' pieces must be captured or blocked. A blocked checker piece cannot move. Otherwise, the game is a DRAW.

Cutthroat (2, 3 or 4 players): each player plays independently.

name: Damn You, Too
description: An Expansion for Damn You, aka Wrath of the Ancients. The quest for petty revenge! New cards, new tiles, new variations to try … same Damn fun but with more celestial backstabbing!

name: Battle for Britain
description:
Flaps, Throttle, Chocks Away! The glamour, mystique and courage of the battle of Britain is brought to life in this elegant design of that great campaign that marked the end of the beginning of the greatest Conflict in History. Take command of the German or Commonwealth air fleets as you battle it out over the skies of London and England desperately trying to save your country from destruction from the sky.

Battle for Britain is a stand alone boxed game that is fast paced, easy to learn but tough to master game covering the entire air war over Britain during those critical months of August and September 1940 when the world held its breath as to the outcome. Containing a unique hidden movement system, a wide variety of units and a rich array of strategic detail, Battle for Britain gives you everything you need to re-fight the greatest air battle in history. Can Germany knock out England’s air defences preparatory to an invasion of the plucky little island or can England repel the Nazi sky hordes and begin preparing for the time when she can return democracy to Europe? Now as Air Chief Marshal Hugh Dowding or Generalfeldsmarschall Hermann Goering you can find out.

Battle for Britain contains:
• 1 large map (1168mm x 820mm) (46" x 32")
• 400 full colour counters
• 1 Rule book
• 2 Hidden unit displays
• 2 Combat Charts
• 1 Rule book
• 5 x 12-sided dice

name: AD HOP
description:
In AD HOP both players try to move their pawns form one edge of the board to the opposite edge. To reach their goal, they have to move boats on the river by tactical playing movement-tokens.
A further element in the game is driftwood that can be placed in order to frustrate your oppenents plans (a mechanic well known form Quoridor)

name: 12 Men on the Field
description:
12 Men on the Field:Deluxe Edition lets you be the owner of a professional football franchise. It is based on football as it is played in the United States. You follow your team through a 14 week season and, with good play calling and some luck, into the playoffs.

The Zeppelin Edition lets you watch the game like a true fan. Cheer for the touchdown, complain about the bad penalty calls, berate your coach for going for it on 4th and 25 yards to go...

The Sideline Edition lets you call the plays. Will you run on 1st and 10? Pass? Mix it up a little to keep your opponent’s defense guessing? That 4th and 25 isn’t such a no brainer when you are behind with two minutes left to play. The Sideline Edition is an add-on to the Zeppelin Edition.

Two great ways to play American Football.

name: Bai
description:
Bai is played on a board with 9x10 squares.
Players place markers (paths) on a square to build a path or move one of their pawns on a path. Used paths are removed. If there are too many paths in one area, they are all removed. If a player cannot move any more, he loses the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Der 7. Zwerg
description:
Der 7. Zwerg (The 7th dwarf) is an abstract capturing game played on a board with 35 squares arranged in a spiral two squares wide.
If you jump over a dwarf, this one is removed from the game and replaced by one of yours.
The player how has all 7 of his dwarfes in play / removed all opponents dawarfs wins the game.

name: WR: Jogo Casas do Benfica
description:
"This is a XXI century society game, a board game of the 2nd generation to play with family or friends of all ages (from 8 years).

This is a race through "CASAS DO BENFICA DE PORTUGAL", covering a virtual distance of approximately 2,500 kms, with departure and arrival at the Stadium of Light in Lisbon. Participants in the game - 2-6 - position in the area of departure - LISBON, each participant sequentially turn the ROULETTE wheel and obey the instructions, you can receive positive kms (Pin progresses), negative kms (Pin backs), crossings of motorways, HELI-TRANSPORT, LETTERS SPECIAL BONUS...

WINS THE MATCH who first returns to the Stadium of Light - LISBON. "

From publishers web site

name: Marines the game
description: This game appears to be somewhat similar to Wheeler Dealer, which offers differently branded versions of the game through different community organizations, typically the Chamber of Commerce of that city. MARINES, THE GAME, appears to be a roll and move game, with property, two event decks, and a victory condition based on having the most cash.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der Weg des Königs
description:
Der Weg des Königs (The King´s Path) is played on a Board of 4x10 rectangles.
The aim of the game is to get your king safe to the oppisite side of the board or to capture the opponents king with one of your henchman. The king does not move across the vacant land, so you fave to develop ractangels to pathes first. For this, you control a third kind of character, an architect.

name: Morphisto
description:
Morphisto is a capturing game played on a board of 9x8 squares.
It is played with 4 kinds of meeples.

Morphisto: A shape-shifter whose movement range is indicated by rings he wears, but looses after the movement.
Cangoo: The most agile one.
Scarab: Comparable with pawns
Palazzo: Comparable to the general in Xiang Qi

The aim of the game is not to capture the opponents palazzo, but to immobilize him.

name: Mutaris
description:
Mutaris is a connection game played with 77 2-coloured balls on a square 9x9 without the 4 areas in the corners.
Each player has to build roads of balls in his colour form one edge to the opposite edge by rotating 14 balls each turn.
Plyers score points for each road they build.

name: Rififi
description:
Rififi is a capturing game played on a square 7x7 without the corner fields. In field in the middle of a board i a fountain you can fall in, similar to the holes known from in Arima.
Each player contriles 8 simmilar fighters.
The aim of the game is to knock out all opponents either by pulling them into the fountain or by attacking them where they are. There are some special movement rules.
You can not move away from an opponent.
You can stumble over another fighters lying on the ground.
Attacked fighters reach diffent states. They loos thier hat, than they fall, but can stand up and fially they are knocked out.

name: Wink Tennis
description:
Instruction manual introduction:

Here's a new "portable" table tennis game whose lively action folks of all ages enjoy, from the five-year-olds up to the adults in the family! It has the came [sic] court and the same scoring as table tennis, but you "snap the Wink" instead of hitting the ball. The Wink-on-a-String never gets lost, so WINK TENNIS can be played anywhere, even on trips or when sick-a-bed, etc. Two players can play Singles; or 4 players can play Doubles.

name: Mugen: Spell of Mirage
description:
A fan-made card game based on the characters from Project Shrine Maiden (Touhou Project). A two-player versus card game in the style of Magic: the Gathering, as the players play characters, spells and interrupts on each other, trying to bring the opponent's life points down to zero.

Translated box back:
Easy to grasp, yet deep! A new card game using the characters!

A new type of card game where the player uses cards depicting all the lovable characters from Project Shrine Maiden, builds his own deck and gets to battle with it.

name: CATONKA
description:
Catonka is a combination of a tile placement and capturing game.
First, players place rectangles and squares of different size on the board and place their armies with different strength on them. After all fields and armies are placed, the capturing begins. An army can only move on an adjacent filed with a weaker unit on it, which than is captured. After no more capture is possible (units can't move without capturing), the player with the largest army leftover wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Pocahontas Electronic Talking Board Game
description:
From the description on the box:

"Actual voices and sound effects from the movie direct game play and guide Pocahontas through the Enchanted Glade towards Captain John Smith. Try to be the first to bring the two together, with help from your animal friends... but watch out for ruthless Governor Ratcliffe!"

This game features a keyboard device that the children press to generate the voices and sound effects. There is also a colorful 3-D playing surface plus some character stands representing the Indian maiden and the explorer. Movement is determined by a spinner. Designed for kids ages 3 to 6 years old with no reading required to play the game.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monster Matsch
description:
The players form monsters from play-do (using templates) und uses these to race along a track. They roll and move the number rolled, adding 2 when ending on a field with a shamrock symbol. When they roll a hammer, though, another player can use the hammer and smash the monster which then has to be rebuilt and start at the beginning again. The first monster to reach the finish line is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Spaceport Criminal Escape
description:
Spaceport Criminal Escape is a cooperative game, set on a planetary space station far into the future.
During the game players become one of earth’s most wanted criminals (a thief, forger, hacker, smuggler and assassin) who are attempting to flee earth to avoid trial. In order to escape they must purchase a ticket to board an outbound ship. At the same time they must avoid being recognised and arrested by the station’s patrols.

During the game the players move around the station attempting to collect enough money in order to purchase a ticket to escape, with each character having its own way to do so e.g. The thief steals wallets while at luggage stations while the hacker steals money from currency terminals (ATMs). Once a player has enough money to escape they purchase a ticket from the ticket office and move to the embarkation area where they become “Safe”.

name: Mijn Eerste Van Dale Liedjesbingo
description:
A bingo game with a CD for a bingo-caller. While you listen to the songs on the CD or read the card, you look quickly for the referred word on your bingo card. If so, then you place a chip on the word.
The first player who filled his card with 9 chips, call 'Bingo!' and wins the game.

Contents:
- CD with 28 songs
- 6 cards
- chips
- 4 bingo sheets
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Schatzinsel
description: Schatzinsel is an easy dice-driven race game for kids. You run around an island on a stated path, the number of steps is indicated by a 6-sided dice. If you reach a field with treasure, you can pick it up. If all are picked, the players have to return to the ship. The player with the most treasure wins, if there is a tie, the moment you reached the ship is the tiebreaker.

name: Table Talk
description:
Welcome to "Table Talk". The Greeks had a word for it, Deipnosophy, from the words Deipnon - dinner, and Sophist - wise man, which when combined mean Skilled in Dining and Table Talk!

Stimulating and fun to play, this gourmet After-Dinner Game combines Luck, Skill & Team Strategy to win.

-(from the box cover)

"Table Talk" is a food-related trivia game. Each team receives a "Menu" of 600 questions and answers, and appoints a "Chef" (team captain) to ask the questions of the opposing team, operate the timer, record the score, etc. Each chef, in turn, will ask successive players on the opposing team a question: if the team confers (answering "Table d'hôte") and answer correctly, they score a point; however, if the player asked chooses to answer without conferring with his teammates ("À la carte"), a correct answer scores 2 points.

Each page of the Menu provides questions in the following categories, in order: Starters; Main Course; Side Dishes; Desserts, Savouries & Cheese Board; Wine List; and Culinary Trivia - "Table Talk". Questions must be asked in the order they appear in the Menu: players do not have a choice of the category of the question. Note: A number of culinary anecdotes ("Jokers") have been randomly inserted in place of a question; a player who receives a Joker scores a point without having to answer a question.

The game is recommended for 4-12 players, split into two teams.

Game components:

2 Menus, each containing 600 questions (1200 total) and the rules
2 coloured page clips - one for each Menu - to mark the current question
2 score indicators
2 score indicator stands
Egg timer


-(user summary)

name: DéfiZen
description:
The game consists of 20 pieces, all of which are differently shaped. There are several suggestions for solitaire puzzles, but also a multiplayer game idea:

An architect and a master builder are chosen from among the players. The other players are builders. The master builder choses a piece as the base, the architect adds another piece on top of it (the pieces are interlocking). Then all players take turns adding another piece. The "building" has to remain stable and it is not allowed to block the next player. The players may hold the building while adding their piece; when they think it is stable they let go. If it collapses, the player who caused that is penalized, so is the architect. If all pieces are used up, all players get points with the architect getting a bonus. Several rounds are played and points are noted. When the players decide to end the game, the player with most points is the winner.

There are several versions of this game, using different materials: wood, aluminum etc.

name: Play Like A Champion Boardgame
description:
Each player starts his / her own penalty area, aiming at the enemy from 16 meters out. As you come through a good question to answer, divided into six categories and three levels. Throwing of two dice determines how difficult (or easy) the question and the category is. Got a question correctly, you may continue to dribble on the basis of the direction that the back of the card prescribes.
In addition you must think carefully about the choices you make, because you can get a red or yellow card. An injury makes you one turn to watch from the dug-out, a yellow card forces you to skip a turn. If you collect two yellow cards or a direct red then you move back to your own penalty area and from there to set up a new attack.
If you reach the penalty area of your opponent and you answer the question correctly, then you score a goal and you have won.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Charlie Chaplin Card Game
description:
An "educational" card game by Bubbles Inc. Published in 1972. A rummy game featuring Charlie Chaplin imagery.

The game play is that of a basic rummy game. Seven card hands are dealt, runs of three with matching suit are required by the rules. The winner is the first to finish their hand.

The suits are related to Charlie Chaplin's general image; Canes, Shoes (untied), Neckties, and Hats.

This game is interesting because the card backs are unique to each card. This theoretically enables a player to memorize the deck. Each card is unique because it has a flip book of Charlie Chaplin on the card backs. He is twirling his cane. Each card is numbered on the back so that the flip book movie can be played in order.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Ten Condiments
description:
Ketchup with a big combo and relish your victory.

Chain together your condiments to make custom sauces and slather them over meals they'd taste the best on. Hoard your condiments to bust out a massive chain at the end of the game for mega points.

Each condiment links to three other condiments. Link together several condiments to make big points, or play one or two at a time to build up your saucy reserves. The elusive eleventh condiment and the sauce monster can make your combos even bigger. The unique card drawing mechanic makes your condiment stockpile vary wildly throughout the game. Read the ingredients to find out what is REALLY in horseradish (hint: it does not contain horse or radish) or plan your next brilliant concoction, it is up to you. Just don't get caught with a bunch of unused packets at the end.

Game includes:

* 30 Menu Items
* 54 Condiment Cards
* Instructions

You will need:

* A notepad and pencil for keeping score

Warning: This game may make you hungry.

(source: publisher's website: http://www.stonetabletgames.com/10Cdetail.html )

name: Baby Hunt
description:
Find your baby, play as 1 of 4 animals. For children of all ages but aimed at children of about 2 to about 6. The Fun Factor is high for that age group, unless you are playing with your child and teaching them how to play Baby Hunt. This game teaches children how to use color recognition, take turns, keep secrets, use strategy, and much more.

Each player places their Animal of choice at the animals home base, each animal has its own home base. The babies are placed in their places, each also has its own place. The game is then ready to play with players rolling the die and moving to the space that they rolled, each player gets a turn. No one knows whose baby is whose until a player has reached one of the four babies and takes a peek, that player and only that player knows if the baby is theirs or if it belongs to someone else. Once a player find their baby the player then races for the home position.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Educational, Exploration, Fantasy, Memory, Miniatures, Racing, Real-time, Travel
mechanics: Acting, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rhymation
description:
Rhymation is a game of word communication in which players attempt to communicate rhyming words to their teammates.

Blue spaces require teams to guess a list of 4 rhyming words (i.e. chance, pants, romance, lance) within 30 seconds.

Yellow spaces challenge teams to guess 3 different one-syllable rhyming pairs (i.e. church perch, fun sun, your tour) within 30 seconds.

Red spaces give teams 30 seconds to guess 2 multi-syllable rhyming pairs (sincere cashier, construction reduction).

Grey spaces are "showdown" spaces, in which each team nominates one team member to compete. The chosen players are given one word and must alternate naming as many rhyming words as possible, until one player either repeats a word, gives a word that doesn't rhyme, or takes more than 5 seconds.

The first team to reach the "high noon" space at the top of the board and win a final showdown is declared the champion.

name: Pippi pluttifikationsspel
description:
This game is set in a Pippi Longstocking theme and is intended to be a used for multiplication training of children.

The games consists of two decks of cards. One deck with simple multiplication questions like 5x5 or 1x3. The other deck is answer cards with text like =25 or =3. At the start of the game, each player is dealt a number of question. The answer cards are placed in a heap on the table. The goal of the game is to score points by making pairs of question cards and answer cards.

Pluttifikation is Pippis word for multiplication.

name: EMPIRES: Fate of a World
description:
How does an empire grow from a nomadic tribe of spear-wielding cave people into the greatest civilization of all? Is an empire forged though might and battle? Through enlightenment and culture? Or through the amassing of great and undeniable wealth?

The course of history is up to you! Guide your empire from its beginnings into a futuristic nation of leaders! Wipe out any who stand in your way, or absorb their territories into yours!

EMPIRES: Fate of a World is a strategy game for 2 to 4 players where each player represents a civilization in its infancy, owning nothing more than a small settlement and an explorer unit. Through the use of Development Cards (Archery, Railroads, Robotics, and the like), players sculpt their civilizations. Over time, settlements become cities, explorers give way to armies, and eventually, one Empire will emerge as the greatest of all!

EMPIRES: Fate of a World is played out on a world map board, with wooden tokens representing settlements, cities, and units. In addition, each player has a development mat where he or she plays Development Cards that shape the Empire. How a player achieves victory is completely up to them: Wealth, Culture, or Might.

—description from the designer

name: MERCENARY: Battle for City
description:
Strategic board game, 2 armies of mercenaries are fighting for control of the city.

Players take on the 2 sides of the conflict. Struggle for dominance over each point of the city - buildings, special points, etc.

Players will acquire victory points for each building under their control.

The board represents the abandoned areas of cities. Attacking units will be coming up a city of eight pages. To realize there will be many missions and scenarios prepared for the modes: standard deathmatch, capture the region, capture the flag, deathmatch and cooperative.

name: Innovation Planner
description:
From the publisher web site:

"Innovation Planner(TM) is a card set of innovation strategies and solutions used for rapid, effective, and efficient problem solving and idea generation. It is based on the Ideation TRIZ innovation methodology that was derived from the analysis of over 3 million patents and 500 standard patterns of technical evolution. Just as you can combine the 26 letters in the alphabet to produce all ranges of literature, these cards describe the universal principles of invention that innovators combine to create the millions of inventions known to mankind.

You can use Innovation Planner(TM) for systematic innovation planning, brainstorming, or to play one of several innovation games. Use of this product as directed leads to the creation of new and patentable inventions. Inventors from using organizations have filed for dozens of patents inspired by the ideas on these cards, making these cards worth exponentially more than their weight in gold for the owning organizations."

See: http://www.innovationplannercards.com/.

Innovation Planner represents a set of cards to aid in brainstorming. The publishers also provide simple rules for two games, Solve It(TM) and Evolve It(TM), that utilize the cards.

In the games, a problem to solve is selected by players. Players are dealt cards. Each player plays a card on their turn. When a card is played by a player, the player attempts to use the information on the card to address the problem. The player then draws a new card. Play continues until the cards run out or the problem is addressed to the satisfaction of the players.

The goal of the card set and games is to innovate novel solutions to known issues, or to generate inventive ideas, which might be patentable.

name: Sprach-Schatz
description:
Each player has a letter grid on a sheet of paper. The players roll dice and move onto letter squares on which they have to solve word puzzles (supplied on question cards). If they succeed, they can write the letter in any position in their grid. The goal is to fill the grid with four words across (different length as shown on the grid) and one down.
There are some fields on the board which allow players to erase letters when they wrote them in wrong positions.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Silly Switch Game
description:
This is a Disney "Mickey Mouse Clubhouse" game for preschool children. It is designed for kids age 3 and older with no reading required. The game can accomodate up to four children who portray Mickey, Minnie, Goofy, or Donald Duck as they move around a colorful board.

A special die is used with colors instead of numbers. Players journey around the board as they learn colors, counting, taking turns, being required to stop during a move, and other basic skills.

Includes the board, 4 stand-up tokens, the special die, and rules.

Cardinal Item # 37169
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number

name: Pendulum of FATE
description:
Also known simply as "Fate"; Pendulum of FATE is an acyclic two-player perfect information luckless abstract strategy game played on a grid of any size that starts out empty. It can also be played on a hex grid.

Fate's most significant feature is the fact that players gain increasing tokens to place and use as the game progresses. "Reinforcements" are calculated as a function of both the number of spaces the player already occupies at the start of his or her turn and the turn number of the game. This increasing reinforcement calculation causes the dominance of the game to swing back and forth like a wild, accelerating pendulum, hence the name of the game. The goal becomes timing the swings of the game such that a player is able to completely win the game before the momentum shifts right back. The game is driven to a conclusion with one player filling the entire board and removing the final pieces of his or her opponent so only tokens of one color remain on the board.

Standard Pendulum of FATE is a two-player game, but it can also be played by more with additional supplies of theoretically limitless tokens in different colors for each player.

name: Zoo Cards
description:
Zoo Cards - "A tail for a head"

The game consists of a deck of 48 cards, each representing a quarter of an animal - head, front legs, back legs, or tail; the cards form 12 complete animals.

Rules are included for two games: Zoo Quartet, a version of [item:21389]; and A Head for a Tail.

A Head for a Tail is similar to Zoo Quartet, except that each player in turn offers to exchange one of his cards for one held by another player; the animal is not named, but the body parts offered and requested are, and the offer is made in general, not to any specific opponent. For example, "A tail for front legs!" or "Back legs for a head!" or the titular "A tail for a head!" The exchange is made with the first player to accept the offer. Play then passes to the left.

As players assemble a full set (one animal), called a "trick" in this game, they lay it in front of them. The winner is the first person to assemble a given number of tricks:


Three players: 4 tricks
Four players: 3 tricks
Five players: 3 tricks (utilizing 3 spare cards in a kitty)
Six players: 2 tricks
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: What a Mouthful!
description:
From the side of the box: Everyone is talking about the game that's a puzzle and the puzzle that's a game! Match the most mouths to their corresponding faces and win! Played alone or with friends, it's hilarious excitement while challenging visual discrimination and problem-solving skills.

From the instructions: Object of the game is to match the mouths with the faces. All of the mouths are placed on the table. Players or teams pick out three face pieces from the box and try to be the first to match the face pieces to the mouths. A round ends when a player or team matches all three. New rounds continue until all faces and mouths are matched.

name: Spinawina
description:
A revolutionary new patented general knowledge quiz game for all the family.

Use your transport peg on the spinner to reach your destination i.e. the centre of the board first. To do this, you need to answer questions correctly and collect your four tokens on route.
The spinner provides a novel and exciting way of playing the game and replaced the use of dice.

name: Syllaballistic
description: This game is played in 3 or 5 minute rounds. Players quickly write down a list of ten words that contain the corresponding word fragment like "tion" or "ous." The fragment can be found anywhere within the word. Within a time limit, players write down a word for each of the ten fragments. Players score points if no other player has the same answers, and it based on the number of syllables in your word. You earn one point per syllable. Score the most points to win the game.

name: Voir Dire: The Game of Lawyers, Jurors, and Justice
description:
Voir Dire is the legal name for the process by which attorneys select a jury to try a case. Each party has the right to question potential jurors, try to understand their biases and the kinds of arguments that may be effective in reaching those jurors, strike potential jurors from the jury through the use of peremptory challenges, and then craft and focus an argument in an effort to win the selected jury to their cause.

In the game of Voir Dire, players are lawyers representing different parties attempting to influence a trial jury to decide in their favor. This strategic game simulates the voir dire process and allows the players to bluff, plan, and manipulate the jury toward their desired outcome for the case.

Voir Dire is played by two players and takes about ten minutes per game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Aliens in Antarctica
description: You and your fellow penguins need to travel accross Antartica, collect enough Patagonian Tooth fish, fish eyeballs, and Krill to build the Great Pyramid. Do this without being eaten or having the fishermen beat you to the supply! You pray that one day the Aliens will come and rid the land of the evil fishermen and rest assured they will come to your aid. Will you be the penguin that contributes the most to the great pyramid to win the game?
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Grody
description:
ENG:
Go back over 1000 years in time when the area of present-day Polish territory was divided between great tribes. Each of these tribes were concentrated around the centers of power - fortified castles. Lead one of the tribes, defend against enemy attacks, conquer the vast territories and finally try to conquer rival's stronghold. Probably you will have to fight many battles in which many brave fighters will fall.
"Grody" (Castles) is a strategy game for 2 players. In this title you will find a nice mix of realm building controlling conquered territories to gain Victory Points and dice based combat. Each player becomes the ruler of the castle, Sielec or Szczukczyn, and seeks to gain territorial dominance or raise the opponent's castle.

PL:
Cofnij się o ponad 1000 lat w czasy, gdy obszar dzisiejszej Polski podzielony był na terytoria wielkoplemienne. Każde z tych plemion skupione było wokół ośrodków władzy - warownych grodów. Stań na czele jednego z plemion, obroń go przed zakusami wrogów, opanuj i zagospodaruj rozległe terytoria, wreszcie spróbuj podbić gród rywala. Zapewne będziesz musiał stoczyć wiele bitew, w których polegnie niejeden dzielny woj.
“Grody” to strategiczna gra planszowo - karciana dla dwóch osób. Każdy z graczy staje się władcą grodu, Sielca lub Szczukczyna, i dąży do zdobycia dominacji terytorialnej lub podbicia grodu przeciwnika.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: World of Transport
description:
Players build their company and fleet communication. The game is practically free of randomness. Everything depends on the player.

Who will win the most markets, and export the most? Board game with world of production and transport.

Phases of a player's turn:

Determine Market Prices
Building City (auction houses between players)
Building Transport Fleet
Trade (sales of raw materials)
Transport
Export


Players produce raw materials, which could trade among themselves, or export it and earn money.

Victory:
Victory points are scored for the export of each product and for the buildings.

name: Mannheim-Quiz
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the town of Mannheim. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Düsseldorf-Quiz: 100 kluge Fragen
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the town of Düsseldorf. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

description:

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Dortmund-Quiz
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the German town of Dortmund. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Chesapeake 1781
description: Chesapeake 1781 is a scenario for Master and Commander v. 2 and is based on the rules found in that game. The first in a planned series, this scenario simulates the naval battle that took place September 5, 1781 between French and British fleets off Chesapeake Bay. The British under Cornwallis were under siege in Yorktown. A British fleet of 19 ships under Rear Admiral Thomas Graves sailed to Chesapeake Bay to relive Cornwallis. He was met by 24 French ships of the line under under the Comte de Grasse.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame

description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the German town of Lübeck. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. (User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Decalogue: The Ten Commandments Game
description:
Decalogue is based on the events that took place in four books of the Bible: Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, and Deuteronomy. The object of the game is to collect and keep all Ten Commandments Tablets and cross the River Jordan into the Land of Canaan. Players roll dice and move around a board, taking the actions prescribed by the spaces they land on.

The game provides a unique and educational way to interact with other players while learning about the faith, offerings, plagues, and blessings of the Old Testament.

(user summary)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Stuttgart-Quiz
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the German town of Dortmund. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Escape from the Witch!
description:
From the Rulebook:

"Both players roll the die. The player with the highest number goes first, and chooses whether to be Hansel and Gretel OR the Wicked Witch. Both players place their markers on their own Start squares.
- On your turn, roll the die and move your marker that number of squares.
- You can move in any direction.
- If you land on a sweet, play again.

IF YOU ARE HANSEL AND GRETEL:
- You must go through the cookie house then back home before the Wicked Witch catches you.
- You can follow the trail of white pebbles or the trail of breadcrumbs to escape from the witch.
- You need the exact number to get home. If the number you roll is too high, move backwards the remaining number of squares.

IF YOU ARE THE WICKED WITCH:
- You must catch Hansel or Gretel by landing on the same square with the exact number.
- You cannot follow the trail of white pebbles or the trail of breadcrumbs.

The game is over either when Hansel and Gretel get back home, OR when the Wicked Witch catches them!"

name: Goofy's Musical Match Game
description: This is a card game for kids in which they learn to match musical elements and Disney characters. It's a super-simplified version of Mah-Jong. One at a time each player passes a single card to his or her right. The player receiving the card immediately checks to determine if the new card creates a pair with any cards currently held in their hand. If a pair has made, the pair is laid out on the playing surface, face up, for all the other players to see. The player who received the card, whether or not they successfully made and laid a pair, chooses a card from his or her hand and passes it to the player to the right. The receiving player, e.g., the player to the right, follows the same procedure for either making or failing to make a pair, and then play continues, again to the right. The first player to have reduced their hand to zero cards, e.g., a nil hand, by playing out their final two cards in a successful pair is declared the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tip Top
description:
Each player has 12 chips in 6 colors and a small board with corresponding color fields plus two free spots. Into these, two chips are put. The players then take turns rolling two color dice. When one or both colors match, the players can take the chip(s) and put them in their color fields, and new chip(s) are put into the free spots. The first player to fill up all 12 color fields is the winner.

The game is entirely luck driven with no strategic decisions whatsoever.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Music Bingo
description:
Teaches names, descriptions and uses of music symbols in a game!

Designed to be used in the home as well as in the classroom, MUSIC BINGO is an exciting and entertaining way for both young and old to learn the fundamentals of music. The principles of Bingo apply to Music Bingo.

Instead on numbers, each player has a card of musical symbols and timing signatures. The caller reads out clues such as "Waltz Time" or "Six-eight time" or "The Time signature whose top number means 6 beats to a measure". From the clue the player must figure out what musical notation for this is and check to see if it is on there card. Like in regular bingo, the winner is the first to have a completed row. There are three levels of difficulties to the musical clues so that students of different levels can play.

Source: Top 2 paragraphs from the box. Last from directions.

name: The Game of Hoosier Equestrians
description:
From the rules: The object is to become the wealthiest player through strategy and property ownership.

A Power Play game: "Hometown Monopoly Games Individualized For Any City." This one was customized for the Indiana Saddle Horse Association, Inc., and depicts 34 "properties" for various members of the Association.

name: Ordlek
description:
Children's game about building words.

Contents:
- 12 six-sided dice with a letter on each side
- sand timer
- game board with depressed squares so the dice lie steady

On your turn, you roll the dice, turn the timer, and then build as many words before the time runs out. The score for all words you built is then summed. Each word is worth the square of its length.

name: Filurer
description:
This is an alternate version of memory. The active player is given one of 100 cards with a person on it and allowed to look at it for 10 seconds. After that, the card is put away.

Another player then reads one of the questions for that card from a booklet, and the player needs to answer correctly to score a point. After that, the player can choose to answer another question (at most three) about the same card. However, each new question is more difficult, and failure to answer a question means the player doesn't get any points that turn.

name: Klemmer
description:
Simple dice game where you choose to roll 1 or 2 die and add the total to the existing total from the other players in the game. Who ever causes the total to go over 42 is eliminated. Score is set back to zero and the rolling begins again.

Game was provided in the 2010 Spring Gaming Hoopla held near Lake Geneva, WI. It included the instructions and two special dice with the cancer ribbon as the pips. The Gaming Hoopla raises money to help fight cancer.

name: Heads 'N Tails
description:
Rules Sheet:

Memory game featuring a playing board and 36 magnetic animal tiles. The tiles are flipped face-down on the board and players take turns flipping over a pair of tiles, trying to match the proper head and tail sections of the animals.

name: SpyFlick
description:
From Rules:
You return from your latest mission to find your headquarters ransacked. Every room has been upended, but the work is far too thorough. This was an inside job. Now it will take your ingenuity and resourcefulness to track down and stop whoever did this before they escape.

In this dexterity-based deduction game, players are attempting to find the missing plans, which spy stole them, and the transportation they’ve used to escape. To achieve this, players flick their Player Token and attempt to strike face-down Evidence Chips. By keeping track of which chips are in the play area, they are able to deduce the missing Plans, Spy, and Transportation chips; the first to guess correctly wins the game. If everyone fails, however, the spy escapes and everyone loses!

SpyFlick is designed by Lucio Rodriguez, and is scheduled for release (self-published) in 2010.

name: Pitch it to the boss!
description:
The boss takes a random product, and a random target market (drawn from 2 decks), and you have 4 minutes to come up with a product name, advertising slogan and some artwork... then you have to Pitch It To The Boss!

The best pitch, in the opinion of the current boss, will get the most points, and climb the corporate ladder the fastest.

--user summary
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Judge

name: Spelet om Linköping
description: This is approximately (but not entirely) a clone of Monopoly, but themed around the Swedish town of Linköping.

name: Concerning the Conquest of the Holy Land
description:
Take command as the grand master of one of the holy orders as they explore, conquer and pillage the Holy Land. Recruit masters to take control of the holy cities, employ crusaders to construct fortresses and ensure the safe journey of pilgrims as they bring wealth and prestige to your order. However, Saladin and the Saracens are lurking beyond the dunes to defend the land and only a true commander of Christ can bring faith to the heathens and treasures back to Europe.
The game, as it is coming to life, enables the players to apply multiple strategies when competing against friends and family. One may recruit a mighty army while another set forth to discover the relics of ancient times. He who manages his masters most skillfully, while controlling most aspects of the game, will stand victorious.

name: Evolution Earth
description:
Evolution Earth is a board game for 2-4 players aged 10 or up. Playing time is from 45 minutes up to 2 hours depending on the number of players and playing experience.

Evolution Earth is a dynamic board game of strategy, tactics and probability. It is a game of area control, card and resource management.

The game is very dynamic and always full of surprises and no two games are alike. You will need your tactical skills and learn what to play and when to play and where to play. You will also mastermind deeper strategic plans in order to dominate a superiority in many aspects of Animal Kingdom or just simply trying to conquer continents for your species.

You, as the player of your precious species, will try to profit from forces of nature for the benefit for your species and try to protect your species from natural disasters. Create the best possible life strategy for your species as they compete against other players´ species. Use your species´ cooperative skills and choose the best competitive strategy against your opponents species that try to survive as well. Conquer the land and conquer the seas. Control your natural resources and rule the elements. Harness the primeval forces of nature for your victory. The prosperity of your species rests on your hands.

Evolution Earth´s rules: The laws of nature are an uncompromising and absolute and merciless as Mother Nature is. Only the most adaptive, cooperative, competitive and most fit can survive in a world of a persistent struggle for reproduction, nutrition and living space. For those species that can not adapt and survive must die out and become extinct and give way to a new species that are more adapted to new conditions in an ever changing Earth and try to survive and thrive and speciate and expand to conquer new territories in a land and sea.

At the beginning of the game, a 1 000 000 000 years ago, the Earth is more or less still an ocean planet. Ice Age has ended long time ago and snowball Earth has melted into a great planet of temperate ocean. Only a few protocontinents or cratons have become to exist over the endless surface of the vast ocean as a predicting sign for the upcoming continents, that will one day thrive with a different kind of life forms. Primordial plant life has already radiated, expanded from oceans into protocontinents and animal kingdom will soon expand their living space into a protocontinents niche too.

The animal kingdom still consists only a single-celled organisms that will soon burst into a multitude of populations of many kinds of multicellular first animals expanding their living space from the depths of ocean floor into all over the vast seas and harboring protocontinents: The Cambrian critters. These numerous types of animals will also victoriously, as a reward and prize for surviving and succeeding, evolve in time into the very first fishes, insects, reptiles, dinosaurs, mammals and birds.

The face of the Earth will change numerous times during millions of years. Protocontinents rise into a great full continents from the depths of the ocean. These large masses of land move and drift apart and reunite again. Volcanic eruptions, pandemic diseases spreading from populations to populations, climate changes, ice ages and asteroid impacts will afflict all life from time to time. Will your species survive and dominate the Earth or will they will they die out and become extinct fossils?

The great contest of survival is beginning. Are you ready to conquer the Earth?

This description is an edit from the rulebook.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Ant's Picnic
description:
A two-player themed 'abstract' in which players race to get as much food off the table as possible. The ants with the most valuable food win!

Wherever there is food, there are bugs! Help a pair of ants race to get food off the picnic table before the wind, the rain, a psycho kid with a magnifying glass and other bugs (among other events) destroy the food.

Quick overview of rules:
Each player takes a turn to roll two eight sided dice. The resulting values are used to move a pair of ants orthogonally across an 8 x 8 board representing a picnic table cloth. If a player rolls and 8 and a 5 he/she may move one ant up to 8 spaces and the other up to 5. If the ants land on matching food tokens, these tokens are removed from the board and placed in front of the player. The value of the tokens depends on which coloured squares they are removed from:
Pink + white or red = 1 point per token
Pink + pink = 2 points per token
White + red = 2 points per token
White + white = 3 points per token
Red + red = 3 points per token

However, there are restrictions to movement. A pop can or an ant blocks passage and cutlery, paper towels and gum slow down movement across the board.
Event cards are drawn at specified points in the game. These event cards can further hinder movement, destroy food, or reduce its value.
The number of event cards used determines the length of the game.
There are three versions of the game:
1) The regular game
2) A kids version
3) An advanced version
The ants who have collected the highest valued food at the end of the game are the winners!

name: Phantom Magic Vision
description:
User summary:
A two-player pre-game deck-construction card game based on the Project Shrine Maiden characters.

Players take turns summoning characters and spell attacks, braided with interrupts, trying to lower the other player's life points to zero.

Translated box back:
"Vision" is a totally new type of card game, based on the concept of free deck design, using all the characters living in the Land of illusionary thoughts (gensokyo). For both light and heavy users.

Contents:

Two pre-constructed decks (100 cards): 48 character cards, 26 spell cards, 26 command cards.
Promotional card "Reimu Hakurei".
Special playing mat.
Special life counter
Rule book, including a comic-book style introduction of the game.



This set can be played by 2 persons.
Buying more sets will allow you to strengthen your deck.
The contents of each box is identical. You get all cards in one box.
Depending on which edition, there might be some slight changes to certain details. Please understand.

name: Cybercon
description:
Cybercon is a game of Fences! each person is attempting to complete a line of marbles from one border to an opposite border while at the same time trying to block another player from doing the same thing. There are only 4 places along each crossover line that a player can complete a connection to another section, so controlling these and making your way to the other side are your goal.

(from publisher website)

name: Dansington
description:
Dansington is kind of a checkers thing, only no piece ever leaves the board. The object of the game is to move all your marbles to the other side before your opponent does. This takes skill and planning so you don't trap yourself in the process.

2 players at a time can play Dansington, each player has 25 marbles that have to be moved to the opposite side of the board. The marbles can only be moved forward, to the side, or at a diagonal but not backwards. Marbles can jump any other marble including your own provided there is an empty space after the marble being jumped. You can also make multiple jumps as long as there continues to be an empty space after each marble jumped. Marbles may be moved only one space at a time if no jump is possible. The first to move all their marbles to the opposite side wins.

--description from publisher

name: Ruhrgebiet-Quiz: 100 neue Fragen
description: 100 new question cards form the expansion for Ruhrgebiet-Quiz.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Köln-Quiz: 100 neue Fragen
description: 100 new question cards form the expansion for Köln-Quiz.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Niederrhein-Quiz: 100 neue Fragen
description: 100 new question cards form the expansion to Niederrhein-Quiz.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Düsseldorf-Quiz: 100 neue Fragen
description: 100 new question cards form the expansion for Düsseldorf-Quiz.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: MAZO
description:
MAZO is a capturing game played on a board of 8x8 squares.

Each player controls:
6 seniors (can move one step in all 8 directions)
8 juniors (can move one step orthogonally)
1 queen (8 directions, but can´t capture)
1 king (not backwards, can´t be captured)

The aim of the game is to capture the opponents queen or to get to the opposite side of the board with any figure except the king.

name: Bruno ist weg
description:
"Bruno is weg" is a simple roll and move game.
The goal of the game is to bring a dog home. On your way, there are special areas where you have to answer questions or fulfill tasks like comforting somebody. The questions are aimed to lead to a discussion about social issues, correct behaviour and the danger of addiction.

name: Top Ten Pins
description: A table-top bowling/skittles combination game, using a top to knock down the pins in a standard ten-pin bowling formation. The twist in this game is the "alley" itself, contained within a frame with four legs of different lengths. As a result, the alley tilts so that gravity carries the top towards the pins.

name: Wer ist's? V.I.P.
description:
220 cards contain the names of 440 celebrities and four hints for each of them. One player reads the hints one by one, the other players can place a chip on fields 1-4, depending on the number of hints they think they need. When the solution is given, the players who guessed correctly advance 1-4 fields (one if they needed four hints, three for two, etc.). The first player to advance 33 fields is the winner.

The game mechanism strongly resembles "Wer war's" which was published by Noris one year earlier.
(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: The New Game of Cash
description:
The game uses a squared board for play, and involves moving a square of card around the board. Holes punched into the square reveal the designs on the squares of the board below. The idea is to use the card square to reveal coins (which are then matched by examples from the pot) with the intention of arriving at pre-determined sums.

The winner is the individual who achieves his or her sum correctly. The values are in pounds, shillings and pence, and the coins are made from card printed in gold and silver to represent the correct look of the original coinage.

name: La Belle Alliance
description: The battle of Waterloo, as part of the IGS-series from MMP. The game uses a new regimental scale system of medium complexity, inspired by the NBS-system. La Belle Alliance will include all four battles of the Waterloo Campaign as well as the whole campaign as one big game. Ground scale is 250 m per hex.

name: The Rapture Game
description:
Players alternate turns by drawing Fellowship Cards. The fellowship Cards contain fill-in-the-blanks questions about passages from the Bible. Players who respond correctly advance on the gameboard. The Holy Bible, King James Version preferably, should be on hand to verify responses.

Upon reaching "Finish" the player must declare, "Hallelujah, Jesus is Lord" or return to "Start." Otherwise, that player is the victor.

name: Tank Shocker
description:
A combination of Combat and Sports, players control robot tanks to score goals against their opponent.
The first player to five goals is the winner.
The game is made up of various decks of cards including Unit, Command and Obstacle decks.
Players can choose their Robot tanks and aim for a fast accurate team to score quickly or a slower tougher team to take out the opposition.
You will need to supply some D6 and a measuring device.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Causeway
description: Board game that pits "armies" of ten pawns against each other on a hex grid. The moves available to the players are in the form of cards with move diagrams. Each player holds a hand of 3 to 5 cards (depending on how challenging you'd like the game to be). Players may play a single color army, multiple colors, or in teams.

name: Welcome to Mission
description:
The object of the game is to discover Mission's history, people and heritage by touring through the city's board game and answering trivia questions.

The board shows a map of the City of Mission, British Columbia. The players move their pieces through the city experiencing some of the ups and downs of the route. At the same time, players will have to answer questions about the history of Mission. The aim is to be the first to travel through Mission to the end.

Description taken from the game box and instruction booklet.

name: The Stork Didn't Bring Me
description:
From the box: A board game that explains what happens during each of the nine months of pregnancy. Players roll a die and move their game pieces from one month to the next.

From the rules: Players landing on a month square roll again, other squares contain instructions about forward or backward movement. The first player to reach the finish square is the winner.

name: Battleships Zenith!
description:
NWS: Battleships Zenith (1930-1945) is a Windows based computer combat system merged with a set of naval rules for miniatures or board game hex based tactical naval combat covering from 1930-1945.

Features:

50 page rules manual including a set of reference charts in PDF.
Radar reference chart covering 6 month intervals of radar fittings and modifications from 1939-1945.
Rapid fire and efficient combat system that will allow for large battles to be played quickly and efficiently.
Can be played as a stand alone set of miniature rules or for hex based board game rules with or without the computer.
A chart for allowing one die roll to be used to handle multiple die rolls for faster damage results.
Windows based computer combat system, scenario editor tool, reference information, and other game material on CD.
Nations include: Japan, Germany, France, Netherlands, Australia, Italy, United Kingdom, United States, and the Soviet Union.
Detailed game data for 200+ classes of warships and 1400+ ships in the scenario editor base.
20+ types of land units included covering airfields, coastal batteries, infantry and armored units, etc..
Includes 3 six sided dice for game play.
Game scale: 1 turn = 3 minutes, 1 DU (Distance Unit) = 1000 yards (0.5nm)
Rules and data for float/spotter aircraft and anti-aircraft fire.
Scenario editor software with a wide variety of scenario building options including ship starting damage, radar fit, crew quality, ammunition, weather conditions, visibility, turn based weather changes and daylight transition, etc.
Detailed printable unit sheets for all 200+ ship classes and land units on the game CD in PDF format.
Each unit sheet has detailed data for each unit in the game, space for 20 turns of combat and maneuvers, and sideview drawings.
Detailed rules covering movement, spotting, speed loss from turning, stack and chemical smoke, radar effectiveness, etc.
Gunnery effectiveness based on calculations covering a ships ‘accuracy’ of fire and ‘volume’ of fire.
Ship movement is affected by acceleration, deceleration, turning rates, turning speed loss, sea state, and listing.
Firepower ratings for each main, secondary, and tertiary gun turrets or mounts.
Spotting details that include the size of spotter and target, visibility, weather, smoke, and optional rules for levels of identification.
Radar rules that cover effectiveness, crew quality, land and sea clutter interference, and blind fire.
Detailed gunnery combat calculations that cover both volume and accuracy of fire and include target range and speed,gun quality, fire controls, target identification, shell types, etc.
Detailed damage system for above and below waterline damage covering main gun turrets, secondary or tertiary firepower, torpedo mounts, con/bridge, rudder/steering, propulsion, radars, and searchlights, fires, flooding, progressive flooding, listing, damage control, and magazine explosions.
The Windows based computer combat system (CCS) allows scenarios to be played without the use of any paperwork.
250 ships and 50 land unit capacity using the CCS.
The CCS keeps track of the status of each unit, ammunition, damage, and progressive flooding.
The CCS allows you to enter the combat data for each firing unit and target unit and at the end of each turn the CCS will simultaneously resolve all gunnery and torpedo combat and display 2 optional detail levels of results.
All combat is recorded using a After Action Report (AAR) using a printable or viewable TXT (text) format.


BZ Website: http://www.navalwarfare.net/drbz.html
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Dreadnought Rising!
description:
NWS: Dreadnought Rising! (1906-1929) is a Windows based computer combat system merged with a set of naval rules for miniatures or board game hex based tactical naval combat covering from 1906-1929.

Features:

50 page rules manual including a set of reference charts in PDF on CD-ROM.
Rapid fire and efficient combat system that will allow for large battles to be played quickly and efficiently.
Can be played as a stand alone set of miniature rules or for hex based board game rules with or without the computer.
A chart for allowing one die roll to be used to handle multiple die rolls for faster damage results.
Windows based computer combat system, scenario editor tool, reference information, and other game material on CD.
Nations include: Britain, Germany, France, Italy, Russia, and Austria-Hungary.
Detailed game data for 200+ classes of warships and 1100+ ships in the scenario editor base.
20 types of land units included covering airfields, coastal batteries, infantry, etc..
Includes 3 six sided dice for game play.
Game scale: 1 turn = 3 minutes, 1 DU (Distance Unit) = 1000 yards (0.5nm)
Rules and data for float/spotter aircraft and anti-aircraft fire.
Scenario editor software with a wide variety of scenario building options including ship starting damage, crew quality, ammunition, weather conditions, visibility, turn based weather changes and daylight transition, etc.
Detailed printable unit sheets for all 200+ ship classes and land units on the game CD in PDF format.
Each unit sheet has detailed data for each unit in the game, space for 20 turns of combat and maneuvers, and sideview drawings.
Detailed rules covering movement, spotting, speed loss from turning, stack smoke, etc.
Gunnery effectiveness based on calculations covering a ships ‘accuracy’ of fire and ‘volume’ of fire.
Ship movement is affected by acceleration, deceleration, turning rates, turning speed loss, sea state, and listing.
Firepower ratings for each main, secondary, and tertiary gun turrets or mounts.
Spotting details that include the size of spotter and target, visibility, weather, smoke, and optional rules for levels of identification.
Detailed gunnery combat calculations that cover both volume and accuracy of fire and include target range and speed, gun quality, target identification, shell types, Director and Fire Control fittings, etc.
Detailed damage system for above and below waterline damage covering main gun turrets, secondary or tertiary firepower, torpedo mounts, con/bridge, rudder/steering, propulsion, searchlights, fires, flooding, progressive flooding, listing, damage control, and magazine explosions.
The Windows based computer combat system (CCS) allows scenarios to be played without the use of any paperwork.
250 ships and 50 land unit capacity using the CCS.
The CCS keeps track of the status of each unit, ammunition, damage, and progressive flooding.
The CCS allows you to enter the combat data for each firing unit and target unit and at the end of each turn the CCS will simultaneously resolve all gunnery and torpedo combat and display 2 optional detail levels of results.
All combat is recorded using a After Action Report (AAR) using a printable and viewable TXT (text) format.
Uses the same combat mechanics as our "Battleships Zenith!" wargame.


DR Website: http://www.navalwarfare.net/drbz.html
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Hope County Stories: Alien Abduction the Board Game
description:
Hope County Stories is a series of board games, each with it’s own unique and exciting theme, which all use the same game board and feature a cast of characters from the community.

Although using the same game board and characters, each different game (or story) will provide it’s own set of rules, game cards, tokens and variations on game play.

As more Stories are introduced, you will follow the inhabitants of Hope County as they face all manner of threats to their very existence; whether it is a horde of Zombies, an evil blood sucking Vampire, an Alien Spaceship trying to abduct innocent townsfolk, or even rampaging Werewolves.

Those players who have played Night of the Bloodsuckers 2nd Edition, or Night of the Slasher, may already be familiar with the people and places of Hope County.

Alien Abduction (for 2 to 5 players)

In the first of this series of games, players will race around Hope County trying to save members of their family from being abducted by the mysterious Alien ship which has appeared over the town!

The files for this 'Print and Play' game can be downloaded from http://www.wargamedownloads.com/cat.php?ItemSubcategory=60&a...;pics

Components Supplied
The Alien Abduction Game Files (all in PDF Format) include the game board and all the game cards, tokens and playing pieces required to play.

Additional Components Required (not supplied)
1 x 12 sided die
1 x 6 sided die
5 x Plastic Markers (each player’s for Health track)
5 x Plastic Stands (for each playing piece)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: 3 Little Words
description:
From The Rules:

"The basic principle of 3 Little Words is that ANYTHING can be described using only 3 words. For example, 'mouse hunting pet' is ... CAT! A player studies an 'answer' on the cards, and tries to describe it in only 3 words. The other players try to guess the answer. The first player to get it right wins a point, and so does the asking player. First player to 20 points wins!"

Contents are: Rules, 1d6 and a set of cards with 'answers' on them.

name: Robin Hood's Adventure Game
description:
An original Archery Board game with the theme of Robin Hood Fun and easy to play a game for all the Family (Description from the front of the box)

Contents 1 Board 1 Target stand and boss 6 Players and stands 6 Sets of Arrows 6 Score Pads 2 Coloured dice 2 Spotted dice ! dice Shaker 1 Set of Rules

The Theme really is Medieval and Archery rather than anything to do with Robin Hood

Players move around the board hoping to land on squares where they are allowed to "shoot" their arrows and avoid other squares that do not help you The "shooting"is done by rolling special dice and marking their "shots" with the plastic arrows on the neat little Archery target and keeping score on a score pad Once you have acheived a score of 21 you race to the finish

The pieces and the board are a delight and look almost handmade however the box is bland and over large
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reclameraden
description:
A trivia game about commercials.
Players throw a six sided dice. On each side there is a different color dot.
The player has to answer a question in the category resembling the color thrown. When the player answers the question correctly, he/she gets a chip.
The player who has five different colored chips wins the game

name: Deft-initions
description:
Deft-initions™ is the great, new, anytime anywhere word-guessing game.

Based on the fact that many English words have disparate, widely distinct definitions — all of which are correct!

Each of 300 cards has a word to be guessed, and eight different definitions/clues — all of which are accurate.

A reader selects a clue, reads it out loud, and the other players shout out what they think the word to be guessed is. Each of the different clues is read until someone guesses the word, or the reader stumps them.

Created to be played by people with a 12 year old's vocabulary level.

Think you know what words mean?
Try to guess what common word the eight definitions/clues below refer to:

* A small mistake
* A piece of paper used as a record
* A part of a plant used for grafting
* A place for a ship
* To slide suddenly and lose one's balance
* You don't want to get a pink one
* Of the tongue • one's mind • through one's fingers
* Rhymes with flip

Right! The answer is "slip".

To Play
A reader selects five clues from the eight shown (at least one must be a red clue) and reads them aloud, one at a time. The other players shout out their guesses. The correct guesser earns points depending on which clue he/she solves. Clues separated by dots indicate phrases or sayings that use the mystery word. An optional roll of the die can add a bonus or a penalty to a score depending on a player’s luck.

From Publisher (http://www.lexogon.com/deftinitions.html)

name: Democracy
description:
From the Game instructions:

"The game consists of a Democracy Board with a spinning dial in the center and a road around the edge of the board over which the Players travel; six individual Charts for players, each chart with a scoring device on top; one Priorities Board Chart; forty-eight Defense Units in eight groups, each group being characterized by a different color background; six individual players Tokens, each of a different color.

The winner of "Democracy" is the first person to win $8,000,000. Thus he arrives at a financial position which enables him to purchase all the units of a complete National Defense. As the game progresses, many unforeseen things may happen to each player. Just as in real life. Strikes, sabotage, shortages, troubles of all kinds beset the way but the end is well worth while."

name: Warfare
description:
Published 1985 by "Hahn"

"The object of warfare is to win control of your opponents government. To do this you must capture any two of his "JEL" pieces. JEL represents Judicial, Executive, and Legislative branches of our government. Lose one JEL piece and your country can still function, but lose the second JEL and you lose control of your government and the war."

Warfare is an abstract strategy game similar in play style to stratego or chess with players taking alternating turns, where they may move, attack, or retreat (though there is no secret unit deployment as with Stratego). To win one must capture two of the opponents "JEL" pieces, which also have the ability to move and attack. The playing pieces are of various military and civilian ranks (JEL, Secret Service, General, Admiral,Army, Nacy, Airforce, and Marines). Each has a particular set of rules in how it can be moved, how far, or under what conditions/direction it can attack. Black squares on the game board represent land, while white squares represent water. Certain pieces may only move or attack on either by virtue of their class (Navy can only move/attack on water, while army can only move/attack on land).

name: Blitzkrieg in France
description:
Issue game of old Game Journal 54.

Designed by Masayoshi Imura.
Covers the blitzkrieg in France in 1940.
The game uses chit-pull activation system.
1 map
180 counters
16 cards
You must prepare a die.

The article by Jun Tajima covers the 11 1940 blitzkrieg games and categorizes these into 4 groups. This article is very interesting and must read for gamers interested in this topic.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Destination Graduation
description:
From rules booklet: This game is designed for children to talk about school and what is going on in their world; how they feel, what they think and choices they might make, while also reinforcing the importance of education.
