Object: To go through the obstacles and finish school - "Destination Graduation."

Contents:
Game board
6 player pawns
1 d6
96 Obstacle cards
24 Oh Rats cards
24 Rat On cards
12 Go cards

name: Mens Medisch
description: The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Puzzel Uurtje
description:
A trivia game with a grammar theme.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Roddelen Maar
description:
A tivia game with national and international celebrities theme.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Nullkommanix
description:
The game consists of tiles with four edges in four different colors. The tiles are placed between the players so each player faces one color edge (all tiles have to be aligned accordingly). Each edge contains a number which forms a larger number together with all the tiles in one row. There are also commas, which can turn a potentially large number into a very small one. The idea is to place commas in positions which are at the rear of one's own line, but at the front of another player's, so the other player's number is minimal and the own one is large.
A turn consists of simply flipping over one tile and placing it into the grid. When all tiles are placed, four spaces in the 6 x 6 grid remain empty, thus further influencing the results.
The player with the largest sum of all six lines is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: The Game of Pittsburgh
description:
A monopoly-like game, in which 2 to 4 pieces are moved around "property" squares on the board in moves decided by roll of dice. There are "Fate" and "Fortune" cards, there is currency bills, and there are property cards.

At the end, the player with most property cards is declared the entrepeneur and wins the game.

name: Drunkfish
description:
Drunkfish is the party game based on a simple premise: act like a fool or drink like a fish! Players will race to catch fish and return to their homes, all while speaking in accents, drawing on their faces, answering trivia, and attempting to outdo their opponents while maintaining their dignity. Hilarity and hijinks are sure to ensue, so be prepared to see a whole new side of your friends!

Drunkfish is a game for 2 to 6 players ages 21 and up. The game takes approximately 30 minutes to play and includes:
6 pawns
1 six-sided die
44 hilarious fish cards
16 sort-of-funny item cards
1 exclusive Drunkfish shot glass
1 easily cleaned vinyl game board.
mechanics: Acting, Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Time and Space
description:
This is the workspace for a new game, called "Time and Space," a project organized by Scott Nicholson.

The goal of this project is to create a game publicly with the engagement of other BGG members. Scott provides guidelines, and anyone can contribute parts to the game.

As the game develops, voting is used to determine what stays in the game and what is removed.

The game will remain as a print-and-play game until the point that a publisher acquires it.

Intellectual Property Note: Any contributions made to the game become the property of Scott Nicholson. Attribution will be made where appropriate. As long as the game is available in print-and-play, anyone will be able to print out and enjoy the game. Once an agreement is made with a publisher, the print-and-play version may be removed.

Research Note: This is also part of a research project, and we will be studying the process as it develops. In any research reports, we will not use the actual user name or handles of any BGG user.

name: Patriots Trivia Game
description: Contains plastic football field gameboard, 3 team pegs, box of 400 trivia cards and one six sided die. The object of the game is to score more points than your opponent at the end of four quarters of play by correctly answering trivia questions.

name: Sniffle Free Land
description:
From the game box:

"A fun game for children that stresses the basics of good hygiene and nutrition necessary for cold prevention! A must for parents, educators, nurses and everyone concerned about the health of our children.

Each player strives to be the first to reach the Sniffle-Free Land. If he lands on a yellow space he must pick up a card, read it aloud and answer truthfully. The card teach the basics of rest, nutrition and good hygiene."

Each card has directions to advance or go back a certain number of spaces depending on if the player did or didn't perform the action. The number of spaces moved is relative to how important the behavior is to cold prevention.

name: Albuquerque-Opoly
description:
How do you make a board game about the city of Atlanta?
While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed as much Atlanta as we could into this box. It’s FULL of history, parks, SPORTS, just one more peach AND...LOTS OF fun! LOOKING FOR A Great WAY TO EXPERIENCE A-Town? HERE IT IS!
Grab Some Friends and
Gather 'Round!
Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy your favorite Atlanta properties, increase your rent by collecting
City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy?
WELL, ADD IN SOME TRAFFIC JAMS, Property Tax
AND PARKING FINES AND IT GETS A LITTLE
MORE DIFFICULT AND A LOT MORE FUN!

SO CHOOSE YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GOATLANTA!
YOU MAY SOON BE THE MAYOR OF Atlanta...
OR YOU MAY BE STUCK IN THE
TRAFFIC JAM OF YOUR LIFE!
Get YOUR Game On!
THIS IS ATLANTA... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!!

Source - Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Citaten Spel
description:
Trivia game with 'quotes' theme.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Dierengeheimen
description:
Trivia game about animals.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Show Business
description:
Trivia with the show business theme.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Kinder Spel
description:
Trivia game your childhood.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Kleur Proef
description:
Trivia game about things that make worth living for.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Spelen met Cultuur
description:
Trivia game about life and cultures.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Baseball-opoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Little League Baseball Monopoly. Coming soon! A game celebrating America's favorite past time.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Zouave
description:
Wargame Rules for Warfare in the Age of Transition 1861-1871

Zouave is the first release in the Repique System, and the latest miniatures rule set by Bob Jones of Piquet fame. The game offers command level and grand tactical options, for 6mm to 28mm miniatures.

The period covers not only the ACW, but also the Franco Prussian War and the Maximilian Adventure.

name: Fin Napoleon
description:
This game covers the strategic battles of Napoleon after 1804.

One player controls France and the other player controls the coalition (Prussia, Austria, Russia, Spain and England).
One turn is divided by activation of Prussia, Austria, Russia, Spain and England. France is activated between any of it's enemy's activation and this is decided at the start of every turn.
The basic mechanics includes movement and combat.
France receives victory point for each of it's enemy at peace or truce during each turn. Peace is obtained through surrender after a war. If France wins the game when 10 VP are reached.

1 map
144 counters
1 chart

Issue game of (old) Game Journal 52.

name: Grand Fleet
description:
Issue game of old Game Journal 50.
Designed by Akio Kikegawa.
Covers the naval battle of north sea during WW1.
One player controls German fleets and the other player controls British and American fleets.
Each turn, both player proceed their construction and decide whether he'd like to have a naval combat. In combat, each player alternatively place one marker ( fleet or dummy ) in one hex on the map. After all placement, reveal the markers and if both have the fleet in the same hex, the combat is resolved.
1 map
136 counters
1 preparation chart
2 player sheets
You must prepare several 6 sided die.

name: Jump 'n Bump
description:
Be the first to move all four of your playing pieces diagonally across the board in this abstract strategy game.

The "jump" movement is determined by two dice: one indicates a color and the other indicates a geometric shape. The token must be moved to a matching color and then a matching shape -OR- moved to a matching shape and then to a matching color.

A token can be "bumped" if it is hit by an enemy token at the end of a move. If a player cannot make a legal jump (because a proper "matching" space is not available) he or she loses a turn.

Includes a colorful four-piece board with a puzzle-cut pattern, 16 platic tokens, and two wooden dice. The rules are printed on the box.

Designed for children ages 5 to 9.

name: Hustlin' Health Care
description: Hustlin' Health Care is a board game that teaches people the real costs associated with medical treatments. Each player assumes the role of an insurance company, charging premiums and paying for patient care. Throughout the game, players see how a market economy works and become informed consumers.

name: Symbol Chain
description:
The pdf. file containing the complete rules and game components can be found at:

World Turtle Games

Here is a brief description:

Players attempt to complete sequences of symbols by flipping over the correct tiles on the board. Each tile that is flipped over correctly rewards the player with 1 point. However, if the tile is one of that player's previously placed tiles the player gets 0 points. Once a sequence is complete that player places their tile on the board and changes the location of one other tile on the board. In this way the location of specific tiles changes throughout the game. At the end of the game each player is given 2 additional points for each tile they have placed on the board.

name: The Throne of the Sun Elves
description:
Elfland is in mourning over Dahla, queen of the Elves, who lost her life in the battle to free and unite the neighboring troll kingdom, before she could choose her successor.

Greed and mistrust are spreading amongst the members of the Elf Council. The Troll Lords stoke up this power struggle and ally themselves with one of the Council Members.

Everyone tries to gain power and win the throne of the magnificent Elf Kingdom.

The Throne of the Sun Elves is a game from Stefan Becker. It consists of a board with three levels and a die, each player receives four Trolls and two Elves Whoever gets their two Elves on the throne first is the winner.

A captivating strategic game - which Elf will win the throne?

The game play consists of rolling and moving your Trolls to help your Elves claim the crown by blocking your opponent's Elves as you both climb to the throne in the center of the board, but watch out for your opponents Trolls and Elves blocking you from reaching the throne. Often it will be more important for you to work out the moves of your opponents Elves and stop them than with your Trolls (and temporarily your Elves) before you can work out how to move your Elves to the center. Think Quoridor where the Trolls are the walls but can move after being placed.

Art.-Nr.: 56.027

-- User summary and Publisher blurb

name: Taal Hobbel
description:
A trivia game about the Dutch language.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player.
Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Verkeersexamen
description:
A trivia game about the traffic rules and situations..
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player.
Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Fill The Train
description:
Fill the train with Teddy Bears.

This is a simple game for young children to teach them about taking turns, and having to miss turns. Each player rolls the die and loads a Teddy Bear of that colour onto the train, unless they throw orange or purple, when they miss their turn. The first person to fill their train with Teddy Bears wins the game.

There are two variants to this game which introduce numbers to the game.

There isn't much of a game here, but it is for very young children, and it has nice plastic Teddy Bears.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Road Rage
description:
Tagline: Apocalyptic death and destruction in 20mm scale.

Phil Tortorici's Road Rage is a set of miniatures rules that allow players to recreate races similar to those featured in the movie "Death Race" (2008). Designed to work with 1/64th scale diecast cars the game is also supported by the Road Warriors line of miniatures, also available from Stan Johansen. It comes packaged standalone or with a set of 'Roads 2 Nowhere' tiles from Scrying Eye Games.

Product details from the publisher's website:

44 page rulebook; 1 Quick Reference chart and card stock templates; 4 pages of pre-made cars - 7 for Death Race and one make your own blank; 4 pages of event, upgrade and setback cards; Death Race scenario; Expanded weapon and driving rules for Road Warrior-type games; 37 4 color step by step maneuvering photos; Sample car construction.

Phil designed these rules with convention play in mind, so they play fast and have been a hit with all players, especially father and son competitions.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warpspawn Waterloo
description: Waterloo the Warpspawn Way. Mapless. Only requires a regular deck of cards (plus Jokers). Chrome via many special rules and one-time-use checklist abilities unique for each player. Victory by reducing opponent to zero Troops, Morale, or Cohesion. Extensive Turn Sequence simulates all aspects of the Battle.

name: Droomkleuren
description:
Trivia game.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player.
Whoever gets all five "dream color" chips wins the game.

name: Il giocadellasalute
description:
"Il Giocadellasalute" is a brand new game about health, where the advantage goes to whoever is more attentive to prophylaxis. Players must face flu and seasonal attacks on their health, answering to several and selected questions about sanitary education. Thanks to active principles, got from doctors and chemists, they must fight microbes and bacteria to arrive first at the finishing line and win the game.
(from the publisher's site)

name: While The City Sleeps: A game of heroic action in Granton City
description:
The heroes and villains who populate the world of Granton City Press will soon be population a new table top miniatures game.

An agreement has been reached with Rattrap Productions LLC to bring the Granton City world to the games table with the fall release of ‘While the City Sleeps: A Game of Heroic Action in Granton City’

While the City Sleeps is a fast-paced tabletop miniatures game of heroic combat set in the world of Granton City. Players control the actions of heroic crimefighters or nefarious villains and their henchmen. Each player will have anywhere from 1 to a dozen models whose actions they determine.

Combat is fast and deadly. Using the results of two six-sided dice, players try and fight through the defenses of their opponents. Heroes and Major villains can withstand punishment but their henchman will be falling left and right to slugs, knives and fists.

All characters are pre-generated so players will be ready to go straight from the book. Special abilities will give the major characters an edge over those around them, but even the greatest hero can fall to the villain's henchmen if he is unsupported.

Two experienced players will be able to play out their favorite action from the world of Granton City in about 2 hours on a game space no bigger than a dining room table.

“When approached about incorporating the diverse characters from Granton City Press into a table top miniatures game, I thought it was a great idea,” said Richard A. Johnson the man behind Rattrap Productions LLC. “Initially we tossed around the idea of incorporating the characters into one of our existing games but came to realize there was enough unique and interesting new character in Granton City to support a new game themselves.”

Johnson said he had been working on a new game, and it turned out to be a perfect vehicle for characters such as The Black Wolf, The Starling, Ghost Wind and Churchill: Alien Bounty Hunter.

The new game will be an ideal place for the soon to be released Black Wolf miniature from Zombiesmith Miniatures. Watch for more news on the miniature front in the weeks ahead. Granton City Press expects to have The Black Wolf #1: Metal Monsters of Doom out in April. Black Wolf #2, and spin-off titles Unit 13, Ghost Win and Churchill: Alien Bounty Hunter follow in the fall, with a release expected to coincide closely with Rattrap’s release of While the City Sleeps.

name: Het Lepel Spel
description:
This game is an advertising collateral for the Dutch movie, Lepel. It is a basic roll-and-move game where players become a character from the movie and race to the finish line on the track on the board. Along the way, landing on a yellow square simulates events in the movie and requires referring to the instructions to see what advantage is gained or penalty has occurred.

The movie appears to be about a boy, Lepel, whose parents are supposed to be on a trip around the world in a hot-air balloon and who is looked after by a nasty grandmother. After she denies him a gift of a balloon from a department store salesmen, Lepel runs away and hides in the department store.

name: Que Pez?
description:
You are a broker in a seafood market. You have some orders to fill and buy the products to fishers via an auction. After that there's a free market where you try to get the items you need at the same time that you're trying to get rid of the products you don't need before they go off.
In this game wins the broker that makes more money.

name: Space Colonies
description:
World of Space Empire is a strategic card game with elements of economic and little adventure rooted in the realities of space. Players take on the leaders of the Space Empires.

Build your empire on one of the planets in the galaxy, managing raw materials - metal and crystal, build and supply the energy of production buildings, strengthen their starry fleet, exploring new technologies, trade in raw materials from other players, lead intergalactic battle, set out on expeditions into the unknown corners of the galaxy .

Every round is divided into phases:
- Selection of cards
- production of raw materials (crystal and metal)
- power supply of buildings to activation and production
- travel and trade
- research into new technologies
- an attack on the planet
- expeditions
categories: Card Game, City Building, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading

name: Tornado
description:
Tornado - A Whirlwind Frenzy of Card Play is a card game for two players. The ultimate goal of the game is to rid yourself of all your cards. This game features simultaneous play which is in many ways similar to traditional solitaire in which each player independently adds cards from their face up "tornado piles" into the face up "frenzy files." To transfer a card from a tornado pile to a frenzy pile, a card must either be one value higher or one value lower.

Featured in the artwork are multicolored tornadoes and stylized numbers.

name: Cinematix
description:
From the rules:

The object of the game is to be the first player to obtain a PhD in Cinematix. This is accomplished by obtaining four degree levels. At each degree level a player will be expected to obtain a Visualization card. A Visualization card from one degree level will allow a player to enter into the next degree level. Once a player has accumulated a Visualization card for each of the four degree levels he/she will be in a position to obtain a PhD.

name: So you wanna be a Superhero...
description:
So you wanna be a Superhero… is an adventure game where you get to play an aspiring hero attempting to save the world. From the moment your hero steps out of his home, he will be righting wrongs by investigating suspicious activity, arresting bad guys and otherwise protecting the good citizens of Big City.
It won’t be easy, as a matter of fact, the bad guys are as tough or tougher than your hero, especially in the beginning. And although he’ll likely not win every encounter, he will learn from his mistakes and grow stronger and stronger. Eventually, he’ll be powerful enough to rid the city of all 7 supervillain bosses and save the world, well, at least he’ll save Big City.

So you wanna be a Superhero… features 61 supervillains, 4 Hero characters and their respective markers, a rule book, 4 six-sided dice and a map of Big City. Encounters and missions are assigned by die-rolling and chart lookup. It is incredibly unlikely that two games would ever be the same. The combat system features ‘exploding’ sixes allowing super-powered possibilities. There is experienced-based character building, nosey reporters, dedicated sidekicks, worshiping fans, and useful gadgets.

So you wanna be a Superhero? Do you have what it takes? There are crimes to investigate and criminals to round up. There are supervillains running amuck and you are the only hope for justice and protection.

Let’s see what you got, Hero!

User Summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing

name: Great Shatranj
description:
As chess evolved from shatranj in the West, pieces gained power by becoming long-range sliders, producing an abstract game where most pieces can cross an open board in a single turn. Eastern variants stay closer to the beginnings of the game, which featured a number of short-range sliders and leapers, but the power pieces still seem to be long-range. What if long-range pieces did not come to be so dominant? Suppose the short-range pieces of chess' infancy became more powerful by gaining additional short-range moves? Great Shatranj examines some potentials of these pieces, offering 5 different pieces that slide 1 square or jump 2 squares. Each player has up to 8 leapers on the board, giving the game a noticeably different flavor.

The game is played on an 8x10 board and is played with standard chess rules, except as modified by the specific piece movement rules. Great Shatranj is a short-range Capablanca [actually Carrera] Chess variant. Kings, knights and pawns are the usual pieces, but bishops, rooks and all the pieces that use them as components have been replaced by analogs that step 1 square or leap 2 squares, only, in the bishop or rook directions. This is the second game in a series of shatranj variants offering an alternate history for chess. It may be played with a standard 8x10 Capablanca Chess set.

http://www.chessvariants.org/index/msdisplay.php?itemid=MSgr...

name: Grand Shatranj
description:
As chess evolved from shatranj in the West, pieces gained power by becoming long-range sliders, producing an abstract game where most pieces can cross an open board in a single turn. Eastern variants stay closer to the beginnings of the game, which featured a number of short-range sliders and leapers, but the power pieces still seem to be long-range. What if long-range pieces did not come to be so dominant? Suppose the short-range pieces of chess' infancy became more powerful by gaining additional short-range moves? Grand Shatranj is the companion game to Great Shatranj. It extends the examination of short-range leapers by looking at another 2-square jumper and 2 short-range riders.

Grand Shatranj is a short-range variant of Christiaan Freeling's Grand Chess [name and setup used with permission and thanks] played on a 10x10 board. A Grand Chess set may be used to play. This game uses the pasha, a piece that steps 1 square or leaps 2 squares in a straight line, and introduces 2 apparently new variant chess pieces, the oliphant and lightning warmachine, bishop and rook analogs which step 1 square or leap 2 squares, then may step 1 or leap 2 again. No piece moves more than 4 squares, but pawn walls lose effectiveness. The game plays rather differently than its namesake, and is the third in a series of shatranj variants.

name: Damned Hot Work: The Steampunk Miniatures Game
description:
Damned Hot Work is a miniatures wargaming system primarily designed for 25/28mm models, and is a fast and simple game that should allow large battles to be fought easily in one evening - or a couple of skirmishes - recreating the drama of combat with dice rolls and a deck of cards.

This is a wargame heavily dependant on a glorious theme - it's actually buried miles deep beneath the Earth's crust in theme! Fight melees between British regiments of Foot, coal-fired robots, fez-wearing villains, snarling, leaping mummies, knife-twirling Chinese warriors, hordes of spear-chucking natives, ferocious African-like wildlife, ravenous dinosaurs, mad scientists, vampire lords, and rifle-wielding Zikhs; or any bizarre combination that tickles your fancy.

DHW is set in a romantic fictional universe, half a world away and over a century ago. Most battles and skirmishes take place in the hot, mountainous country of Quarajanistan. Though bloodthirsty action has also been spied on the dinosaur-infested Namajaro Plateau, in the steaming jungles and Lost Valley of the Baka-Mang, and the deadly, secret Kingdom of the Kuji-Gani.

The game is based loosely on the well-known wars of British Colonialism: Northern India, the Zulu War, the Boer War, the Egyptian and Sudanese campaigns, but also includes many fantastical elements. In the world of DHW, it is not uncommon to spy an armoured airship, coal-fired borrowing contraption, Martian Tripod, steam-powered tank, or even lancers on unicycles! During the course of play, expect to encounter heinous villains, angry creatures, fearsome monsters - and the worst monsters of all: true-blooded Englishmen. Play may be accompanied by a stiff brandy and cigars.

Inspired by books and films such as The Lost World, War of the Worlds, The Mummy, Zulu, Zulu Dawn, Master of the World, At the Earth’s Core, Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea, Valley of the Gwangi, and many others, DHW is a light wargame.

An often-cited shortfall of wargaming design, is that the player who rolls better dice than their opponent will always win. This is generally true, and some would say this reflects the chaos of battle and the vagaries of command. Damned Hot Work addresses this issue with Feather Tokens, gifted to each player whenever they fail certain die rolls. These tokens can be spent in multiples of four on later turns to buy instant-kills, or succeed morale checks, or move a unit more aggressively.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Düsseldorf-Quiz
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the town of Düsseldorf. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Loto-Leitura
description: A word lotto game, intended to teach young children simple spelling of short words. Players draw and collect letter tiles at random, attempting to form the words printed on their boards. Several variants are included.

name: Greenline
description:
Greenline is a roll and move game that represents the moving of the resources of a large corporation around the world. Players compete to get to the end of the board first...

However, unlike a simple roll and move game, there are some interesting wrinkles. Each player uses a different mode of transport: airplane, train, truck, or boat. Each mode allows a player to avoid a hazard or gain an advantage in a particular situation that may or may not come up during any particular session. At the beginning of the game, the player who rolls highest gets to choose their mode of transport, followed by the next highest rolling player, etc. Each mode uses a different color pawn.

Also, players have the option of rolling for one of 5 special attributes at the beginning of the game. These attributes - 1. invoice, 2. letter of credit, 3. customs documents, 4. freight insurance, & 5. the goods... are not exclusive to any one player and are randomly determined. A player may roll as many times as they like for these attributes (which can potentially prevent setbacks or lend an advantage), but once they've started moving on the board, they are not allowed to roll for any more attributes. Players must balance a desire for having as many attributes as possible with the notion of getting moving on the board.

The main path on the board (also the shortest path) is the Greenline of the title. However, if players land on certain squares they must roll a die to see if they are diverted onto a red circuit. This creates a delay as the player must go through a side path that usually has other negative encounter possibilities. There are also a number of yellow spaces on the board that represent random challenges which require the player to have one of the special attributes to avoid a penalty or to gain an advantage.

This game appears to have been developed by Philips to build teamwork or to encourage employees to think in terms of working as efficiently as possible. Apparently this game only appeared in Dutch.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Hot Numbers
description:
a sizzling game of Fun.
for young and old , keep's em popping with excitement.
this set accommodates two, three or four players. add additional sets for larger groups.game is comprised of 60 blocks, ten of which are the "hot numbers" ranging from 100 to 600. the remaing blocks are assorted in 5's, 10's, 15's, 25's and 50's.
instructions from side of can:

Play begins with all tiles face down and each player drawing 15, taking a brief look at them, and returning them to the table face down in front of the player who drew them. Here they are again mixed up so the player doesn't know which tile is where. Based on what they saw in their sneak peak players make a bid as to how many points they believe they'll earn throughout the course of the round. Each player then blindly turns over one of his or her tiles and the highest number played takes that turn.

After all tiles have been played, the points are tabulated to see how each player did in relation to his or her bid. After a round of play, players may find their score increased or decreased. They may earn either the number of points taken in or the number of points taken in plus the amount of their bid. Or, if they are unlucky and do not make the amount of their bid, will find their overall score decreased by the amount of their bid. Play continues round by round until one player has earned 10,000 points.

above info from side of tin.

name: WordSaic
description:
From the front of the instruction book: "A mosaic is traditionally the creation of a design by the combination of components. Wordsaic combines components of words in a new and unusual way to provide a mosaic of words and pictures."

In WordSaic, players solve word problems in order to complete their collection of mosaic tiles. Roll the dice to determine which clue you receive and solve the multi-part clue. Each part of the clue gives players a hint at one or two syllables of the solution word.

Example clue: "5th letter of the alphabet, cut the grass, lower leg"

Solution word: "EMOTION" (e - mow - shin)

name: Der reimende Sprechdachs
description:
Der Reimende Sprechdachs is a compilation of games played with 72 different cards, 36 pairs that show rhyming (in German) things.

The first game is a memory-variation, the second is a quartett-variation.
In another game, all card are placed face up, one player chooses a picture each turn, and the others try to find the rhyming word as fast as they can.

name: Kalle Anka & Co Korsordsspel
description:
This is, more or less, a dice version of Scrabble without the board. The game consists of 12 dice with a letter on each side (and a score). When it's your turn you roll all dice and build a "crossword" using as many of the dice as possible, and then sum up your score.

The game was distributed as a freebie with an issue of the Swedish edition of Donald Duck magazine sometime in the very late 1990s or early 2000s.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game
publishers: Kalle Anka & Co, Walt Disney Productions (Disney)

name: Little Rock-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Little Rock! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some cheesy hot dogs, electric streetcars, a great Big Dam Bridge, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; Little Rock-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!
Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Little Rock! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Nashville-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Nashville! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some hats, boots, music, sequins, Southern hospitality, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; NASHVILLE-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and
Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Nashville! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: New York-opoly
description:
New York, New York, the city so incredible it had to be named twice. It’s the largest city in America, where skyscrapers pierce the sky and taxis provide a constant symphony for throngs of people of all races, religions, and social strata. New York is the world’s hub for business, communications, finance, fashion, sports, and the arts. It’s the Big Apple, the city that never sleeps.

NEW YORK-OPOLY was created with the help of New York natives. We asked New Yorkers What makes this place so great? While it’s impossible to include everything in this great city, NEW YORK-OPOLY hits the highlights.

The game is full of the Big Apple, Yo!Yo!Yo!’s, carriage rides through Central Park and if you think this game could be boring FOGETTABOUDIT! This game is about New York City, the most exciting city in the world!

Are you looking for a fun way to experience New York?
Here it is! NEW YORK-OPOLY!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Omaha-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Omaha! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some culture, awesome parks, music, a great big castle, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; OMAHA-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and
Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Omaha! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Raleigh-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Raleigh! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some awesome parks, higher education, the arts, a great big acorn, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; Raleigh-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Raleigh! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Santa Fe-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Santa Fe! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some majestic mountains, beautiful pueblos, the arts, a world-famous opera, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; SANTA FE-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!
Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!
Get YOUR Game On, Santa Fe! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Het Vaarbewijs Spel
description:
From the official website (translated from Dutch)
Visit the ports and win!
In the game, up to six players on a star shaped board, try as first player to visit all six Dutch ports. this can be done over land or water. Along the way the players must answer questions and can save for a bigger ship or a permit.

But that's not without a struggle. Players can encounter, severe turbulence, a license check by the water police, vehicle breakdown or they have to wait for an open bridge. After the purchase of a ship, all ports can be visited by water. The ports can also be visited overland, but that is dangerous because other players can tag you on the ring dike.

The player who first collects all the port tokens, wins the game

Explanation for non-Dutch visitors
In the Netherlands you must have a Sail License (Dutch: Vaarbewijs) if you want to sail a sailboat longer than 15 meter or a motorboat whose speed can exceed 20 km/h.
There are two types of license.
With Sail License 1 you may sail the numerous rivers, canals and small lakes of the Netherlands
With Sail License 2 you may sail the big lakes, sea arms and inland seas.
To get such a license you have to take an official exam, which quizzes you on traffic rules, navigation, boat handling and the dangers on the water. This game tries to teach some of those rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mad Robots
description:
Mad Robots is the game of slightly crazed megalomaniac robots. These twisted geniuses have been building Doomsday Death-Ray Devices (DDD), and are now in the final stages of construction.
All that remains is to deploy Nano-Bots into the construction to activate the 6 final components, and then, victory is theirs!

Each player (Mad Robot Genius), has 6 Nano-Bots at his disposal. These Bots are deployed from the LAB starting point to venture out into the DDD structure in an attempt to locate and control the last 6 remaining components of the DDD.

name: デジタルモンスタ Dejitaru Monsutā
description:
Japanese CCG created by Bandai and based on the pocket digital pet and anime series of the same name. Known as Digimon in the US.

Players pit various monsters against eachother in battle, attempting to deplete the opponents of energy and striving to evolve their own monsters to more powerful forms by playing cards to enhance combat or advance the monsters through two or more stages.

Each monster is denoted by a leter and colour type that is referenced vs the opponents monster to determine one of three types of attacks that can be performed. Players attempt to outperform their opponent by playing enhancements to increase the power of the attack, evolve to a more potent form, or to even change the colour type to one more advantageous. Cards may also be played to weaken or devolve the opponent monsters.
The monster ending the battle with the highest rating wins.

Each starter contains 34 cards and one gold embossed card and one special "hologram" card. Rules and battlemat are combined in a single mapfold sheet.

The Upper Deck release of the Digimon game in 2000 appears to use slightly modified cards as this with similar rules.

name: Roman Triumph
description:
Covers the 7 main battles of 2nd Punic war: Ticcino, Trebia, Transimeno, Cannae, Becura, Metaurus, and Zama.

1 map with no terrain must be prepared.
192 counters are provided as sticker. These must stick to cardboard and cut.
2 charts.
6 sided die is needed

Issue game of old Game Journal 47.

name: Hostile Stars
description:
Hostile Stars is a tabletop miniatures wargame of tactical starship combat. The game covers fleet scale battles with ships being grouped into squadrons led by flagships. Players choose to allocate Reactor Points to perform movement and combat actions. The movement system is based in 2 dimensions with some 3D considerations and the combat rules cover a variety of weapon types. There are additional rules governing how ships are affected by the gravity and atmosphere of nearby planets.

Hostile Stars is designed for use with Dark Realm Miniatures but may be used with any starship minis.

The rules, ship stats, and player aids may be downloaded for free from The Dark Realm Miniatures website.

name: Cyber Sneak
description:
Set in the far future, where the innocent are arrested for mere thoughts, one man is making a break for freedom. Players take control of the innocent man and his hacker friend and work together to outfox the automated prison guards and weapon systems.

A single board represents both the physical jail and the equivalent cyber world. As the heros move around the board they collect information in the form of cards that can be played to disable the jails defences, thereby making it easier to reach the goal

As well as fixed on-board obstructions the player has to avoid or deal with game controlled robots that move and patrol the jail.
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Definitions
description:
A party word game. Contents:
Over 1200 Definition cards
1 Board
26 Alpha-pieces
4 blank pieces
Good Word Cards
Bad Word Cards

Descriptions from the box and rules:
"Word for word, we think you'll find DEFINITIONS(TM) more fun than any other pursuit."
"An adult word game for 2 or more players."

Players attempt to move to the Dictionary space on a square board by correctly answering Definition questions. Each card has a word and three possible definitions, only one of which is correct. Along the way, players can send each other back to the Primer, collect Good and Bad word cards, and Challenge other player's definitions.

name: Bloodlines
description:
Description from the rulebook

Bloodlines is a game that can be played by 2-6 players. Each player controls one bloodline, which is represented by a set of nobles from the same family tree. Each living noble has one or two genetic markers, indicating which (up to two) bloodlines he or she belongs to. The genetic markers appear as tokens on the noble’s card.
The game proceeds in turns, and in each turn, the player can perform a set of actions with one or more of the nobles in his bloodline (nobles containing at least one marker for the players bloodline). Actions include having a baby, getting married, starting an affair, or challenging another noble to a duel.
Your goal is to use your actions wisely to build the most powerful bloodline in the game.
publishers: Nobility Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Dimension X
description:
Chess in the Twilight Zone. From the introduction:

"This game consists of two parallel planes of existence. On one plane we have a typical chessboard; on the other plane (Dimension X) we have a board inhabited by strange trans-dimensional chess pieces in the form of snakes, spiders and crabs. These creatures can leave Dimension X, and also return
to it..."

The rules of the game are simple. The goal is to checkmate your opponent's king. You start with 2 chess boards next to each other. On one board, you play a normal chess game, making 1 move per turn. On the other board each player has 3 short range pieces - creatures with strange powers - that may only move in Dimension X and only attack in our dimension. Each player, during his or her turn, also either moves one of the Dimension X creatures on the second board, crosses between dimensions, or attacks with a creature in our dimension.

This is a most unusual 3D chess variant that quite literally adds a whole other level of tactics and strategy to chess, with a twist.

name: Keep Safe In Traffic
description:
"The game of playing it safe... while walking, bicycling, and driving."

Teaches children to use their eyes before their feet as they move tokens around a street grid. The crossing guard tokens helps the children and the game also teaches kids to avoid talking to strangers.

Situations include crossing at a traffic light, dialing 911, and hitchhiking.

Includes a colorful board with a spinner, kid tokens, car tokens, rules, and a sheet of reflective stickers for children to put on their bikes.

Cardinal Item No. 7000

name: Election City U.S.A.
description:
User summary: When more than three play, the players form teams.

Each card represents a number of electoral votes. To win the card (and get the votes) a player must roll the number on the card on either die or total of both dice. A player who gets the plurality of votes in a state wins the entire state. The player (or team) that gets the plurality of electoral votes has won the game.

name: Sneaky Space Spinners
description:
Humanity has made the jump to the stars only to find that they are not alone. We are threatened by pirates, aliens and danger at every turn. Our only hope is to send 2-4 intrepid heroes into the unknown to find new technology that might turn the tide in earth's favor.

Players take on the role of Earth's last hope, charting the galaxy, discovering new worlds and making a profit on the side. Keep an eye out for the four mysterious alien races: The Heartiols, The Diamondias, The Clubstations and The Spadoo. These fantastic beings have harnessed the power to 'spin' their region of space and will impart that power to you, for a price. With this power, the Human race can effectively turn away any invader that might threaten the Earth. Only a hero with all four space spinning artifacts can save us!

Playable with 4 space tiles, player ship tracking boards some tokens and a deck of standard playing cards!
categories: Adventure, Economic, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Escape From Sneakius IV
description:
Introduction

You drew the short straw on Space Ranger duty today - your Federation of Planets scout ship was assigned to Sneakius IV, the most dangerous planet in the entire universe. And in keeping with your luck, your ship encountered a mysterious space storm and crashed!

Sneakius IV is crammed full of every kind of lethal predator and deadly parasite that you could imagine... and you'll have to use your imagination because no survey team has ever survived the onslaught of ravenous beasties to file a report. Your only hope is to try to make it across unknown terrain past horrible monsters to an escape shuttle at the abandoned ecology survey station. But if you're caught on the way, you'll end up as lunch. So, tread carefully Space Ranger... and pray you don't taste too delicious.

Gameplay Abstract

Players take on the role of characters moving from a crash site location to an abandoned ecology station using point to point movement. The first player to reach the ecology station is the winner. As players move their pawns through locations, they must roll a die to avoid detection by alien monsters represented by tokens. If detected, they must fight. Individual players use characters with individual strengths and weaknesses and player powers, helping them avoid or defeat monsters. Each round, events on cards cause more monsters to spawn and regulate monster movement around the game board.

Additional Information

This game is an entry to the contest Sneaky Sci Fi Game Design Contest.

name: Fransche Koningen Spel
description:
French Kings Game

Oblong pennyprint with/of a board game, that is similar to the Game of Goose. There are 63 spaces, which depict kings and emperors of France from the year 420 to 1859, and eagles. In the middle is a larger picture of the 'Famille Impériale' (Emperor Napoleon III, emperor from 1852-1870, with wife and son). Title and Rules of the Game are in Dutch, the text with the pictures is in French. In the four corners there are pictures of acts of war with the subscripts 'En Afrique'; 'En Crimée'; 'En Italie'; 'En Chine.

Rule of the game

This game is played with two dice and goes from 1 to 63. Everyone throws [the dice] in turn, and puts something on the place that his number of pips indicates, with the second throw you move the number of spaces indicated by the number of pips in the throw, etc.

Whoever lands on number 63, the imperial family, wins the game and gets the pot. Before the start of the game, everyone agrees on an amount to put in the pot, and what the fines will be that have to be payed at every 'hinderpaal' (obstacle) or 'ontmoeting' (encounter) that either hinders progress or makes you change places, for example, if you throw 6, you pay a fine and go to 12.
If you land on 19, you are resting in the hotel, you pay the fine that was predetermined and you have to pass for 1 turn.
If you land on 31, where St.Louis is taken prisoner of war, you pay the fine and have to stay in the space until someone else is taken in your place.
If you land on 42, you are in the imperial garden, you pay the fine and go back to 39 (it may say 30, I can't tell).
If you land on 52, where the iron mask is in prison, you have to pay [the fine] and stay there until you are released again.
If you land on 58, Napoleon II at Solferino, you have to pay [the fine] and start from the beginning (written is '= 24 june 1859').
Whoever is passed by another player, has to pay and go to that players number.
Whoever throws a 6 and 3 at the start of the game, goes to 26 the trophee, and whoever throws 5 and 4, goes to 53, the crown (not sure if I see the numbers right).

If you land on an eagle, you go forward again the number of pips you threw on the dice (this will happen again if you land on another eagle). If you would pass 63 this way, you count back so many spaces as you have movement left over.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cribball
description:
Cribball is a sports action game for Cribbage players, involving the strategy of Cribbage and the competitive action of Football.

To play, all that is needed is a standard deck of playing cards and a basic knowledge of Cribbage.

The game played in two timed halves, of 30 or 60 minutes. Each player receives 3 time outs. The board is an illustrated football field, 50 yards in length, with an end-zone at each end of the field. Special deck cuts are used to determine kick-offs, kick returns, punts, field goals and extra point attempts. The players play a hand of Cribbage. The difference between the hand scores is the total net yardage gained or lost by the offensive player. The football peg is then moved the appropriate distance on the field. If the ball advances over the end-zone, the offensive player scores a touchdown. At the end of the regulation time, the player with the higher score is the victor.

From the rule book.

name: CEO: Cheat Every One
description:
You are a "CEO" of a multinational company. Your objective is to "transfer" money from the company account to your private "retirement" account on the Cayman Islands. You fly around the game board in your company jet, carrying a well-stuffed moneybag - but the money isn’t yours.. yet.
As a serious and highly paid "CEO" you have a lot of chores; hiring a new secretary, whose business qualifications spring from her weeklong experience as a Hooters waitress, convincing the SEC that a couple of late night phone calls do not qualify as insider trading, but are simply a question of friendly talk between collegues, and maintaining your expensive friendship with the local politicians. Of course you also have to be on top of the latest news from the various business' you are involved in, which means chatting up other "CEO's" on luxury cruises. On your way, you encounter the chance to do alittle trading, spend the Company's money on luxury items and maybe have a run-in with the IRS or the SEC. So before you get to fly to Cayman, your moneybag may have inflated or deflated – or you may even be forced to exchange your moneybag with another "CEO".

You are ready to retire (have won the game) when you have put away 150 Million on your private Cayman Islands account.

name: Rattlesnake Creek
description:
Howdy, ya'll. Rattlesnake Creek is a rip-roaring miniatures wargaming system primarily designed for 25/28mm models.

Set in the Old West, this game delivers a fast, simple, and exciting experience of small-scale gun battles, recreating the drama of combat with dice rolls and poker chips.

So grab yer six-shooter, pilgrim!
categories: American West, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Across the U.S.A. Game
description:
Get set for a great trip across the U.S.A.! You don't have to worry about what to bring or what to wear. So don't drag out the backpacks or knapsacks, and forget about the plane, train, and bus tickets. You won't even need a driver's license. All you will need for the journey is THE ACROSS THE USA GAME book and a few playful, game-loving friends.

With this great game you'll travel from coast to coast, exploring all fifty states and discovering all sorts of interesting info about this wonderful land of ours. You'll find out about national parks and rivers, famous monuments and landmarks, prominent people, state capitals, flowers, and birds - tons of terrific trivia. When your cross-country game is finished, you will have had a fun-filled time from sea to shining sea - and what better souvenir of an unforgettable trip!

- from inside cover

This game was sold as a slim staple-bound book. The map gameboard is on the center pages, with a list of basic facts about each US state on the backs of the gameboard pages. The surrounding pages contain a total of 32 punch-out trivia cards, each with 8 questions on the front and 8 answers on the back. The rules are inside the back cover. Players must provide their own playing pieces and a die.

- user description

name: Stockcar Challenge
description:
From the box: The ultimate stock car racing trivia board game for race fans coast to coast.

Players answer stock car racing trivia questions to move off Pit Road, onto the Track and around to the Finish and Victory Lane.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reykjanesspilið
description: A trivia game about the municipality of Reykjanesbær in Iceland. The questions come in three levels of difficulty making this an easier game for younger / less knowledgable players than many trivia games.

name: Shields Up!
description: A game of starship-based combat and exploration with a variable board of planets and empty space. Mission, event, equipment and personnel cards are dealt to the planets, and players use their starcraft to travel amongst them, executing missions for the currency used to purchase upgrades to ship and crew, and to earn Fame points. Game is won when a certain amount of Fame points are collected.

name: Sverigedemokrat eller nazist?
description:
A simple roll and move game, in which you get questions about the difference between being a follower of the Nazi Party or the Swedish Democrats.

Published in Faktum #95.

name: Warlocks of the Dark Star
description:
Warlocks of the Dark Star is a strategic space wargame pitting the eponymous Warlocks against a group called the Technoids or Techlongs (the rules use both names). The Technoids, as suggested by their name, use technology, while the Warlocks use magic.

The basic system is not especially complicated but there is a fair amount of chrome. For example, the Warlock player receives magic points which can be used to build new units and create effects (such as moving a star system). The Technoid player can't create new units but can scavenge the wrecks of old ones.

At the start of the game, the Warlock player chooses an alien race to play (some of which have special powers) and chooses a home system and colonies, along with a decoy race; all of this information is kept secret. The object of the game for the Technoid player is to find and destroy the Warlocks' systems.

This game should not be confused with Warriors of the Dark Star: The Age of the Neutron Wars.

name: DragonElves
description:
DragonElves was a short lived foray into developing an E-card game by Fast Forward Enterprises in 2000. This was an unusual design in that players could design and customize their cards and then print out the decks themselves.

Gameplay is a mix of standard CCG cardplay and some aspects of a wargame. DragonElves depicts the battle between the armies of the DragonElves and the BronzeMen.Players arrange their armies in 4 columns and striving to eliminate the units in the enemy ranks by direct combat and boosting attacks by playing various effect cards over a 4-Phase skirmish turn. Players attempt to better their opponents attacks with spells and skills, then augmented by a random draw.

As characters are eliminated then new warriors are exposed to attack until one side or the other has been totally wiped out.

name: Rakentaa
description:
The pdf. file containing the complete rules and game components can be found at:

World Turtle Games

Here is a brief description:

Rakentaa is a new and unexplored set of islands. You represent a group of explorers who have been sent out by your King to find new lands and wealth for his Kingdom. Players build castles and structures in a race to dominate the landscape. Victory is obtained once your people have garnered enough resources to bribe the King into letting you keep the land for yourselves.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Spot's First Picture Word Cards
description:
From the publisher:
Learn now words while playing with Spot and his friend. Choose the colorful puzzle piece with the picture and try to find the matching word from other puzzle pieces. Watch out, because the wrong pieces won't fit and you lose points. Be the first little learner to get 5 correct picture/word match and win the game.

name: Pirate Race Game
description:
From the publisher:
Throw the doe and move round the board, picking up cards as you go. the first player to have collected enough cards to complete a pirate picture and race around the board to the treasure is the winner.

Content:
1 board
24 pirate cards
4 counters
1 die

The skills being developed at this age include:

counting skill
co-operative play
concepts of winning and losing


This Pirate Race Game will aid this development as a child:

throws the die and counts the correct number of places on the board
learns to take turns with the other players
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Orchard Toys, The Boots Company, PLC

name: Orkusparnaðarspilið
description: From the rules: Each player is the owner of a house and tries to win the game by heating, renovating and fix it for up to twenty years as cheaply as possible. Each house starts out with oil warming, consuming 100 units of energy each year. Each unit costs 3 shillings. The winner is the player who's total heating cost is lowest at the end of the game.

name: Stock Market
description:
From the bottom of the box:

"It's bulls vs the bears!

The Stock Market is a vibrant and exciting place where fortunes are won and lost. This real life game helps you in understanding stock trading and could help you in making big money, one day.

Invest in Blue chips like Asian Paints, I.T.C., Grasim, Tisco, Reliance and Blow Past. Buy when low and sell when high and you could end up becoming one of the stars in the ring!"

Everything is in English, but this is a game either for Indians or made in India. The currency of the stock market is rupees, and it's drawn from the Bank of Dalal Street.

name: Critical Decisions
description:
From the rule book:

This is a gambling game for people who like to think and make decisions, or who like to discover how other people think and make decisions. The objective of the game is to acquire a greater dollar value of poker chips than any of the other Players. The game ends when either 1) the Bank is broken, or 2) an agreed upon time limit expires.

There are 3 different Versions of Critical Decisions:

A) The first, Version A, can be played by 2 or more people. It relies on extensive consumer research, and gives Players a good idea of how specific groups of Americans react to Critical Decisions. This is the informational Version of the game.

B)The second Version, Version B, can also be played by 2 or more Players. It asks particular players how they would react to Critical Decisions. It provides a friendly opportunity to explore the philosophies of your friends and acquaintances. This Version is played best with people who already know each other, or who want to know each other better. It's the personal Version of the game.

C) The third Version, Version C, is complicated analysis of group reactions. It should only be played by odd numbers of people. For those seeking just a little relaxation and interaction, it's a headache. For the hardcore cerebral types, it presents an unusual challenge.

name: The Last Sneak Standing
description:
[This game was created for the Sneaky SciFi Game Design Contest http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/55802/sneaky-sci-fi-ga... please give it a visit and try out the other great games that were created for the occasion.]

"Listen well and attend, for this is the way it was. They were here when our mighty forces came, this planet that was ours by right. They fought us till they were no more, ground to dust by our stark fists of destiny. We remember though, we remember them by playing this simple game. We remember how cheaply they sold their last moments, how easily they were led to the slaughter with mere promises. We remember the last of them, the very last, for that was our promise....that the last sneak standing would find a place in our history. So now remember..."

The Battle Of The Stark Fist on July 5th was brutal, short and final. What remained of Humanity was marched off to a barren expanse of wreckage known as Camp Apocalypse. As the leader of one of the last remaining factions your goal is to keep your people alive as long as you can how ever you can in hope that something or someone might come along to save you from total destruction.

Your first job is to secure your followers a place to survive. With limited space you plot and plan with the other faction leaders to carve out your new home.

Your next job is to survive each day. The one certainty is that when the sun sets another part of Camp Apocalypse will be destroyed by the malevolent Stark Fist. In the morning will need to bargain with what resources you have, including the lives your your followers, to find out what part of the Camp is going to be destroyed. The afternoon is spent moving your followers around the Camp to avoid the coming nights destruction, hopefully with the knowledge of where the destruction is going to happen. After the bombs fall you will need to spend the evening hours caring for those who survived. If you can not supply them with food and shelter they will perish in the harsh night.

Each day goes as the one before and and your goal becomes ever more important...to have your faction be the last of Humanity.

Game Flow
-Setup Up Phase- Camp Apocalypse
-Main Phase - It Was The Best Of Times It Was The Last Of Times
--- 1. Morning Intel
--- 2. Afternoon Delight
--- 3. Ashes To Ashes Dusk To Dusty
-End Game - The Last Sneak Standing

Materials
- Sector Tiles
- Humanity Counters
- Faction Leader Counters
- Influence Cards
- Stark Fisk Chits
- Stark Fist Container

(a rough draft of the rules can be found here http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/5103540#5103540 . Finished rules will be posted to the files section here when they are ready for testing)

name: Zombie Manor II
description:
Zombie Manor II is a mini-game that is included with the terrain model set "Wildwood Grove." Besides the change in setting, it expands the original Zombie Manor by adding new monsters and treasures. This set can be combined with the contents of "Zombie Manor I" to create a longer game and add variety.

From the rules introduction:

The objective of the game is to search the Graveyard for the ring of Lady Coreanne Swarthington. The Graveyard is not completely abandoned however, as strange forces (or perhaps even the curse of the ring itself) conspire to make it a focus of foul magics and a home to misshapen creatures that never should have been. Will you recover the lost ring, or will you find your own grave in Wildwood Grove?

Link: http://www.worldworksgames.com/store/index.php?main_page=pro...;products_id=288
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: SNEAK: Smugglers Nimbly Evading Alien Killers
description:
They said hello by destroying the moon. Tides ceased to exists and wave after wave of dead fish washed up on shores the world over. You will never know the pleasure of walking in the surf during a lazy summer vacation, bug. I'm so sorry for that.

In the midst of the panic over the moon they appeared. We tried to fight back but they destroyed our biggest weapons in their silos. Governments and world leaders responded in different ways. Some gave up instantly, and others resisted. The beach, bug, remember what I told you about that? It used to be a lot farther away, but that was before they made an example of it. All in all, it was a hell of a way to find out that we were not alone.

That was about 15 years ago. Since then, we've had some victories, but far too many failures. The biggest op your daddy was involved in was faking the crash on Mars a few years back. See, bug, we WANTED that ship to take heavy fire and crash, right where it did. There were enough diggers aboard to set up the underground Mars base. Last time daddy was there he got to see a new weapon, based on their tech. Hopefully we can have it ready soon.

This is why I have to go, bug. Mars needs people like me to sneak in, hide in the Moon belt, deliver supplies and workers, and get back home without being seen. And I promise you that one day I will take you to see the rings of Saturn, when we can fly throughout the system safely and freely. It'll be just you and me. I should be back soon. I will miss my little bug, bunches and bunches! Daddy will always l-

END TRANSMISSION

In SNEAK, players take on the role of heroic smugglers looking to transport supplies up to the secret Resistance base on Mars. On each turn, you will have an amount of energy (action points) that you can use to maneuver and move your ship around the board. However, any leftover energy is converted in cargo cards, that you draw into hand. Asteroids will then semi-randomly move around the board, blocking your way or revealing your hiding space. Then, the aliens will move and attempt to destroy you. Each time you get hit by an alien you will have to lose cargo cards- or else you will have to start your smuggling run again. Upon a successful run, you will score notoriety points based on the cargo you brought and can spend it to increase your maximum energy, maximum cargo (hand size), and number of special powers (mods), or to buy new mods.
The most notorious smuggler at the end of 10 rounds is the winner!
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Psephology
description:
From the box cover and Rules of Play:

Presidential Campaign Game - Win the election using strategy and knowledge. The object of Psephology (se-fahl-uh-gee) is to be elected the president of the United States. The first candidate to win at least 100 votes and then move to the White House is the winner.

Psephology (from Wikipedia http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psephology) Psephology (from Greek psephos ψῆφος, 'pebble', which the Greeks used as ballots) is that branch of political science which deals with the study and statistical analysis of elections. Psephology uses compilations of precinct voting returns for elections going back some years, public opinion polls, campaign finance information and similar statistical data. The term was coined in the United Kingdom in 1952 by historian R. B. McCallum to describe the scientific analysis of past elections. In Britain the term occasionally appears in scholarly literature.

The game has 625 cards containing 2500 questions and answers, Power Politics cards, game pieces, dice, a game board and vote cards.

Roll the dice, decide how to move your marker, read the vote bonus/penalty on the board and then attempt to correctly answer a political question to win votes.

Includes rules for 7-12 players and classroom team play, including a timed version.

name: Gator Trivia
description:
This is a football trivia game that features questions about the University of Florida. Questions cover the beginning of the program in 1899 and continue until the game's publication date in 1984.

The game board is a representation of the Gator football stadium. Players move up and down the field by correctly answering questions about players, coaches, historically important games, etc. The number of yards a player moves forward on the gridiron is determined by a die roll. Penalties are assessed for incorrect answers. The player with the most points as time expires is declared the winner.

Includes the board, four tokens, die, rules, and a storage insert.

name: Vicksburg
description:
Vicksburg was published in the October 1969 (Volume 2 Number 10) issue of International Wargamer, an IFW publication. It consisted of six pages of rules, three pages of OOB and playtest response form, two pages of counters (which needed to be colored, mounted, and cut out), and seven pages of maps (which needed to be cut out and assembled).

The rules seem typical for a simple wargame from this period, with a few embellishments such as rules for canal-building, mines, and mortars. The most unusual element of the game is that it takes place on two maps, a small map for campaign operations and a large map showing just the fortifications around Vicksburg. Units are presumably supposed to move between the two, but the rules are not entirely clear.

name: Mount Dora: City Of Festivals
description:
This is a game designed to showcase local business owners in Mount Dora, Florida. Located north of Orlando, this small city is famous for antique shops, the historic downtown district, and a massive sidewalk art festival.

The game features a map depicting regional landmarks and dozens of stores. The cards describe each business and the game play is similar to Monopoly.

Includes a large full-color laminated map, cards representing the local business community, play money, dice, tokens, and rules.

name: Tjejernas Frågespel
description:
From the publisher:
A girl's quiz is the perfect game for girls to play. By answering the questions and taking various exciting challenges ahead can be reached finish while collection narrow point chips. Game has questions about things that interest girls and a large proportion of them are also of the girls themselves! In addition to answering questions you have to compete in the charades, participate in exciting word hunts and may take part in special assignments.
Reach the end first and be the winner of the Girls Trivia game!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kontrast
description:
From the back of the box:

"Cards

112 cards representing the letters of the alphabet
4 cards for each letter except:
2 letter Z's, 2 of the letter X
6 each of the vowels, A, E, I, O, and U.

Object Of The Game

The object of the game is to be the first player to remove all of the cards from his hand by forming valid words and accumulating 25 points.

Valid Words

To be valid, words must have two or more letters, must not be proper nouns, words must be in singular form. Abbreviated words, slang words, and foreign words are not permitted."

name: Trivia Philadelphia
description:
This is a trivia game about the City of Brotherly Love that features actual business locations, sports teams, etc. Players move around the board "visiting" these shops, radio stations, restaurants, etc.

Players must complete a score card by answering trivia questions from five different categories and be the first to cross the finish line.

Includes a colorful board, score cards, score markers, tokens, labels, dice, question cards, rules, and a storage insert.

name: Zhang Qi
description:
Zhang Qi is an abstract strategy game, in which the players simply take turns claiming a number from the set {2, 5, 7, 10, 11, 14, 15, 17, 20, 23, 25, 31, 33, 37, 39, 40, 44, 46, 49, 50, 53, 59, 60, 61, 62, 68, 71, 73, 74, 78, 79, 83}. What makes the game something other than a trivial exercise is that the person whose turn it is, is always the player with the lower score, which means that getting too far ahead can ultimately set you behind, as your opponent takes several turns in a row. The winner is the player whose claimed numbers have the highest sum.

Because the shape of the board is irrelevant (technically, you could play by grabbing numbered chips from the middle of the table), the designer gave the game some visual appeal by making the board square, with numbered spaces set up like the board was broken into fragments.

name: Medieval Meals
description: A Warpspawn card game. Players draw cards to acquire the foodstuffs necessary to cook "a meal fit for a king"; or else a commoner, as his majesty doesn't eat gruel and the hoi polli don't get to eat pomegranate. Each of the more than 100 foods falls into a category, such as fish or drink or bread. Each of the 20 recipes requires an appropriate number of foods from a category or several categories. Each recipe has a number of points which a player earns upon discarding the requisite food cards. First to get 100 points wins.

name: Creatures and Features Game
