description: Can pigs fly? Do gorillas have tails? Discover the answers to these and other fascinating animal facts in this fast playing game. Reveal an animal tile and quickly place your chips on the features you think belong to that creature. THe more features you get correct, the more points you score. But watch out - some creatures have features that will surprise you! The player with the most points wins.
categories: Animals, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: John Hancock Lifeline Game
description:
LIFELINE is the challenging and educational game about Life Insurance. In this game each player plays the role of head of family (father) and the goal of the game is to obtain insurance coverage in relationship to his income and responsibilities. The player who obtains these goals first is declared the winner. LIFELINE may be enjoyed by two to four players.

-- from the back of the game box (which also contains the complete rules for the game)

This appears to have been a promotional game used by the John Hancock insurance company.

Quoting the rules, again:

"Once a player has acquired a house, a wife, and 2 children, and has purchased all necessary insurance, he continues to move around the board until he reaches the Finish space, and then he is declared the winner."

Never have I heard a more ominous formula for victory as, presumably, at that point our poor victor has collected on his life insurance.

name: Domestic Economy
description:
In the late-19th-century, noted London printer C.W. Faulkner published a small card game titled Domestic Economy. Needless to say, the title did not refer to Britain's gross national product or budget deficit, but to the subject that today goes by the name of Family and Consumer Science - the successful running of a household.

Displayed at the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery, Birmingham, UK, 2009-?

name: Fragments
description:
A 1920s party game in which participants hunt down cards which have been scattered around a room. The goal is to find three cards depicting a head, a torso, and legs which combine to form a complete picture of a person.

Part of the "Dainty Series."

name: Captain Kangaroo's Numbers Game
description:
This in an educational game for young children. The games are easy to learn and the kids can play alone or in groups. Wild cards make winning a combination of learning and luck. The Captain Kangaroo theme is designed to spark a child's imagination.

This is actually five games in one package. Kids match pictures to numerals, match identical pictures, match the quantities shown on the card, place items in number order, and a classic "Go Fish" card game.

Includes 36 learning cards, 4 double-sided game boards, 6 wild cards, a storage insert, and a rules booklet with a parent's guide.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number

name: Colorswap
description:
Colorswap is based on a juggling notation called siteswap.

Goal: Get all of your pieces including the cube into different columns and onto different colors. The cube must be played in the far right column (I)

Setup: Each player has a board and 8 pieces. There is also 1 cube sitting between all of the players. On your turn place a piece on your board in any row as far left as available. All other players immediately place a piece on their own board in the same place. When all 8 pieces are played the puzzle solving begins.

Solving the Puzzle and Scoring Points: Pieces may be moved left and right, but not up or down. The very last column on the right (I) is reserved for the cube. Once a player has all of their pieces in different columns from A-H, simultaniously on different colors and are the first to grab the cube and place it onto the missing color they score a point.

Negative Points: Players who grab the cube before finishing the puzzle get a negative point. Players can also get a negative point by grabbing the cube and finding that their answer is actually not correct.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Educational, Math, Print & Play
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Go Figure!  Silly Bodies
description:
From the back of the box:

Pick a shape card and lay it down. Add another! Then another! Take turns adding new shapes until . . . You've made a Silly Body."

The rules give four different games that you can play with the shape cards: We Made It Together - a cooperative variant in which the players take turns laying down cards until they both think they've made a silly body; On Our Own - a competitive variant where each players takes 20 or 30 cards and makes as many silly bodies as he or she can; Use 'Em All Up - a competitive variant where each player takes 20 or 30 cards and uses them all to create one incredible silly body; and Jump and Switch where after completing one of competitive variants you switch cards with your opponent and play the game again.

The shape cards have many different shapes and colors, but are made out of very flimsy cardboard.

name: Vive Victory
description:
User Summary:

A simple war game featuring units with varying movement, attack and range factors. Units include infantry, artillery, cavalry, support and an HQ.
Players set up on their side of the map in any configuration desired. Combat is determined by spinning a spinner. Terrain has an impact on game play. Rivers must be crossed at bridges, towns act as defensive positions and therefore get to fire first (but only at one of the enemies that is attacking the defending unit) and most terrain features limit who can move through them.
The goal is to capture the enemy HQ or force their surrender.

name: Stuart Little 2
description:
This is a children's game based on the classic Stuart Little books and movies... in this case, the sequel.

Players race stand-up plastic biplane tokens along a path on the colorful game board. The children search for tiles that match the scenes on their movie "story board" displays. The first player to collect all six images from "Stuart Little 2" is the winner.

Includes the large 28" x 20" board, 4 Stuart Little tokens, 32 movie scene tiles, 4 story board displays, 6 dice, and the rules printed on an illustrated storage insert.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Glow in the Dark Monster Math
description:
Slim book of 14 spooky games with 5 glow in the dark dice. The games are:
A Bat's Chance
Bewitching Brew
Odd Man and Even Stan
Monster War
Swamp Monster Math
Troll's Gold
Pirate's Treasure Hunt
Graveyard Ghoulies
Monster Baseball
Who wants to be a Monster?
Monster Knockout!
Dueling Numbers
Medusa's Snakes
The Seven-Headed Dragon

Included with the book are 3 glow in the dark pipped dice, and 2 glow in the dark dice with +,-, x (each twice on each die)

ISBN GID-MONST

name: The Slinky Game
description: Players alternate turns setting the Slinky in motion (the rules call it "walking") down the slope. Where on the target card the Slinky stops tells the player how a player’s scoring peg moves on the scoreboard. (The target card is double sided for variety.) Landing on "Slunk" send a player back to Start. The first player to get to the top of the scoring chart wins.

name: Shores of Heaven
description:
This is a card game for 7 players. It is based around Space Pirates. Though similar to BANG!, there are several unique twists. Each player has his own unique objective, and his own unique card set based on his own unique alien race. Each player commands a ship that has 15 Hit Points. Hits are usually taken using Dice. However, while some players may have powerful attacks, the focus of the game for many players is not to destroy the other players but to accomplish an objective.

Samples:
Akzinal - A traditional thief. His goal is to capture all treasures.
Felian - A snakelike race, the Felian are tremendously territorial. Their objective is to be the last Faction standing.
Homin - This hominid race lived relatively peacefully until an alien race sent an explosive that destroyed many lives, not including the lives that were lost. The Homin Captain seeks to find and neutralize the alien menace.
Morph - As their name suggests, the Morph are a race of appearance-altering people who have developed their ships to transform as well. Always seeking to attain transcendence, the Morph try to do so by learning from other people. Their objective is to acquire technologies from all other factions.
Ralyk - Wolf Men. Because their genetics prevent their reproduction, the only way they can continue as a race is to (naturally) turn others into Wolf Men. They prominently seek out the Alphas of each species. This said, their objective is to capture all opposing Captains through duel or by kidnapping.
Var*por - A squidlike race who travel aboard live ships. These ships look like rays but hold solar powers. Thus they are called StarRay in first phase and SunRay in later phase. The objective is to raise a StarRay to its second phase and lead it to a New Birth phase where another StarRay is born.
Wallaboo - A small teleporting Kangaroo race who stow away on ships and influence the playing field. They maneuver game play while attempting to remain unnoticed and escape capture. Their objective is to be free aboard the winning ship.

Objectives that are well thought out with interesting back-story, only made more incredible by the fact that this game is so easy to play.

As stated, each faction has their own unique abilities, but a shared deck unites them all. In this shared deck are Detonator Cards (the central card which allows players to make basic attacks or to play their faction cards), Evasion Tactics which protect ships from attack, Quick Fix cards to restore Hit Points, Steal cards that allow players to steal Faction abilities from other factions (including Captains and Treasures), Void cards which return continuous abilities to their decks, and other (more unique) abilities.

Dueling, a major factor of Traditional Bang, is now done exclusively in battle for captains. (All players may Duel for opposing captains, as Captain cards hold unique abilities. This was also true of Traditional Bang). This does not require the use of cards. Any player can Duel with an opponent that has less than 1/2 Hit Points. Each Captain has his own HP rating, and a series of D6 Dice Rolls resolves a Duel. The winner retains the opponent's captain along with his unique ability.

Another new feature of Shores of Heaven is a mini game called Common Threat, wherein 2 D6's are rolled and the values are multiplied. Players must work together to destroy the Common Threat before returning to play. Each player who fails to neutralize the threat loses 1 HP. The Victor redeems all lost HP.

FOLLOWING IS A SIMPLE RULE SET. SOON, WITH PRINTABLE CARDS TO BE UPLOADED, YOU SHOULD BE ABLE TO PLAY THE GAME WITHIN A FEW MINUTES...

START
Along with cards, you will need a D4 and a D6 to play. (Unique sided dice are usually inexpensive and can be found on the internet or at specialty board game shops.)
After Starting Position has been determined, each player pulls a faction at random from the SPECIES deck. This card remains face up until the faction is removed from play. There are two SPECIES decks, only one of which has a WALLABOO card. If the WALLABOO card is chosen, the Wallaboo faction keeps the additional SPECIES deck to mark his current position. His position is revealed to only the player who plays the IMPRISONMENT card. (Each faction has an IMPRISONMENT card in his FACTION deck.) If the Wallaboo plays his TRUCE card, his position is then revealed to all players.
At this point, all players but the Homin also receive a THREAT card, distinguishing them as a Menace or as Benign.
OBJECTIVES:
Akzínal - Acquire all treasures. This can be done using a STEAL card from the SHARED deck or a FILCH card from your personal deck. The treasure is returned to your opponent if 1) It is VOIDED. 2) It is STOLEN. 3) It is taken back using 2 DETONATOR cards. 4) You are destroyed. (It is reshuffled into the FACTION deck.)
Felian - Be the last Faction standing. Your Treasure card can help, as it allows you to regenerate after 1 round destroyed. This card stays in effect until it is stolen or voided.
Homin - Hunt and neutralize the Menace. THREAT cards distributed at the start of play determine the Menace. If the Menace is destroyed by someone else, THREAT cards are redistributed. You must destroy the Menace yourself.
Morph - Steal and hold Faction cards from each opponent. These are considered learned abilities, and may be made Lasting Effects, regardless of status, as long as your treasure is in play. (See CARD SYMBOLS for details.) Addendum: Wallaboo movement cards effect range. Sabotage card (in Wallaboo deck) counts against your HP, and is returned to the Wallaboo deck as soon as acquired.
Ralyk - Acquire all Captains. This can be done using a Steal card, or by Dueling. (See CAPTAIN DUEL for details.) If an opponent’s ship is destroyed, his captain is left out, and a Steal card can acquire the Captain for you.
Vär·por - Raise your StarRay to New Birth phase. See SunRay gauge. (This is a narrow purple sheet marked with 15 movements and contains pictures of SunRays at all phases.)
Wallaboo - Remain free aboard the winning faction’s ship. If imprisoned (See Imprisonment cards), you cannot play any of your cards. You can, however, discard and collect cards each round until you hold the Escape card. (Since it has a cost of 2 Detonator cards, you will want those in your hand when you find it.)
CARDS You will start with 2 FACTION cards and 5 SHARED DECK cards. This is the maximum number of cards you will hold in your hand. However, both at the start and end of your turn you will be able to replenish your hand. (Thus Attack does not penalyze Defense.) You may only discard unwanted cards at the end of your turn, before replenishing your hand.
Cards of the same type may be stacked to boost effect. I.E. Because of this, a player who has 2 FOCUS cards may be able to roll a maximum value of 8 with a D4.
CARD SYMBOLS Each card likely has 1 or both of 2 symbols. The first is LE (Lasting Effect). The card may be played down to be in permanent use. The second is #D. This indicates how many Detonator cards must be played to use the card. If the LE has a #D over it, this indicates that there is a cost to make the card a lasting effect. If the card has LE and #D on opposite cards, it may be played as a Lasting Effect but you must play as many Detonator cards for each use.
CAPTAINS’ DUEL - Each Captain Card has a number in the upper right corner. This is how many hits a captain may take before he is defeated. Each time a Duel takes place, both captains start with full HP. Both captains roll a D6. When one opponent rolls higher, the opposite loses 1 HP. This is repeated until 1 captain is lost. Captains may only back out of a Captains’ Duel if a truce is agreed upon. The winner keeps the opponent’s captain as prisoner and can use the additional Captain’s ability freely. If you lose your Captain, you can only rescue the captain using a Steal card, or a Void card. Any captain can duel with an opponent’s captain so long as the challenged opponent has less than ½ HP.
VOID - This card usually means the opponent forfeit’s a card of his choice. However, if you play a VOID card with a DETONATOR card, you may roll a D4. Rolling a 4 or higher (using bonus cards) can give you the ability to choose which Lasting Effects are voided. This can prove a useful tool in recollecting Captains and Treasures as the VOID card returns cards to their Faction decks.
COMMON THREAT - When this card is found, it is played immediately. Roll 2 D6’s, and multiply the scores. Each player in succession uses their attack cards to destroy the common threat. If the player fails to destroy the threat, he loses 1 HP. This continues until the threat is destroyed. The Victor receives all lost HP. The player of this card may determine the initial opponent after the dice roll. (This means that some clever calculation can result in a quick HP boost for him.)
RANGE - Unless otherwise stated, all attacks have a range of 1 in either direction. Captains’ Duel is maximum range.
TREASURES - All opponents may steal treasures to use opponents’ treasure abilities.
categories: Card Game, Pirates, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Computer Derby Horse Racing Game
description:
This is a vintage electronic game sold in the 1970s at Radio Shack stores.

Players use plastic betting chips to wager on horses displayed on a circular computer operated game board... actually a 3-D device similar to a Simon game! The race begins when a switch is activated and two sets of lights start to rotate around the board. The moving lights stop randomly. One light indicates the winning horse and the other light indicates the payoff... 2 to 1, 10 to 1, etc.

Includes the Derby device, 100 chips, a storage insert, and rules.

name: Coloposa
description:
The game consists of L-shaped tiles which contain squares in up to three of the four colors used in the game.
Each player receives four open tiles, an additional tile is placed openly on the table. The players now take turns adding a tile which has to be adjacent to at least one square in the same color, while different colors have to be separated by at least one square. For each matching color the player gets a scoring chip. A new tile is drawn at the end of a turn. The player with most scoring chips at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Runny Babbit Card Game
description:
A promotional card game given out with purchase of Shel Silverstein's book, Runny Babbit. Teams compete to be the first to decode the spoonerism on an updrawn card. The 1st team to do so earns a point. The team with the most points at the end wins.
Contents:
20 cards with a spoonerism and an illustration by Shel

name: Dots n' Spots
description: Multi-match dominos. Hexes with three matching areas: a ring on red, yellow, or blue, with 1 to 3 dots of red, yellow, or blue. Make a three-way match -- ring color, dot number, and dot color -- to get a second turn, which must be at least a two-way match. First player to run out of hexes wins.

name: ALMANiAC
description: Players divide themselves in teams. Each team consists of two or more players. During each turn, one player of the team is designated the clue giver. The clue giver takes the next card from the box. There are six lists, each of a different category, of five proper names. The clue giver must give verbal clues to get the teammates to say each name on the assigned list. The team will advance its pawn one space for each correct response. The team has forty seconds, as counted by a sand timer, to get all five names. The team that first completes one circuit around the gameboard is the winner.

name: The Game of Christmas Cheer
description:
From the Publisher...

The Game of Christmas Cheer is a simple, small game (box is 3.5" square) for families to play during the holidays or anytime you’d like to remember Christmas.

The object of the game is to be the one with the most Christmas cheer (chips) at the end. Cards depict holiday events like last minute shopping and package in the mail. Each one instruct the players to pass cheer right or left, take some from the center. Players can choose to keep rolling the die, hoping to get more cheer, but some rolls can make them lose it all. Everyone has fun because it’s impossible to know who will be holding the most cheer when the game ends.

It’s for 3 to 6 players. There is text to read on the cards, but as long as one player at the table can read even young children can easily enjoy the game. It takes only about 10 minutes to play.

The game comes with:
- a wooden hand-painted gingerbread man pawn (each is unique)
- a 1" die (green or red)
- 10 color cards
- 60 plastic chips
- 1 rule sheet (not in the picture)

Besides just enjoying the game with family and friends, rules are included to use it to give out gifts at a party or family get-together during the holidays.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Finegrader Game
description:
From the rules "The object of the game is to be the first contractor to complete the job and cross the finish line. Just as in actual contracting situations, the quicker the job is completed, the better off you are."

This game was designed for marketing. One player chooses the CMI Autograder-55 and the other players choose any of the 3 generic autograders. Players take turns spinning a wheel to determine how many spaces they move. Spaces can direct the player to lose a turn, go again, draw a card, etc. Many cards tell the player to loose a turn but do not affect the player controlling the Autograder-55 and then describes why the superior technology of that machine makes it a better performer.

name: Welsh Quest
description:
When times are tough, as indeed they are just now, gather your friends and family around the table and cosy up for a few hours of traditional fun with Welsh Quest. Together you can rediscover your Welsh roots and the family values that really matter when you play Welsh Quest. An ideal way to spend quality time together. Be Welsh and proud of it!

Your Country, Your Heritage, Your Passion

Test your knowledge of everything Welsh and learn so much more by playing Welsh Quest. With over 2,000 Welsh multiple-choice questions in four different categories HISTORY, LAND AND NATURE, CULTURE and MODERN there’s so much to share and learn, and the accompanying booklet enhances the experience with further explanations for many of the more interesting and unusual answers. But beware! As you tour the country to collect the letters ‘Q U E S T’, Destiny cards may help or hinder you and you will need to earn sovereigns to help pay your way.

name: Combat Wings 12 O'Clock
description:
COMBAT WINGS 12 O’CLOCK are a complete new set of rules, derived from our WWI aerial rules.

With this rules you can play aerial combats from the Spanish Civil war, WWII an Corean War.

Our first plane data cards are to play the aerial combats of the Spanish Civil War, a total of 90 planes of fighters, ground attack planes, bombers, and reconnaissance.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: A Day of Choices
description:
Look on the back of your Koala Crisp cereal box - free game!

From the Game Rules:

In this game, you need to get through a typical day, trying to make some good, healthy choices along the way.

name: Mother Road
description:
Main Street in your town has just been incorporated into Route 66, the US highway system that links Chicago to Los Angeles. Can you manage to snag a piece of the tourist business pie? Will you build a motel or a cafe? How about a mini-golf and can you make money from your neighbor's giant ball of twine? Some of your family may work for free, but you will have to pay a higher wage to get the people in town to leave your competition and work for you.

Erecting neon signs and billboards, expanding current businesses, and annexing land to increase the size of the town (can we actually incorporate that huge canyon over there?) are all viable ways to make the most money before the interstate system opens and all the traffic bypasses the towns.

name: Sector
description:
1) What is Sector?
Sector is a board game, for 2 to 4 players. The game is based on the strategic occupation of the game board. Taking turns, the participants role a normal cube die and place pieces on the board, according to preset rules. Some of the pieces, or some of the squares where the pieces can be placed, have specific properties that affect how that particular turn is played. Players who can't, in their turn, place the required pieces on the squares of the board are eliminated. The winner is the last surviving player.

2) What do I need to play Sector?
(a) A game board (15x15 squares), with special squares marked;
(b) 225 normal pieces and 20 special pieces (per 2 players);
(c) Nontransparent bag(s) or box(es) for the pieces;
(d) One cube (1-6) die.

3) Let's start the game. Who plays first?
Let the players throw the die and the person with the highest number goes first. After that, the turn proceeds clockwise.

4) What does each turn consist of?
(a) Roll the die.
(b) Take the number of pieces corresponding to the value obtained in that particular throw from the nontransparent bag and place the pieces, in a straight line, on the board. If you happen to draw a special piece or the last piece happens to end in a special square, certain other rules apply.

5) It's my first turn. I've rolled the die. Where should I begin?
In the first turn, all players start in any chosen square, on the edge of the board.

6) How can I place my pieces?
The pieces, always corresponding to the number obtained with the throw of the die, must be placed in a straight line. You are not allowed to turn in a different direction nor are you allowed to place one piece over another. The line, except obviously in the first turn, must always start from a preexisting piece belonging to the current player.

7) What are special squares?
Special squares are clearly marked squares on the board that have a unique propertie. When a line, in a turn, ends on a special square, the current player can place, if possible, an extra piece on any other free special square in the board. This only happens when the turn ends on a special square, not when it crosses a special square. The extra piece is only taken from the nontransparent bag when all other pieces are in place.

8) And special pieces? What are they?
Special pieces are distinctly marked pieces that allow the player to convert, if possible, adjacent opponent pieces into his own. They are mixed up with the normal pieces in the nontransparent bag and are taken, eventually, by chance, when the player is taking the number of pieces obtained by the role of the die or taking a piece for a special square as described above. Special pieces can be used at any point of the line and in any direction as chosen by the current player. The drawing in the special piece shows the allowed positions from which the opponent´s piece(s) can be converted into a player´s piece. In the drawing, on the piece, a dark circle represents the player special piece and the light circles represent the the allowed conversion positions.

Description from the author.

name: Amsterdams Zwerfspel
description:
A Monopoly clone.
Players can buy or sell stocks in companies mentioned on the board.
Playes roll the dice and move along the board. When a player lands on a company owned by another player, he/she has to pay the rent.
At the end of the game, the player with the most money wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Cross Number Roll
description:
Contents 23 dice, some with numbers all the way around, some with mathematical symbols all the way around.
3 minute Egg timer
Cup

Turn the egg timer over and roll however many dice you wish. Try to make a true mathematical equation with as many dice as possible, while rerolling whichever dice you wish. When the timer stops, score a point for each die in the true equation.

example. "10 + 6 = 11 + 5" is worth 7 points

name: Capitan
description:
CAPITAN is a new concept of Napoleonic simulation game, which can be played by both the neophyte and the Napoleonic “grognards”

If you do not have figures we can endeavour you to build your own small units, if you already have them congratulations (28mm, 25mm or 15mm. no problem with the scale or the basing system), you have infinite game possibilities with CAPITAN

Do not think CAPITAN is a “skirmish” game, it is a game system based on the infinity of battles during the Napoleonic wars.

The Combat

CAPITAN is a selection of rules designed to play battles between small groups of troops, such as advance recognition, convoy escort, guerrilla actions, raids on small towns, border posts, incursions into enemy territory, actions against advanced camps, and all those situations where specific tasks were assigned to a few troops of their units.

The troops

In most cases these clashes included small combination of infantry and cavalry, where the training and preparation of the troops was important, unlike the big battles where the big formation groups and the way they were formed was very important (column, line, square, etc.). The gameplay is frenetic and highly addictive.

name: Captain Special Ops WWII
description:
CAPTAIN SPECIAL OP’S (CSOP) Second World War game rules, that belong to the series of CAPITANGAMES CAPTAIN they are designed to play confrontations between small groups of specialized troops, such as airborne assaults, reconnaissance in enemy territory, intelligence missions, coup de main, special operations, commandos actions, patrol scouts, escorting convoys, attacks on villages, border incursions into enemy territory, armour clashes, and all those situations in which specific tasks entrusted to a few units.In most cases small combinations of infantry, armoured and support teams, are included, in what the important thing was the training and preparation of troops, in contrast to the great battles, where large groups of troops and impact of the strategy was crucial.

CSOP is a pure tactical game, the player has to know how to combine arms, infantry, armour and artillery. Our goal is “keep it simple & historically accurate”

name: Bio-SNEAKERS
description:
Bio-SNEAKERS is a multiplayer card game. Mankind has been subjugated by machines and the planet is ruled by an all controlling AI (artificial Intelligence) The object is to to hack the ruling AI and destroy all its core mainframes. If even one of the mainframes survives then all the players lose.
There are various ways of hacking the mainframes and doing it stealthily will give you control points. If you have the most control points at the end of the game then you will control the machines and rule.
The rules are only one page in length.
There are 9 pages of components required for the full 5 player game but only 5 pages of components are required for a 2 player game.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Barney's Rainbow Egg Game
description:
This is a children's game based on the Barney's Great Adventure movie.

Players leave the barn with Twinken's Rainbow Egg and move along the track by matching colors. The kids have adventures as they visit the circus, watch a parade, etc. Cards instruct the children to find colors or play let's pretend.

Players collect star chips for following instructions correctly. The kid with the most score chips when the players reach the finish line is declared the winner.
Includes a colorful puzzle-cut board, a plastic Barney, the egg, star tokens, a spinner, cards, and the rules.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: De Twaalfde Man
description:
De Twaalfde Man is a simple roll-and-move game. It was given away at EMTÉ Supermarkets (The Netherlands) for the 2010 World Cup.

The game recuires 1 die and a miniature from 'Het Oranje Legioen' per player. 'Het Oranje Legioen' are small, orange supporters you can collect at the supermarket.

The board is a soccerpitch on which players move their pawn. On different fields a special situation happens - always with a soccer background: a yellow card, an off-side, free kick, etc. The winner is the one who - on the last field - kicks the ball in the right corner (by throwing the die).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Ancient Magnetic travel set
description:
From the box top,

Contains all that is needed to play Ancient Wargames on the move!,
set includes: Rules, Magnetic playing surface and terrain,
Dice,
Two measures &
Two painted and magnetised armies!!

User:

Players compete with two preselected ancients armies to be the first to out fight their opponent by destroying four enemy units whilst losing less of their own units. Each player has a camp which counts as two units if captured and a general who is equivalent to four units.

The scenery is fully magnetic and offers a myriad of battlefields. Scenery includes river, hills and rough terrain, all of which greatly affect unit capabilities.

The two painted ~2mm scale armies offer varying units including; cavalry, knights (including chariots), elephants, archers, pike and psiloi.

This original version includes Alma Wargames Easy-peasey Ancient Wargames Rules a simplified derivative of De Bellis Antiquitatis 1.2 and offer rules for flanking and unit depth.

All units and scenery are magnetic and battle is joined within the box which has a green battle area with magnetic storage.

This is truly a travel miniatures wargame which can be played on the move.

name: Swordplay: Generic skirmish rules
description:
Front Cover:

Brawls from the dawn of time until the age of black powder.

Inside the rulebook.

"Swordplay" is a set of rules. Written to provide a universal set of skirmish rules, from the dawn of man up to the beginnin of black powder weapons. It covers the sword and sharp pointy stick type of warfare best.
At the end of the book are provided some historical period details to get you started. It is planned to provide details for other periods at a later date.
The rules are written to provide a more "Hollywood" type of game rather than historical accuracy. So if you were brought up on a diet of swashbuckling heroes, and dastardly villains these are the rules for you.

User,

Exhaustive individual character skirmish rules including horses. Includes scenarios for Maldon 991 C.E. (Viking vs Saxon), Ambush Wars of the Roses 1461 C.E. and Bar Room Brawl France 1627 C.E.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Swordplay Supplement: The Three Musketeers
description:
Front Cover;

Recreate the cut and thrust of this classic tale. All the characters and scenarios listed for "Swordplay" rules. Including rules for large groups and mass actions.

User;

Includes eight new scenarios including new rules for grenades and the "A Cast of Thousands" group rules.

Full of flavour this game allows you to recreate a blend of the classic novel with the Hollywood films and play the tale as a campaign.

All the major characters are fully represented with their own character sheets.

Features grid maps of the skirmish locations with plenty of bottles of Le Plonk and Le vin to throw at your opponents as well as the usual chairs and tables.

Designed to work with the Gladiator games range of Three Musketeer 25mm miniatures.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame

name: EverJump
description:
STORYLINE: Somewhere in an old funfair, Little Charlie owns an attraction that features a special kind of trampolines. Far from being a childish game, the tournaments he arranges provide a challenge for memory, tactics and intuition. Will you be able to set clever traps for your opponents while avoiding to get caught in theirs... or even yours?
MATERIAL: AN 8x8 board, 48 tiles and 4 counters in different colors.
TRAMPOLINES (TILES):Charlie´s trampolines do not allow to jump the way the user pleases, but only in certain directions (according to the arrows inscribed in the tiles) which are revealed just when they are trodden on. The arrows are in three colours: green (1-space jump), orange (2-spaces jump) and red (3-spaces jump). Besides, there are two types of arrows: one-way (self explanatory) and multidirectional (the user may choose among two o three possibilities). Finally, there also exist two ‘fake’ trampolines that once occupied will tumble down and will make the player lose its counter.
GOAL: To be the last player remaining on the board, the rest having fallen in a hole or being forced to jump out of the trampolines field.

name: God Calling: Build an Ark!
description:
You’re sitting on your deck under a cloudless day, when the phone rings. You answer it and a voice says “God calling, build an ark.” Before you can react, it hangs up. You look out your window to see storm clouds rolling in. You’d better get going!

God Calling: Build an Ark is an irreverent game that combines the biblical story of Noah and the Great Deluge and the timeless tradition of crank calls. Be the first to gather your Animals, Wood, and Nails, but be warned, everyone else wants the same, and competition is fierce!

Each turn, players play Supply cards, trying to fulfill the minimum requirements for their ark: three Wood cards, three Nail cards, and three Animal cards. However, everyone also has God Calling cards that aid or hinder the players, making them require more cards to complete their ark, discard cards, or counter other God Calling cards. Play is fast and frantic, as players play their cards as fast as they can.

name: American Throttle the Game
description:
From the publisher's website:

American Throttle, The Game is in a few words, a “Poker Run” that tours the United States. It’s about having some drinks, some fun and some laughs. Share stories of rallies you’ve been to like Laughlin, Sturgis or Daytona. Belch a name, take a swig of your drink, tell a joke, name that song, guess who was in that biker movie, or even give unwanted advice! Test your knowledge of motorcycling, motorcycle trivia, and road skills. You can even invite your family or friends who don’t ride, since they can play to win too! They will learn a lot about riding either from you or this game!

There are two ways to win: finish first to win half the game, draw the best poker hand to win the other half of the game. It’s smarts and luck. This is a drinking game, so it is geared toward adults. However if you forego the alcohol and let young adults in on the fun, American Throttle is actually a general audience, sometimes educational, definitely fun game for them too. In other words, we didn’t put in a bunch of junk. This is about riding!

Here is how it is played: Up to seven players or teams of players per game. Put money (or anything you would like) in the Pot. Pick one of 15 motorcycle playing pieces & take your first poker card. Start in the upper northwest and roll the die to tour the country. Pick another poker card at each rally you visit. The person to reach the end, or Hollister Rally first wins half the Pot. The person with the best poker hand wins the other half of the Pot. So, anyone can win! Oh yeah and it makes a great Christmas gift for the biker, the game player, or the person who has everything (because they probably don’t have one of these).
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Transportation, Trivia

name: Fighters versus Bombers
description:
Theme: [from the game itself] Wargames duplicate the action of real or imaginary battles on a miniature scale. By following these plans, you can create a battle between British fighters and Zeppelins. Gotha bombers are also included.

Game-Play: The game was designed as an educational tool giving young players numerous tasks that build and exercise various skills, from constructing the game itself [following graphic instructions + making precise materials {maps and measures for the aircraft}], to forward thinking in planning British defenses and deploying German Bombers, to making critical decisions in how to best achieve each side's objectives, to finally analyzing the results - applying the lessons learned to refine and improve future game play/decisions.

Goal: In addition to the greater educational benefits listed above, the specific game's goal is to simulate the problems for both the offense and defense in the world's first Strategic Bombing campaign.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Educational, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Taargus
description: Taargus is a 2-5 player trick taking game where players bid cards from their hand to claim the right to call trump. The cards are dealt in 3 stages and each stage a player must bid one card to the middle of the table. After the third stage of bidding the player who has the highest bid calls trump and players then play the remaining cards from their hands gaining one point per trick taken. Taargus uses a 5 suit deck with values 3 through Ace.

name: Staviteľ
description:
Game Objective: Gradually build houses in different countries. Rent the property. Who after the construction of all homes will become the richest player wins.

Players can buy lands in different countries. When you visit your land you can build:
1. Tent
2. Project of house
3. House
4. Landscaping and swimming pool
(respectively)
When other players visit your lands, they must roll the dice which indicate how much they pay. When a player hasn't the money to pay, he must sell land or go bankrupt. Players can trade with each other and with the bank. The game ends when are all the houses built completely or when is only one player in the game.

Accessories: game board, 4 figures, 1 dice, set of money, 9 playing cards, 36 cards with building
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Asimovian Hyperchess
description: Chess version where there are 8 boards stacked atop one another, thus making an 8 x 8 x 8 cube of possible places to move (512 spaces).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Static Capture, Sudden Death Ending, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Holland Export Spel
description:
Each player represents a international company.
The players have to buy and sell goods on the international market.
Players try to buy cheap raw materials and sell their price against the highest price possible. But players have to account on the exchange market.
The player with the most money at the end of the game wins the game.

name: Het Witte-Motor Spel
description:
Each player has a set of clickets that start in his or her corner of the board. The goal is to move the clickets around the board to the "home" section.
Each player throws two dice. Then the players choses to move one clicket or two clickets. He or she can only use one die per clicket.But the player can use any clicket in play.

The first player with the word Melk in clickets wins the game.

name: The Newspaper Game
description: User Description: Player take turns rolling dice and answering trivia questions about the newspaper industry. If a question is answered correctly, players can advance the number of spaces on their roll. Each space on the board either rewards players with shares of the "Podunk Gazette," or forces them to draw "Goodie" or "Zinger" cards, which have effects on their progress. The first player to reach the Publisher square or accumulate the 50 million shares needed to purchase the Podunk Gazette wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Stock Holding

name: Ms. Sneak-Man
description:
An experiment gone wrong!
One minute you are in your lab about to test your latest transmat breakthrough, and the next you are on an alien world, your body transformed and being chased by hungry Jelly monsters who think you are their nemesis!

Through an accident during transmission you have been dropped into a dimension based on a popular computer maze game. Except now you are the main character! Sneak through the Maze to collect all the markers before the Jellies gobble you up!

Welcome to ChompLand 2.0!

This is a tile based solo-play maze exploration game where you must complete the game to be sent home. Sneaking keeps you from being easily spotted but sometimes running might save you from being dinner! Evade the Jellies as long as you can and collect power ups for various bonuses. Keep an eye out for garnishes too laying about the maze. They might just keep you off the menu. Now get Sneaking!!!

Optional rules are presented for multi-player co-op or competitive play.
categories: Maze, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Bomb!
description:
Bomb! is a board game designed by a primary 4 student, Tan Zhiyong, from Rosyth School in Singapore.

The game appears to be similar to snakes and ladders, each player has a single pawn that moves up a boustrophedon track, and there are ladders that pawns can climb up and bombs which send pawns back to the start. There are also a few squares with instructions like "miss a turn" and "Move forward 3 spaces". All other squares that do not have a bomb or instructions on them have a fraction. Whenever a player lands on a fraction, they add it to their own cumulative score. The aim of the game is not to be the first to reach the last square, but to have the highest total sum of fractions among all players once everyone has reached the last square.

The game is copyright of Government of Singapore and the graphic design is copyright of Noble Education.com (indicated on the board)

The game does not come in a box, but in a large transparent sleeve which holds the laminated cardboard board and bits.

name: Jidoka
description: From the designer: Jidoka is a two-player abstract strategy game. Each player starts with 12 pieces in the back row on a 12x10 checkerboard. The pieces are numbered from one to seven and that number represents their movement capability. Each player takes alternating two-stage turns in which they move pieces and may switch positions of pieces if desired. The first player on the first turn may move only; no switching. The goal is to capture two pairs of opposing pieces. It is possible to win with just four captures, or to lose even after making eight captures. It is being released in 2010 as a print-and-play playtest version.

name: Space: The Game that Defies Gravity
description:
This game is a solo race game in a similar vein to Screwball Scramble or Harry Potter and The Sorcerer's Stone: Levitating Challenge Electronic Skill and Action Game. The goal of the game is to move the ball through the obstacle course in the shortest period of time.

From a promotional website

Strap yourself in and prepare for travel into the deep outer regions of our solar system... all from the comfort of your room! It's fun with The Space Game that defies gravity!
Your Mission: to navigate the levitating satellite through a series of adjustable rings in record time. Are you up for the challenge! Think you've got the right stuff? Then grab a hold of the air thruster and lift off to space!

3 Ways to play:

Regular Play: Play in a lit room.
Black Light Play: Play in the dark using its built-in black light to make it glow.
Space Race: Challenge yourself against the timer for competitive play!


Product Features:

Navigate the levitating satellite through a variety of rings.
Adjustable obstacle course for endless challenges.
Built-in black light lamp for illuminated game play.
Test your skills against the timer.

name: Shrek Forever After: Board Game
description:
Oh no! Rumpelstiltskin has turned Far Far Away into a place you'd want to stay far, far away from! Help Shrek and his friends journey through the twisted, alternate reality and make it back to their real home in the swamp.

Players take turns rolling the die and moving their characters clockwise around the board, trying to get all four characters home to the swamp area in the middle of the board.

Pnp game from the Hewlett Packard website.
Description from the pnp file.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: KUMITE: The Karate Card Game
description:
"KUMITE-The Karate Card Game" is an exciting, action packed card game based on the strikes, kicks and blocks of KARATE.
The cards feature outstanding graphic illustrations of the basic offensive and defensive techniques. As in real-life 'kumite' (sparring an opponent in a match), you must "deliver" an attack that your opponent cannot "block" in order to win. Simple to learn and easy to play! Children and adults will both enjoy playing "Kumite".

name: Gissa vad det är
description: Simple Disney-themed guessing game for children with a similarly simple scoring system attached to it. Players take turns to provide hints about a creature or object on a drawn card and the others get two chances each of guessing the answer.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Matematikspelet
description: Players lay out cards with digits and operators from a dealt hand, trying to construct a sum that yields a predetermined result. Points are lost for being off the target. During a round, players can draw new cards or pick up discarded ones. There are three levels of difficulty that determine how many and which cards are used, starting with basic addition and subtraction and moving on to things like negatives, multiplication and division.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Funny Phone
description:
An electronic game for young children. Players take turns dialing a number on the phone's slide-out directory, then listening to instructions over the receiver.

The talking phone will select one of nine categories of questions or activities for one or all players to do (rhyming words, guessing songs, charades, etc.).

Correct answers allow the winner (or winners) to place one of their tokens into the Funny Phone. The first player to rid themselves of all five start tokens may dial the Winner's Line to hear congratulations.

name: Gamba
description:
Gamba ist played on a 4x4 grid. Each player starts wirh 4 tokens on opposite sides. His aim is to catch the other's tokens. The machanism is nearly the same as in Checkers.

The player with the last token on the board wins.

name: World War IV
description:
Publisher blurb

At the end of the Cold War historians declared an “end to history.” Supposedly there was nothing left to fight about and a period of prolonged peace and prosperity seemed at hand. Sadly this was not to be. The events of September 11th, 2001 proved there were still issues to fight over.

But as the War on Terror ended and the Obama administration transformed America, abdicating its role as sole world peacekeeper, other nations reignited the great power struggle ended in World War II by division of the planet into two blocs.

Ironically, the environmentalist dogma of declining world resources was the catalyst that launched a new struggle between the world powers; a struggle not for power or prestige, but to control access to the resources that everyone was assured would soon be rapidly depleted. The New World Order is dead. Long live the New World Disorder!

Fast playing and easy to learn, World War IV is a two to eight player game played on a tabletop where players are leaders of major powers in a struggle for world resources. Conquer earthly resources or pursue a space program to develop off-world colonies and resources.

The game system emphasizes strategy and places a minimum on die rolling. Rules include weapons of mass destruction, missile defense, cyber warfare, air, ground, and space combat.

Each major power has its own special rules and pieces including Texas militia, Falun Gong chi-knights, Russian Spetznaz, European robotic panzers, American mobile infantry, South American guerillas, Turkish mujahideen, Japanese armed spacecraft and more!
The game includes eleven sheets of die-cut game pieces and complete rules. Some six-sided dice (not included) are required to play.

name: The Elf-Dwarf War
description:
Publisher blurb

Fantasy Nations is a game played on a tabletop where each player controls his own nation in a fantasy world. Each game is a new experience since players create the game “board” anew each game by placing large cardstock terrain tiles on the table. Players conquer territory, recruit new units, draw magic items, gold, healers, heroes, sorcerer’s apprentices and additions to their royal family from the Cup of Destiny to increase their power, making and breaking alliances with other players, slaying monsters and fighting desperate battles. It is possible for more than one player to win. Any game set can be played by itself or added to any of the other Fantasy Nations game sets to increase the size of the playing area and add new races, allowing larger games with more players. Each nation comes with its own special rules, terrain tiles and die cut pieces. Explore all the possibilities!

The Elf-Dwarf War: “The Final Solution to the Dwarven Problem.” Includes unique mountain, forest and plains terrain tiles, plus special rules and pieces for the Elves, Dwarves and Ionian Empire (Greco-Roman humans)

name: Sorceress Queen
description:
Publisher blurb

Fantasy Nations is a game played on a tabletop where each player controls his own nation in a fantasy world. Each game is a new experience since players create the game “board” anew each game by placing large cardstock terrain tiles on the table. Players conquer territory, recruit new units, draw magic items, gold, healers, heroes, sorcerer’s apprentices and additions to their royal family from the Cup of Destiny to increase their power, making and breaking alliances with other players, slaying monsters and fighting desperate battles. It is possible for more than one player to win. Any game set can be played by itself or added to any of the other Fantasy Nations game sets to increase the size of the playing area and add new races, allowing larger games with more players. Each nation comes with its own special rules, terrain tiles and die cut pieces. Explore all the possibilities!

The Sorceress Queen: Includes unique desert, mountain and plains terrain tiles, plus special rules and pieces for the Sorceress, Goblins and Devourers of Wisdom alchemists.

name: Lair of the Liche Lord
description:
Publisher blurb

Fantasy Nations is a game played on a tabletop where each player controls his own nation in a fantasy world. Each game is a new experience since players create the game “board” anew each game by placing large cardstock terrain tiles on the table. Players conquer territory, recruit new units, draw magic items, gold, healers, heroes, sorcerer’s apprentices and additions to their royal family from the Cup of Destiny to increase their power, making and breaking alliances with other players, slaying monsters and fighting desperate battles. It is possible for more than one player to win. Any game set can be played by itself or added to any of the other Fantasy Nations game sets to increase the size of the playing area and add new races, allowing larger games with more players. Each nation comes with its own special rules, terrain tiles and die cut pieces. Explore all the possibilities!

Each set is compatible with any of the others or can be played by itself.

Lair of the Liche Lord: Includes unique wasteland, swamp and mountain terrain tiles, plus special rules and pieces for the Liche Lord, Ratlings and Cimmerian barbarians.

name: Dragon Riders Triumphant
description:
Publisher blurb

Fantasy Nations is a game played on a tabletop where each player controls his own nation in a fantasy world. Each game is a new experience since players create the game “board” anew each game by placing large cardstock terrain tiles on the table. Players conquer territory, recruit new units, draw magic items, gold, healers, heroes, sorcerer’s apprentices and additions to their royal family from the Cup of Destiny to increase their power, making and breaking alliances with other players, slaying monsters and fighting desperate battles. It is possible for more than one player to win. Any game set can be played by itself or added to any of the other Fantasy Nations game sets to increase the size of the playing area and add new races, allowing larger games with more players. Each nation comes with its own special rules, terrain tiles and die cut pieces. Explore all the possibilities!

Dragon Riders Triumphant: Includes unique swamp, forest and plains terrain tiles, plus special rules and pieces for the Dragon Riders, Centaurs and Gnomes.

name: The Eastern Nations
description:
Publisher's blurb

Fantasy Nations is a game played on a tabletop where each player controls his own nation in a fantasy world. Each game is a new experience since players create the game "board" anew each game by placing large cardstock terrain tiles on the table. Players conquer territory, recruit new units, draw magic items, gold, healers, heroes, sorcerer’s apprentices and additions to their royal family from the Cup of Destiny to increase their power, making and breaking alliances with other players, slaying monsters and fighting desperate battles. It is possible for more than one player to win. Any game set can be played by itself or added to any of the other Fantasy Nations game sets to increase the size of the playing area and add new races, allowing larger games with more players. Each nation comes with its own special rules, terrain tiles and die cut pieces. Explore all the possibilities!

The Eastern Nations: Includes unique desert, forest and plains terrain tiles, plus special rules and pieces for the Prophet, Empire of Reichsland and the Moldavian Motherland.

name: The Barbarian Hordes
description:
Publisher's blurb

Fantasy Nations is a game played on a tabletop where each player controls his own nation in a fantasy world. Each game is a new experience since players create the game “board” anew each game by placing large cardstock terrain tiles on the table. Players conquer territory, recruit new units, draw magic items, gold, healers, heroes, sorcerer’s apprentices and additions to their royal family from the Cup of Destiny to increase their power, making and breaking alliances with other players, slaying monsters and fighting desperate battles. It is possible for more than one player to win. Any game set can be played by itself or added to any of the other Fantasy Nations game sets to increase the size of the playing area and add new races, allowing larger games with more players. Each nation comes with its own special rules, terrain tiles and die cut pieces. Explore all the possibilities!

Each set is compatible with any of the others or can be played by itself. The Barbarian Hordes Fantasy Nations Game set includes: unique desert, forest and swamp terrain tiles, plus special rules and pieces for the Lizardmen, Orcs and Div cat-people.

name: Pictionaussie
description:
An Australian-themed expansion to the original game Pictionary, but sold including the original game.

Adds 500 new words and phrases (50 double-sided cards) with Australian people, places, slang ... for example "Bells Beach", "Boomerang", "Slip. Slop, Slap", "Crikey" and "Grog".

(As they were unable to get public feedback during production, input is requested for what phrases should be included in a subsequent edition.)

Contains the Challenge Die previously included in Pictionary: 15th Anniversary and Pictionary: 20th Anniversary.
It can make you draw with eyes closed, or your wrong hand, or extra fast, or without lifting your pencil...



Launch CompetitionAs part of the promotion for launch of the game, they're running a Pictionaussie competition on Facebook where you have to draw pictures in 30 seconds. It concludes August 16th, 2010.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: BlueMountain Coop.
description:
Blue Mountain Coop. is a board-game for 1-6 players (time: 20-30 minutes).
The Blue Mountain Coop. is a medium-sized pharmaceutical company. F&O at Blue Mountain Coop. is smarter than big pharmaceutical because cross-department projects are here regarded as common tasks and are successfully conducted in a cooperative way.

BlueMountain Coop. is realized as a print & play game meaning that everything needed to play the game is included in the attached pdf file.

BlueMountain Coop. is a co-operative game; the players take the role of a department head. Each round they assign their resources to cross-department projects, internal projects, training or "Great Place to Work"-activities.
At the beginning of each round there is a random event that may change the availability of resources or importance of projects. Afterwards a die is rolled to determine how many workers are ill or left the company. After the drawing of new projects, resources are allocated. At the end of the round all projects that had all required resources allocated may bring victory points.
The game ends after 6 (short variant) or 12 (long variant) rounds.

name: Hoe Word Ik Miljonair
description:
Players throw a die to move along the board. They have to collect, two emotion cards, three building cards, two luxery goods cards and three staff cards.
If a player lands on a space with an emotion, building luxery good or staff, the player turns the spinner. When the players spins tumbs up, he/she gets the card. Otherwise the player loses the good.
The first player which collected all the goods wins the game.

name: Community Game
description:
From the game instructions sheet:
"This is a simple game designed to help the players understand and appreciate the cultures and customs of the different communities in Singapore. Through the game, the players can also learn to appreciate the importance of racial harmony in our multi-racial society."

The game is played on a large paper board with a picture of Singapore island overlaid with a triangular grid. Each player takes a set of four coloured chips with stickers depicting children of different races and places them on the starting positions at four corners of the island. The object of the game is to move these pieces one step at a time to link them up in a diamond shape or in a straight line. Along the way, there are spaces marked with a star that act as barriers. If a player's piece lands on one of these starred spaces, an opponent takes a card from a stack of cards bearing questions about ethnic customs, festivals or practices in Singapore and asks the player the question. If the player answers correctly, the piece is allowed to remain on the starred space, otherwise it must return to the space it had just moved from.

The game was first printed in 1992. The text copyright belongs to the National Community Organisations Council and the illustrations copyright belows to Promotion & Sales Centre Pte Ltd. The game was planned and produced by the National Community Organisations Council.The game was made and printed in Singapore by Promtion & Sales Centre Pte Ltd.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Life is a Movie Starring You
description:
Pesky Meddling Girls Presents Life is a Movie Starring You! Lights, Camera, Play! lets you learn about yourself and your friends by answering questions, guessing your friends' answers, and acting out charades. Everyone's a winner because you and your friends learn so much about each other.

Be the first player to move around the board and get back to your original starting space. Players advance by correctly guessing how other players feel about different situations from the following categories: Script, Audition, Casting Call and Wardrobe.

User Summary from Rule Book

name: Matcheroos
description:
The Classic Memory game with a twist. There are two levels of play and unique mix-'em cards to add a surprise element and keeping players guessing.

The first level of play uses the blue cards, and the second level of play uses the yellow cards and the mix-em cards. If a mix-'em card is drawn, then the remaining cards are mixed up and play continues.

For even more of a challenge, the yellow and blue cards can be used at the same time.

User Summary

name: Splatisphere: Gladatorial Combat
description:
Splatisphere is a game of gladiatorial combat and fighting set in a sci-fi universe. You manage a team of warriors (up to four) that you build up, equip and unleash on your opponent. The game is played on a hex-based arena, with stand-up cardboard figures representing the fighters.

Your fighters are from one of five races, each with statistics that determine their strength in combat, and special skills. Character creation is a large part of the game and is similar to a simple RPG system.

Combat is similar to many miniature based systems. The turn phases are: (1) Initiative, which determines how many actions you get per turn; (2) Movement, using movement points; (3) Actions & Attacks, when you can perform the number of actions allowed by your initiative roll; and (4) Tests and Withdrawals, when you check to see if your fighter can shrug off his wounds, random events and when you can withdraw a fighter from the contest.

There are also rules for spell casting, special arenas and managing a gladiatorial team through a campaign.

Contents are: A rule book, arena map, terrain overlay sheet, two sheets of stand up figures and a bag of plastic stands for the figures.

name: Orbit
description:
In this abstract boardgame, 2 players try to reach the opposite end of the gameboard as fast as possible.
The opposing player tries to prevent this by placing blockades on the board. Players can cross their own blockades, but not those of the opposing player. A player can either mover his pawn or place a blockade.

Part of the Clipper Duel Series.
Possibly only published in Dutch/French

(user summary)

name: Barbie The Nutcracker Playset Game
description:
Players race to free Nutcracker, trapped in the Mouse King’s dungeon! But be careful, you must position your Clara mover to avoid the Mouse King who is trying to catch you! If the Mouse King lands on the same space as you, then you lose your next turn.

For Level 1 play you don't use any item cards.

For Level 2, item cards are used. Players must first free the Nutcracker and then try to be the first to defeat the Mouse King! When attempting to save the Nutcracker the player color must match the Nutcracker color inside the tower or the player must try again.

Publisher's Website + User Summary

name: Tyranno Race
description:
This is a children's game about dinosaurs. The kids race to the Tyranno food source -- the first critter to reach that space becomes the Mighty Tyrannosaurus. This prehistoric marauder chases the other plastic dinosaur figures around a huge 38" x 38" vinyl game mat. A kid is knocked out of the game if his or her dinosaur becomes a snack for the big kahuna. Everybody is heading for the safe space where Mr. Personality can't devour them. Movement is resolved with a giant 3" x 3" soft die with the texture of a pillow!

Includes the colorful vinyl mat, five high-quality plastic dinosaurs, the weird die, and the rules.

name: 101 Dalmatians Puppy Pairs
description:
This is a memory like game. When a pair of puppies is found they are taken. However, if a steal a puppy card is flipped by an opponent, your puppies can be stolen away. Whoever flips a rescue all puppies card wins all the previous stolen puppies. Also, watch out, because if a mix-up card is drawn all the puppies still in play will get mixed up.

User Summary
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Epic Engagements
description:
From Manual Prologue:

The Story So Far...

Shortly after the discovery of faster−than−light travel, humanity reached for the stars and expanded beyond its home solar system to colonize planets throughout the Milky Way galaxy. Hundreds of planets have been inhabited, with the species seeing unprecedented growth and prosperity, all ruled autonomously and under the protection of the Free Alliance of Stars. Man had believed, after almost limitless exploration and colonization, that mankind was unique, and that no other intelligent life of any kind existed outside of human−controlled planets. Then, the Continuum attacked the Sirius system. Human defense forces did not believe there to be a threat in the universe, and were woefully unprepared for the invasion, with nearly every man, woman, and child murdered by the alien menace.

Three weeks after the last message was received on Earth, the human fleet dispatched from Jupiter Base reached the Sirius system only to find that every colonized planet had been bombarded from orbit, utterly devastating the colonial surfaces. No sign was left of life, human or otherwise, until a small lifeboat was recovered in space with a dying scientist, Dr. Mark Wallace, who chronicled the assault on the colonies shortly before his death. Humans were not alone in the universe, and they were being systematically eradicated.

30 years later, the war was being waged in every corner of the galaxy, and Humanity had taken advantage of its genetic predisposition of reason and their inherent ability to quickly learn and adapt. They first learned the name of the enemy via decoding communications taken during battles, and later reverse−engineered power sources, propulsion systems, and most importantly, the highly advanced weapons systems that the enemy had used against them. Humanity now had a hope of repelling the invaders, and would stop at nothing until the Continuum was stopped.

The Continuum is a collective of enslaved worlds, made up of several hundred species native to planets outside of our galaxy, all burning with the sole desire to subjugate all habitable planets and species, or destroy them if they were deemed a threat. The only chance that humanity has to stop them is to travel to the Continuum Homeworld, located somewhere in the Crab Nebula, and to destroy their leadership and command and control structure, defeating the threat forever.

Epic Engagements is a stand-alone tactical starship combat game that can use included components as well as models from Star Wars Miniatures: Starship Battles or any other models. Players begin on opposite ends of a 24x36" Star Map and using a turn-based "simultaneous action" mechanic wage war on one another using capital ships such as carriers, frigates and fighters to defeat the enemy force.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Vaquero!
description:
Vaquero! is an Old West fast play skirmish ruleset for 2 to 8 players, ideal for convention play.

In Vaquero! players create groups of characters, gangs, if you will, and shoot it out with other players controlling rival gangs in the dusty streets of 1880’s Western America.

Vaquero! is designed to be played on tabletops with little painted figures. Miniature tumbleweeds and “Pow! Pow!” noises are strictly optional.

The rules are short, and the mechanics are very simple, so simple that they can be explained to a new player in five minutes.

Decks of standard playing cards are used for character creation, turn activation, and wounds. Combat is resolved using a standard d20.

A typical 6 player game can be completed in an hour to an hour and a half.

All tables needed to play fit nicely on a single page of paper.

-From the author

name: Kings of Pools
description:
Kings of Pools is a solitaire replay game based on water polo, featuring data for all the Olympics competitions from 1948 onward and the last four World Championships.

Using a derivation of the gaming system used for The Dream to End All Dreams: World Cup Soccer, this game consents to replay an entire tournament in less than an hour, To play a match, each team simply compares his attack value versus opponent defense value. Then, each player rolls dice to see how many goals he scores. There are several data that have been used to rate the various teams and an element of randomness has been added, to give much flavor to the replay of the tournaments.
Expansion set with data for other tournaments are on the way

name: Hälsolyftsspelet
description: Simple roll and move game uncontaminated by skill where players seek to reach a number of checkpoints, one after the other. Upon reaching each checkpoint, there's a prescribed brief gymnastic exercise to be performed. The game was made to promote regular exercise among Swedish pensioners.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scrambler:  Rock Climbing
description:
Game website to download for free is here: http://www.esotericclaw.com/scrambler

Players are trying to be the first player to climb the mountain with the most prestige points. Players must use a unique risk assessment system to climb the twisting cracks of the mountain, but they may also use other helpful cards. Using helpful cards will give the player more ways to climb to the top of the mountain and even open up possibilities for sabotaging other players.

name: Scramble for Africa
description:
DISAMBIGUATION: This design is 25 years old. It is NOT the game designed by Joel Chacon for GMT Games. For information on that game, please refer to UNPUBLISHED PROTOTYPE.

Scramble for Africa recreates the European exploration and partition of Africa in the final decades of the nineteenth century, combining a strong historical theme and the random element of discovery with a simple positional game system. Played on an authentic 19th-century map of Africa, Scramble for Africa includes two scenarios, one historical and one hypothetical, each playable in under two hours. Complexity is easy (about 2/10).

Play is determined by the triangular grid, which is superimposed over a map of Africa. The points at which the lines of the grid intersect determine the placement of pieces on the game board in a manner similar to the game of go. A player action consists of placing one control marker on the map, often in conjunction with moving an army (if in play), playing an event chit, and/or drawing an event chit from the randomizer cup. Event chits add random elements to the game, and include discoveries, diplomatic events, resources, or encounters with native populations. The object of the game is to acquire the most Victory Points, primarily by surrounding and controlling spaces in a manner similar to the game of go. At the end of the game, players receive Victory Points for their positions on the board, and for resources controlled. This is added to VP's accumulated for discoveries accumulated during the course of the game. The player with the greatest score, obviously, is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chit-Pull System, Enclosure, Point to Point Movement

name: Masters of the Universe: The Power Sword Conquest
description:
He Man with the help of his fellow heroes must reach the Power Sword first in order to prevent Skeletor from ruling Eternia. He Man must not fail. (Description from the rule book).

This is a team game similar to Snakes and Ladders, with the Good Guys vs the Bad Guys. As well as rolling the dice to move, there are board spaces that move characters around or allow the drawing of Mystery Cards that give special abilities. When a Good Guy and a Bad Guy end up on the same space combat occurs, with the winner moving forwards and the loser backwards. The winner is the first side to have all characters reach the final space - the Power Sword.

name: Barbie Says
description:
In this electronic tabletop game, Barbie calls out a series of colors and/or icons. All the players try to follow the pattern she calls out, but only if they hear Barbie Says. If they successfully complete a pattern during the game, players win rings, bracelets and hair clips they can really wear. The first person to collect enough jewelry wins the game. Cool music, lights and the voice of Barbie add to the fun. Three levels of play appeal to a broad range of ages and abilities. Girls will enjoy fashion, friendship and fun while playing Barbie Says.

Publisher's Website

name: U.S. MAIL and CHECKERS
description:
Vintage (date unknown) board game where players spin and move along a pre-determined route on a map of North America. "The object of the game is to see which player can deliver Uncle Sam's mail the quickest and best."

This game comes in a cardboard box about 17" x 9" with a great graphic of a speeding steam engine pulled train on the lid. In the lower left corner of the top of the lid is the Milton Bradley name and the number 4904. No date is present on the box or the board.

The reverse of the game board is a yellow and black checker board.

Complete directions from box lid:

IMPLEMENTS consist of four differently colored pieces, one for each player (these represent mail trains), and an indicator. {Spinner}

THE OBJECT of the game is to see which player can deliver Uncle Sam's mail the quickest and best.

TO BEGIN. The players draw lots for first play. Then each player chooses as his starting point one of the four cities: New York, Chicago, new Orleans or San Francisco. No two players can start from the same city.

THE PLAY: Each player then puts his piece on the city of his choice and all spin the indicator {spinner} in turn. As soon as a "3" is spun, the player spinning it is entitles to start on his journey.
The player may travel in either direction.
Each circle, whether colored black, red, or green, counts as one space.
Each time a player's piece, or "mail train", falls exactly upon a green circle the player loses a turn.
Each time a player's "train" falls exactly upon a circle city which is colored red, the player counts one to his score.
No two players may occupy the same space. The last comer loses his turn.
The player first to reach the city he starts from counts five extra to his score.

TO WIN. The player scoring the most points wins.

name: Det Store Norske Familiespillet
description:
The Great Norwegian Family Game is a game for the entire family, with questions in two grades of difficulty. A fairly close relative of Trivial Pursuit, the questions come from the Great Norwegian Encyclopedia.

The total of 6200 questions are divided across eight subjects, and offer challenge to any player.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Castles, Cogs & Chevauchees
description:
Three rules sets covering sieges, navies, and campaigns in skirmish level combat. Designed for use with Knights & Knaves and adaptable to other skirmish level rules. 36 pages. (Book Cover)

"Castles" - rules for conducting sieges in your campaign. Thirteen pages covering the three types of sieges you can mount: Blockade, Bombardment, or Assault. Sieges are conducted on a weekly basis and both the attacker and defender must manage their armies and resources to be successful.

"Cogs" - rules for handling ship to ship engagements. Two pages of rules covering simple boat movement, grappling, and skirmishing on board the vessels.

"Chevauchees" - rules for conducting a full campaign. Fourteen pages of economic rules including how to acquire and spend resources, dramatic events, and how to set up multiple detailed and linked skirmishes for the campaign including using the rules from the Castles and Cogs sections.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: De Binnenvaart
description:
In this game each player an enterprising skipper. Everyone starts with one small ship and a capital. You can earn money with your ship cargo between the inland transport.
With the money you earned, you could buy a larger type of ship and
The first player which collected the agreed amount in cash, is the winner.

name: Sins of a Star Empire
description:
A boardgame inspired by the fantastic PC game Sins of a Solar Empire.

The game is more or less in the same respect as the PC game. You build ships, research technology, and expand your empire through vast star systems, of which several may be used at once.
