Does your garden suddenly look dry and wilted? Are you finding it hard to get new plants to take root and grow? You may think these are signs that insects or bad soil quality are at work but I must warn you it could be a sign something far more sinister is at work. Something you may have heard of. Faeries! There are those who want you to believe faeries are these cute, harmless little winged people who are only curious about humans. That belief could not be farther from the truth. Fairies are nothing more than selfish little addicts, whose sole desire in life is to suck the life right out of your garden. What you don't know is that a beautiful well tended garden is a place of magic and magic is what the evil little creatures are addicted to.

Welcome to Bad Faeries, the game of faerie combat. In Bad Faeries each player controls a mob of faeries fighting over a magical garden and the right to drain that garden of its life giving magic.

User summary:

Players build a mob of 200 points worth of fays, such as Brownie, Pixie, Leprechaun, Goblin, Nymph, etc. Each fay type is rated for six attributes: Flit, Nimbleness, Wards, Wariness, Smacks, Being, and has a given cost. A mob can be of mixed types, and you may have Brownies facing Brownies.

Once your mob is assembled, give them weapons and magic abilities. The mobs then meet in combat to determine who rules the Garden. Rules are provided for movement, ranged, melee and magical combat, wounds, terrain, morale and victory.

name: JumpStart Alphabet Card Game
description:
Frankie has dreamed up 12 words that use every letter of the alphabet. To play, collect four cards that spell a word. The cards are self correcting so that players will know when the set is complete.

With 3 levels of play to match your child's personal skills and grow with his or her development.

From the game rules, a summary of the three levels are:
Level 1-Find words and spell correctly
Level 2-Go fish with words
Level 3-"FRANKIE" game: Try not to be the last to notice that one player has a set of four. Players touch their nose if they have a set of four, and everyone must touch their nose as soon as they see that someone else has. If you are the last one who notices, you get a letter in the word FRANKIE. If you get all of the letters, you lose.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Tourist Traps
description:
Tourist Trap is a card game where you see how many vacations you can complete before you run out of money. But beware, the tourist traps want their share of your vacation money too.

This family card game is played by placing mileage cards on different destinations. Once a destination is completed and the player returns home they get the points on that card. While traveling, others may play Tourist Trap cards which will actually cost the player even more of their vacation cash.

Source: [The Game Crafter, LLC].

name: Het Grote Verjaardagsspel
description:
Each player gets a birthday card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the birthday card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the birthday card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

name: Het Grote Film & Muziek Spel
description:
Each player gets a jurysurvey card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the jurysurvey card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the jurysurvey card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Het Grote Kerst Spel
description:
A christmas themed trivia game.

Each player gets a christmas card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the christmas card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the christmas card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

name: Het Grote Oranje Spel
description:
A Trivia game themed with the Dutch monarchy.

Each player gets a monarchy card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the monarchy card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the monarchy card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

name: Ara
description:
Ara is a game of strategy, diplomacy, and, economics. The game was created to be a strategy game that balances economic and military competition.

You must gather resources while building an army to conquer other nations on a planet of the future. There are three different units you may purchase: Mobs, Hovertanks, and Ships. The attack mechanic is dice based where certain numbers score casualties, and casualty shots are taken. There is a track around the outside of the board that you go around for the purpose of a random event generator as well as a time keeper, as you cycle through seasons where you may either only build or only gather resources

name: Gizoomie
description: Gizoomie is a dice game where people try to be the person with the Gizoomies worth the most points when the game ends! On their turn, players roll two dice. One die tells what color Gizoomie to do something with, while the other tells what to do with that Gizoomie: pass left, pass right, take from the pot, put into the pot, take 1 from anywhere, or take both. Each color Gizoomie has one large Gizoomie and one small Gizoomie.

name: Avoid the 10!
description:
A dice game in which you roll 5 dice three times, setting one aside each time, trying to get the highest score possible. If your total is over 10, then you get points worth the difference between your score and 10. However, if your total is less than 10, you get points equal to three times the difference between your total and 10. If your total is 10, you are out of the game!

However, there's one more twist: of the five dice, two are normal dice marked 1-6, two are trick dice marked with three 2s and three 6s, and the last die has a 5 on every face. This contributes to some interesting strategies as you try to maximize your points but avoid the dreaded 10!

First to reach 99 points exactly wins!

name: PBC: The Pro Baseball Chronology
description:
The baseball game which spans the entire history of pro baseball.


Features Every pro team from 1871 to the present is rated. All players, regardless of their playing time, are included. All batters and pitchers are individually carded. Each batter is rated for: Overall batting ability, propensity to get on base, to strike out, to hit into double plays, to hit singles, doubles, triples & homers, to draw walks, to be hit by pitches, to attempt base steals, and base stealing success. Each batter card also gives the number of games the player appeared in along with the team stint. This is included for those of you wishing to conduct realistic player transactions during a season. Each pitcher is rated for: Overall pitching ability, propensity to keep runners off the bases, to give up hits, to walk batters, to strike out batters, to throw wild pitches, to hit batsmen and to commit balks. Each pitcher card also included the number of games the pitcher appeared in, along with the number of games he appeared as a starter. As with the batting cards, a team stint number is also included.


Each team has its own fielding chart, with each position player listed, along with the positions he played, the number of games in which he appeared in that position, his error rating for that position, and his throwing arm rating (if he is an outfielder.)

Unique control system controls the flow of the game. You will get a visual picture of the batter/pitcher duel as each at-bat is conducted. The great hurlers will generally control the game, but a weak batter will surprise the ace at any moment!

Fast action cards included, ready for printing. You may print them 1 or 2-sided. Additional game charts include out charts, extra charts and missing data charts (for those years where statistics were not available.) Game playing time is about an hour.

name: Swear Jar
description:
Remember the days when your parent's or job made you put money in a swear jar everytime you ended up using curse words?

Now play the game inspired from all the times you lost your money to the jar. Match colors or values in the fast paced game while trying to get your Swear Jar built up before someone plays a dirty word.

No Actual Foul Language is used in the game.

Each player is dealt 5 cards. Each turn a player draws a card and must place a card in their swear jar. Cards must match either the color or the value of the top card of their current swear jar. If a Swear Card is played the banks are removed and added into the players scoring pile. Once all cards in the deck have been played the round is over and scores are added up. Cards are reshuffled and play continues until a player reaches
500 points.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: 71 grader nord
description:
This game is based on the Norwegian reality TV Show "71 grader nord", where a number of participants hike from Norways south most point "Lindesnes" to the North Cape.

From the publishers website (translated from Norwegian language):
"Who achieves the most victories on the way to the North Cape?

Finaly the board game is here, which lets us all attend the exhausting tour from Lindesnes to the North Cape.

The aim of the game is to answer right to most of the questions in the course of ten stages and gain stage victories, which you can take with you on your way to the North.

Here you can show your knowledge of Norway. All from geography and history to famouse peoples and curiosities is includet. And, like in the TV show, it is possible for you to use a map as help, if your strengh lies not in geography.

If you are lucky you can get an extra round, where you can get full three points if you are fast. The questions on the cards are classified in easy, medium and difficult, and so they can created total unpredictable situations.

Are your the next to be winner of 71 grader nord?

Content: board, map, gaming pieces, dices, 200 cards with questions, 100 bonus cards, free card, point counters, winner counters, card counters, hour glass and Norwegian rules."
categories: Adventure, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel

name: Red Card
description:
Red Card is a game based primarily on luck where you try to beat 90 levels by revealing cards until you reveal a bad red card.


RulesThere are 12 green cards in each level. There is 1 red card in level 1, 2 red cards in level 2, 3 red cards in level 3, etc. The cards are randomly laid out on the board.



Red card count and red card limitRed card count is a number of red cards remaining on the board. To calculate red card limit divide initial red card count by 2. Round up to nearest integer. For example, in level 7 red card limit is 7:3=3.5, round up to 4. If you pick a red card and red card count is lower than red card limit, you lose. You win 1 point times multiplier for each green card during main game, 2 point times multiplier during 1st replay, 3 points times multiplier during 2nd replay, and so on. If you complete all 90 levels, you play the game again.



Yellow cardsYellow cards are cards that are used automatically to avoid decreasing of a red card count if you pick a red card. Levels 41-65 come with 1 yellow card on the board and levels 66-90 come with 2 yellow cards.

name: UFO Interception: Roswell 1947
description:
This aerial combat game allows players to fight for control of the sky over New Mexico. Players can choose to fly the classic piston-engine P-51D Mustang or the Roswell UFO over the desert. This is the first game in their "UFO Interception" series.

UFO Interception: Roswell 1947 (Standard Set) contains UFO Interception: Roswell 1947 Rulebook, Roswell UFO + base (1/285 Scale), P-51D Mustang + base (1/285 Scale), various Templates, Dice and Reference Cards.

UFO Interception: Roswell 1947 (Limited Edition of 600 copies) also included a 4'x4' desert play map, an extra "Mogul" balloon mini and a "Crashed Roswell UFO" mini.

name: Het Nationale Ballet Spel
description:
A trivia game with the Dutch National Ballet theme.

Each player gets a jurysurvey card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the jurysurvey card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the jurysurvey card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

name: Baobab Reisspel
description:
There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she receives a Right-chip. Otherwise he/she receives a Wrong-chip.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

MAde for the travel company Baobab.

name: The Party Game
description:
There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she receives a Right-chip. Otherwise he/she receives a Wrong-chip.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

A trivia game about fashion, dances, music and Bacardi.

name: Playboy The Game
description:
Each player gets a Playboy card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the Playboy card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the Playboy card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Trivia game about the World of Playboy.

name: Step Chain: Expansion Set
description:
The Step Chain Expansion adds a fourth color into play and also includes a new type of card that allows you to split your chain into multiple chains, giving you more options for scoring and blocking.
Source: [ The Game Crafter].

The expansion set really completes the game adding yellow into the mix. A total of 80 cards are added including the new Split Chain Cards offer more options on building chains and some interesting scoring possibilities if you can merge your chains back together.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Alle alle
description:
Players take turns rolling 1-6 dice. Beginning with a 1, all consecutive dice (i.e. 1,2,3 etc) are stacked up in the middle. After 6, the 1 is stacked on top. Dice which can't be used have to be taken back. If the stack topples, the guilty player has to take all the dice. The first player to run out of dice is the winner.

The game was sold in a dice bag.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Race World
description:
A simple pseudo-collectible card game supplied with each Hot Wheels car as part of the backing. The card when cut out shows on the front the car and on the back the cars three statistics: Horsepower, Speed and Accelleration 0-60. The stat is followed by a rating bar of 1-5 and then a numerical value. The card also lists the cars data, which do not have any impact on the game. When it was Born, Designer, Birthplace and Speciality which is a short description of the cars functions.

Gameplay is as follows.
Challenge a friend - 1: Choose one of the three categories. 2: Highest number wins. 3: Race the cars in the case of a tie.

Re-implements:

Top Trumps
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Racing

name: The Charge
description: A "Tokalon" series game about Teddy Roosevelt leading the charge up San Juan Hill in the Spanish American War. A simple roll and move game. Getting to the top of the hill before the Spanish have the opportunity to react and stop you by interferring with your avenue of attack.

name: Meeple Feast
description: A dexterity/flicking game descended from the likes of Elchfest. Flick ice floes for your polar bear to walk on and race your opponent's polar bear to be the first to eat your own meeples and the neutral meeple standing on ice floes in the center.

name: Watch on de Rind
description:
An ethnic and inappropriate 'Black Memorabilia' ball toss game from 1931 produced by All-Fair Games
The box was set up on a table top and the object was to throw a ball into the mouth or hats of a number of Black caricatures who are seen eating and standing around a large watermelon. Points were scored for landing in the targets.

name: Brandenburg
description:
Before the German blitzkrieg stormed across Europe in 1939-40, a group of elite soldiers prepared the way by seizing bridges and other strategic targets ahead of the attack. In the following years, these warrior-spies, known as the Brandenburgers, operated behind enemy lines around the globe, from Russia and Yugoslavia to Egypt, Iraq, and India, Often bending the rules of war while completing their daring covert missions. Trained to be mobile and independent, steeped in foreign languages and customs, and expert in numerous military specialties, the Brandenburgers influenced the world's special forces long after World War II.

Brandenburg is a tactical wargame for up to three players, depicting the actions of the German commando force throughout the entire WWII. The game's map is assembled using hexagonal tiles, a method which simulates the fog of war and increases the game's replayability over time. Counters represent individual units, with specialized infantry (soldiers, medics, engineers, scouts and snipers) able to pack, equip and use a wide variety of weapons and gear to carry out their missions. Civilians, agents and partisans populate the conflict zone, acting as influential factors capable of tilting the balance of power to either side's favor.

name: Mit barer Münze
description:
This is based on a game played by the Ancient Greeks and Romans.

A clock-shaped field with numbers 1 to 12 and 15 coins are the materials to play this game.

Get the least penalty points by "rolling" the coins in the air and seperate the coins in two groups: one with a number from 1 to 15 revealed and the other with a face revealed.
Place the coins with numbers on the field by using their own number, sum of two coins or difference of two coins.
If you can't place any coins anymore, throw the coins up again and start over, until you can't place any coins of your throw.
The sum of your coins you couldn't place are your penalty points.

name: Zombie Masters
description:
Background
Zombie Masters uses the popular Zombie theme and adds some new twists to the Zombie games.
This time you take the role of a Zombie Master, who creates these "undead" bodies and sends them out to control the world. Everybody is wondering about why Zombies are driven to eat brrraiiiins... we will give you the answer!
We all know that knowledge is a drug for mankind (just ask Faust) - it's a drug for Zombies as well. Our Zombies don't want to live with a brain all the time and therefore, feed upon the Living to get there wits back. Of course, this process is very slow and it would take tons of Einstein brains to spark rational thinking in a Zombie. But who cares, if you are "undead" and have all the time in the world. Additionally, if you are a very dedicated and strong human and have the (mis)fortune to get bitten and turned into a Zombie yourself, you may be lucky and retain some of your basic knowledge regarding routine tasks/skills. So a cop may be able to still fire a pistol - though much slower and maybe not very accurately or the Zombie nurse may still be able to perform the task of giving you an injection.
And naturally, - intelligent brains are much more attractive to Zombies than „no-brainers“. Thus, a special resource is made available to Zombie Masters: Beer! Too much beer makes human brains unattractive for Zombies and those people who drink a lot of beer are not eaten by Zombies. And you, of course, as an evil Zombie Master can have the beer infested people fight or work among Zombies as well - they simply will not notice it ;-)

General game description
Zombie Masters is a game for two players, who fight for control of a city or other location. Each player represents a „Zombie Master“, who is able to create Zombies and control them to achieve his goals.
Zombie Masters tiles are used to build a strategy for this game. Each player choose a set of 30 unit- or character tiles and put them into a chosen order in five turn sets consisting of six cards each.
A game turn consists of the following actions:
1) Produce Zombie Masters resources
2) Play Zombie tiles face down to locations you would like to attack
3) Players alternately put Zombies or Humans on the Zombie tiles
4) Turn over the tiles you like and place Zombies on them. Discard Zombies which are surplus or can't be played on the tile
5) Starting with Initiative 0, use the action of that tile or attack with it until all tiles have been used
6) Seize locations if there is no enemy Zombie or citizen left and at least one of your Zombies/Humans occupy the location
7) Continue to feed "living" Zombies

Zombie Masters will include a base set of 30 tiles for two players as well as a whole lot of Zombies and the remote city of Riverview to battle for. More strategy boards, unit tiles, locations and Zombie/Human tokens will follow up in expansion and scenario packs.
mechanics: Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Takado
description:
A tactical game for 2 persons. Everyone has 14 pawns, 4 for the attack, 10 for the defence. The board´s size is 20x20 fields, it´s divided into outer range and inner range. The 4 attack pawn are in the outer range, moved on a "railway system", big moves, but they can not stop everywhere.
The 10 defence pawn move one field per turn or can jump above an other pawn.
If an attack pawn is in the same line as one or more defence pawns, they can only move one per turn, no jumping. If the defence pawn is by oneself in this line, it is captured.
Who can captured all 10 defence pawns first, is the winner.

name: Akzente
description:
Akzente (Accents) was published by Pro Futura in cooperation with WWF.

It is three games in one:

Game 1 (red numbered game board) - "Impressions":
Tiles must be placed on the corresponding squares neighboring already placed tiles (up to 4 at a time).
The first tile must be placed near the starting picture of the Panda Bear.
Some special tiles affect the switches of individual cards all the entire hand.

Game 2 (multi-colored board) - "Picture Pyramid":
Divided up in two parts, the players must first place as many tiles as possible, in the second phase the players roll a die (with 5 green sides, one red side) to determine if they are allowed to exchange tiles, and bring them into a numerical order.

Game 3 (no board) - "Picture Doubles":
All tiles are placed face down, players take turns trying to uncover pairs. - This is a version of Memory.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Flixt
description:
The board has in the middle a worm wheel with many fields and the "Finish" field. Around are 12 circles with 12 fields each. It is a simple game of luck, you roll a die and move. If you can capture an opposing pawn, move it to a free blue field. Because the board are anfractuous circles, you can push up your luck, you can cheat, but the other players should not see it.
The first who arrived in the center at the "Finish" field is the winner.

name: Goldrush
description:
As a digger you try to find as many nuggets as your fate will be allowed. Its a lucky dice game for 3 to 4 persons. You start with less equipment, but you believe in your fate. The run to the claims begins, chance fields and chance cards are on your way. You can buy a donkey or you can work (temporarily) with your opponents together, you can choose safe long ways or risky short ways.
The first player, who arrives at a claim, get 2/3 of the claim, the next player the rest.
Who can collect the most nuggets, wins the game.

name: Fußball Weltmeisterschaft
description:
Its time for the soccer world championship. 2 to 16 players can supporting their team to win.
On the first board is the soccer field. Two goals and different ways in three colours can be seen. First you throw a die with numbers to determine your numbers of moves. Then you throw a die with colours to determine your way (e.g. blue) and you move on a blue way as far as you can. If you cannot hit the goal, the opponent is on the move.
On the second board your team begins at the outer space and every win push your team one field nearer to the center.
At the end only two teams are left - and the last match begins.

name: India und Irrgarten
description:
India is one of the oldest boardgames of the world, better known as Pachisi or "Chaupur". 2 to 4 players from 5 years up throwing a dice and move their three pawns clockwise along the fields on the board to their houses. The first player, whose three pawns arrived at the end fields, is the winner.
Variations:
Neutral fields: Nobody can capture an other pawn
Chains: If you move one pawn to an other own pawn on one field, nobody can capture this two pawns
Tandem: If you have two pawns on one field, you can move both together as one pawn, but then every other pawn can capture this two pawns as one.
Barricade: Put four black pawns on the four neutral fields on the board. You must arrive these fields with the right number and displace the black pawn to any other field on the board as a barricade.

The idea for the Irrgarten is from Greek mythology. It is a labyrinth like on Kreta, which was build by Daedalus for the King Minos. You start at the outer circle of the labyrinth. Who moved first through all five circles to the center, is the winner. There are 12 neutral black pawns at any point of the labyrinth. You throw a dice and move one of your three pawns forward or backward to the center. You must throw the right number to stop directly on a field of a black pawn. Now you can displace the black one and barricade the way of your opponents.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tri-Gammon / Triplet / Triangle
description:
A box with 3 games: Tri-Gammon, Triangle and Triplet. Inside you can find a doublesided board, 28 chips in 4 colours and 2 dice.

Tri-Gammon is an easy to play Backgammon version for 3 players. Every player get 7 chips in one colour and two dice. The board is divided into three parts. Every player throws the two dice and placed his chips in his part of the board (the fields are numbered). After you placed all your chips, you can move one or two chips as far as you throw the dice. If you have 2 or 3 chips on one place, you are save, otherwise one chip can be captured. Who can save all his seven chips in the home first, is the winner.

Triangle is a game of concentration for two players. Put 28 Chips in 4 different colours on the board, but never build an triangle with 3 chips in the same colour.
The board has in the lowest line seven places, in the next line six etc.

Triplet is a solitaire game. It is the same board as Triangle. Place 27 chips on the board, one field is free. Jumping above each other to catch every chip on the board.

name: Brusselez-vous?
description:
Are you from Brussels? Prove it!
A quiz (mix between Trivial Pursuit, Monopoly and the game of goose) about the city of Brussels, Belgium.
There are 2 sets of decks for 2 levels of difficulty, totalling 1200 questions.

A game by Jean-Paul Deleixhe and Christian Libens.
Illustrations by Johan De Moor.

Source: back of the box.

name: Letterix
description: A very simple game from HABA where the player must build letters out of wooden pieces. Kind of a cross between a game and a jigsaw, there are two game modes: draw the wooden bits piece by piece in a bid to build the letters in alphabetical order, or race to put all three letters together in the shortest time possible. (Taken from rules sheet)

name: Star Siege
description:
From the Developer: Star Siege offers the player a friendly game of strategy that is easy to learn and fun to play.

"The Zyntrac galaxy is the closest galaxy to the Black Hole. Of the Zyntrac Galaxy, the four closest galactic sectors contain the most energy and power of any galactic sectors in the universe. The very essence of this untapped power is reason inough for all Interstellar War Lords to battle for possession of them. Players become Interstellar War Lords in Star Siege and use the forces of the Black Hole to gain strategic power over their oppenents, thus limiting their movements and eventually eliminating them from the game. Enter the Star Siege and let yourself be cast into a galaxy where space and time do collide.

OBJECT OF THE GAME is to conquer the universe by strategically occupying planets in such a manner as to limit your opponent's movements and eliminate them from the game.

EQUIPMENT includes a game board, one die, 16 men and 144 planetary chips.

The Star Siege game board is separated into four galactic sectors: Sector 1 is the closest sector to the Black Hole and contains 6 planets. Sectors 2 and 3 are the second and third closest to the Black Hole and contain 12 planets each. Sector 4 is the farthest from the Black Hole and contains 6 planets.

Each player receives 4 men of one colour and can use 1 to 4 men per game. All players must use the same number of men.

Each player receives 36 planetary chips of one colour. These are used to designate ownership of planets. When players come to rest on a planet they place one of their planetary chips in the space provided and place their men on top.

GAME PLAY: Roll of die determines order of play. First player places one of him men and planetary chips on any unoccupied planet of his choice. Play continues in a clockwise direction with each player doing the same until all planets are occupied. Die is now re-rolled to determine who moves first.

When a players man comes to rest upon an opponents unprotected planet, he invades that planet and replaces the man and chip with his own.

Players try to enter the Black Hole by moving up along their own planets. Upon entering the Black Hole the player can move his man to any unprotected planet on the board.

A player's man can only be eliminated from the game when it is "stranded". A player is said to be stranded when one of his men is surrounded by his opponent's planets.

A player is out of the game when all of his men have been eliminated.

Game comes with instructions for basic, intermediate, advanced and expert level play.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 仮面ライダー １１ライダーゲームバトル
description:
Game title translation:
Masked Rider 11 Riders Game Battle
Game title transcription:
Kamen Raida- Ju-ichi Raida- Ge-mu Batoru

From the publisher:
平成仮面ライダーの世界観を反映した7つのゲームが楽しめるゲームセット。
http://catalog.bandai.co.jp/item/4543112551832000.html

Translation with extra description:
A game set comprised of 7 games that incorporates the worlds depicted in the 11 Masked Rider TV series that have aired since 2000 (each series lasted about 1 year). The games include a roll and move game, a concentration game using the game cards, and a rock-paper-scissors game using the game cards. The roll and move game is the showcase game and allows the players to take on the role of one of the 11 main riders from the TV show and travel to the various Masked Rider parallel worlds.
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Weimar:  German Politics 1929-1933
description:
October, 1929: The Republic is crumbling. With the death of Gustav Stresemann on October 3, 1929 and the crash of the American Stock Exchange, Germany's recovery from the devastating Great War now is in doubt. Communist, Fascist and Republican forces clash over ideology and erupt into a war of words and violence. Unemployment begins to spiral out of control while the German people grow restless. Rallies are held by charismatic leaders as lawmakers struggle to find answers. Amongst the chaos, a new figure will head the German nation.

Weimar: German Politics 1929-1933 is a two-player political game that tries to simulate the chaos of Germany prior to Hitler's appointment to chancellor. Will you take the role of the Social Democratic leadership, staving off the extreme ideologies of Communism and Fascism? Using your political influence and paramilitary forces, will you try to gain control of the Reichstag, or send Germany to the brink of anarchy? Can you change history, or is Germany doomed to repeat it?

Weimar is a block/CDG in which one side plays the SPD and the other plays the NSDAP. A third Communist force is played by both players. Players hold rallies, street fights, build alliances, and try to win the hearts and minds of the German people.

Victory can be achieved in multiple ways, with both parties being able to gain influence in each electoral area and score them in each election phase. Influence is gained by holding rallies and bringing political and paramilitary forces to both "encourage" and intimidate the German people. Alternatively for the Nazis, they can use events to increase chaos and unrest in order to bring down the weak parliamentary government. For the SPD, they can use special actions to stop the Nazi political machine, including the elimination of its leadership.

name: MageBattle: Nekromant – Magier der Untoten
description:
Extension to MageBattle.
Nekromant contains 55 cards and adds cards to win the game by emptying the hand of the opponent.

Die Erweiterung Nekromant ist eine Erweiterung mit einer untoten Kreatur und besteht aus 55 Karten. Sie ist eine Erweiterung der Schwierigkeit "schwer". Mit dieser Erweiterung kann man Magebattle auch gewinnen indem man dem Gegner alle Karten von der Hand zieht. Es sind Gegenstände mit neuen Effekten vorhanden und natürlich auch wieder Countersprüche zur Verteidigung.

www.4globalplayers.com

name: MageBattle: Dämon – Die Magie des Bösen
description:
Extension to MageBattle.
Dämon contains 55 cards and adds counterspells to defend versus heavy attacks and several items with strong effects.

Die Erweiterung Dämon ist eine Erweiterung mit einer bösen Kreatur und besteht aus 55 Karten. Es ist eine Erweiterung der Schwierigkeit "schwer". Mit Countersprüchen kann man sich gegen Angriffe verteidigen. Es gibt auch neue Gegenstände mit starken Effekten.

www.4globalplayers.com

name: MageBattle: Lich – Der Beherrscher des Todes
description:
Extension to MageBattle.
Lich contains 55 cards, including an undead creature and adds curses and benedictions to the game. It´s the first extension with the difficulty level professional. Also there is the possibility to win by emptying the opponents hand and there are many new visitors and items.

Die Erweiterung Lich ist eine Erweiterung mit einer untoten Kreatur und besteht aus 55 neuen Karten. Diese Erweiterung ist von der Schwierigkeit "Profi" und man kann erstmals auch Flüche und Segnungen spielen. Ausserdem kann man jetzt auf den Handtod des Gegners spielen. Es gibt auch viele neue Besucher und Gegenstände.

www.4globalplayers.com

name: Game of Four and Twenty Black Birds
description: Inspired by the Mother Goose rhyme of the same name, this game is a game of dexterity in which players attempt to hook a pair of metal wings on a rod, to catch blackbirds poking out of a pie and then remove them one by one without letting them fall.

name: All About Town: Greater Bangor, ME
description: From the game instructions: The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a residence square to the bank and shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with the travel cards for all locations contained on his shopping list wins the game!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Intercept
description: 2 players (or 4 by teams) compete to catch and bring the ball initially placed in the center of the board, The aim is to capture the ball and transport it to the opposite line.

name: Cafe Pronto
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: Game of To The North Pole by Airship
description: From: "The Games We Played" This game probably was inspired by the failed attempt of Swedish explorer Salomom Andree in 1897 to reach the Arctic by balloon. The game challenges players to successfully navigate the make-believe skies above the icy polar cap.

name: Decision Day Fantasy Football
description:
From the back of the box:

Embark on a quest to build your all-time fantasy football team by competing against opponents while managing a salary cap to become the best General Manager in football history.

Build your fantasy team with the roster of trading cards provided or use your own trading cards from any era to enhance your roster.

Game play:
Players pick up challenge cards in the categories they are trying to advance in, example "Touchdowns", a sample of one question would be "how many career Touchdowns does your opponent's Wide Receiver have? Your opponent will then tell you who their Wide Receiver (trading card) is and the last year of statistics on his/her card. For Example, "My Wide Receiver is Jerry Rice and the last year of stats is 1996. You must then make your best guess as to how many Touchdowns you think Jerry Rice had by the end of the 1996 season. The closer you are to the correct answer, the further up the fantasy charts you go in the Touchdowns category. So....the more you know about Jerry Rice and how many Touchdowns he averaged, the better guess you can make as your answer.

You don't ever have to be exact, but the closer you are to the correct answer the faster you move up the fantasy category charts.

name: Inversion
description:
Inversion is played on a hexagonal board with five cells per side.

The objective of Inversion is to occupy more cells with your own stones than your opponent when there are no legal moves remaining. This occurs when all cells have been occupied. No draws are possible in Inversion.

Players move alternatingly, starting with White.

The player must first place a stone of his or her color in any empty cell.

A hex is any set of seven cells consisting of one center cell and its six surrounding cells. The dominant color of a hex is the color occupying four or more of the seven cells. If the player’s stone occupies the last empty cell in a hex, the stones of the dominant color in that hex are replaced by stones of the non-dominant color. This is called an inversion.

The placement of a stone often completes multiple hexes simultaneously. In this case, the player may choose the order in which to invert the hexes. Each of the completed hexes must be inverted once and only once.

name: Decision Day Fantasy Baseball
description:
From the back of the box:

Embark on a quest to build your all-time fantasy baseball team by competing against opponents while managing a salary cap to become the best General Manager in baseball history.

Build your fantasy team with the roster of trading cards provided or use your own trading cards from any era to enhance your roster.

Game play:
Players pick up challenge cards in the categories they are trying to advance in, example "Hits", a sample of one question would be "how many career Hits does your opponent's 3rd Baseman have? Your opponent will then tell you who their 3rd Baseman (trading card) is and the last year of statistics on his/her card. For Example, "My 3rd Baseman is Wade Boggs and the last year of stats is 1991. You must then make your best guess as to how many Hits you think Wade Boggs had by the end of the 1991 season. The closer you are to the correct answer, the further up the fantasy charts you go in the Hits category. So....the more you know about Wade Boggs and how many Hits he averaged, the better guess you can make as your answer.

You don't ever have to be exact, but the closer you are to the correct answer the faster you move up the fantasy category charts.

name: Decision Day Fantasy Basketball
description:
From the back of the box:
Embark on a quest to build your all-time fantasy basketball team by competing against opponents while managing a salary cap to become the best General Manager in basketball history.

Build your fantasy team with the roster of trading cards provided or use your own trading cards from any era to enhance your roster.

Game play:
Players pick up challenge cards in the categories they are trying to advance in, example "Assists", a sample of one question would be "how many career assists does your opponent's Point Guard have? Your opponent will then tell you who their Point Guard (trading card) is and the last year of statistics on his/her card. For Example, "My Point Guard is John Stockton and the last year of stats is 1998/1999. You must then make your best guess as to how many assists you think John Stockton had by the end of the 1998/1999 season. The closer you are to the correct answer, the further up the fantasy charts you go in the assists category. So....the more you know about John Stockton and how many assists he averaged, the better guess you can make as your answer.

You don't ever have to be exact, but the more you know, the faster you move up the fantasy category charts.

name: Starcraft Dice: Life of a Marine
description:
Ever wondered whats the life of a marine on the battlefield. From putting holes in zergs to getting stimm'ed, if you're lucky maybe even a hot medic might patch you up. If you manage to rack up enough kills, you can even upgrade your armor and weapon to make sure you last longer and the zerg don't.

Players start off by rolling the zerg dice to see what they're up against, then proceeding to the attack phase where they try to roll as many kill shots as possible. If they survive they can proceed to see a medic and/or buy upgrades for weapons and armor. Players can also use different attack tactics to increase their survival. Winner is decided by a variety of rules of the players choice. Eg. Last survivor, most kills or points after a set number of rounds etc.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Spinmaster
description:
Spinmaster will have you: impersonating, performing, describing, sketching, humming, singing, acting, etc.

It’s easy -- spin the arrow and let the party begin

Spinmaster can be played individually or in teams. As players/teams correctly identify what has been sketched, performed or described, they collect spindiscs. When all of the spindiscs are used up, the player/team with the most is the winner.

name: Weer of Geen Weer
description:
A game about the weather.

The board displays rows with all kinds of weather and rows with dots. The player turns the spinner and moves his or her pawn in the direction of that kind of weather. The player may move as many dots as the spinner indicates.
The first player who arrives in the centre of the board wins the game.

name: USA by the numbers
description:
From the rules book:

Family kit contains five engaging games that combine U.S. geography with the math of numbers, data, logic, and strategy. The games are ideal for children 7 to 13 to play with parents, siblings, or friends. Children a little younger can play them with an adult or older child. The directions include ways to adjust the games to fit the age and experience of the players.

Games included are: (1) Guess my state; (2) Take a trip; (3) Guess my rule; (4) Capture states; and (5) Closest match.

(1) Guess my state - In this game, similar to "Twenty Questions," players ask questions to try to identify a secret state that one player has chosen. At the start of the game, the state cards are laid out face up. Players take turns tryin to identify the secret state by asking yes-or-no questions (e.g., Did it become a state in the 1800s? Does your state border Canada?). After each question is answered, the states that have been ruled out are removed from the layout. The player who narrows the layout down to the secret state is the winner. Use either the East or West cards, or for more of a challenge, play with all 50 state cards.

(2) Take a trip - In this game, players navigate around the U.S. by finding states that border one another. At the start of the game, one state card is turned up. On the first turn, a player puts down a state card that borders it from their hand of 3 cards. The next player puts down a card that borders that state, and so on. For example, if Texas is turned up at the start of the game, on the first turn a player could put down Oklahoma, since it borders Texas. On the second turn, a player could put down Kansas, since it borders Oklahoma. The game is over when one player plays all of their cards or no more cards can be placed. Use either the East or West cards, or for more of a challenge, play with all 50 state cards. May also be played cooperatively with all players' cards face up.

(3) Guess my rule - In this game,players try to discover a secret rule that one player is using to sort the states into two groups. For instance, a secret rule could be "borders on an ocean." States that border an ocean would go in one group; states that do not border an ocean would go in the other group. the Rule Maker selects about six states form the layout ans sorts them into two groups according to the rule. Players take turns trying to figure out the rule by choosing a state that has not yet been sorted and saying which group they think it belongs in. After three turns in a row in which players sort states correctly, they may begin to guess the rule. The first player to guess the rule wins. Use either the East or West cards, or for more of a challenge, play with all 50 state cards.

(4) Capture states - In this game, similar to "War,"players compare the states according to a certain feature. At the start of the game, players choose a state feature, such as year of statehood. On each round, all players put out a state card at the same time from their stack of face down cards. The player with the state that has the biggest number for the chosen feature (e.g., became a state most recently) captures all the cards played in the round. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

(5) Closest match - In this game, players use math to find states that are most alike. At the start of the game, players choose a state feature, such as number of libraries. In each round, they compare the states in their hand to a Goal state. For instance, if the Goal is Colorado, which has 253 libraries, they find the card in their hand of five cards that has closest to 253 libraries. They compare their chosen states, and the player with the closest of all takes the cards played in the round. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Contents:
- large map of U.S. for reference
- 26 Blue fact cards, one for each of
the states in the Eastern U.S.
(sorry, no Washington, D.C.)
- 24 Red fact cards, one for each of
the states in the Western U.S.
- 10 Wild cards
- 10 sample rules/question cards
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Trick-taking

name: First Dividend
description:
From the rules:
First Dividend comprises a pack of Cards numbered to correspond to the numbers shown against the matches or races on a pools coupon, together with three dice: one white dice marked 1,2,X, (represents a home win or first favourite, an away win or second favourite, a draw or an outsider respectively), and two standard dice (red and blue) for Greyhound racing selection.

All together using these cards and dice you have any options:
1) Treble Chance
2) Four Draws and Twelve Homes
3) Eight Results
4) Easier Six
5) Treble Chance and Home Racing
6) Lucky 7 - Jokey Points Pool
7) Racing Bingo
8) 8 Winning Jokeys
9) Win or Place Only bets
10) Forecast Bets

This game comes with coupons you use to play this weird game. You first use the dice and cards to create winning chances for teams/horses/dogs or other gambling areas. The names for the teams and such are all fictional and every game the favourites are different.

Then using the cards you try to predict winning chances to each contestant, but you can only use each card once, so you need to select carefully between the right range of winning chance. You can predict first 3 places (at races and championships) or winning team on individual matches. You can only predict only one certain place, if afraid to lose points (money).

After everyone have placed their bets (written down), according to rules for certain part (10 up above) leading player uses dices and cards to make the final results. Favourites getting better chances and so on. The 2 Joker cards in the pack act as a Act Of God in this betting game. They can remove a winner of bring a loser to front. Rules for Jokers and how to use them come with each part separately. Each part has different conditions for winning, but main idea is to collect most money at the end of each coupon (races, matches etc).

PS! Rules say that these cards for predicting the races can also used for real life races as well and refers to the product with the same name used for only gambling purpose.

name: Chanz Spel Med Eva & Adam
description:
From The Rules:
All young people have been able to follow the popular series for Adam & Eve.
But in this issue offers CP also a fun game for 2-6 players that played out in the schoolyard of Eva & Adam's school.
It is easy to play, so here's how:

Games Preparation
Before you start playing the game you need to get a die and a playing pieces to go with. As the pieces you can use spirit buttons, coins or anything you can find. Place the pieces in the start box and gear up for a tough game with many tricky choices

The game's start
In order to enter the school yard, you need to roll 1 or 6. Otherwise, you will remain in the starting box and try again next time it gets to you.
Once you are on the playground, simply put full speed toward the target. and the success of all opportunities and challenges that you must take all hazards, interesting girls and boys and the cool gang.

Chance Boxes
If you get a chance to box, you must make a choice:
You can choose to walk two steps forward (which is a bit cowardly. But surely) - or you can take a chance and beat the dice, and then applies it to be lucky, you hit a 5 or 6th, you will go 6 steps forward. but if you turn l - 4th and you'll remain, and thus have no extra steps at all.
Any chance of box is a very special place, and more about just the place you come in, you can read at the bottom of the board.

Risk Boxes
If you are on a risk-box, you must also make an important choice: You can choose to stand on a roll - or you can take the risk to die, and you may encounter real bad, switch one l st or 2nd, you stand over the three throws, but if you beat the 3rd - 6th so you do not have to be completely over.
Each risk-box is a very specific risk-spot. It is what all the boxes is a risk for places at the bottom of the board.

Rebuff
There are additional elements of risk in the game on the board are a number rebuff-boxes; you'll go to such it is revealed that you studied for a bit. You will then get back as much as it is in the box and attempt to catch up from when it's your turn next time.

Who will win?
After all the risks and chances are you or any of the players until Mon / box. No matter what the dice show you have to stay here and beat again. Turns you then 1st or 6th has been gained, otherwise you have to go back five steps, and try again the next time.

All special rules are written on to the board and can be read once you encounter them.

Winner is the first to get through the school yard with most friends.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fidget Digit
description:
Sliding Puzzles Turned Into a Board Game!!

Game consists of 4 15-slide puzzles attached to the box bottom. In the top of the box there is a wheel with different solutions. When the top is placed under the bottom, the different configurations show through slots, and the players compete to make their slide puzzles match the examples. The first player to finish calls "Fidget Digit!" Each win counts 5 points.

"An exciting fun-packed game, for all age groups, with no loose parts to lose. May be played anywhere...even in a moving car, train, plane or bus."

"The object of the game is to duplicate on the sliding squares the example shown in the window alongside. To start the game, turn the dial one stop clockwise. The first player to finish calls "Fidget Digit!" From box.

name: Roll-Away Speedways
description:
Players take turn rolling the dice and moving their race car the appropriate number of spaces following any instructions on the space they land on. Yellow spaces on the track will have the driver take an Official's Choice card that will alter the race (out of fuel, flat tire, spin out, engine trouble, drafting pass, lane shifts, and more). First driver to complete 3 laps is the winner.

Contents include: gameboard, 6 race cars, 6 sets of flags, 6 flag stands, 63 Official Choice Cards, 6 six sided dice, and rules

name: Too Few To Fight, Too Many To Die
description:
Rules for the North American Indian Wars, covering the period from the French and Indian War to the last stand of the Sioux at Wounded Knee. The Eastern Woodland, Plains, Rocky Mountain and South-Western tribes and their British, French, Spanish, Mexican and American opponents are all catered for. Based on the mechanisms used in Death In The Dark Continent.

The game aims to represent fairly large scale battles instead of the skirmishes usually played out with Wild West games. The rules come complete with a quick reference section, contents list, and army lists for all the major combatants.
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Je eigen huis
description:
Try to collect your house (9 pieces), buy it, fix the mortgage get the key.
Game published for a real estate company.
Game material :
1 game board, 72 cards (36 black & 36 green), 4 pawns and 1 dice.
By going around the boards outer ring, you must collect cards which you can save (to assemble a complete house set for which you receive a key card) of to discard.
After that you have to collect a buy card and an mortgage card, together with the key card and by doing this claim the win.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Smart Investor
description:
Smart Investor is a card game that simulates the stock trading. Players are dealt a random set of stocks worth 500€ - and for winning the game you have to increase the value of your portfolio with four rounds as much as possible. During the course of the rounds, players buy and sell stocks, which impacts the price. Just remember that every stock you sell decreases the stock value... but every company's first stock you buy increases the value. If one particular stock in sector/industry raises high enough in value, market bubble follows with raising other stocks as well... but beware of market crashes!

Therefore - for being successful in "Smart Investor" you have to know when to buy, when to sell and when to do nothing more but wait. Just like in real life, isn't it?

name: Wythoff's game
description: Wythoff's game is a nim-like game played with two piles of counters. Players take turns to remove counters from one or both piles, with the winner removing the last stone. The Dutch mathematician W. A. Wythoff published a mathematical analysis of the game in 1907.

name: Grundy's Game
description:
A Nim-like game where players take turns to split big piles into two smaller piles, with different numbers of things in each pile. The game ends when only piles of size one or two are left, and the winner is the last to make a move.

Wikipedia link

name: Mit Händen und Füßen
description:
This is a party game promoting Viennese culture. There are six categories in which the two teams compete, like charade, imitating celebrities, using the other team's players as "puppets" to depict a scene, etc.
The other team and one referee decide about the success of a task - a successful team can keep the card. When one team has completed a task from each of the six categories, the game ends and the team which has most cards wins.

The game was apparently distributed for free in Vienna.

name: Mirror of Famous Generals
description:
Mirror of Famous Generals is a twenty-card expansion pack to be played along with the card game ‘Seppuku’. This set introduces military themes including Towers, Generals, Alliances, and a variety of new Armaments.

The expansion pack consists of (20) cards. There are (6) Alliances, (4) Towers, (4) Generals, and (6) Armaments.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
publishers: Epic Atom Game Lab, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Attercop
description:
Overview from game designer:-

Attercop is a new board game where two players take on the roles of Attercop and Meratoo. Meratoo is the hapless spider who must cross the web of Attercop. Meratoo, must gently feel his way across the web before being caught. Hidden, Attercop stalks - probing, deceiving, sneaking for her prey.

It's devious, it's cunning, it's sneaking good fun !

How the game is played, from game designer :-

Attercop is a game for two players. One player is Attercop, a spider with a reputation for cunning, and a lady with an appetite. The other is Meratoo, a little spider nervously trying to cross her web. The aim of the game is for Meratoo to make his way from one side of the web to the other, whilst Attercop tries to catch him.

The web consists of 44 connected points, each covered by a "blank" tile. Meratoo travels from blank tile to blank tile, gently feeling his way accross the Web trying to avoid running into Attercop. Meanwhile, Attercop has a number of tiles to represent her legs, which tease the web and try to bluff the Meratoo player into her grasp, by being able the change the position of the tiles on the web. Here's the catch: the Attercop tiles remain face-down on the web, undistinguishable from the blank tiles, and they can be moved along with the rest of the web tiles. This is how Attercop probes her way around the web.

For Attercop the game is all about bluffing and enticing Meratoo into her grasp. For Meratoo it is all about staying alert, testing the web and calling Attercop's bluff. The game is fun to play, generates lots of laughs , is a light-hearted and quick game, and is great for both kids and adults.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Law & Chaos
description:
The abstract game Law & Chaos combines careful placement of "stones" on a board with changing victory conditions and capture methods, controlled in considerable part by the players. You can either place a stone, or play a victory method or capture method card that changes either one of your methods, one of another player's methods, or one of the shared methods. You have to try to build your position while interfering with others by placement or capture, anticipating what they may be trying to do.

It is that rare thing, a highly-interactive, natural three-player game, but can also be played by two or four.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Variable Player Powers

name: Füttere die Tiere
description:
Füttere die Tiere (Feed the animals) is an eays pick-up and deliver game
It´s designed to teach children which animal likes which food.

At the beginning, the plyers draw animal cards, which show, what kind of food the animals want. This food can be found on the board (a farm). The players run around the farm in order to collect all food tokens, necessary to feed thier animals. The first player to fulfill all needs of his animals is the winner.

The playing time can be varied by the number of animal cards per player.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: El Peregrino: das Kartenspiel
description:
Card game based on the Way of St. James. The game consists of cards which have photos of places along the pilgrimage route on one side; and trivia questions on the other side.
Four cards are placed on the table, picture side up. Each player receives three cards at the beginning and must try to be the first one to get a consecutive set of eight cards (10 with 2 or 3 players).
The active player chooses a card from the four on the table that he/she would like to have. Another player then reads one of the questions on the back to him/her (the number of the question is determined by the position of the card on the table, i.e. 1-4 positions away from the draw pile). If answering correctly, the player can keep the card; if wrong, the card is discarded. A new card then replaces the old one.
No player may hold more than 12 cards; excess cards have to be discarded. There are also some wild cards which help complete the sets.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

55 cards

First print run limited to 3,000 copies.

name: Der unschlagbare Rechen-Fuchs
description:
The game is designed to train first graders' addition skills. The players take tiles from their hand which show either points or plus or minus. The active player has to add sheep to the current total or substract some, but never going above the limits 0 and 10 or 20. The current sum is shown by sheep tiles. A player who manages that gets a fox, a player who doesn't gets nothing and a player who makes a mistake has to return a fox. The player with most foxes at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: The Good Sirs
description: The Good Sirs is a 2 player debate game between cats and dogs. All nonsense aside this is a very strategic game. Players have to allocate their actions to gain debating resources. These debating resources help them persuade the audience on certain topics of the city planning debate such as the budget, healthcare, and municipal buildings. The player who sways the most audience members wins the game, but beware to not get carried away, because for every audience member you get, you lose an action.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Economic, Fantasy, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Ivory Tower
description:
A strategic domino game for 2 to 5, played with traditional Western Dominoes. Designed to provide a tense, tactical, and strategic game in a quick time frame, played solely with dominoes, that does not require pencil and paper or any other components for tracking score.

In Ivory Tower, players strive to construct their own ivory tower and make it the most impressive in the group by placing dominoes with sequential pips following specific rules and scoring based on numbers of dominoes included in this personal "tower." A few extra dominoes are available for purchase in the "shop" each turn, leading some playtesters to affectionately refer to Ivory Tower as "Domino Alhambra" (which is not inaccurate in terms of the feel, but the novel and simple game mechanics actually create a fast and tense game that generates the kinds of difficult decisions and turn angst that is more akin to games like Battleline, Lost Cities, and the Keltis series).

Depending on the number of players, varying configurations ranging from Double 6 to Double 9 dominoes are used.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Animal Shelters
description:
Child-sized dominoes designed with colorful pictures to encourage your children to learn numbers, counting, colors, and to associate common objects.

Included in this game are 28 dominoes, each with an animal on the right and an animal shelter on the left. The objective of this game is to match the animal to its proper shelter.

How to play:
-Place all the dominoes upside down on the playing surface
-Each player draws 7 dominoes and sets them up in front of himself. The remaining dominoes constitute the bank.
-Determine the starting player. The game begins with the play of the first domino.
-The next player must fine one of the two playable dominoes. It must be played to the left or the right of the starting domino.
-If the next player does not have a playable domino, one is drawn from the bank. If the domino drawn is playable, it may be played. If not playable, that turn to play is lost.
-The game is to proceed in this manner until a player is out of dominoes. The first player out of dominoes is declared the winner.

Source: Back of the box, Directions

Similar to Picture Dominoes except that each number-picture is divided up into two separate items that can only be combined a specific way.

name: Rat Six
description:
Rat Six is a solo wargame depicting the actions of teams of Allied soldiers entering the Viet Cong's extensive tunnel systems for the purposes of flushing out and/or eliminating enemy combatants. The soldiers were known as Tunnel Rats and the team commander was codenamed Rat Six.

The game employs an Action Points game mechanic. The tunnel layouts and encounters are determined by die rolls and tables. Using the tables a player moves a team of Tunnel Rats through the tunnel complex eliminating enemies and mapping the tunnels as play progresses. Action points are spent for movement and for attack/defense. Victory is achieved when the entire tunnel complex is free of Viet Cong. Individuals in the teams are armed with various period small arms and team members may have to be "pulled out" of the tunnels if wounded. Game may be used with miniatures and play area movement is square to square.

Rules were originally published in The Gauntlet #10.

name: Cobalt-1
description:
Softcover book with rules for science fiction tabletop encounters.

No dice are ever used with these rules. The approach is that each weapon or tested action has what's called "The Solution". The Solution is a range of numbers from which each player chooses one of those numbers and writes it down on a piece of paper. In order to be successful, the attacking (or testing) player must match the defending player's choice for that Solution. So, for example, if a Solution is listed at 4, each player chooses either a 1, 2, 3, or 4 for that Solution. If player A chooses 2, player B must also choose 2 in order to succeed. If he instead chooses 1, 3, or 4 the test fails. Better characters will have lower solutions (1 or 2) and worse characters can have solutions ranging as high as 8 or 9.

name: Mon Tresor
description:
Roll and Move game with social and creative elements. The basic rules are simple: Roll a die and move forward the appropriate number of fields, then perform the action that the target field demands.
The actions are not just referring to the game itself (such as letting someone pass, skip a turn etc.), but some are also pledges about things one wants to do in the future, while others just encourage players to talk about personal matters. Winning (reaching the last field) is not supposed to be important in this game.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Sensis
description: A player asks a question, which must be answered with yes or no by a fellow player. Before the asked one answers, the remaining fellow players must guess what he or she will answer. Coincidents bring points.

name: Task
description:
Three games for the exercise of the language ability.
“Drawing game”:
A player takes a card, other players can´t see the picture on it. Now he gives instructions to the other players, after which they after-draw the design exactly.
“Story game”:
From an impact of 36 cards a player draws any number of cards, until two people show up. Now he considers, in which order these cards show a story, and tells this story. Afterwards the 36 cards are shown and the other players try to find the used cards.
“Description game".
A player draws from 36 cards as many as desired, on which different designs are to be seen. He must describe this card in such a way that the other players can find it out from the entire deck.

name: Trugbug
description: The task, which offers the game to each player, consists of developing and/or completing a certain number of square equations on a board of 8x8 squares.

name: Musical Pop-Up Baseball
description:
From the back of the box: Wait & watch for balls to pop catch em' fast before they drop!
Each player has a scoop. Little balls are set in a board that looks like a catcher's mask. The balls pop out of the mask and the players try to collect them.

name: Das listige Labyrinth
description:
Rough translation from the box:

An entertaining game for the whole family. Who can find the quickest way through a labyrinth of walls, some built by you and some put in your way by your opponents? Planning, along with some luck, will decide the outcome. This game can also be played as a team battle.

Contents:
Game board
4 pawns
76 path cards
4 direction indicators

name: Das Umweltspiel
description:
Rough translation from the box:

A boardgame with cooperation and competition for 3 to 6 players from 12 years

Short description:
How can I get from Start to Finish most quickly? Should I pollute and soil the environment in order to reach the finish quickly with the money I raked in? But wait! Whoever makes use of industry earns money but at the same time pollutes the environment and blocks the path for everybody. Should I therefore set myself up to defend the environment by founding citizens' initiatives with others? Or should I establish nature preserves? How can I best reach the Finish? Each player will choose one of the following options: to reach the Finish quickly choosing pollution over environmental protection, or to reach the Finish less quickly but more environmentally. Each game group can choose for each game to pursue personal or group strategy.

Contents:
Colorful game board
6 charts for ecomoney
6 pawns
Cardboard chits

name: Cibo The Pasta Card Game
description: Cibo – the pasta card game is a game in which players are chefs who have to make the right pasta meal before the others. Cibo means food in Italian, and each card has unique artwork. Cards are drawn from the centre stack to gather ingredients and pieces of the place setting. Once the fork, spoon and plate cards have been played to the table in front of the player, they can start to play cards for their meal. But other players can use waiters to steal cards, and chef cards to force other players to make certain pasta dishes. Also the mouse card can be used to spoil another players dish. The first one to complete their pasta wins the round and scores points for their own cards on the table. The first to score 50 points wins.

name: Easter Week, Dublin 1916 1922
description:
Who fears to speak of Easter Week?
Who dares its fate deplore?
The red gold flame of Eire's name,
Confronts the world once more.

Easter Week is an area/impulse game depicting the Easter Rising in 1916 and the Battle of Dublin in 1922. The Irish Republican Army is controlled by the IRA Player and the British Army and Irish Free State Army by the Government Player. In both games the IRA Player seizes strategic buildings across Dublin and must hold them as long as possible despite being outnumbered 10-1. The Government Player must use his superior forces to retake the city block by block, helped by artillery, bombers, gunboats, tanks and armoured cars. But the IRA is barricaded in thick-walled buildings where a few men can hold up an entire battalion and the centre of Dublin was reduced to rubble before they surrendered. Each side earns victory points during the game and while the IRA Player is unlikely to win the battle he may earn enough VPs to win the game.

Includes:

Map (33 x 22 inches)

Countersheet with 280 ½ inch counters

Rules Booklet
categories: Civil War, Print & Play, World War I

name: Berlin
description:
Rough translation from the rules introduction:

In this city game, there's something going on -- such a little board, but sooooo much fun! Where's "in"? How do you get there? Where is there a lot to see in the museums? Where does the bus go? When does the train leave? And just think -- there's another monument! At the end, everybody has won: the one that got the most points, and everybody who got to experience a city tour in the game. Have fun!

Contents:
1 board in four pieces
30 double-sided cards
4 pawns
1 die

name: Wang Zi
description: Another self produced abstract strategy game by Nicola Castellini; it's a typical area enclosure game. With your wooden Wang Zi's (chinese princes) you have to move around the board and objective of the game is to conquer and set the widest territorial area, scoring points proportionally to the number of hex conquered.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Enclosure

name: Trivial Pursuit: Rijnlands Lyceum
description:
This expansion to Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition consists of 50 cards about the Dutch Rijnlands Lyceum in Sassenheim.
The questions are related to the school, the pupils and teachers.
There are six different categories; Gebouw, Docenten, Leerlingen, Sport en Cultuur, Historie, Algemeen.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Toy Story Shooting Game
description:
[Box Back]
Contents: 1 Playing board, 3 Launchers, 27 Hats.

Setting up:
Place the playing board in the centre of a table or any other suitable flat surface, with one corner facing each player.
Each player chooses 9 colored hats to match the colors of the target area furthest from them (opposite corner).
Each player selects a corresponding colored launcher and places it at any distance so chosen from the target area.

Playing the Game
- All players position their hats within easy reach of their launcher.
- Place a hat on the lever arm, press down and release. This will launch the hat forwards toward the target area. With practice the distance to press and the distance from the target area to land a hat in the right hole will be easy to judge.
- Each game consists of the number of rounds necessary for 1 player to score 75 points.
- The first round starts by one player (chosen by agreement) calling out "GO". All players launch all nine of their hats, immediately in flight during the call "HAT SHOOT" does count. The round ends. All players count and record their scores. Players then recover all 9 of their hats to be ready for the next round. Round 2 is started by the player to the left of the Round 1 starter.
- The first player to reach a cummulative score of 75 points is the winner of the game.

Scoring:
- For each hat which lands a hole of the correct color-5 points.
- Note: There is no score for hats which land in another player's color target area.
- There is no score for hats which land outside the hole position at the end of a Round.
- There is no score for hats which land outside the playing board.
- For each hat of a players color which lands inside any other hat (regardless of color) within the correct target area. (No bonus points are scored if the player who calls "HAT SHOOT" scores a bonus of 5 points-provided player in that round has landed to least one hat in the correct target area. (No bonus points are scored if the player who calls "HAT SHOOT" does notland 1 hat in the correct target area.)
- If 2 or more players call "HAT SHOOT" simultaneously each player scores the "HAT SHOOT" bonus.

[From submitter]
The game was available in Hong Kong. The English rules is not clear. There are a number of grammatical and logical mistakes in the text.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Parade Spel
description:
A Monopoly like game.

Players move along a square board. They try to buy and sell properties. This game is situated in the Dutch city 's-Hertogenbosch. If another player lands on a space you own, you can collect the rent.
When a player has all the property cards of one color, that player can build houses and hotels to increase the rent.

A player wins the game when the other players are bankrupt.

This game is produced to raise funds for a Child Abuse program.

name: Swordwitch Wardancer: TactDecks Booster Series 1
description:
From the TactDecks website:

The Swordwitch Wardancer is a Near combat Character specializing in line-breaking and battlefield rearrangement. The booster comes with 8 Invocations (including Blade Blossom, Coven Strike, Infiltrate) plus the Wardancer play card.

The Wardancer is for any faction and considered an Uncommon type.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Swordwitch Healer: TactDecks Booster Series 1
description:
From the TactDecks website:

The Swordwitch Healer is a Near combat Character who can restore allies while holding her own in battle. The booster comes with 8 Invocations (including Martyr, Censor Rejuvenation, Healer's Edge) plus the Healer play card.

The Healer is for any faction and considered an Uncommon type.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Swordwitch Hexbearer: TactDecks Booster Series 1
description:
From the TactDecks website:

The Swordwitch Hexbearer is a Near combat Character specializing in reactive attacks and sowing misfortune for both near and far opponents alike. The booster comes with 8 Invocations (including Maladroit Swing, Flakey Fortune, Uncertain Fate) plus the Hexbearer play card.

The Hexbearer is for any faction and considered an Uncommon type.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Marchland Defender: TactDecks Booster Series 1
description:
From the TactDecks website:

The Marchland Defender is a Near combat Character specializing in strategic defense of both man and structure. The booster comes with 4 Squiring zone cards, additional Vanguards and Archers, plus the Marchland Defender play card.

The Defender is for any faction and considered an Uncommon (2) type.

name: Remember the Alamo! San Jacinto April 20-21, 1836
description:
