A road section is indestructible, only if, all its adjacent north, south, east and west land parcels (that exist on the game board) have been paved by either player and it is not part of a crossroads dispute.

Goal: The first civil engineer to pave a thruway (connected path of horizontally and/or vertically adjacent indestructible road sections) connecting their two sides of the landscape wins the game.

name: Animal Freedom Force
description:
Animal Freedom Force is a fast-paced race around the world game for 2-5 players that plays in around 15-20 minutes.

Players assume the roles of Animal Rescue Specialists scouring the far corners of the earth for endangered species held in private zoos, often in appalling conditions. Players must search for rare animals in the regions within each continent and once discovered they must return them to their home continent, to be cared for and released into the wild

Using luck, deduction, memory and strategy, the game plays super-fast, as players search for their the precious animals and negotiate for passports that allow passage across international borders, but in doing so, they will often help their opponents find their animals more quickly.

The first player to successfully return all 6 of their animals to their home regions is the winner.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Autobus
description:
The game consists of cards numbered 1-12 in two colors. Each of the players receives a stack of cards and places it in front of him/her without looking at the cards, plus five hand cards. The top card of the personal stack is flipped open.
The active player can play a card with number one to the middle of the table or a card that is one point higher on any card already open in the middle, as long as it has the same color. At the end of the move, a card from the hand has to be put onto a personal discard stack (of which each player has up to four), but only one number can be into any given stack. Cards from all stacks can also be played to the central stacks.
The aim of the game is to get rid of one's original card stack first.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Der große Dreh
description:
Another roll and move game of the early '70s.

Each player has 3 pawns and tries to reach the target field in the middle of the gameboard over pathes of different lengths.
But special is the turnable center mounted disk (with a part of the pathes on it). Everyone tries to shorten his own way by turning the disk and - of course extent the opponent one's!

name: Autorennen
description:
Simple roll and move. The players move cars around a race track. When they reach certain fields, they have to follow instructions from event cards. Reaching one field forces them to go back a part of the track. When reaching a field with another player's car, they proceed to the next free field.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Aux Sabords Kartenspiel
description:
Expansion for Aux Sabords. This set of cards offers two sets of rules. Both require the basic game and the expansion.
In the first game, the players try to collect and lay down sets of cards including a ship card, a captain's card, three item cards and four crew cards (in a certain order). In a basic move, a player draws a card and can play one to his/her display. Alternatively, s/he can attack other players with combinations of cards, forcing them to discard or hand over cards, etc. Afterwards, the hand is filled up to five cards again. The first player to complete a display is the winner.

The second game is similar, but includes entering enemy ships. So attacks are directed at a player's display, and entire ships can be sunk.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: Startups
description:
Startups is a game about economy, trading, risk management and negotiation.

You start out with a young company "Startups" and travel around the board buying, trading and auctioning on the way.

The goal of the game is to grow your company by buying different properties and buildings and in the end take over your competitor's shares and/or money - In that way buying them out of the game - leaving you as the most succesful Startup.

You own 100% of your company in the beginning - but might loose or gain shares from other players which forces you and your competitors to alter strategies during the game.

[In short you could call it a strategic Monopoly]

Some of the key elements to winning the game is knowing when to build, when to save up money and buy other's shares, when to expect spending your money and winning auctions by the smallest margin possible.

As a Startup you'll face both good and bad times during the game, knowing how to manage your money and deal with the situation at hand is what makes a good Startup!

(source: www.suntzugames.com/startups.html)

[Production]
Startups is a indie board game production and is being produced in Denmark with game parts from all over the world.
categories: City Building, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Travel
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Iris Wappen
description:
The game consists of two matching sets of tiles (in two colors) with coats of arms on them. One of the sets is openly spread out on the table, while the other one is dealt to the players. When the game starts, each player opens his/her own tiles and tries to find the matching tiles on the table, grab them and put them on his/her own tiles. The coats of arms are rather similar, so mistakes happen.
When the first player has covered all his/her original tiles, each correct pair counts one point, each wrong pair counts minus two points and plus two points for the "rightful owner". The first player to reach 50 points after several rounds is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Junior Chef
description:
A game of economy for 2-4 players from 7 years. There are four big business in the town: ice cream, toys, soft drinks and candy.Every player starts with 2000 Marks. Buy a van (three different ways with luck, cash or credit) and drive through the city.
In this town are two different seasons: spring/summer and autumn/winter. Ice cream and soft drinks will be sell only in the summer season, toys and candy only in the winter season. Every double with the dies will change the seasons, every crossing the start field will be money from the bank or you have to pay the interest rate, insurances can help you in bad times.
If you cross a field in the colour of your company in the right time, you do an order and get money. If you have enough money, you can buy a second van or pay back your credit.
The player with the most money wins the game.

name: Life Balance Board Game
description:
From the Publisher's website:
The Life Balance Board Game teaches you the practical principles of time management in order to help you increase your effectiveness and balance your life.

Each player has a one week calendar page with which they must schedule at the beginning of the week all the important tasks that they need to complete. During the week, various events occur and the players must make choices – to react to these events and take action or not, when to do it, how to choose what to do, what leads to increased effectiveness, how to balance the different areas of your life, how to delegate work to other players, etc.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Queen Mary Ahoy!
description:
GAME information from www.nostalgiagames.net: The board of this game features circles and squares around a picture of the QUEEN MARY. Each square has a number of cards on them. These are the different cargoes that need to be on the ship before it departs, (oil, provisions, passengers, mail etc.) When you land on a square you take the top card from the deck located on each square in an effort to accumulated a full set of cargo. When you acquire a full set, you then race to the dock in order to drop your goods off so that the ship can sail. First one to do so wins.

Candy Lovegrove from Nostalgia Games provided me with the information about this game. She does have a game for sale at her site. (nostalgiagames.net)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Sconudi
description:
Sconudi playing cards are a unique, new set of cards that can play multiple card games. Sconudi Playing Cards have four parts: shapes, colors, numbers, and directions. There are 50 cards in each deck. most games can be played with 2 to 4 players. Also, there are solitaire games to play alone.

Currently there are nine published games that can be played with Sconudi playing cards:

Chainbreaker
Ages 7 & up
2-4 players
Follow the flow of arrows on the cards and score the Chainbreaker!

Continuity
Ages 7 & up
2-4 players
Attempt to draw a five-card hand in which each card has two matching characteristics (shapes, color, numbers, directions) as the cards immediately adjacent to it!

Mimic
Ages 7 & up
2-4 players
Score points by matching as many characteristics (shapes, color, numbers, directions) while also playing the highest number card!

Pinwheel Solitaire
NEW!
Ages 7 & up
1 player

Recall
Ages 5 & up
1-4 players
Find the hidden match or hidden numbers sequence by turning over hidden cards!

Sconudi Poker
New hands! New hand ranks! Play the classic in a complete new way!

Sconudi Tennis
Ages 7 & up
2 players
Play the highest hidden card of your hand to win the volley!

Sconudi Trump
Ages 7 & up
2-4 players
Play the highest card of the selected trump to win the hand!

Straight Solitaire
NEW!
Ages 7 & up
1 player

name: Objective: Stalingrad
description:
From the publisher's website:

Objective: Stalingrad (OS) is a regimental-scale game of the two-month struggle for control of the 30-kilometer long industrial town that sat on the West Bank of the Volga River. In the fall of 1942, the very experienced German army was pushing further into the Soviet Union despite the serious setback inflicted on it by the Soviet winter offensive in December 1941. The Germans were now fighting a rebuilding Soviet army composed of raw recruits and some veteran units that had survived, and learned from, the battlefield disasters suffered by the Russians in 1941.

The German Sixth Army approached the outskirts of Stalingrad in September 1942 a little over two months into its summer offensive. Although his bombers had destroyed the city's industrial and transportation capacity in August, Hitler ordered the capture of Stalin's city. In Objective: Stalingrad, the German player starts with only sixteen regiments to accomplish this mission. The means to German victory is in the ground-attack Stukas and independent battalions of artillery, combat engineers, anti-aircraft (flak), and assault guns (StuGs) that can be attached to the regiments to devise the best tactical mix of forces to conquer Stalin's city.

While the German regiments were steadily reduced in strength and exhausted to impotence, dozens of untested, conscript Soviet rifle regiments and brigades were obliterated in the house-to-house fighting. Cards will provide crucial influential factors such as snipers, leader initiative, mine dogs, armored trains, and river flotilla warships.

In Objective: Stalingrad the German player commands up to twenty regiments of infantry, including panzer grenadier infantry, along with numerous independent units. There are four scenarios representing each of the major attacks launched by the Germans between 13 September and 11 November. There is also a multi-player campaign game. The smaller scenarios are designed to be played in three to four hours. (For a different approach, see Stalingrad: Verdun on the Volga. In VoV the German player can refight the four major historical attacks using up to nine primary maneuver units – divisions – at an operational level. The same scenario at that level can be finished in one to two hours.)

Objective: Stalingrad is about tactical choices for both the German and Soviet players. If you never had time to play Dana Lombardy's tactical company-level "monster" game Streets of Stalingrad, OS enables you to refight one of the most important battles of World War II in far less time.

name: Tippy the Turtle
description:
Tippy the Turtle is a balance game in which players attempt to place colorful barrels on Tippy's tummy. A roll of the special die tells you which kind of barrel (small, medium, or large) you must place on top of precariously balanced turtle. If your barrel causes Tippy to tumble, you lose!

The game includes 15 wooden barrels in three colors, a single wooden die, a cloth tote bag for storage, and Tippy the Turtle himself.

name: Theater van het Sentiment
description:
Theater van het Sentiment is a trivia game with questions about the sixties, seventies and eighties. Each turn, a player rolls a die to determine a question category. Then, he is asked a question from that category. If he answers correctly, he gains a score marker for that category; the first player who has a marker for each category wins the game.

The games is based on a radio show with the same name.

name: Line Of Battle: Fleet Naval rules for the Age of Nelson 1760-1820
description:
Allows players to recreate large fleet actions within 3 to 4 hours.

Covers all major and minor powers of the period with various rules to cover fire ships, transports, blockades and much more.

Line of Battle: Fleet Level battles in the Age of Nelson 1760-1820 includes scenarios and Campaign integration rules with Corps Command Campaigns

8.5x11, Naval rules for the age of Nelson. Covers all major and minor powers of the period. Includes scenarios, terrain rules, leaders and more. 1 vol, 58 pgs.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Frederick d'Or: Rules for the Age of Frederick The Great
description:
Covering the period from 1734 thru 1792, Frederick d'Or allows players to recreate the battles of the 18th Century. Includes army lists for all major powers, points system, battlefield generation system, leader lists, and rules that allow for action in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Far East, and in the Americas.

The smallest maneuver unit is a battalion for infantry, squadron for cavalry, and battery for artillery. Game scale is 1 figure = 50 men.

Wars covered are the Austrian Succession, the French & Indian War, the Seven Years War, the Turkish wars, and the American Revolution.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Quorum
description:
The dawn of civilization is upon us. You are tasked with leading a group of potential citizens out of the wild and into a nation. How will your nation function? Where will your citizens live and work? How will you play with others? Choose a government type to align yourself with to collect development points. You may decide to change paths along the way.

Build your territory into the most developed nation and you just might have what it takes to win.

The base set includes enough cards for 4 people to choose a primary government type and build a 40 card deck as well as enough winks to build a population of 40 people.

Players take turns claiming territory by playing cards, and use the resources from those lands to build improvements. The Objective is to develop your territory into a sustainable society. The game ends by meeting conditions that fit the mold of a particular form of government. The player with the most development points wins.

name: Social Mania
description:
In Social Mania, players form teams that compete with each other to develop and deliver the best experiences before time runs out. The team that ships products delivering the best experiences over a period of four quarters (20 minutes) will score the most points and win the game! But watch out—the other teams may sabotage your best efforts by playing anti-patterns.

Simplified cards and play structure. Includes newly added VC cards. The time monitor becomes the VC. Teams must pitch their product for extra points and the win.

Includes:
Product Cards Deck (184 cards)
VC Cards Deck (5 cards)
Rules for Social Mania Beta III Document

name: Pizza Math
description:
Make tasty pizza pies while building early math skills! Play pizza slice shaped cards from your hand in order to create a pizza - but be careful! Depending on which game variant you choose, the number and kinds of toppings on the card must match the other slices you've already played.

1. The Works: build a pizza with a different topping on each slice.
2. Make 10: make sure the number of toppings on your pizza add up to 10.
3. The Six Mix: bake a pie with toppings that number 1 to 6.

First player to build a complete pizza wins!

Game comes with 48 pizza cards and instructions.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Quardiddl Cards
description:
A collectible card game based on cartoon character Diddl and his friends. Diddl is a mouse with big ears and large pink soled feet. Diddl and his friends are featured on various products.

Cards are distributed in packs with 5 cards. There are three different series published since 2006. Each series contain 32 cards. Each card has 8 numerical point values: Friendship points, Good humor points, Speed points, Lucky points, Feelgood factor, Stress factor, Bad mood points, Learn factor. Also, each card is grouped in three groups: scissor, paper, stone, and in eight colors.

There are three different games that could be played with the cards. First game is called Dib-Dab-Diddl and it is classic rock-paper-scissor game. Every player chooses a card and holds it face down. Symbols for scissor, paper and stone are compared and scissors wins paper, paper wins rock and rock wins scissors.

Second game is called Quarteddl and it is played like classic game Quartet Happy Families. Each player has to collect as many quartets as possible.

Third game is called Compatiddle and it is another version of Quartet Happy Families game, with added twist of comparing different point values of collected quartets. Player with highest points wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: Hasen-Hosen
description:
Hasen-Hosen is an educational word game played with a set of cards; each card shows a word with one letter (a vowel) missing. Each word can be completed in several ways (e.g. H?sen can be completed by inserting either an 'a' or an 'o').

The game is played in rounds. Eight cards are drawn and placed face-up on the table. Each round, a die showing the different vowels is rolled. Then, all players try to find a card in which the rolled vowel can be inserted to form a correct word.

name: Ki a győztes hadvezér?
description:
An old Hungarian chess variant. The title means Who is the winning army leader? The pieces (stickered checkers) depict 6 kind of modern (at that time) military units. They move a little bit differently from the pieces in chess.

Both players get a a 10x10 grid with terrain (basically some squares are obstacles for some pieces). They secretly deploy their armies, put the boards next to each other and then alternate turns moving one of their units, and optionally capturing a unit of the opponent. The goal is to capture either the leader or all the other units of the opponent.

There is a partnership variant where some of the units in your army are controlled by your partner.

name: Tacspiel: The American Army's War Game of the Vietnam War
description:
User Summary:

A map based wargame, intended to be played by opposing teams and refereed by a team of umpires, developed and adopted by the US Army as a training tool for guerrilla and counter-guerrilla operations in a jungle or densely forested environment. Teams are in separated rooms, and assign orders to company or platoon sized units in 6-hours time increments. The umpires work out the eventual detections, contacts and battles resulting from the teams' orders. Several tables are provided for time periods expended on movement, and detection and contact probabilities based on the terrain. Combat is resolved on a combat result table, with percentages of inflicting casualties depending on combat odds ratio.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: lulu.com, The History of Wargaming Project

name: Troll Robot Arena
description:
Five players take the rolls of Trolls - the deep thinkers.

With big brains, but large hands, only plans not robots can be formed. Thus they rely on Goblins and Igors to do their bidding.

Creating part after part in a cooperative way, always on the look out for a backstabbing move by a fellow play the game at first begins with worker placement and strategy.

In the second phase the players bet on the outcome of the third phase: the Battle phase!

Card directed combat with dice to boost!

To finish a round, the players can brag about the outcome and collect their healthy win of 'Shrooms.

Build. Bet. Battle. Booyah!

The game for the troll. A game for the euro gamer. A game for the AT fan.

Created for the "PnP Summer Contest - Confuse A GAMER!" Contest - held by Rudolf Aligierski.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Economic, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: The Hilly Chronicles
description:
The Hilly Chronicles is a collectible card game that will give you the chance to challenge your friends in epic absurd battles. Set in the world of Bunny Hilly where anything is possible, it is a great way to spend fun time with family and friends.

In The Hilly Chronicles players take on the role of a powerful rabbit and fight evil monsters for carrots by playing cards, using special powers and combining to form teams. With multiple game variations players can change the game difficulty to reach ever higher goals.

Game and rules are in Italian.

Italian:
The Hilly Chronicles è un gioco di carte collezionabili che ti darà la possibilità di sfidare i tuoi amici e compagni in epiche battaglie al limite dell'assurdo.

Ambientato nel mondo del Coniglietto Hilly dove tutto è possibile, questo gioco ti farà passare del tempo allegro insieme ai tuoi amici.

Impersonifica i vari personaggi Hilly e combatti per la conquista delle tue carote.

Con molteplici varianti di gioco è possibile cambiare la difficoltà di gioco per raggiungere obiettivi sempre più alti.

Cosa aspetti a provarlo?

Italian from the publisher http://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/the-hilly-chronicles

Includes:
Cards Deck (99 cards)
Regole del Gioco Document / Rules document
1 D6 (16mm) - Green
1 Plastic Bags - 3"x4"
60 Wink (7/8" | 22mm) - Orange
[English is my own translation, with details added for bgg]

name: Autobahnspiel
description: One of the first "pick up an deliver" games from the late '50s. As in Deutschlandreise the destination towns are drawn randomly. But in addition to that traveling game on a german map, goods have to be transported on the shortest or fastest way.

name: Terrarium
description:
A previously unknown immense cave system is discovered underneath Europe. It has been nicknamed "Terrarium" - in it animals have evolved into species unknown and strange to man. You are the head of a team of biologists set on an expedition to discover these new species within the caverns.

You discover the cave by laying out tiles. Within the caves you can discover pieces of information on the animals (Mammals, Reptilians, Birds, Fish, Insects). Then you must study and construct the animal at your base camp. In the end you will have discovered new species. The explorer who has discovered more and rarer animals will gain the most prestige and win the game.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Slay the Dragon
description:
From the designer:
"The goal of the game is to enter into the underground layer of the dragon and make your way down to its lair. As you travel you will find various caves and wandering monsters. You fight these and explore things and you will pick up various items that will help you in your quest to defeat the dragon."

From the Rulebook:
"Your objective is to get to and slay the dragon. The game starts out with you on the Start Circle. You roll the dice and move your game piece the number of squares shown on the dice. It is your choice how directly you want to go to the dragon. You can go directly toward him or you can explore the various tunnels and caves along the way. If you land in a square with a number then look up that number in the RuleBook and follow the instructions. When you land in a cave you look up that cave in the RuleBook and follow the instructions."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Chinzei Gunki
description:
This is expansion kit for 九州三国志 (Kyushu Sangokushi).
It covers battles for the conquest of Kyushu by Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

Four scenarios are included in this kit:

"Battle of Hetusigi-gawa" (1 turn)
"Siege of Iwaya castle" (short)
"Battles between Satsuma and Bungo" (short)
"Kanpaku goes west" (short but with a very large army coming from central Japan)



NB: "Chinzei Gunki" means "Record of the fight for Kyushu".
A "gunki" is a war story (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gunki_monogatari); Chinzei was an older name for Kyushu (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyushu).

name: Daddy Long Legs
description: Flick the colored spinner and pivot either leg of your Daddy Long Legs to the appropriate color. You may be able to move forward but you might have to move backwards! First player to reach the finish line wins!

name: Neutral Zone:  A Game of Interstellar Expansion
description:
From the Designer....
Neutral Zone is a game of interstellar expansion that can be played by 2 to 6 people. The setting of the game is a spherical volume of space and the 61 stars, including Sol, that occupy this volume. In the game of Neutral Zone, six galactic powers compete for control of this area of space, and seek to dominate all of the stars within it.
Neutral Zone is a game where 6 alien empires trade, fight, and negotiate over resources and real-estate. Six sets of plastic playing pieces representing Space and Planetary [Ground] Forces are used. Planets are randomly drawn and placed on each star. The planets determine what resources and events occur to all players.
categories: Civilization, Dice, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Carolus. Great Northern War
description:
Designer summary: Carolus. Great Northern War is a Card Driven game focusing on the events of the war between Sweden, led by young king Karl XII and coalition of her enemies: Russia (led by Pyotr, later known as Peter the Great) Saxony (led by Augustus der Starke - the Strong) and Denmark (led by Frederik IVth). The war has also spread to initially neutral Poland, which became a battleground for involved powers.

In history, the Coalition has lost three major battles in the first year of the war. But the war continued, even despite early Danish withdrawal and Saxon surrender, which followed six years later. Carolus, who was also able to put his own king on Polish throne in the meantime, faced his last active enemy - Russia. His failed attempt at taking Moscow became the pivotal event and a milestone in Northern European history.

Players will be able to recreate those events or find their own alternative strategies to win the Great Northern War themselves.

The game is currently in development, first bits will be hopefully shown at Essen Spiel 2010.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement

name: Spin Bingo
description: This Spin Bingo game is an all-in-one organized version of the classic that keeps things somewhat tidy. An 18-inch octagonal plastic tray cradles eight sets of numbered Bingo cards, while small wells beside each hold plastic chips for covering the numbers on the cards. In the center of the tray, a spinning roulette-style wheel catches a steel ball in a lettered, numbered space when it stops--telling players what numbers to cover in their race to get five in a row. For younger players who are just learning to read double-digit numbers, it's good reinforcement; but, it's also fun for adults who usually can't sit through a "kid's" game.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Discover Through Play with Chicky
description: This is a roll-and-move game published as an advertising premium for the KFC Chicky Club in Singapore. Players roll two dice and move their Chicky token forward that number of spaces, trying to be the first to reach the Finish (on space 100). Along the way players may land on special spaces and have to follow the instructions on the space - one of these sends the player to their room where they have to roll six before continuing. Landing on a player sends that player back to the start.

name: Pokemon Challenge
description:
From the box, "The electronic head-to-head spinning top game. Which Pokemon is stronger? With the Pokemon Challenge, the electronic head-to-head spinning top game, you can find out!

Choose two Pokemon characters from the included disks and insert one into each top. Use the electronic turbo-launch system to launch them into the battle arena. Each player has two sets od flippers to keep the action moving. The last top spinning is the winner!"

name: Tchibum na Lagoa
description:
Tchibum na Lagoa is a game publiched by Brazilian Cosmetic Company Natura to call in children to clean a garbage full pool and restore wild life to it.

It is a cooperative game to children from 4 years old. On each ones turn, the player rolls the dice and move their boats around the pond to collect recyclable trash, put the trash in recycling bins or restore wild live to the pond, which can only be done after the pond is clean. The players have 12 rounds to perform this task. The die rolling have a twist in which a player's results may be divided among two players, if the right side is up.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver
publishers: Grow Jogos e Brinquedos, Industria e Comercio de Cosméticos Natura LTDA

name: Snowball Arena
description:
Snowball Arena has been created during the Christmas Print And Play Game Design Contest 2010.

Snowball Arena is a tactical game, where two teams of up to 4 players each have to get the Christmas gifts into their home base.
Each round players select one card out of six to determine their possible actions this turn.
Combat is dice driven, however it is not the primary goal to get rid of the other players - since they will respawn anyway. The goal is to get the presents into the home base, before the other team gets them.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Oak Island
description:
Oak Island, Nova Scotia, 1900

In 1795, Daniel McGinnis found a 10-foot circular indentation in the ground, in the centre of a man-made clearing. A large branch (and some say the remains of a pulley) hung directly above the pit. He recruited friends and, armed with shovels, they began to dig. They found a solid floor of oak-logs every 10 feet for a considerable depth. Sea-water floodied the pit and prevented them from digging further. What still lies buried over 100 feet below the surface depends on who you ask: Captain Kidd’s treasure, Incan gold, Shakespeare’s lost manuscripts, the Holy Grail, or perhaps nothing at all.

Over the years more men brought their ingenuity to bear on the problem, but failed. The failures were due to lack of modern machinery and ignorance; each excavation being stopped by water and lack of funds. A new century brings new technology and every hope that the mystery of Oak Island will soon finally be put to rest.

Oak Island is a board game for 3-5 players attempting to get to the bottom of the mysterious treasure pit on Oak Island. The amateur treasure hunters bring their resources to bear on the problem of excavating the pit, and compete with each other to publish their findings and theories using an innovative scoring system.

Players take turns picking up a row or column of resource cards from the card display. Action cards set in the display are triggered when a player picks it up. Machinery cards in the display do not refresh until the next round. A round ends when a player picks up the Treasure Trove License card, triggering an excavation.

The Money Pit consists of consecutive tiles that are revealed as they are excavated jointly by the players. In order to excavate a tile, the symbols shown on it must be matched on resource cards invested secretly and simultaneously by the players. Each resource card has an abstract monetary value ($, $$, or $$$); the players are ranked in order of investment, with the one who invested least playing first in the next round. The player who invested most gets first pick of the assets (clues, machinery, and victory points) collected by the venture.

Another source of VPs are the theories a player can publish. A theory consists of two or more clues joined together. A complete theory is any size rectangle (2xY) while a partial theory is any other assembly of clue pieces. Publishing a theory during the game consists of a player revealing one or more new clue pieces to form a new theory, or revealing one ore more new clue pieces and reinterpreting the clues of the same colour in an existing public theory (theirs or another players) in order to form a new theory. Clues that don’t make it into the new theory cost the player points. The first clue played of any given colour are worth bonus points. Adjacent clues of the same colour within a theory are worth additional points. Complete theories earn a player 2 points per clue, excluding blank ones - incomplete ones earn a player 1 point per clue, including blank ones.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Great Floatini
description:
From the back of the box:

The magic game of floating fun!

Add rabbits to the floating figure to test Floatini's powers to their limit.

From the Introduction:
The Great Floatini is famed throughout the world for his amazing magical powers. Aided only by his son Teeny Floatini's small balloon, the Great Floatini is able to levitate his wife, Floatina, before your very eyes!

Once this amazing magical feat has been achieved it is your job to test the Great Floatini's powers to their limit by adding rabbit after rabbit to his wife's floating figure.

But be careful -- one rabbit too many and not even The Great Floatini can cope! The burden of one bunny too many will send the rabbits, Floatina and even Floatini's top hat crashing to the floor. A disastrous end to a fabulous performance, that will result in the player responsible losing the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Lingua Ludica
description:
Language learning games with various editions in different languages. Two or more teams are competing, but two individuals can also play. Teams with different language levels can compete, but within a team, the players should have roughly equal abilities,
The players roll and move, then a player from another team draws a card from a category depending on the field the active team landed on and the language level of the active team. Questions or tasks are read out, and the active team has to answer/perform them. If successful, they collect the card and continue, if not, their turn ends.
Categories include definitions (taboo-like), grammar, culture, expressions, vocabulary and role playing. The first team to collect a card from each category is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Great Empires
description:
In Great Empires you choose one of the great civilizations in history and pit your luck and skill against other greats to prove your mettle! Do you rush your enemy with basic infantry, or do you hold out for your elite troops and your commander? Does your god shine his blessing upon you, ensuring your victory, or do suffer crushing defeat?

Players roll dice, scoring Troops, Elites, and Commanders, while avoiding the dreaded Defeat dice, in an attempt to knock their opponents out of the game! The Blessing die adds another level of excitement, giving players a chance to bask in the blessing of their god, granting bonuses!

Get your opponents down to 0 points to win, but make sure to reinforce before you find yourself at 0 points!

name: Computer Basketball
description:
The game consisted of a plastic playing court with two long plastic arms underneath. Players would slide the arms left or right to pick offense or Defense strategy. A light at the intersection of the arms would illuminate a spot on the court giving a code. The code would determine the outcome of the play.

This game was liscensed by the NBA and had actual team logos on the box.

name: VITP variant: Story of the Eight-Eight fleet
description:
This is expansion kit for Victory in the Pacific based on Japanese fictional war novel "Story of the Eight-Eight fleet".

Predominance to the battleship of the aircraft isn't proved in this imaginary world. Because of that, the main force of the Pacific war is not an aircraft carrier but a battleship. It plays except for the added battleship, and a few rules as well as the original game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms Expansion Kit
description:
This is expanshion kit for Romance of the Three Kingdoms.
Add 80 leader units, army units, event cards, mini map, extend and optional rules.

name: AbraKIDdabra
description:
Overview:
AbraKIDdabra is a card game of crazy spells and rules that you play on each other. If you make three mistakes and get caught you are out of the game. Last person left is the winner.

Basic Play:
Each player has two parts to their turn:
Part 1: Draw a "Simon Says" card and answer the question or follow the directions.
Part 2: Draw a "AbraKIDdabra" card and give it to another player. That player must follow the directions on that card for the duration of the game.

Players caught not following the rules or "AbraKIDdabra" cards in front of them are marked for the mistake and must turn the appropriate card face-down. When a player gets 3 marks or face-down cards, he or she is out of the game.

Published by Play All Day Games (makers of Curses!)

(information from the rules card inside the game.)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Bamogo
description:
Abstract Two-Player Game. Each player tries to connect two sides. The 16 playing pieces have three colours, 5 of two colors and six for the third.

Players either put two stones with different colours on adjacent places on the board or switch the position of two adjacent stones.

A connection can be made with any colour. First one to make the connection wins.

name: The Arian Controversy
description:
The Arian Controversy: A Game of Heresy and Hilarity is a light strategy game for two players. Set in the early fourth century AD, one player takes on the role of Arius, attempting to gain support for his position that Jesus was not equal to God. The opposing player takes the role of Alexander, bishop of Alexandria, and attempts to convince the world that Jesus was equal to God. Players must move quickly around the board, spreading their message across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.

On their turn, players draw two cards, each of which has a certain number of action points. Using one card for action points, players move around the board and lay down support cubes. The other card is stored away, to be used at the Council of Nicaea.
Players debate at the Council of Nicaea with the cards that they've put away in order to gain further support for their position.
Once all cards are discarded, the player with the most support wins, and the opposing player is labeled a heretic.
The Arian Controversy: A Game of Heresy and Hilarity brings all of the tension and name-calling of early Christian controversy to the comfort of your living room!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Hossen
description: HOSSEN! is a tactical cardgame in which players each form a "Polonaise" (a dancing pair or group) using different party guests. Not all guest are compatible with each other and your Polonaise can be disrupted and extended in several ways. A winning Polonaise is always unique and because disrupting other players lines and cards is all in the game, the game requires some sharp wits. The last round always comes unexpected, making every play unique

name: I.Q. Games: Inventors and Inventions
description: User summary: Like the other games in the "I.Q. Games" series, this game consists of a deck of cards, each card listing an "answer" (in this case Inventors and Inventions). There are 35 cards, and each card has art depicting the inventor and their invention on the front. Players take turns guessing. The "reader" starts with the first of the 5 clues. Answering correctly on the first clue gets 5 points. Each subsequent clue is 1 point less. An educational trivia game that has game-play flexibility, allowing for normal play, solo play and team play.

name: Heimat-quiz
description:
Translation from box leaflet:

It is very simple. 100 important questions, 100 right answers. One asks the question, the other gives the answer. Who picks the right answer from four possible choices keeps the question card. Then the next player has his turn. The one with the most cards at the end has proven himself to be a true "Niederrheiner" [Lower Rhine resident].

name: Orado
description:
Abstract two-players-game on a leather-plan (which you can tighten to a little bag) and with semi-precious stones as counters.
Both players have 13 counters, 8 in one and 5 in another color. The board has 13 fields. During the game, the players "color" the fields with their stones, at the end every field has one of four possibilities of stone-combination.

To win, you want to create less equal color-combinations in adjacent fields than your opponent.

name: Raupenrallye
description:
In Raupenrallye, you want to be the first to get your seven caterpillars from one side of the apple to the other. On the apple game board are two lines of holes, with the lines crossing at the core and with each line having three holes on either side of the apple.

On a turn, you roll the four-sided die, and (if you don't roll a 4), you move one of your caterpillars that many spaces, either from the start area next to the game board or from wherever it is on the game board. If you land a caterpillar on the core, you move it immediately to the goal space off the game board. If you do roll a 4, roll the dice again; if you once again roll a 4, you must return one of your caterpillars on the board to the starting space; if you roll anything else, then you can move a caterpillar from the starting space to the core, then an additional 1-3 spaces depending on what you rolled.

If you manage to fill all three spaces on one half of a line with your pieces, you immediately move all three pieces to the goal.

name: Encounter
description: User summary: Each player is dealt five playing cards. A turn consists of playing a card, following the cards instructions and, if possible and desired, buying a space on the game board. Certain spaces on the game board are common areas. They are considered to be owned by everyone and occupied by no one. The object of the game is own a path of spaces connect any side of the board to one directly opposite.

name: Mad Monks
description:
In the Monastery of Bierbrau, the monks brew their famous ales which are sold all year round to keep the church coffers full. The monks are normally forbidden to drink their own beer, except on their ‘night of madness’ - Verrücktheitsnacht, where one special barrel is marked by the Abbot for consumption by the monks.

On this night all of the monks attempt to gain the barrel of beer from each other. They all claim not to want the beer for themselves, but merely to save their brothers from it. Once a monk reaches his cell, he may lock himself in and safely dispose of the beer. Whatever happens during the night of madness will never be spoken of ever again.

Players roll two dice to move themselves (one when carrying the barrel or being watched by the Abbot), plus an additional die to move the Abbot. The winner is the first monk who can carry the barrel into his cell after it has exited the cellar, brewery, kitchen and refectory. Monks can attempt to chastise and berate each other to help themselves gain the upper hand, or the Abbot can berate another monk on their behalf.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: T'was A Night of Pandemonium: A Christmas Murder
description:
From the publishers website:

A Santalicious Christmas Murder Mystery Party! A fun Christmas-spirited murder mystery party for 8-16+ guests ages 13 to 112! There is an expandable Elf character that can be expanded to as many optional characters as you need!

Mystery Synopsis: It was time for the annual pre-Christmas meeting at Mr. and Mrs. Santa Claus's home in the North Pole. This was the bustling time of the year when the Christmas workers needed to stop working for a moment and come together to discuss how Christmas was unraveling. The meeting attendees arrived as planned at Santa's home. They enjoyed appetizers and engaged in fun Christmas trivia questions while waiting for the meeting to begin. They had fun with an exciting game of 'What Christmas Thing am I' followed by a challenging game of Christmas Taboo. Mrs. Claus served a delicious dinner along with an entertaining Christmas Scramble challenge. The meeting was productive and the Christmas spirit was soaring high until to everyone's shock...a murder occurred! The Christmas characters all rallied together to figure out whodunit before this scandalous murder ruined Christmas! After everyone accused who they believed the murderer was...everyone came clean with their involvement in the crime and...the murderer confessed! While the group awaited the North Pole P.D. to arrive and arrest the accused, the group played a fun game of Christmas Charades. Overall, Christmas had its issues behind the scenes - but the nice boys and girls got their presents on Christmas morning according to plan.

home page: http://www.mymysteryparty.com/

name: Godzilla!
description:
Run back and forth gathering marbles while Godzilla spins around and tries to whack you with his tail! Watch out, if you get knocked over you have to run back home before you can stand up and gather more marbles. Gawo Wowo!

Up to four players each use a hand crank to move their character back and forth on a fixed track, while Godzilla spins in circles sweeping colored marbles around a circular track. Each player tries to grab his or her own color of marble and haul it back to home base. If knocked over by Godzilla's tail, the player looses any marble he is carrying, and has to crank his character back home to stand back up.

name: Elf Defense
description:
DESCRIPTION
It's Christmas time, but somehow, the spirit of warmth and goodwill has gone astray. The tree IS greener on the other side; and certainly, the presents look more expensive.

So... since your neighbours won't be giving all that lovely loot to you, you're just going to have to take it by stealth.

Recruit an army of elves.
Build up your defenses.
Steal your neighbour's presents before they steal yours!

Each player needs 1 deck of cards. There is no limit to the number of players.

GAME PLAY
Each player starts with 6 cards in front of them face-down, representing 6 presents under 6 branches of their Christmas tree. Each branch comes with a decoration card; these are defenses (e.g. Tinsel barbed wire, Fairy lights electric fence). During their turn, players may play elf cards to form squads, then send the squads of elves to attack their neighbour, attempting to steal their presents.

Elf Defense uses the mechanics of a Magic: the Gathering circle of death to allow any number of players to join in, without significant downtime.

GOAL
A player is eliminated when they have no presents remaining. When there is only one player left, the player who has captured the most presents is the winner.

ADDITIONAL INFO
Elf Defense is an entry for the Christmas print & play competition here: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/569801/christmas-print-and-p...

Source: designer.

name: New Imperialism
description: Territory Acquisition board game. Has New Imperialism theme describing the historical period between 1875 and 1914 when the European great powers as well as new powers such as Japan and the USA were forging far-flung empires in a race for new markets, raw materials, and national prestige. Players recruit and move their units on a world map. Conflict is handled by a quick random method. Victory points are earned by having the most units in Seas and Colonies. Each great power has its own unique abilities and starting set-ups. An Event deck and Empire Deck provide tons of Chrome.

name: Corporate B.S.
description:
"Sometimes success has nothing to do with skill." - Anonymous (as quoted on the front of the box)

The object of the game is to move up the corporate ladder to the penthouse suite and become the Chief Executive Officer of the company.

This game is essentially a roll-and-move race, with event cards and money and other twists to make it a bit more interesting. Instead of rolling the die to determine how far you move, the roll determines which deck of cards you draw from. The card determines your move, usually by giving you a choice. For example, here is a card from the "Personal Life" deck: "You suddenly get hit with two paternity suits. Collect (2) enemychips and move back (3) or pay $2500." Here's one from "Connections": "Your boss' spouse takes a liking to you at a company picnic. Move up (2) or collect $500 and two friendchips."

Most turns you'll have to make a decision as to how to best balance your forward progress with your money, friends, and enemies. Friend chips are awarded for various "friendly" events, and Enemy chips are earned for all the people you had to step on to raise yourself up. Friendchips can be turned into $250 each if you can't otherwise make loan payments, or they can be used to move up one extra space. Enemy chips can be bought off for $500, and you can't enter the CEO's office (and win the game) unless you have more friendchips than enemychips. You also must enter the CEO's office by exact count, so it helps to have friendchips to adjust you movement as needed.

In addition, certain squares landed on indicate that a card from the "Outside Influence" deck is drawn. These cards affect all players. These events may refer to the department indicated on the board spaces. The departments are "Sales," "Accounting," "Data Processing," "Manager," etc. A card from the Outside Influence deck is: "A new simulator increases the productivity of the Technical Department. All technical staff move up (3)."
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Chronicles of Zombie Town
description:
From the publishers website:

A fun zombie-themed murder mystery party for ages 15 and up, 8-16+ guests. Non-gender specific - play co-ed, all female or all male! Expandable to over 40 guests with the main game by adding additional guests to play with the 3 expandable characters.

MYSTERY SYNOPSIS:
Three weeks ago, the cheery town of Sunnyville was hit hard with a devastating plague that turned the living into horrifying undead zombies. Once the H5N1 zombie virus spread and the zombie population dominated the living within Sunnyville, the zombies staged a revolt and took over the government. The Center for Disease Control, hearing of this epidemic centered in Sunnyville, quarantined the town and the U.S. Government threatened to 'wipe out' the population of zombies to prevent further spreading of this viral nightmare. But the citizens of the newly-formed Zombie Town weren't the stereotypical aggressive zombies portrayed in movies, television and comic books. The citizens of Zombie Town were simply dead and decomposing but still the same as before - upstanding citizens! But with one gruesome exception: the virus gave them an intense craving for living human flesh! Because a mandatory vaccine against the H5N1 zombie virus was given to the human population outside of Zombie Town and the epidemic ceased to exist, human rights activists caught wind of the situation in Sunnyville (aka: Zombie Town) and formed the Save a Zombie Alliance. Millions banded together across the country and persuaded the United States government to sign an unprecedented peace treaty with the zombies. Ashes, the self acclaimed Emperor of Zombie Town, represented the zombies and outlined the truce with the U.S. President. The major clause in the treaty was that zombies would not cross the borders of Zombie Town unless on an approved journey by the U.S. President and they would never hunt living humans for food outside of their borders. Because there were extensive warning signs posted for miles surrounding Zombie Town's borders, there was an addendum in favor of the zombies that if a living human ended up inside the borders of Zombie Town, they were 'fair game' to be hunted, captured and on a zombie's dinner table. Ashes set forth the laws of Zombie Town and the treaty was to be signed by both Ashes and the U.S. President within 24 hours. The citizens were happy to be at peace with the United States Government. Thankfully, they discovered they could sustain themselves by eating pumpkins but pumpkins didn’t quite satisfy their appetite for living human flesh. Suppressing their cravings led to increasing irritability and with frustrations escalating in Zombie Town, Ashes knew s/he had to pump up the morale of the citizens. Leary of an impending civil unrest, s/he scheduled the Undead Festival which was a massive town-wide celebration with delicious pumpkin-inspired food, rockin' music and fun zombie games. And this is where the story begins...

name: Homicide On Halloween at the Chamber of Screams Haunted House
description:
An exciting Halloween Murder Mystery in a Haunted House setting for 8-16+ guests, ages 15+ (for challenge level). There are 4 expandable characters that can be played as teams - so this game can accommodate over 40+ guests! With the 5 character expansion pack, you can expand this game to over 75 guests! This game can be played as Co-Ed, all Female, or all male with one required female player.

The cast members of the Chamber of Screams Haunted House worked really hard this Halloween season scaring the people of the town. The management of the Chamber of Screams decided to reward the employees with a mini-Halloween celebration held during normal business hours in the employee break room. The Haunted House typically shut down each night for a brief time period so the employees could get a break and straighten up their haunted scenes. It was rumored that management probably did this so the line of customers outside would build up and The Chamber of Screams would look twice as popular. Regardless of the reason for the break, the employees looked forward to the upcoming treat during their next shift at work. The Halloween Celebration kicked off without a hitch as the frightening cast members piled into the employee break area and enjoyed delicious creepy appetizers and eerie drinks while quizzing each other on challenging spooky trivia. Unexpectedly, the lights went out and within a few minutes...to everyone's horror...a dead body was discovered!

The employees scrambled to figure out whodunit before the police arrived.

--from the publishers website

name: Pandemonium On Plymouth Rock
description:
From the publishers website:

A fun family Thanksgiving Day Murder Mystery Party for 7 to 10 guests, ages 13+. This is an extremely light-hearted and comical murder mystery for great family fun on Thanksgiving.

MYSTERY SYNOPSIS:
Hannah Standish sent the announcements for her annual Thanksgiving feast to the Pilgrims of Plymouth Village and the Native Americans of the Wompang tribe. The day of the feast arrived and the hungry guests flocked to the Standish home with their hands full of tasty dishes to be shared by all. The guests quizzed each other with fun trivia while nibbling on delectable appetizers. To everyone's surprise, representatives from a neighboring flock of wild turkeys also arrived on the scene to befriend the Pilgrims and Native Americans in hopes to stop the growing tradition of roasting a turkey on Thanksgiving Day. The turkey representatives gave it their best shot and pleaded with the humans to make a switch of the traditional Thanksgiving feast to cow, pig or maybe even fish as the main course. After the humans listened to the wild turkey’s pleas, they decided to give the turkeys 'temporary immunity' while they engaged in a fun game of 'What Thanksgiving Thing am I.' They continued with the challenging 'Football Mascot Challenge' before settling in for a nice Thanksgiving Dinner. But before they could dig into the Thanksgiving feast, a victim was discovered in the adjacent room! Murder on Thanksgiving?! Disastrous! The group rallied together to investigate whodunit before the murderer could get away! They took a quick break from the stress of the investigation and played some awesome games such as the 'Thanksgiving Scramble Challenge', 'Thanksgiving Bingo' and the hilarious 'So You Wanna Make a Turkey' challenge. Then, the guests one by one accused who they believed the murderer was and then to everyone's shock...the murderer confessed! The guests capped off the investigation with a hilarious game of 'Thanksgiving Charades' followed by a challenging 'Thanksgiving Word Hunt' game and then settled in for a delectable Thanksgiving feast! Overall it was most definitely a Thanksgiving that everyone will remember for years to come!

name: Jalgpall
description:
From the rules:
Game comes with a board (football field), ball, 2 paws (goalies) and a dice.
The one who rolls the highest amount, will start from his side of the field. You move on elected paths and may move direction with dice rolls. When you land on opponents field, he will take now over and start attacking your goal. Same happens when you kick the ball out side the field. Same rules apply to the corner kick as well.
When attacker reaches the big space in front of the goal, defense players now first rolls the dice. When he rolls even number, he catches the ball, unless attacked rolls the same number. Then it is GOAL. When defender rolls odd number, it is instant goal.
When attacker reached big space little further from the goal with number 4 on it, attacker needs to roll 4 or higher to score from that place. To defend a kick from that place defender needs to roll higher than attacker.
Goals can be blocked with correct goalie placement.
How long the game lasts is determined before the game starts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jäähoki
description:
From the rules:
Game comes with game board (ice rink), 2 pawns and a dice. The regular pawns has black lines across them, which shows the movement direction.
In this ice hockey game, penguins and bears are competing against each other.
Blue squares are for penguins , yellow for bears and white are neutral.
Before rolling a dice you need to decide your direction, but be careful, because you do not want to go against the boards (lose the ball) nor you want to end your movement on the opponents square.
In front of each goal there are two circles that cover each 4 squares. These are places you can hit a goal. From yellow, you lose the ball, if you are blue player. From blue you hit a goal if goalie is set on blue as well. From white both players roll the dice. Higher wins and ties go to the attacker.
It is possible to score from the center of the field.
The game length is determined before the game starts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Мы по улице идём
description:
From the rules:
Help Sascha move around the city safely. Move using correct traffic lights and laws.

Game is for 2-4 players and is played by drawing cards. Each card can go only one place at the time creating a pathway to your pawn. Get your pawn through the city first without getting hit by a car or violating any traffic related laws and win the game.

name: Kings' Duel
description:
Contents:
Instructions
Game board
4 sets of checkers (1 set each of red, blue, white, & black)
4 playing pieces with flags (1 each of red, blue, white, & black)
2 standard decks of playing cards

The game is played on a cross-shaped grid of five three-by-three blocks, with a 'king's space' at the terminal end of each branch. The players each start on a branch of the cross by laying out 6 checkers and one horsemen (these 7 pieces are their knights) in the squares of the grid of their branch and their king's space. A player's turn consists of (1)drawing a card, (2)dueling another player's knight (optional), (3)turning in any pairs of cards you may have for more knights, and (4) moving any one knight to either an adjacent space or any available green space on the board, one of which allows a player to draw an extra card on their turn.

When a player starts a duel with another player, they each select a card from their hand, and higher card wins (king is high). Ties are draws and both cards are discarded. Re-dueling is optional. The winner draws a card from the draw pile AND takes both cards used in the duel (placed in 'pair's pile'), and loser removes their knight from the board.

Certain spaces on the board have numbers on them which require the attacker to play a card of that value or higher, while the defender may play any card value. Jokers may be played at any time to steal a random card from an opponent's hand.

After dueling, if you have any pairs (from either your hand or your 'pair's pile' ) you may turn as many as you wish in for more knights which are then placed in any space adjacent to another of your own knights.

Your goal is to have your knights occupying all four king spaces on the board. You must always occupy at least one king space on the board, but not necessarily the one you started with. If a person loses a duel for their last king space, all of their knights are removed from the board, and their cards are given to the winner of the duel.

name: Penguin Pick-Up
description:
This set of oversized ( ) cards comes with instructions for several games:

Penguin Pick-Up: Players turn over the top card of their stack and the card with the most penguins wins the trick. Play continues until one player has captured all the cards.

Penguin Race: Each player is dealt 5 cards. The top card of the deck is turned over and players race to find a card in their hand that has the same number of penguins. The first player to get rid of all the cards in their hand wins.

Countin' Penguins: A player turns over a cards from the draw deck and counts the penguins. S/he continues turning over cards and adding penguins to the count until either a counting mistake is made or a Mother penguin card is turned up, at which point the player keeps all the cards turned up so far and play passes to the next player. The player with the most cards when the draw deck is exhausted wins.

No More Penguins!: Each player starts with 5 cards. The top card of the deck is turned face up and players take turns playing a card that matches either the number of penguins or the color of scarf on the face up card. Anyone unable to play from their hand draws cards until a match is found. The first person to play all their cards wins.

Penguin Memory: Cards are placed face down in a 4 x 10 matrix. The player turns over any 2 cards. If the cards make a run (e.g., 2 & 3 penguins or 4 & 5 penguins), another card may be turned over. The player continues to turn cards face up until one is found that does not continue the sequence. The player keeps the cards that formed the sequence and the next player takes his/her turn. The player with the most cards once all cards have been claimed is the winner.

{User Summary}
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Number

name: Perfect Picnic
description:
Throw the die and be the first to fill your rug with a complete set of picnic items.

Each player takes it in turn to throw the die. If you throw a six, you take a rug; if you throw any other number before getting your picnic rug you pass. Once you have your picnic rug, you take the other pieces as follows. When you throw:
One - a bottle of pop
Two - a sandwich
Three - a piece of cake
Four - an apple
Five - sausage roll
Six - pass

If you throw a number you do not need, for example, two, when you already have a sandwich, then you must pass. The first player to complete their rug and make the Perfect Picnic wins the game.

Similar to Jumbolino and Cootie

name: OPFOR Insurgency
description:
Publisher information

The world is full of perfect havens for insurgents. They hide in the jungles, mountains, and even the cities.OPFOR Insurgency is third in the companies "10 Minute War Game" series and includes the Jungle, Mountain, and City editions.

As the Blufor (US) you have intelligence units, air and artillery support, and your allies to help find and destroy a High Value Target (HVT) before it disappears.

As the OPFOR you have the advantage of restricted terrain, IEDs, ambushes, and engineering obstacles to delay or destroy units searching for you.

To play, the OPFOR places cards,including the HVT, facedown in a 5X5 pattern. The Blufor has 3 turns of 3 moves to uncover the hidden OPFOR cards, find and destroy the HVT with his units.

The game was designed by Steve Pearson, a member of the World Class OPFOR, Ft. Leavenworth, Kansas.

name: Zombie Tide: Road to Hope
description:
In Zombie Tide: Road to Hope, players must explore a ruined city, scavenging fuel, food, ammo, and equipment in an attempt to survive roaming zombie hordes and arrive safely at the Military Base where rescue awaits.

Cash in fuel chips to move, spend ammo to fend off zombies, and collect equipment to bolster your attacks and defenses.

Running out of food, ammo, or fuel could be disastrous, as infection sets in, leading to madness and eventual transformation into a zombie!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Inspecteur Lénigme
description:
Two teams compete to solve enigmas writen upon cards. The less clues you use, the more points you score. A magnifying glass serves to reveal the anwers as well as a scoring pad.

Contents:
- A book of rules
- A big magnifying glass
- 75 cards printed on both sides (for a total of 150 enigmas to solve)

name: Santa's Workshop Disaster
description:
After 3000 years of restless retirement, batty old elf Willy McWindup is suddenly called in to perform Head Elf duties amidst a wild case of snowball fever sending all of Santa's remaining Head Elves to bed rest. With mere days before Christmas Eve and piles of presents yet to construct, you must reign in old Willy's outrageous ideas and convince him to green light and produce your concepts to help save christmas.


Santa's Workshop Disaster is a quick family holiday themed card game for 2-6 Players, the more the merrier! It plays similar to Apples to Apples, using funny and disgusting combinations of IDEA and CONCEPT Cards, which together represent a finished present yet to be constructed. Taking turns playing the Head Elf, you draw an IDEA card and (reading aloud) present it on the table. Helper Elves (the remaining players) then choose a CONCEPT card that they feel best matches the IDEA card. Receiving the cards face down, the Head Elf then shuffles and (reading aloud) presents the CONCEPTS on the table. Using ANY criteria, the Head Elf then chooses which Combination of IDEA and CONCEPT to green light and send to production - thus scoring one point towards the win for the player whose CONCEPT was chosen. Roles then rotate around the table until there is a winner with the most CONCEPTS chosen (rules vary based on number of players).


Santa's Workshop Disaster is a Free Print and Play designed by Monster Make.108 Cards, all files provided in High Resolution, including Rules and Tuck Box.

Currently files can be found HERE.

It is a large file (240MB) consisting of 14 pages of 8.5x11 (Letter) Cards with 9 cards to a page. It also contains 1 page of 8.5x11 PocketMod layout Rules, and 2 pages of 8.5x14 (Legal) Tuckbox layouts.
The files will eventually be loaded into the Database, but for now can be found at the above link!

Included is alternate rules for 2 players with the addition of A,B,C cards and a version for young (3+ years) players.


Thanks, hope you enjoy!!
Stephen - Monster Make
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Skreemer
description:
Welcome to Skreemer, a game of future hovercar racing for 2 - 10 players.
The game is based on the popular Wipeout computer games, and has tight bends, speed-up’s and of course....missiles to slow down your opponents.

The simple rule set allows players hovercars to use a speedometer to accelerate round the track. Moving over speed-ups will propel you forward. Moving over weapon pods will equip your car with rockets to slow your opponents down. Hits are calculated on a very simple dice throw. The winner is the player to cross the chequered flag after the final lap.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Christmas Spirit
description:
It's that time of year! The air has gotten crisp and the elves are working overtime to ensure Santa's sleigh is ready to go on the big night! And boy have there been a lot of orders this year! From iPlods to Zebras (with Real Exploding Action), children's wish lists have gotten increasingly lengthy and complex!

This year, the big cheese himself has decided to bring in some migrant elves to help with demand. He even gave them their own factory floors and access to the common area! Needless to say, The pointy eared members of Christmas local #127 have become fearful of replacement if they fall behind on this year's manufacturing.

In Christmas spirit, players take control of one of the groups of elves competing to create toys for Santa's winter ride. The object of the game is to create more, better toys than the rival groups. The player with the most victory points in toy cards in Santa's sleigh at the end of the game is the winner and has a little job security for next year.

name: All Time 9
description:
All Time 9 is a baseball board game that includes 160 of some of the all time great players in baseball history.
The statistical accuracy of the game lets players play out games using these all time greats from every era, up to the modern age of baseball.

The mechanic that sets it apart is the initial rolling of dice by the player controlling the pitcher, with a follow-up dice roll by the batter, in response to what the pitcher did. This accurately recreates the pitcher/batter duel, as opposed to other baseball boardgames that resolves all action in a single dice roll, with no input from one or the other of the 2 players involved.

name: Disassemblin' Dice
description:
Disassemblin' Dice is a dice game for 2-4 players using the Nestortiles game system. In Disassemblin' Dice, players build dice using Nestortiles, roll those dice to score points, and then disassemble and re-assemble the dice in order to create more powerful dice. Rolling a higher score than the other players allows a player to push their opponents' dice markers towards the end of the disassembly track. Once a player is knocked off the track, their die is disassembled, and they are out of the game. The last player to have their die disassembled wins.

Each tile that a player uses to assemble their dice changes the score that any roll yields. Players must carefully remove and add different tiles to their dice in order to maximize their chances of scoring higher than their opponents. Careful manipulation of the six Nestortiles and a bit of luck result in victory!

name: Sink it
description:
Early variation of the battleship type game.

ships noted are BB CA and DD's

Each ship generates a different number of shots and when the ship is sunk the player reduces the number of shots he takes.

Ship locations are noted on the pad and each turns shots are noted by turn. This creates a record of the game played.

The game appears to be a promotional item of the Krueger Brewing comapany. They closed their doors in 1961.

owner description:

name: Discretion
description:
This game is from Volume Sprayer Mfg Co of Tulsa Oklahoma and was produced in 1942.

The game comes with money in 1,000, 500,100,and 50 dollar denominations, 36 yellow and green combination cards and 36 red and black combination cards. The game also has 2 Dudecahedron dice (12 sided)

All of the number combination cards are placed face down and each player draws a card and places it face up. The first player decides if he is rolling red or yellow. The dice are then rolled and anyone who has a card showing on the table with the combination that has been rolled wins. If no one wins then they all keep the first card and turn over another one. The player must always declare the color that he is rolling. The accumulated cards that you have increases the payoff if you have a winning card. (you hold 6 cards, 4 red and 2 yellow. The roller declares Red and rolls a 3 and a 9. One of your red cards has that 3 and 9 grouping so you win the value of the roll times 4 for the number of red cards that you have.

A time limit is suggested as to when the game ends.

name: SUWS/NSUWS
description:
SUWS/NSUWS is a simple introductory system which allows to simulate land and naval battles mainly during the pre-gunpowder era.

It is easy to understand and play and players must face the same problems of their historic counterparts, finding some battles very hard to win, and to lose, or very slow or fast, finding themselves in the same climax of the leaders which fought hundreds of years ago.

The game includes:

Two set of rules, basic, for easy introduction, and advanced, for a deeper game.

Two scenarios books including naval and land battles ranging from ancient Greek and Roman era to European medieval and to Japan civil war; covering battles never simulated before like Al-Qadisiyyah or Dan-No-Ura.

Each battle has its own map (of a standard size) and includes advanced and special rules if needed.

More than 1,000 front-back easy-to-understand counters including Leaders, infantry, cavalry, archers, ships and other units with unique symbols based on era and geographic area, European and eastern, of all forces involved.

Charts and table.

The game is open to suggestions, new ideas and scenarios, and a blank map and blank counter sheet is included to help in development.

Actually the game is in Italian tongue only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

name: E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?!
description:
E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?! is an economic-oriented game inspired to Role-Playing Games, what future awaits an old sorcerer, fighter, paladin etc. after their retirement?

How they invest their gold pieces and how they maintain their glory and fame?

In E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?! 3-6 players are ex-adventures whose, once retired, are trying to invest their gold, trying go to become more and more famous and to climb social hierarchy and now, becoming older, they need the services of young adventures.

To reach their targets now they must buy land, build manors, trying to attract people and build a little village, engage young adventurers to defend their proprieties, and defend themselves from any kind of bureaucracy, an hard work, the main challenge must still start…

The game includes:

Easy to understand Rules
Map of a city and surrounding area
Counters including gold, adventures, manors and more.
Charts and tables for easy play.
The game system is based on “Metropolis” (Editoy) game.


Actually the game is in Italian only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

Designer Gian Carlo Porciani
Artist Gian Carlo Porciani
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Dragon Flight
description:
Dragon Flight is a racing game for 2-4 players.

Using strategy and luck, players must race their dragons across a modular map, avoiding obstacles and attacks from their competitors.

On each turn players use hand cards to enable their dragon to fly at defined speeds and altitude across a modular hex map, containing obstacles of various heights, namely floating mountains.

Race your dragons through the rings, placed at various height weigh points and back home again, making best use of your cards and the available thermals (up-drafts and down-drafts) to gain and lose height. Attack your enemies with powerful flame attacks and force them to lose control.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Danguard
description: Two players game: one player will take control of Danguard, hero of the humanity who will have to stop the other player evil project to harm terrestrial bases with his terrible ufo robots. Danguard will win by destroying 3 ufo robots. Ufo robots will win by occupying and destroying 4 terrestrial bases
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Peanut Butter Party
description:
From the instructions: Peanut Butter Party is a fun, fast-paced game based on answering riddles. Follow the friendly animals from the Peanut Butter Pond series along a path filled with special places. Answer exciting riddles as your travel toward the pond.

User summary: Answer riddles correctly to draw "Peanut Butter Party" cards, which allow movement along the board, either one or two spaces, or to one of six designated "Special Places". Reach the end goal (pond) and answer a final riddle to win the game.

name: American Basketball
description:
Statistical replay game on basketball, featuring many different expansion sets. Basic game is very simple: each team is rated for points made, points allowed, rebounds and assists, plus it has a special value based on historical performance in the tournament (used to give a possible random variation to a few of his ratings). Opposing teams compare their value and a die is rolled for each team to determine the score. It is a fast replaying simulation, with a good bit of accuracy in the final result.

For the moment the following sets are available (directly from the designer, Roberto Chiavini or from Wargamer Vault): WNBA (all seasons) NBDL (all seasons), original ABA (all seasons), all the NBA from 1951 in single decades

name: Ramar of the Jungle, The New Jungle Game
description:
This is a spin and move game based on the television series Ramar, the White Witch Doctor. The object is to lead your Safari safely through the jungle until you find the hidden treasure of the Golden Goddess.

Players spin and the player with the highest number goes first. Each player in turn will spin and move their pawn along the jungle path.
