If you land on one of the various assists or penalties, perform the action described. Two or more players may occupy the same space, unless you collectively decide to place them the next spot behind that pawn. You must land on the final destination by an exact spin to reach the finish. The first player to reach the Golden Goddess is the winner.

Game for ages 7-10

name: Put-In-Bay-Opoly
description:
The classic Monopoly game. This theme: A game celebrating Island life!

Players roll and move along the board to collect the properties of the Lake Erie area, in the United States. When they have a complete collection of one color, players can build houses and even hotels. If another player lands on a property, the player who's owning it, can ask rent.

The object of the game is to let the other players go bankrupt.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Schäfchen ins Trockene
description:
The lush green grass of irish meadows and a homey shelter provide a pleasurable life for black sheep as well as white ones. A feast for the old lazy wolf. That's why you should keep an eye on your herd with help of the shepherd and his dog.

A strategic two player game about tending sheep. Each player moves sheep around the meadows and either into the shelter for twosomeness or off the board to score. A core mechanic is to keep an eye on blancing the size and composition of the flocks. The wolf will kill one of the sheep in the largest flock and you should make sure its not one of yours! You win by scoring enough points or reduce the opponents sheep so they can no longer mate.

As all the "Mini-Lederspiele" of Hiku-Spiele this game comes with several semi-precious stones in a leather pouch that when opened is the board of the game.

name: Le concert des animaux
description:
The cards all show a couple of different animal types. There are six different animals - donkey, frog, rooster, cat, cow and pig - on the cards and there are one, two or three of them on each card. The cards are dealt, in his turn the player turns the top card of his stack and places in front of him.

If somebody sees a series - i.e. one, two and three animals of same type on one card - it makes the noise of this animal and gets all the played cards. Player who calls 4 times first is the winner. Whomever calls wrong must give one card to other players as a penalty. Who has no cards left is eliminated.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Brewtown Brou-ha ha
description:
A bi-collaborative game where two teams of gamers group together to try to accomplish game objectives and stay alive for the duration of this game set in downtown Milwaukee, WI USA. The game will involve dice-based combat, but will have multiple paths to victory for both the monsters and the humans, both fighting for different things.

One group will consist of six monsters: a cow; a crayfish; an asian carp; a gorilla; a bluegill; and two deep-tunnel sewer rats. The other group will consist of humans, plus humans with functions like workmen, fire fighters, police, nat'l guard, and some super-humans like Lara Croft and ninjas might appear during gameplay.

The game is driven foremost by the HO scale minis used in the game, and the plastic monsters. The toy value is what this Über-Ameritrash game is about.There will be multiple rule sets developed. Really, this game started with the toys, and a desire to improve an old game or two, while thematically morphing it into a game which featured downtown Milwaukee, WI USA.

At this point it's a prototype. The game is a homage to The Creature That Ate Sheboygan, borrows from Heorscape and Monsters Menace America, requires some D&D features like THACO, and has lots of other options for tweaks and alt games.

The "ha ha" is deliberate in the name because of the twisted humor woven into the fabric of the game. The "bronze fonz" is on the map, and either side will get a bonus for either destroying it or simply rubbing it for good luck. Names for the creatures also have built-in humor:

Vince Gill: the bluegill who is also a Packer fan, but hates Milwaukeeans because of their fascination with the Friday Fish Fry. His desire is to crush restaurants which serve fish.

Son of Samson: the undead giant son of the most famous ex-resident of the Milwaukee Zoo, whose goal is to get to the top of the Firstar/U.S. Bank tower and fling poo.

Carpie Diem: an asian carp, who seized headlines recently as the no.1 environmental enemy to Lake Michigan. He can jump across city blocks and smash things under his weight. Very easily distracted by the Ladybug Club, thinking they are asian lady beetles.

Holey Cow: a sympathizer with O'Leary's Chicago firestarter, this copycow is a Cubs fan and happens to breathe methane gas fires from her four stomachs, and out her nostrils. She's also capable of making massive cowpies which block city streets.

'Hood Ratz: a pair of residents from our failed Deep Tunnel system, these rodents are skaven mad *wink* and capable of chewing through even the five foot thick walls of the Fed Bldg. They're also attracted to hip-hop music.

Rebecca the Boiling Crayfish: (no relation to our new Lt. Governor of WI) she's looking for her crawdaddy in one of the restaurants that serve her brethren. The humans are in hot water this time.

The game narrative is such that an event has taken place that, combined with the deep tunnel sewer failure, has caused six local creatures to grow in size and terrorize Brewtown.

The Federal Bldg. is within the now quarantined section of Brewtown, and the goals of the monsters are many, but they have to achieve them before they are killed or the feds are able to call in the antidote. Meanwhile, the humans are to stay alive and kill monsters,while protecting buildings from fires, repairing blocked roads, and achieving other goals along the way.

There are several groups of humans:

Firefighters: complete with a new ladder truck, these six individuals have axes and hoses in hand *wink* to face any challenge.

Police: one car (Milwaukee police are grossly underfunded) and a handful of officers help with attacks, rescue civilians, and keep the peace among the surviving humans.

National Guard: these weekend warriors with five tanks were setting up for maneuvers downtown, ending in at the Veterans Memorial nearby when this hit. They've not got much live ammo with them for this reason, but they have plenty of rubber bullets of all sizes-and they look scary as hell. The can fly in one helicopter from General Mitchell Airport in a couple of rounds, and it will have the firepower they need, but the rest of the military is on furlough.

Municipal Construction: several men on a job site with a huge dump truck, a CAT backhoe, and two CAT scoopshovels. They're tough enough to fight the monsters on their own with their equipment and they're experts at "catcalls".

Waste Management: one unmanned truck full of Milwaukee's finest refuse, abandoned.

Superhumans: activated at different times in the game when humans accomplish certain goals: a Lara Croft lookalike, with the guns to prove it; a ninja; two advanced swordplay students from the T'ai Chi Ch'uan center of Milwakee, and their leader Mike. Mike's wearing a Yoda costume he found at the Milwaukee Film office, and his mastery of push hands gives him the equivalent of the "force push". He hopes the creatures watched the trilogy, and fear him...

The two collaborative groups struggle until the game ends for a variety of reasons. There are several paths of victory for either team.
categories: Animals, Dice, Environmental, Fantasy, Horror, Humor, Miniatures, Transportation
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Ben 10: Alien Attack
description:
From the box:
It has been 5 years since Ben used Omnitrix. He once again uses the all powerful Omnitrix when he finds out that his grandfather Max is missing. New alien army does not make his life any easier.
Help Ben in his new adventure.

Content:
-game board
-4 pawns
-rules
-12 tiles

Game Play

Place each of the 12 tiles next to the game board. Each player then chooses one of the colors and places their pawn on the to the corresponding space on the board.
Youngest player begins.
When ever you stop on Ben 10 symbol, you gain one tile.

In game:
with 2 players each can get up to 6
with 3 players up to 4
with 4 players up to 3

When ever someone have the necessary amount of tiles, then all tile spaces are deactivated. Pawns cannot fight each other, but when they are on the same space, then the one who was there earlier give one tile to the player that just got there. If he has no tiles to give, he misses his turn

Special spaces

Alien X - Ben 10 can move faster by 3
Ben, Kevin and Gwen - miss 1 turn
Green circle - Ben has a date with Julia. Miss 2 turns.
Max - miss 3 turns.
Jetray - Ben can move faster by 4

Winning

First player to get needed amount of tiles and reaches finish is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Wailing Lighthouse Game
description:
Fifth title in the Famous Five Adventure Games book series. A "make your own adventure game" based on the Famous Five children's book, "Five Go to Demon's Rocks".

Players start at the first paragraph and roll the Famous Five die to select the first step on their adventure. In subsequent paragraphs, players receive instructions about how to proceed: they must make decisions about which way to go next, roll the die, or solve clues using the included playing cards (in the shape of various tools, such as a torch or a codebook). The more clues solved, the better chance of unraveling the final mystery. And running out of provisions (picnic cards) automatically ends the adventure!

From the back of the book:

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find a book and a selection of playing cards including a codebook, measure card, torch, map, and rucksack — and to refresh you in your adventure, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.

name: Wissens-Spektrum Nachfüll-Paket
description: This expansion contains 540 cards with 3200 new questions to the basic game.

name: La Maison de Pain d'Epice
description:
Hansel is too greedy and wants to eat all the cookies from the roof of the witch her house. But he has to be carefull because the witch who is disguised as a pigeon will prevent him.

The board looks like a house with on top 3 places to put a card. Shuffle the deck of cards and put three cards on these locations. Then you put a pigeon figure on the roof in one of the three slots above a card. There is also a Hansel figure, place this on the table.

At his turn a player may turn over a card from the deck. If the card doesn't match the card under the pigeon nothing happens and the player may take the card. The player can turn over as many cards as he wants. If he wants to stop he can take all the cards that he has turned over. But if he turns the same card that is under the pigeon then the player has to make the sound of a pigeon and take the pigeon figure from the roof to prevent the witch from coming down. At the same time each other player may try to take the hansel figure. The first person who does this gets the first card of the open pile, and all the cards go to a discard pile. So the player who turned the cards lost all his cards (except maybe one). The witch is then put in a slot on the roof again.

A player that took Hansel by mistake has to give in a card he won in a previous round.

When the drawing deck is empty the game stops. The player with the most cards wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: De Wereld Rond
description:
Subtitle of this old Dutch game: "Intellectueel en interessant gezelschapsspel voor jong en oud".
Up to 6 player try to voyage around the world as fast as possible. Each player follows a 'private' route and has to visit 20 different places. It is also possible that 'somtehing' happens during the trip...

name: This Is Your Life
description: Based on famous TV show from the 1950's starring Ralph Edwards. In it, famous people would be surprised by Edwards and would wind up on his show where people from that celebrities past would appear as special guests. The object of the game was to fill in as many of the areas of the celebrities past as possible including using the Charm Bracelet for friends and family. This game lets you figure out which famous person Edwards has chosen to honor during the game.

name: TRICK x 5
description: The players move their five pieces with numbers on them around the board trying to put at least three of them in line with a total of 5 or a multiple of 5. They then write down the sum as score points and continue playing until one player reaches 200.

name: Kosmojet
description:
The year is 5777. 3,000 years ago the scientists thought that the Sun was going to explode. Therefore the humanity had to leave Earth, looking for a hospitable planet. Four different empires were created and they forgot the solar system and the planet where the humanity evolved. Now, 3,000 years later, the scientists have discovered that the solar system still survives. Each of the four empires decide to conquer the cradle of humanity for itself... a space conflict is about to erupt!

Kosmojet is an educational game on the Solar System and for developing memory and dexterity skills. Each player represents one empire and must reconquer the Solar System planet by planet by means of a classical memory-style competition as well as some dexterity matches.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Educational, Memory, Science Fiction

name: Harlequin Checkers
description:
From Zillions of Games

"Pieces move diagonally but capture orthogonally. This is so as to combine the forced progression of diagonal checkers with the richness of the orthogonal game.

Object: Capture all your opponent's pieces ("Checkers" or "Kings") by jumping over them, or stalemate the opponent so he has no moves.

Checkers can move diagonally forward, by sliding to an adjacent empty square or by jumping either left, right, or forward over an enemy piece to a vacant square on the other side. Jumping over a piece captures it, but you may not jump diagonally. Capturing is mandatory, and you must keep jumping and capturing as long as it is possible, taking the maximum number of pieces.

The King is a long range piece and can slide diagonally in any direction or jump left, right, up or down over any opponent piece to any free square. When your Checker stops on the other end of the board, it becomes a King and can then also move backwards. If it merely visits a promotion square during a series capture moves, then it does not promote."

name: Wenchkins
description:
One or two player square and counter wargame by Sir Basil about a battle between Amazonian-like warrior women called Wenchkins. Each army of Wenchkins has its own Queen and Executioner. There is also a Monster that runs around indiscriminately devouring Wenckins.

From the rules:
". . .each Queen starts as a prisoner of the other side; the object of the game is to annihilate all enemy Wenchkins, torture the enemy Queen to death, and, if possible, rescue the friendly Queen before she is tortured to death by the enemy."

Players take turns maneuvering their Wenchkin forces and engaging in combat - while avoiding the Monster and Torturing their prisoner Queens. The Wenchkins are very aggressive and are compelled to engage anything they come into contact with.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Monkey Party
description:
From the back of the box:

Be as clever as a "monkey" and take on the challenge!

One after the other, each player takes a card. When two identical monkeys follow one another, be the fastest to touch stack of cards!
Be lively because the last player will have to collect all the played cards.
Be careful of the tricks and the tactics of your opponents...
This exiting game will create unforgettable moments in a fun-filled eviroment of laughter!
Agility and observation are the keys to winning the game. Monkey Party will really test your reflexes!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Double Trouble
description:
From the back of the box:

You're in Trouble!...No! You're in DOUBLE TROUBLE! In fact, you've got a whole handful of DOUBLE TROUBLE!--"Bad News!" cards, "Double Trouble" cards, and a bunch of other penalty cards - All against you!

Quick! Dump your Trouble cards - On The Double! - By playing two at a time. Then dump even more by PASSING them to your opponents. Be first to go out (and WIN!), sticking your opponents with DOUBLE TROUBLE if you can.

Player Summary:

Playing cards by number and color (similar to Uno), the player to get rid of all of their cards first wins the round. An extra effort must be made to hand off certain 'Trouble' cards to other players that will count against their score if they're not able to get rid of them. After a number of rounds, the first player to reach a pre-determined score wins the game.

The game comes with a special deck of 108 cards:
- 9 WILD cards
- Three suits of cards (red, green, yellow) each containing:
* 18 color cards
* two BAD NEWS cards
* two DOUBLE TROUBLE cards
* two PASS BASH! cards
* three PASS cards
* three PASS RIGHT cards
* three PASS LEFT cards

name: Heroes, Villains, and Vigilantes
description:
Heroes, Villains, and Vigilantes is the title of a superhero-themed board game where two players use the forces of good and evil to vie for control of the city. The game currently features:

20 characters cards (5 heroes, 5 villains, 5 vigilantes, and support characters - Police Lieutenant, Police Squad, Mobster, Gangsters, and Street Punks)
12 location cards
markers

Victory is achieved by controlling a majority of the locations in play. Each player takes control of either the Heroes or the Villains. There are also five independent vigilantes that can be persuaded to join either team over time. The Mob is an extra resource for the Villains that can be driven out of the picture by the Heroes, and the cops swing with City Hall. If City Hall falls under the sway of evil, corruption runs rampant, and the police will actively help the Villains. Clean up City Hall, and the police become the force for Good they're supposed to be.

The fate of The City is in your hands!










HVV is now available as a free PNP edition.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Wereldwijs Spel-Boek
description:
The "Wereldwijs Spel-Boek" (freely translated to "Worldwise Gamebook") is based on the 1988 Dutch television show "Wereldwijs".
It was available in stores, but also given to the participants of the television show.

The game consists of:
- the book containing more than 5000 questions and answers
- a gameboard
- 12 theme cards
- 6 Worldwise jigsaw puzzles
- 6 pawns
- 1 die

From the back of the gamebook:
This Gamebook Worldwise is the first exciting question and answer game that will lead you across the whole world. The gamebook contains more than 5000 questions divided in three age categories: from 8-11, 11-16 and 16 years and older. To put it short: a game for the complete family.
The more you know, the further you will get! With the gamebook Worldwise one can enlarge ones knowledge on the field of: voyages of discovery, expressive art, worldseas, nature, music, tourism, sports and many other subjects.
Casablanca - Anton Geesink - origami, H2O - barracudas - drift currents and Beaujolais. Fascinating names out of the challenging gamebook Worldwise that will put to the test everybodies knowledge to their limits.
Knowledge alone isn't enough, as luck an coincidence will change the favors on unexpected moments.
More than five thousand difficult yet educational questions in increasing difficulty levels are the obstacles that one will meet in the Gamebook Worldwise. You decide if you want to answer easy or difficult questions. A correct answer will provide you with one or more pieces of the Worldwise jigsaw puzzle. Herewith you will progress to your goal step by step.
Have you almost completed your Worldwise jigsaw puzzle? Do you already believe you are the worldwise winner? You'd better watch out! Because with the gamebook Worldwise the smartest can still loose!
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Atlantic City Jackpot Game
description:
Contents: 3 dice, with BAR, Bell, Lemon, Cherries, Orange, and Plum faces.

From the packaging: Each player contributes 10 chips to the pot before starting the game. The starting player pays one chip into the pot to roll the dice, and is rewarded from the pot according to the payoff as shown. At the end of the game, the remaining chips are divided equally amongst the players.

Distributed by Howard Sales Company, Margate, N.J.

name: Het Zuinig Rijden Bordspel
description:
Het Zuinig Rijden Bordspel - freely translated to "The Economical Driving Boardgame" - is made by Shell as a promotional game for "De Zuinig Rijden Beweging" ("The Economical Driving Movement").
This movement wishes to help drivers save 10 percent fuel by giving and sharing driving tips.

The game components:
- gameboard
- 4 cars (pawns)
- 2 dice
- gamerules

The game is based on the game Game of Goose. Though in this game the players drive their car and confront problems like an open bridge, driving with open windows or using the wrong fuel.
Favorables for example are switching on cruise control, or throwing double 5, which means you shifted to fifth gear correctly.
Winner is the player ending his or her move on field 63.

name: Das Kleine Einmaleins
description:
From the box:
New game from Noris Spiele to help youngsters learn math like never before.
This board game that comes with a cool CD teaches youngsters all kinds of math, from adding to dividing.
But this is not just another boring math game, but this time each players had a mission cards and each time the game is different. Scores can be multiplied if you are smart or divided by your opponent if not careful enough.
Win this game by fulfilling you mission cards first.

name: Vad säger djuren?
description:
From the box:
Game for small children to help them learn about animals and what sound they make.
Each player gets a board with 5 animals on it - sheep, cat, cow, dog and a pig. Each animal has a different colored background.

Then all wooden tiles are shuffled. Each tile has a picture of an animal on one side, a colored circle on the other side. All tiles are shuffled good and placed the colored circle upwards. Now starting with the youngest player, they turn around tiles. When player turns around a red circle and it has a cat on it (which has a blue background), he/she need to do red animals voice (cow) while doing the cat move (sitting straight and doing ears). If that player is successful, he may place that tile on his board, covering that picture (cat).

When player turn around a blue circle tile, with a blue picture (cat), he/she just need to make a sound.

The first player to get all 5 tiles is the winner.

name: Heimat- und Sachkunde
description:
From the box:
New board game for the children that comes with a great CD to make the experience even better. This game teaches all about your surroundings, about another kids and world. Each player chooses randomly a board and then his goal is to complete the puzzle. Each puzzle needs 6 correct pieces in correct category like dogs or traffic signs. CD teaches and put sounds to the game as well. Winner is the player who is able to complete 3 puzzles.

name: Gromadka Misia Uszatka
description:
A funny board game for 2 to 4 players.

Each player chooses the colour of his pawn and rolls a dice, then he moves his pawn. When he steps on the place with the blue circle, there’s something happening (good or bad, for example the player is missing his turn). On the red circles nothing happens. The winner of the game is the person who first will reach the place with the bears' house.

name: Vector Race
description:
Miniature game recreating a buoy race with flying/hovering vehicles (like the ones featured in Wip3out videogame, or Podracers from Star Wars Episode I). Vehicles can be equipped with weapons, and victory coul be achieved by being the fastest racer, or the last one still in game.

It was published on #3 of french magazine Ravage (February/March 2001).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Polaritease
description:
From the back of the box:
Polaritease is the unique vertical board game that has caught the attention of people around the world. By using the forces of magnetism, each player is presented with the opportunity to create a wide variety of game-winning strategies.

Polaritease comes complete with rules, a black and white set of positive and negative charged tokens, a triangular game board, and two stands for mounting in a vertical position.

From the rules:
The object of Polaritease is simple. If you remove your tokens from the board before your opponent, you win. This is done when each token is placed on the bottom row, advanced to the red holes and then removed.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Bedmaster
description: This is an adult themed game in which the goal is to use cards and directions in race to disrobe your "opponent." Each turn the two players are vying to control the title "Bedmaster," which gives them control of that round.

name: Azincourt
description:
Several versions of the battle have been produced. Each has been contrived to show a historic resolution, fun for the English player, depressing for the French. Azincourt (French spelling) is a unique approach. The French might have had more coordinated leadership. They might not have been so intent on an easy victory, and as a result been so careless. They might have taken advantage of the vulnerable English advance. They might have waited for the English to wear themselves out crossing the muddy field and allowed Henry to make the first attack. They might have employed their crossbows to better effect. Had they better control of their troops, crowded conditions would not have reduced combat effectiveness. Finally, had they considered avenues for retreating units, disruption of fresh units would not been such a problem.

In Azincourt I address a number of these what-ifs but, moreover, I offer players the unique mechanic of commanding one flank of each opposing army. In effect players play BOTH the French AND the British. It works out much better than you would expect. Since the English line is necessarily pretty static, there is little problem in coordinating an English defense while splitting command of the French in the face of the enemy mirrors the historically poor French command.

Azincourt is a card assisted, counter and hex game utilizing large colorful counters and a variety of aids that allows for a key battle component which other versions neglect to emphasize - the capture of nobles for ransom. Integral to Azincourt play is the capture of these nobles, English and French (including King Henry), of varying value. Ah and then there are the complications that such nobles bring. Wounded nobles become easy targets. Captured nobles make targets of their captors. Then there are Henry's terrible archers ... who WILL run out of arrows, and then what? To add to the game's variety is a random set-up and reinforcemnt schedule that toys with a number of possible historical possibilities.

Playtesting has been a blast so far but continues so no publisher has yet committed. Still, all in good time...
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Do You Know Where You Are?: World Challenge Edition
description: Geography Trivia game where players are given a latitude and a longitude and a short clue and must guess the location. Play to a set number of points or any given time length. Includes 3000 questions on 500 cards.

name: IN STAMPA!
description:
In an era of global communication’s transformation, which will be the strategy that will grant a greater number of readers?

Our editorial strategy will prefer to publish newspaper like the metropolitan one's, specialized or the more traditional newspaper?
Our News will be published?

In the game the players will play both as Journalist that as newbie Editor.

On one side they will demand some news, on the other they will need to write some of that or write their own.
Once obtained enough news they will be able to publish their own newspaper.
Both the publication of the news, than the writings of them will grant a grown of popularity of the readers. Who will be the most famous? Who will have more readers?

At their turn the player can make 1 or 2 different action after having draw two News Cards:

1) Draw another News Card
2) Play a News Card on the board, asking with this action the writings of a news.
3) Play N different News Cards so that the sum will reach or will be higher of the value of the News on the board, Writing with this action the required news. This action will grant a number of readers both to the Journalist that write the article, than to the Editor that put the card on the board. The News Card will be earned from the Editor
4) Play a Newspaper Card using the News Card obtained from the action 3. This action will grant a number of readers to the player that has done it.

The game ends when a player had played 3 Newspaper Cards or had obtained 12 News Cards

The player with the most readers is the winner.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management

name: Utazás a nagyihoz
description: It is all about getting to grandma's place. A traditional dice throwing board game with excitement caused by special fields. The players are moving on the board and come across different types of surprises, such as free ship trips or a broken car. The ultimate goal is to reach grandma's place before anyone else.

name: OPA`s grote avonturenspel
description:
This board game was made by a grandfather to play with his grandchildren. He publishes the game himself. The game is made to play with very young children. (Publisher & Designer = John Jacobs)

Every player starts with 250 Euro. In your turn you roll the die and move your player-piece. You perform the action, marked on the field. When you pass the start field, you can open the treasure chest and choose one of the treasures (stones). The first player who collects 10 treasures wins the game.

Some of the actions:
• Skip 1 turn (You make a trip to an island, Pirates, …)
• Pay money (For candy, the dentist, a train ticket,…)
• Receive money (For washing grandpa’s car, because of your birthday, …)
• Answer a question (The Easy question are very well suited for young kids)

The theme of the game is “going on adventure with Grandpa”

name: Q-Back Football Game
description: Detailed football simulation created and produced back in 1989 by an avid football fan. A two-player game, players make decisions about what plays to run on offense and defense like American Football. Like American Football, the winner is the player who successfully scores the most points via touchdowns and field-goals. The game comes with a special count-down timer to be used for the game clock and the play clock, and is used to help determine penalties or substitutions. Only a handful of copies of the game were created.

name: Short Rules
description: This is a rule book for miniature wargames in the Napoleonic period. The book contains the rules, tables and charts needed to recreate battles in the Napoleonic era. The book is written by Leon Tucker.

name: Manufacture
description:
Manufacture is an economic simulation game where players compete in variant aspects of the manufacturing process. Their decisions concern the production cost (setup, materials purchases, wages, rents), the sales (volume and value), the cash flow, the research of new products and optimization of current production, the financing of their actions, etc.

These tough economic decisions are being unfold over a factory layout where the positiong of the different modules is also important. The manufacturing process involves different stages of processing, routing and the efficient worker allocation.

There are 3 different types of goods (raw materials, intermediate goods and final goods) which are traded between the players and the outer world (in all directions) via contracts or a free market.

name: Word.Nut
description:
In a Nut Shell - This game is all about making WORDS.
It's fun to play and quick to learn.

Your objective is to make as many words as you can by using the ‘Nuts’ provided within a pre-set time deadline. (10 minutes, 30 minutes, or even days at a time - you decide.)

Play Word.Nut as a SOLO or MULTI player game. All players play AT THE SAME TIME.


Mix all the Nuts around inside the Word.Nut shell. Then open the zipper and leave open.
Each player or team takes a ‘lucky dip’ to gather a supply of 12 Nuts (no peeking).
Set your own stopwatch or timer to notify you after the agreed playing time.
Play. Make Words. Go nuts.
Play till time runs out or all of the Nuts are used up.
The winner is the person who achieves the highest score for the words they have made. The game rules show a clear scoring chart.


Invented in New Zealand by BERRY.

name: Sea Ranger
description:
Sea Ranger is a new type of game, where learning is entertaining and family fun. The world's oceans our are largest single resource. If they are abused, mis-managed or ignored; we on land will be worse off for our neglect of this wonderful planet.

Sea Ranger can teach or remind us all of our place in this world; how we use the oceans and waterways; the balance of life and our needs; raise our awareness of how mankind neglects or abuses these incredible places.

Within, on and around our oceans and rivers, hide a multitude of life, living in a state of balance, growing and evolving. Mankind is upsetting this balance to dangerous levels.

Learn, have fun with friends and family, share this knowledge and make a difference in this world.

What is Sea Ranger?

Sea Ranger is a board game designed to educate and entertain 2-6 players about the amazing and diverse wildlife that inhabits the oceans and waterways creating a giant circle of life. We can also learn how mankind uses and abuses this incredible resource we all share.

Sea Ranger is a multi-facetted game. Not only are the players learning about the aquatic environment, they are also learning about themselves. Players learn many qualities of character that are required to either win or prevent collective loss among the players. They share the responsibilities, successes and benefits.

Players learn:;

To share and care for resources.

Collective and individual responsibility.

Manage resources.

To maintain a balance of life and needs.

Value life in all forms as part of the wealth of this world.

Respect each players participation and support.

The best part is that it is fun doing this.

Who Can Play?

The game is aimed at children from 8 years and over and adults. Children will require guidance to assemble.

Children quickly master the rules.

So how does it all work?

The game gives players knowledge and choices. Players can easily discern what feels right or is the right thing to do. We all know within our hearts what is right and good, even if we don't know the answer.

The game uses a special board and tokens. You print out the board and pieces on your colour printer, then cut and assemble the components. To make them last longer or be more durable you may mount them on card or laminate the pieces. Teach the children skills as they read instructions and learn to cut out the pieces.

The game is directed by a special card deck which will present players with a series of events and choices. The players must decide how they will resolve these, sometimes this may require teamwork and sharing. There are many different strategies you can use to win, some can be very quick, others slower.

Part of the game revolves around maintaining the circle of life, ensuring a balance of species to enable life to continue. Each creature is part of that circle and has a unique role to play.

Players must then try and balance mankind's intervention and damage to the seas and waterways. It is a careful juggling act; players individually cannot hope to keep the balance so you need to play cooperatively.

What Do I Get?

Sea Ranger is 26-page colour PDF plus a small rules booklet. The game requires you to print 16-pages to create the board, cards & tokens. Included is the deluxe card set giving you the choice of finish. Where possible we have tried to minimise the graphical content to save ink. Ideally the major components are printed on card. Some simple assembly is required.

(Edutainment Games, www.edutainment-games.com)
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Mature / Adult, Print & Play

name: The Gauntlet
description:
In the dark depths of a drifting space wreck, a small team of specialists investigates unusual scanner readings of life on board. The team acts relaxed; banter hides their anxiety. Motion scanners show nothing; torches illuminate the dank corridor casting long shadows.

Suddenly the point man's scanner shows movement ahead, increasing in speed. His reflexes are conditioned by experience, so he shoulders the carbine. The torch illuminates a horrific shape. Recognising danger the point man fires the carbine in a rapid series of bursts.

An alien screeches of pain and the creature falls to the ground. You have just made first contact.

More motion scanners come to life, movement all around you starts closing in through the maze of ship's corridors. This is more than five men can handle. It is time to withdraw back to the assault shuttle.

What is The Gauntlet?

The Gauntlet is a print 'n play board game for 1-6 players. Designed as an entertaining tactical-action and strategy game, the game is based around teaching leadership concepts and team work.

Players are tasked with a simple mission, get the team to safety. Players choose their leaders and role within the team, each team character has unique skills or abilities which can be used to advantage by the team and individual. The teams leader guides the play of the game, allowing the individuals to create team work to support each other.

The play is fast and furious, players quickly mastering the simple mechanics designed to focus the players on making decisions than working out how to play. Within minutes players will be talking, making decisions and blasting aliens.

The game is over in 35 turns or 45 minutes, whichever comes first.

The Gauntlet is even suitable for solo play.

What do I get?

The game is available in a downloadable PDF format. You have the choice as to how the game will be printed and presented to fit your needs. The game includes;

+ a complete full colour board detailing a section of the space ship.

+ stand-up counters for the humans and aliens.

+ 3d components (containers, boxes and rubble).

+ optional 3d components to create the walls and structure of the space ship.

+ a complete rules guide with examples of play.

+ a guide to assembly.

Not included are six (6) regular six-sided dice (the game can be played with less, six being the ideal).

The game may be produced with the minimal components or with option 3d componentry that creates an incredible game board that gives the game an incredible look and feel.

You can print the game on your own colour printer or have it proffessionally printed by a 3rd party printing service. A heavy card stock of around 200gsm is reccommended. The board could be printed on full page label stock. In either case they can be mounted on very heavy cardboard, wood sheets or even foam boards.

Assembly is quick and easy.

(Edutainment Games, www.edutainment-games.com)
categories: Educational, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Memo Fantasy
description:
This is a memory-game for the very young. 10 stars cover 5 picture pairs in the sky. The first player picks up two stars and if the pictures underneath are the same the stars are kept. If not, the stars go back into the sky. Then the second player picks up two stars, etc. Who will collect the most stars? To play a NEW game there is the possibility to change the picture-plates underneath, fitting the colors, around the holes in the corners, to the same colors of the pegs. There are two plates, printed on both sides, that give four different possibilities. To add even more playing possibilities, there are 5 papers included for drawing, or gluing pictures or photos.
To practice before playing memo, you can start with a simple game, where you look for each pair. One picture is covered with a star, who will find the same picture?

name: Kanhasshu Kosenroku
description:
This is self-published expansion kit for 関東制圧 (Kanto Seiatsu).
"Kanhasshu Kosenroku" means "Record of Ancient Battles in 8 States of Kanto Region".

Covering battles of Hojo clan before and after period of 関東制圧 (Kanto Seiatsu).
Six scenarios are included in this kit.

Also need to play Standard rule (Late version), Reference card and Map #2 from 関東制圧 (Kanto Seiatsu).

name: Jihad !
description:
Jihad is a variant kit based on "Belisarius" published on S&T 224.
Original game, "Belisarius" was published in the Decision Games Strategy & Tactics magazine #210.

"Jihad !" is a wargame simulating the early expansion of Islam in the period of the Caliphs Omar and Othman (634-656 AD) when is 100 years after the parent game.

"Jihad !" is a two player game. The Caliphate player controls the forces of the Islam. The Kingdom player controls various non-caliphate kingdoms. Each player’s forces are represented by military units and Stratagem markers. Players must use a combination of military strength and cunning strategy to maintain and increase their power.

The rules are based on the Charlemagne (S&T #189) and Xenophon (S&T #203) games. And this system was later used in Khan (S&T #229).

name: Good: the Battle
description:
"It's War!! ...but in a nice way."

Good: the Battle is a miniatures based combat skirmish game, in which you take the role of a character or characters and attempt to defeat your opponents by doing good and inflicting bad upon them. The core game, designed by us at Project Good is the game of Good: the Battle. The uniqueness of Good: The Battle is it's ability to use any genre, any miniatures, anywhere, anything else...? Yes there is, but it's all Good...

Unlike the heavily stat-based games that you see everywhere nowadays, Good: the battle turns these statistics into two basic attributes; Good and bad. Obviously the better you are at things (shooting, close combat, healing, etc.) the longer you will survive in this world, but everyone has a limit of how much Good they can do. Nasty things like damage, curses, etc can only be described as Bad things, but sometimes a bit of bad is exactly what is needed.

There are thousands, probably hundreds of thousands, of character miniature manufacturers out there; and every single one of these can be used in Good: the Battle - regardless of scale, setting, period, race, etc. Good: the Battle uses the actual miniature to give you benefits in the game. For example; a miniature equipped with swords will be better in close combat, than somebody with none. A miniature carrying a rocket launcher will obviously do more damage if it shoots you in the head. Huge dragons will have more hit points, and mice will have less. But this doesn't mean a one-armed dwarf mute who's only weapon is a bag full of dead hamsters won't be able to put up a fight...
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mystery Gun
description:
This game features a circular metal lithographed playing board, which is very similar to a metal tray. The board has a "gun" at the bottom which shoots metal balls at metal airplanes which are placed at the 4 predetermined positions near the top half of the board. A pullstring is wrapped around the spinner and then it is pulled like a top. The metal balls are then loaded into the left side of the "gun" and the spinning mechanism "fires" the balls out the other side of the gun in rapid fire. The metal airplanes have a ball-bearing on the underside of the planes that allows them to rest in the holes near the top of the board. When a fired shot hits the airplane it is dislodged from its position and it falls toward the bottom of the playing area, thus crashing into the ground. The player then scores points based on which airplanes are shot down. Each player gets a set number of "shots" and the player with the most points after all players have taken their shots wins the game.
This game is made by McDowell Mfg. and was manufactured around the 1930's.

name: Stir 'em Up! The Flipping & Switching Word Game
description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is no ordinary crossword game...it's unpredictable, it's fast-paced, it's Stir 'em Up! Scoop the letters out of the bowl, but don't get attached - the die may force you to flip them or switch them. And once it's time for everyone to make their own crosswords, don't dawdle - you've got 30 seconds to use more letters than everyone else!

User Summary

Once everyone has their letters, roll the die to stir things up! If the die shows a color, everyone must flip over those color tiles they have. If it lands on "right," they take two tiles from the person to their right. If it lands on "left," they pass two tiles to the person to their left. Now ask them to
try to form a word with the tiles. The word must have at least three letters (no
one- or two-letter words). The person to announce a word gets the points for that word. Continue playing until all tiles have been used or you run out of room on the board.

name: Gulf War
description:
Excerpt from page 3 of the rules: Gulf War involves the use of military maneuvers and the careful use and selection of weapons, in order to achieve sea, ground and air supremacy. Gulf War is made up of two teams, regardless of the number of players.

Excerpt from page 1 of the rules:
Long Version (Game One): The object of game 1 is to completely destroy and eliminate your enemy from the game board by using your various weapons.
Short Version (Game Two): The object of game 2 is to maneuver your flag on the game board, as well as protect it by using your various weapons. In addition, weapons must eliminate your opponent's flag to achieve victory.

From the front of the box:
Dedicated to all those who helped liberate Kuwait!

name: Texel Info Toerspel
description:
"An informative route game around the island of Texel"

This is a roll-and-move game published to promote tourism on the Dutch island of Texel. The players throw the die to move their pawn across 87 spaces on a map of the island; the first player to reach the finish, wins.

name: Fun and Gnan: 2 in 1 Game Pack
description:
This is a game from India published for the purpose of educating children in the teachings of the guru Gnani Purush Shri Ambalal Muljibhai Patel, also known as Dada Bhagwan. It consists of two separate boardgames: "Dada's World", which teaches about how to behave apropriately in given situations and answer questions about the guru's teachings; and "Guess, Who Am I?", which focuses on identifying role models.

Game 1 (Dada's World) - Players roll a die and move along a track which represents their journey through Dada's World, collecting rectangular plastic "coins" with a variety of point values.
Landing on marked spaces along the track can either add points (Helped Poor Person: 100), subtract points (Killed a cockroach: -150), provide the opportunity to answer questions about Dada's teachings to earn points (Dadai Dhamaka), lose turns, take extra turns, go back to Home, and other similar effects. At certain points on the track, players have the opportunity to pay points to take a shorter route.
The winner is the first player to make a complete circuit of the track and return to the start space with 1500 points or more. Players who complete the track with fewer than 1500 points must go back to an earlier square and try to accumulate more points.

Game 2 (Guess, Who Am I?) - Players roll a die and move along a track collecting pieces of three separate puzzles. Most of the spaces on the board are marked with a statement associated with one of the three "role models" - Parents, Dadashri and Humanity. When landing on a space on the board, players must identify which role model is associated with the statement on that space (example: Space #17 "We should bow down to them every day" is associated with Parents). Correctly identifying the role model allows the player to take the puzzle piece associated with that space.
Other spaces give the player a free random puzzle piece, allow the player to take a piece from another player, or cause the player to lose a turn. Players who reach the end of the track without winning the game move back to Start and continue to collect puzzle pieces.
To win, a player must collect all 12 pieces of one of the three puzzles. He may then assemble the puzzle to see a picture representing one of the role models, then flip the pieces over to reveal a message.

From the rule booklet:

Hello kids!!!

Time to enter DADA'S WORLD filled with excitement, fun & learn.....

This 2-in-1 Game Pack offer dual knowledge and fun, Get the tracks right from 'Home' to 'Simandhar City' and back 'Home' in Game 1. If you follow the rule you are IN, if you refrain then you commit a SIN.

Also recognize the ROLE MODELS of your life by learning their virtues and identifying them in Game 2. Abount Parents, Dadashri and humanity is what we get to learn.

Wow! So much to do, so much to learn, so little time we want more fun, then grab on this Game Pack 2-in-1.

name: Lawyer, the Game
description:
From the rulesheet:

"The object of Lawyer, the Game is to be the Player with the most money at the end of the game. You make money when you land on teal squares and you lose money when you land on fuchsia squares. Suing and being sued are another way to make or lose money. And at the end of the game, merchandise that you purchased along the way to The Good Life is figured into your final assets at a value 2 to 3 times greater than its original purchase price."

A simple roll-and-move game with a spiraling track, and spaces where you can pick up event type cards and buy merchandise. Has event spaces that allow you to "Sue your Neighbor", at which time the player may choose to "sue" any other player, for whatever made-up reason they choose. Lawsuits are settled by die rolls.

Game also comes with several dime store type toys that represent merchandise.

Game is subtitled "The hilarious game of negotiation and frivolous lawsuits".

name: Chocolade Bordspel
description:
The board has 22 square spaces in two colors. Each player places chocolates on the spaces in his/her color. They can use the chocolates of 'Sinterklaas' and 'Zwarte Piet' together.
every turn a player moves a chocolate to an empty space. When you jump over another chocolate, the chocolate is removed from the board. It's allowed to jump over chocolates on the spaces of your own color.
The first player who has no chocolates left, wins the game.

name: Potions Festival
description:
Wizards and sorcerers from all around the world get together in a contest of potions. They open the old Grimoires and start selecting potions and ingredients. The rules are strict and only the best will prevail.

Potions Festival is card game were the players collect ingredients to make potions. The ingredients are at the center of table and the potions are hidden. The ingredient cards are placed or moved to match the sequence of the potion.. They must lie in single path. You can choose any needed ingredients as long as
they are connected in a single path. You cannot backtrack at the
path or pass twice by a card.

There are four kinds of ingredients and three types of magic. At the end of the game additional points are earned by who have most from each type of magic and also for those who collected all three types.

Includes:

•Red Deck (33 cards)
•Blue Deck (40 cards)
•Game Rules Document

name: Duplo
description:
This game is played on a 8x8 square board.
Setup:Initially,each player drops two friendly stones on empty cells.
On each turn,each player expands a connected line of one or more friendly stones.
A line of stones expands by doubling its size in one of the two directions it is defined.
When the board is full,wins the player with more friendly stones.

name: Tin Star
description:
This is a set of tactical rules for gun-fights and shoot-outs in the setting of the American Wild West. The gun-fights take place as a table top miniature game which uses 25mm scale miniatures. The rules cover everything that is needed to play including character design and stats, scenario creation and even rules for campaign games. There are floor plans included in the rule book, or the game master can create their own.

The battles can take place outdoors for example in the middle of a western town, or even indoors, such as in saloons, banks, etc. Once each player has his character or gang of characters, then each player takes turns moving and firing at each other until there is one player (or team) remaining.

name: Laste mälumängudoomino
description:
Laste mälumängudoomino is a junior version of Mälumängudoomino

Game mechanics are the same: trivia game with domino pieces. The tiles have two categories marked on them, out of total ten. The tile placement follows normal domino rules, but each time you are placing a tile, you have to answer a question on the topic marked on the tile in question. The categories in the game are: history, people, nature, geography, computers & technology, entertainment, sports, Estonia, culture and various other information.

The game includes:
100 question cards with 1000 questions
55 domino tiles
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Rechenakrobat
description:
Rechenakrobat (Calculation Acrobat)

Rechenakrobat is game consisting out of five dice only. It is a mathematical game in which the player tries to make a correct calculation with the thrown values of the dice.

With the eyes of the 5 coloured dice the number thrown with the 2 black dice should be calculated through addition, subtraction, multiplication or division.

"Lebst Du nur, oder spielst Du schon?" / "Still living, or already playing"?

name: Nutimäng
description:
From the publisher:
Nutimäng is made for 4-5 year old children. It is a simple story telling game, in which adults can aim their kids if needed.Each time you give your kid and question or task, let them finish it and then check the other side of the card if they got it. First child to collect 5 correct tasks/questions is the winner.

The game is put together from national children educational standards.

name: Roheline Tuli
description:
From the publisher:
We all take part in traffic and knowing it is not just for drivers. This educational card game teaches about traffic and it contains 40 cards: 36 traffic sign, 3 traffic lights and 1 rule card. It can be used to teach about traffic signs, but it also is a party game for kids as well. The game is simple, you just need get rid of your cards by finding companion traffic sign. Sound easy enough, so now lets start teaching the youngsters...

name: Collector
description:
Collector is played on a 6x6 square board.
On each turn,a player must drop a friendly stone and a neutral stone,both on adjacent empty cells.
When all cells are occupied,wins the player with the largest group.
Collector is presented at 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris.

name: Ambivalence
description:
Ambivalence is played on a 6x6 square board. On each turn, each player drops a friendly stone on an empty cell.

In the following cases, stones are transformed into neutral stones:

Custodian: An enemy stone becomes neutral when placed between two friendly stones.
Intrusion: Two enemy stones becomes neutral when a friendly stone is dropped between them.


When the board is full, the player with more friendly stones wins.

Ambivalence is listed as Ambivalente in 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris.

name: Dinner Party
description: Players randomly and secretly pick a character from a pool of 10. Each player/character will host a dinner party consisting on a starter, a main dish, a dessert, drinks and entertainment all of them represented by cards with various choices of food, drink and entertainment. At the end of the game, each player will receive points from the rest depending on the various and particular tastes of their characters.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Grid Snakes
description:
Grid Snakes is a quick-playing game with some real-world dexterity elements for two, four, or six players (with variant rules for three, five, and seven to twelve players). You’re a digital snake, trapped in an arena with several other snakes. As you move, you leave body segments behind you. Your goal is to eliminate your opponents by forcing your opponents to crash into the edge of the board or and section of any other player.

Play is simultaneous (so there's no down time) and proceeds through the following phases: plan, challenge, resolve. During planning, you have a just a handful seconds to pick a direction and a speed for your snake. When all instructions are revealed, any player may spend a token to challenge another player. If you're challenged, you have to flick a token onto a chart; where it lands dictates your speed for the turn. During resolution, you move the snakes, add body segments, and check for collisions.

Grid Snakes uses a large and a small custom board, several small custom decks of cards (eight cards each), some nickels or quarters, and a lot of colored glass beads (or other small tokens). The rules and cards are available at: http://www.invisible-city.com/file_download/165/

Grid Snakes has fairly simple rules, but requires quick decision making and planning. Grid Snakes is appropriate for ages 12 and up. If you eliminate the timer, you could probably play this game with slightly younger children. If you allow multiple attempts on reflex challenges, you could go even younger. A four-player game takes 30 minutes or fewer to play. A six-player game takes 40 minutes or fewer.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Print & Play, Racing, Video Game Theme

name: Chairman of the Board
description:
Object: Become Chairman of the Board, the winner must have a minimum of 51% of the stock of his company and a minimum score of $255,000. The highest score wins.

Players take turns picking up a Situation card, adding or subtracting value to the score sheet and/or move along the gameboard. Some cards allow you to choose between increasing/decreasing your net worth or moving your playing piece forwards/backwards while other cards will have you to both.

The are other squares on the gameboard which involve Conflict/Advantage cards and Corporate Investment cards. Conflict/Advantage cards are played when picked up. These cards are similar to the Situation cards but some are Advantage cards which can cause other people to lose a percent of their income, move backwards and other 'take-that' actions.

Corporate Investment cards are kept face down and typically add to your wealth but amounts vary. They are added in towards the end of the game.

Contents include game board, score sheet, 4 player pawns, 72 situation cards, 35 conflict/advantage cards, 30 corporate cards, and insert with the instructions on them

name: Identik "Pizza Hut"- mini-expansion
description:
Mini-expansion included in Pizza Hut's "Helaba!"-magazine no 43. (magazine edited in Belgium for Pizza Hut)
This mini-expansion has 2 new cards for the game "Identik":
The dutch cards are:
- Sliertenbezweerder (stringscharmer)
- Dolle koeien (mad cows)
- Tussendoortje (snack)
- De beste vriend van de hond (a dog's best friend)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: The Inn Game
description:
The object of this business game is to become the wealthiest player through buying and operating hotel properties. This unique title was published by the Holiday Inn corporation... the good hotels have the Holiday Inn logo but the bad inns are called The Heartbreak Hotel!

Players move around a board similar to Monopoly by rolling dice and then use a spinner to determine if the hotel will be a good Holiday Inn or a stinker. Players can upgrade a hotel by adding recreational facilities or a convention center.

The board includes cities in the USA, Asia, and Europe. The players buy and sell hotels while paying rent on an opponent's property. The last player with any cash is declared the winner.

Includes a colorful board, tokens, spinner, rules, play money, dice, hotel logo markers, and property cards.

name: Jolly Robbers, A Shooting Game
description: JOLLY ROBBERS: A SHOOTING GAME from Wilder Manufacturing ca. 1920. The game comes with illustrated pictures that can be erected to form a village with a wall. 5 Gnomes are set up on the wall and the object of the game is to shoot them off with a pop-gun. Each target hit scores points.

name: Panama Canal Game
description: This is a simple roll and move game which shows the commercial routes through the Canal. First to get through the canal and get back after delivering their cargo wins the game. (from the Parker Brothers Catalog for 1920)

name: Kiel: A Naval Battle Game
description: This game shows attacks on German forts by American, British and French vessels in World War 1. The game comes with shells for the guns and tracking lines for the shots taken by both the vessels firing at and the forts returning fire. Rolls of the dice determined hits or misses.

name: Casino Dice
description:
"The Pocket Casino"

The greatest gambling game of the century, brings Monte Carlo into your own home.

The game includes (Pocket edition):
one cloth (in pocket Case)
two dice
100 counters
rules.

Casino dice the latest Gambling Game of the Century is similar, to a certain extenr, to Roulette.
It is played with two Dice and the odds, payable by the Baker, ranges from "even money" to 12 to 1 according to whether single numbers, doubles, sequences, or totals are backed.
There are 29 seperate bets on the cloth, and all odds are clearly shown.

The folding "Pocket Edition" Size 6 inches by 3 3/4 inches, opening out to 17 inches by 11 inches. Complete with two dice.

The "De Luxe" Club Outfit, on Rexine Leather Cloth, Size 50" x 24" with Dice Cup, Dice, Rules and Counters.

- summary from game box, rules and game flyer

name: Halos' n Horns
description: This roll and move game was designed to help teach children the positive and negative consequences to their actions. Based on their decisions in 'real-life' situations they could earn Halos be doing the morally correct thing, or earn Horns by choosing the morally incorrect thing to do in a given situation.

name: Garanimals Paw Prints
description:
This game is part of the Paw Prints Floor Games series.

Paw tiles are placed on the ground, and several games are played as children need to step on the `paw prints' in animal fashion. In the game "Let's Switch", you need to pick an animal print and act like that animal until you draw a card with a different animal. In the game "Time to Go Home", you need to follow directions to bring the animals home.

As the the inventor, I have found through dozens of classroom studies that children love to carry this game with them everywhere they go. That is why I designed the tote box to make them easier to carry with them.

There are no limits to this game, you can make up any game you like, like :hide and go feet" and countless others.... just let your children come up with their own!

name: BasketBoard
description:
Basketball dunked in a box! All the excitement and the fast-thrilling actions of a basketball match recreated in a family game.

By rolling two special dices, the players can organize their attack actions, by passing, running or shooting, while the opponents will try to stop them by defending their area. Are you able to score before the time in the shoot clock ends?

The first team who scores 25 points during the 4 periods of the match wins the game! And with the special “team rules”, the game goes up to 10 players!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement

name: 40 Hats for 40 Cats
description:
The game consists of 40 cat puzzle pieces and 40 hat puzzle pieces. Players draw 4 cats and race to find their 4 matching hats. A round ends when one person completes their 4 pairs.

In subsequent rounds, each player draws a new set of 4 cats and play continues until there aren't enough cats left for everyone to have four. The player with the most matches wins.

{user summary}

name: Necromancer: Rise of the Undead
description:
Necromantic acolytes are dueling in a deserted graveyard to become the most powerful Necromancer! This is achieved by collecting arcane tomes of power & the chest of ultimate secrets, or by destroying your enemies minions with devastating spells and hordes of undead monsters.

This game has been taken to several war gaming conventions in the uK where it achieved Best Participation game at Warfare (Reading 2010)

The games consists of 4 players each representing a Necromancer in charge of an undead horde. To begin with eaxh player has 3 ghouls, these are; fast, good at searching but weak in combat. During each turn the players will raise a skeleton and a zombie to supplement their force. So more figures will enter play as the game progresses. The turn order is determined randomly by pulling stones from a bag. There are six stones, one for each player and the other two represent the resurrection of skeleton & zombie. When a players stone is drawn, they are allowed to move all their figures. No diagonal movement is allowed, nor are you allowed to enter a space occupied by other players pieces, and finally there's a stcking limit of 4 figures per area. After moving any figures against to an enemy must fight (this is compulsory), otherwise they may search for artifacts. Specially prepared dice are used for both searching & combat. These dice have the following faces; 2 x swords, 1 x shield, 2 x eye and 1 x swirl. During searching a number of dice are rolled, if any show the 'eye' the item has been found and will need to be carried back to the Necromancer in order to be used or scored. In combat, both players roll their respective dice, lokking for swords or shields. Basically a shield will negate a sword, any any excess swords on either side will kill a minion each. Spells can be played to influence the outcome of a battle ie 'Battle rage' - All swirls count as swords, thereby increasing your chance of killing your opponents figures.

zombies are slow, not good in searching but the best fighters, skeletons are average across the board. The Necromancer himself, is very good at searching, but otherwise similar to a skeleton.Points are awarded for kills and for collecting items. The first player to acquire 25 points wins. Sets of gems are worth more than singles, scrolls give you another spell but are not worth any points, relics are worth 2 points, the chest is 4 (this is placed in the centre of the board) and potions are worth 1 but can be used in combat to roll an extra die. Kills are worth 2 points each, however the Necromancer is immortal so each wound he takes is worth 2.

name: Etsu-To-Ga Sanshushi
description:
This is self-published expansion kit for the "Sengoku Gunyuden" series.
"Etsu-To-Ga Sanshushi" means Records of Three province, Ecchu, Noto and Kaga.

This game covering battles of Hokuriku region in Tenshō era (1573-1592 AD).
Six scenarios and one campaign game include in this kit.

name: The Little Big Game of aCowntin
description:
From the back of the box:

COWntless hours of entertainment with family and friends. Forget cows or balancing the books, this fast-paced card game has everything to do with rolling the dice to be the first to get rid of all your cards.


Roll the dice!
Do the math!
Lay down the cards that qualify!
First players to lay down all the cards in their hand, wins the game.
Watch out for the Cow eyes!


Includes: Two decks of 48 cow cards - numbered 1-12 in four colours, dice and instructions.


* *


Summary:

In this light children's card game, players begin with a hand of cards, each of which is numbered (1-10). On their respective turns, each player rolls a pair of six-sided dice and tries to discard a card from his/her hand based on the result rolled. The numbers on the dice are combined using simple mathematical operations to determine whether a card can be discarded. For example, if a player rolls a 3 and a 2, they could discard a 1 (3-2), a 5 (3+2), or a 6 (3x2). A player who cannot discard must draw an additional card. The first player to empty their hand wins.

name: Blick hinter die Kulissen
description:
This educational game shows the consequences of lobbying for fair trade relations with third world producers. It is used in schools of the German state of Rheinland-Pfalz, with the goal of inspiring students to put pressure on their communities to buy fair trade goods.
Up to five players represent importers of third world goods (bananas, stones, coffee, tea and cotton clothes), trying to be the one with the greatest profit who doesn't get caught either overcharging the buyers or inhumanly exploiting the producers. The board has five tracks, one for each product (for the sake of the game, they all have the same price). On the track, there are three markers: The lowest is the price that the producers get; the middle one represents the overall cost including shipping costs, the third one the price that a municipality buys the goods for (the distance between the latter two is the profit margin). The mechanism is a simple "play one card, draw one card". The cards have events printed on them, with each event either influencing the own track (with some choices to make) or that of another player. There are also hidden cards which can be played face-down to another player's track. These are revealed at the end of the game and influence the the maximum prize a municipality will pay and the maximum abuse of producers it will tolerate. A player who exceeds either of these levels is out of the game; the remaining player with the highest profit margin is the winner.
The game has some push your luck element (you can make a rough guess about the tolerable levels from the number of cards played against you) and is embedded in a curricular project in the schools of the state.
It is not for sale nor does it come in a box. 12 copies were hand-made by Reinhold Wittig, of which 10 copies will be used in schools beginning in 2011.

name: Take That The Game
description:
Hi Fans! How would you like to tour with Take That?

Play the Take That game and be part of our exciting, hectic lives. We all need personal assistants to take care of us 24 hours a day

You'll get closer to us than anyone and you'll have to be prepared for anything! From appearing in our videos, to organising our parties and even sharing our secrets.

So everyone take your pick and take us around the world! Who will it be? Gary, Howard, Jason, Mark or Robbie. Choose your favourite and Take Them around the world!

Source: box

name: Choose Your Clues
description:
A guessing game of Bible people, places, and things!

You get 20 clues to figure out the biblical person, place, or thing. Ready. Go!

Learn the Bible in a fun, new way with Choose Your Clues. Almost 2,000 clues lead you to discover many Bible facts you never knew existed.

Use as few hints as possible and you're the winner!

Three ways to play. Great for family times and travel, too!

(description source: back of the box)

name: GridBowl
description:
GridBowl is a simulation of American Football.
In this game you find : touchdown, field goal, punt, play of scrimmage, etc...

This game is played on a large gameboard (110 cm by 50 cm for big version, or 80cm by 45 cm for smaller version). You can play with 11 "football miniatures" (from Miggle Toy, or kaskey kids for example), or with 11 tokens representing players.

Gridbowl is a game of PROGRAMMATION : each turn, you use a PlayBook card. This PlayBook card gives the type of movement for each specific player.

Your opponent does the same with his own PlayBook card.

Once the Playbook cards are chosen, players from each team act alternatively.
So there is a lot of suspense in GriddBowl.

In this game you must anticipate opponent's moves.

name: Jingle Jangle
description:
Designed for the 2010 Christmas Print and Play Game Design Contest, Jingle Jangle is a domino-like placement game which scores points for arranging tiles into the appropriate patterns.

Jingle Jangle uses a special set of 30 tiles with two bells on them called jangles. The game can be played by two, three or four players and the size of the hand varies with the number of players.
• Two players get 14 jangles each, with two jangles left over.
• Three players get 9 jangles each, with three jangles left over.
• Four players get 7 jangles each, with two jangles left over.
In the case of three left over jangles, one is put away out of the game and not exposed, to leave two jangles in the starter. The starter is the pair of left over jangles. These are turned face up and put side by side to make a square in the middle of the table.

Jangles are placed on the table, vertically or horizontally, played out from the starter square. The idea is to build a “crossword puzzle” grid of repeated color patterns in the rows and columns.

Any set of two or more adjacent jangles ending in a row or column is called a group. The jangles must be played so that the bells in each group form a (repeating) pattern. The possible patterns are:

• a single color repeated, example: red, red, red or
• two colors alternating, example: red, blue, red, blue, red, blue or
• three colors in a repeating cycle, example: red, blue, yellow, red, blue, yellow, red, blue, yellow or
• four colors in a repeating cycle, example: red, blue, yellow, green, red, blue, yellow, green or
• or all five colors in a repeating cycle, example: red, blue, yellow, green, purple, red, blue, yellow, green, purple
As soon as a group has a repeated color in it, or contains all five colors, the pattern for that group is fixed, and future jangles that extend the group must conform to the established pattern. As the layout grows, it is possible for a row or column to contain two or more groups, separated by spaces.

Each jangle must be placed so that it correctly extends two or more groups, but you are not allowed to create a set of four jangles side by side in the layout, touching along their long sides.

If a player thinks he cannot play, he exposes his hand. The other players can then (if they wish) point out any plays he might not have seen. In this case the player must play a tile. If more than one possible play is pointed out, the player has the option of picking the one he likes. If no play is pointed out, then the player scores zero and places no jangle. He is not out of the game, but has to wait for his next turn to see if he can then find a play.

The game ends one of two ways: 1) When one player places all his jangles. The other players who started after him get to place one more jangle, however. 2) When no player can place a jangle.

Scores are counted and added as the jangles are placed. Each bell on a jangle is worth 5 points, The score is the product of the new lengths of all extended groups. If the jangle used to extend the group is a double, then the score is also doubled.

All players lose points for the jangles remaining in their hands when the game is ended. Doubles are -5 points and all other jangles are -25 points.

name: The Smurf Game Happy-time Picture Matching
description:
The Smurfs are busy having a wonderful time. Can you match up all your cards to their happy activities?

Source: box

This is a simple game (recommended for ages 4-8) of matching colours and symbols. Each player has a hand of five cards which they must match to the corresponding spaces on the game board.

Players spin a spinner to determine what colour card they can play and then attempt to match the symbol on their card to a space on the board. If they have no card of the appropriate colour they must draw from the deck.

The winner is the first to play all their cards.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: SHAKE 'M & TAKE 'M
description:
From the back of the box:
The luck of a dice roll with the strategy of a challenge!
Build enough sets of 4 and win.

The game's fast and furious so the cards lay on the table. When you see the cards you need, you're in luck - SHAKE'M & TAKE'M. But watch it! Your opponent might be luckier. Make another challenge. Shake 'm and OOPS! You lost. Next player.

There's plenty of action and risk when you SHAKE'M & TAKE'M. Cards go from player to player, back and forth. Dice roll with each challenge. And wild cards add to the fun as part of the strategy.

Players are attempting to acquire a number of sets of 4 cards each by challenging other players to a dice roll off. Players set down their hands face up in front of everyone. On your turn, you may challenge a player for some of their cards. You both roll a die and the higher roll wins the cards.

name: Loco Loco
description:
Simple roll and move train game. The players go around a train track. When they reach fields in front of a building, they have to perform a task in order to be able to proceed next turn (imitate an animal, sing a song, etc). When they stop on a tunnel field, they lose a turn as well.

This simple children's game was published in Geo mini magazine 2/2010.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Deluxe Contagion Survival Kit
description:
New to Endicott Epidemic: Infectious Contagion? Or are you a veteran Zombie slayer in need of assistance? Here’s your survival kit: it includes everything you need to live through this never-ending horde of Undead, plus room for extra goodies when the time comes. Use it wisely, for those not used to keeping resources plentiful will soon fall victim to a flesh-craving maniac or two…

This deluxe add-on to the base game of Endicott Epidemic includes:

1 large game box insert to hold the base game, expansions, and bits:

88 full-color chipboard chits (pre-punched)
45 Player Hit Chits
35 Zombie Hit Chits
5 Headshot Chits
3 Mercenary Chits

2 D6

6 Exclusive Game Cards:
1 New Character – Ant
1 New Weapon – BFG Minigun
1 New Zombie Boss – “Military Troll”
2 New Zombies – “Mo’Hawk” and “Willow II”
1 New Event – “Mercenary Assistance”
2 Heavyweight play mats:
