1 Main Game Mat [8.5x14]
2 Side Game Mats [4.5x11.5]

1 Expanded rulebook

[Can also be bundled with the ENDICOTT EPIDEMIC: INFECTIOUS CONTAGION core game deck!]

name: Cheddar Challenge
description: Cheddar Challenge is an abstract game of strategy and skill similar to Chess. Imagine simplified Klingon Chess. Each player has three categories of wedges. Sharp Cheddar, Medium Cheddar and Mild Cheddar. There are specific sizes, numbers of, movements and strengths for each category of wedge. Each category of piece has unique movement and strength. (For example the Mild Cheddar has the greatest number of pieces.) The goal of the game is to win by capturing all wedges comprising one of your opponent's three categories of cheddar. A player will lose if they lose one of their categories. The game is played on a rhombus shaped game board made up of triangluar cells. The theme is fun because its based on cheese and the shapes of cheese wedges. And its much easier to learn and less complicated than Chess or Klingon Chess and can be a great introduction to those games later on.

name: Alexandriaopoly
description: Another of the many Monopoly games. This one from Alexandria, Indiana put out by the Alexandria Jaycees. Developed by the THETA TAU Sorority as a fund raising device.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: ELSE: spielend gebären
description:
The name of the game comes from ELective SEstio. This is a C-section for the birth of a child without any medical reasons.

This game is published by the association of midwives as an educational tool against the elective sectio.

First you need to become pregnant so you have to draw a pregnancy card. Then you have to collect different cards for a "normal" birth.

There are several aims of the game mentioned. They are to be interpreted.

First player with a birth wins. Players with the most births win.
Avoid the ELSE card. Last player with ELSE card loses. (This aim is like in Old Maid [Schwarzer Peter])

The game designer confirmed all aims being valid.

name: Tortenschlacht
description:
Translation: Cake-Fight.

Partnership trick-taking game with four suits:
yellow and red cake with numbers
yellow and red flour

You have to follow suit. In the number suit, highest number wins. In the unnumbered suits, tha last card followed suit wins the trick.

name: Football Legend
description:
Ground breaking new Football (Soccer) based trivia board game to play with all the family.
All the action of the real game even the referee. Pick your team and formation then test your knowledge to become a Football Legend.

A football pitch board and 1 soccer ball as marker, use your special cards and the right answers to move the ball towards to the goal; penalty cards, shoot cards ...referees ...yellow and red cards are adding a touch of realistic match to the game.

Playing wisely your cards and a good knowledge of football soccer history is the key to win the game.

name: Der Ferien Express
description:
As a give-away in the seventies, private customers of the insurance company DEVK received a free copy of the game "Der Ferien Express" (the holiday express), probably as a summer gift for the kids.

It is a simple Roll and Move game, with a gambling component.
Players have to supply their own player-tokens, coins, and a die. Only the board game field was given away.

Players roll a die which indicates how far they are allowed to move down the 42 field track trough Europe. If he lands in a black city (Copenhagen, Cadiz, Bern, Athens) the player has to pause for a round and has to pay a coin into the pot (as a hotel fee). If the player lands on a red City (Berlin, London, Paris, Madrid, Venice) he has to pause for a round, but has the chance to take a shortcut when rolling a one on a D6. If he is allowed to take the short cut (express line) he must pay two coins into the pot.

The first player who is back in Berlin receives half the pot, the second and third divide the rest.

name: Cycle Tour
description:
Free-download cycling game made in Melbourne (Australia). The pdf provides game board, player tokens, chance cards and shopping cards, and you will need to supply a regular deck of cards from which you will remove the jacks, 3's,and 2's, as well as the jokers.

Players use the cards to move their pieces around the board and collect shopping cards as they fall on green squares. Blue squares are special “chance squares” where players get cards.

There are 2 winners in this game, the person who completes 5 laps first and the person who has the highest value of shopping when they finish 5 laps.

name: Charisma
description:
Setup: Charisma can be played on various sized boards. A 6x6x6 or 7x7x7 hex hex board is recommended. Each player has a plentiful amount of their own colored pieces.

Goal: The player with the largest group wins. If tied then another equal or second largest group wins etc...

Turn: Place one of your pieces on the board or strike with one already placed. If you cannot do either then you must pass. Passing is otherwise not permitted.

Place:
one stone anywhere on the board not adjacent to any other stone.

Strike:
The striking stone moves in a straight line and may not pass through any other stone.
The strike value must be equal to the number of stones in the target group.
strike value = number of spaces moved + number of stones in the group(s) adjacent to the departed space.
Upon striking, the target group is converted to the color of the striking stone.



End: when both players consecutively pass or when it’s clear who will have the biggest group.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement

name: Battle of Cannae
description:
"Battle of Cannae" is the 3rd postcard wargame published by Formosa Force Game in 2011. It simulates the "Battle of Cannae" in 216BC.

Components:
Two players lead 11 Roman units and 7 Carthage units respectively. The battlefield is a 6X9 grids map. There are three kinds of soldiers including cavalry, heavy infantry, and light infantry.

Sequence of play:
Two players do actions alternatively. The Carthage player act first. He need to move all units and then units next to enemy units can attack. In each battle, two players roll 1D6 and add the unit combat value. The difference of the result determine which side needs to retreat or flip the counter. The cavalry unit can move for 3 grids and infantry can move for 1 grid.

Victory condition:
Player who eliminates half of opponent's army win the game immediately.

name: Triquetra
description:
This game is played on a 12 x 12 field, with some squares colored and some grey. The players have 2 chieftains, 4 druids and 12 warriors each. Each type of pawn has its own movement rules. The goal is to reach the opponent's end zone with two chieftains or warriors.
The colored squares are either danger fields or trigger fields. If a pawn is on a danger field and the opposing player can move a pawn into the corresponding trigger field, the pawn on the danger field is destroyed.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Carrera Ciclista
description:
Strange cycling board game because during the race the cyclists also switch to air movement (via either a balloon, slow or fast air plane) and travel over water (via a rowing boat, 2 normal boats and a hovercraft) between the tracks. The cyclist who arrives first in the port can choose which boat he chooses and thus move faster over the water to the final cyclist track. So this is a race game over land, air & water. The player who reaches the finish in Chiromo Village wins the game.

From the book The KnowHow Book of Action Games.

name: Cyclo Tour
description:
French self-produced cycling game that features a couple of two-faced boards whith which you can make four different tracks, four teams of four riders (some of them hand painted, though monochrome), an extra yellow jersey rider (to replace the leader in stage races), a set of tactic/chance cards, a couple of dice, some markers, a classification sheet and a set of rules.

On your turn you divide your dice throw among the riders, maximum four points per rider; you cannot win the race unles all your riders have reached a certain 'hot' point in the race; you have to play inmediately chance cards but you can keep tactic cards (you take a card for each rider that finishes his move in red fields).

Strange is that the riders also have to pass barriers and gates. The game is played over several stages. In each stage points can be scored depending on your result in that stage. After all stages have been completed the total from all stages is added up to determine the winner.

name: Moody
description:
Be the player who's secret mission card is closest to the mood marker after the character reaches the mood wheel.

Each player is a daemon that guides and influences the main character. The game is a struggle between daemons to control main character's spiritual state or his mood by using the environment surrounding the character. Daemons take turns playing cards to trigger the environment or some of it's aspects to shift the character's mood, advance the character to next section or to change the environment all together. Each player's actions directly affect decisions and strategy of the other players. Game ends when the main character jumps into the mood wheel.

name: Divine
description:
Divine is a game for 2 to 4 players in which you assume the role of a Deity trying to spread their religion in ancient times. You can use your divine powers to quickly gain followers or deviously attack your competing religions. Priests, Zealots, Prophets, and Avatars are your pawns of strategic influence in a developing city which you must control.

The game board consists of 9 tiles that are randomly placed at the beginning of the game to represent an ancient city. Each tile consists of a 36 square grid that depicts various special locations within the city. Players start by controlling a single temple that allows them to train either Priests or Zealots. Priests can preach to gain followers based on the population of each spot on the game board; however, they are vulnerable to be assassinated by an opponent's Zealot. Priests can also establish new temples throughout the city, which can also be desecrated and destroyed by an opponent's Zealot. Unit movement is dictated by multiple dice rolls equal to the number of temples you control.

Players can use divinity cards from their hand to change the outcome of certain scenarios. More powerful units like Prophets and Avatars can only be created by using specific divinity cards. By taking control of special spaces on the board players can also receive additional bonuses.

To win the game players must carefully choose a win condition to work towards. A player wins the game if they are the first to 1) amass 100 follower tokens or 2) capture all 4 tower spaces or 3) be the only remaining player with a temple.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: HTPsim
description: Simulation of a cycling race. It is possible to play a simulation of a stage race with multiple stages. Typically the length of a stage will vary between 150 and 200 spaces. Movement in the game is determined by the position of the riders in the peloton. A peloton typically consists of 10 teams with each 3 riders.

name: Le Petit Vélodrome
description: French board game about indoor cycling, it comes with 3 dice and a board with a metal frame. It is unknown when this game was produced.

name: Rouleur
description: Cycling game where the goal is to advance riders depending on the dice rolls (there also is one black die) and on the use of energy cards. There are 5 cyclists numbered from 1 to 5. Each team has one control board where pins can be sticked in. The game is also played with a deck of 200 energy cards, there are 5 different energy cards.

name: Bicross
description: This French cycling game for children was given as a bonus in april 1986 with the French Picsou magazine. It was the third and last of their cycling series (the other two being Picsoutour and Pic-Etape). This time we have a free-style race. The best thing of this one is that the track is three-dimensional. As can be expected, landing on downhill squares is better than landing on uphill ones!
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Racing

name: 6 day Bike Race
description: This game is unique because it's a self destructing game! The game was published with six paper boards that self destruct after you play the game! It has a cycling theme, the mechanic is that you have to touch with a burning cigarette the starting line of the cyclist, the line of the rider that's burned up first is the rider that wins the game.

name: Radrennen
description:
German cycling game that features 4 double sided board with multiple tracks for road cycling, track cycling and time trial. It's a dice game but it doesn't use regular dice. Instead it provides 6 different-coloured modified D6s.

Teams are composed of 5 riders (6 teams provided, plus some riders with special jerseys: rainbow, yellow, pink, green and polka-dot (the last one is the jersey for the German national champion).

There are rules for one day races and for stage races, including rules for time trials, team time trials, and even the prologue, as well as rules for 11 different track races!

name: Das Müllspiel
description:
An educational game for groups about pollution. 1/3 of the players are farmer and the others are industry-people. Everybody needs each turn one food and one industrial product. Without one food the player is out of the game. Also everybody is produce one garbage each turn and the pollution starts.

The players can trade freely with each other.
The game ends after 10 turns. One winner will determined depending on how much one owns.

But the goal should be (educational) not to loose any player in the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Simulation, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Colin Miroir
description: Original memory game where players on their turn can taken and look under one of the thick wooden tiles to find matching pawns. Below the wooden tiles (there are 84 of them) is a mirror that reflects an image. The winner at the end of the game is the played who found the most matching pawns.

name: Ascot
description:
Horse game with a Game board with two Boards on it: 1 racing course and 2 business course.

Each player start in his first business course and advance via the second to the third. For each course there are different event cards.

Two times in the game the horses race. You try to make the most money

name: The Swarm
description:
The Swarm is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where hordes of animals, troops, and even sinister toys lay siege to cities around the world.The game allows players to create and control one of several different types of swarms, from beasts to vehicles and everything in between. The Swarm gives players complete control over the creation of their swarm. Players can create an existing swarm from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless. The object of the game is to destroy the opposing swarm and lay claim to the city.

The Swarm is a standalone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle System game.

name: Priory
description:
The monastery of Shewsbridge lies on a small hill that overlooks the countryside. Its Prior has fallen ill and the monks have decided it is time to call for at vote to find out who will be his successor. There are two primary contenders for the title, you and your fellow player. As custom have it you are not allowed to be in the monastery during the three days of voting. You are therefore located in a small camp outside with eight novices to help you. After the election you are going to enter the monastery and receive the monks’ decision. However, you are both very proud so you’ve made a private agreement. During the days of voting you will send in your novices in secret to find out what the general opinion is on some of the 5 major issues in the monastery. Before the voting begins you both write down your opinion on each issue on a scroll and seal it safely away. When the third day arrives you will open the scrolls and compare your scroll with the general opinion in the monastery that you’ve gathered from your novices. The one you think will win the election will enter the monastery and win the game. The other will leave the monastery for good to pursue a life elsewhere.
CONTENTS
• 1 Rulebook
• 1 Game Board
• 1 Bag
• 1 Watch Pawn
• 5 Issuecubes
• 8 Novices
• 10 Issuecards
• 50 Monktokens
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Medieval, Political, Religious
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Flick Racer
description: One of the two finalists in the Cadburys Pocketgame competition, Flick Racer was designed by James Wallis. Pocketgames are designed to be portable, quick to play and easy to learn, and Flick Racer does that. A dexterity game along the lines of PitchCar / Carabande, racers must flick their car discs (made from recycled tyres!) around a course drawn using the included stick of chalk.

name: Drag Show: The Contentious Drinking Game
description:
In this fast-paced card game each player takes on the role of a drag queen trying to out-perform her peers at the club. On your turn you can play one card from your hand and the first player to earn 10 points of GLAM wins!

"Show Move" cards, such as "Shimmy the Girls" and "Hit the High Note", benefit your own performance and give you points. "Bitch Move" cards, such as "Smack Talk" and "Kick Her Canckles", hinder the other players' performances and make them lose points.

You could also play nasty-sounding drink cards, such as the "Turd Spackle", on a player which slowly gets them drunk and makes them lose points every turn until they can pass it on.

Fabulous card art from Stan Yan and witty catch phrases from Layman Kingsford help to inspire players to get catty with each other in true drag queen style.

name: CEO
description:
This is an economic simulation game where each player is the manager of a multinational company. These companies produce and sell the same good (but in different styles and qualities) in 4 different regions (North/South America, Europe, Asia). Each game year the players will need to make important investment decisions (such as constructing or shutting down shops/factories worldwide, buying/selling shares, paying dividends), select a viable and efficient production plan, try to fulfill it and finally convert their production to sales. Also, they will have to look at the competition and through research try to push their efficiency even further. Simultaneously, local providers will also offer their products and "steal" a share of the market.

As in reality selling does not come easily. Each region will have a specific demand for the homogenous good (but in different quantities and styles) and a specific preference for quality and style. Considering these factors and of course the price, players will try to manipulate the markets. Demand is not totally known, however there is always a way to know better and possibly "change" the knowledge of the competitors at the last moment. Difficult decisions and a bit of luck will define the actual sales.

Players try to make profits not only for the money but also for their share price. Otherwise they will have to pay dividends if they want to keep the share price from declining. Loans are limited, costly and should not be taken lightly.

Scoring is unlocked by profitability and is measured by share price. Thankfully, no ownership changes are taking place in this game (it is assumed that the initial number of shares represent less than 50% of the company).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Simulation, Stock Holding, Trading

name: No Problem!
description:
No Problem! The Number Strategy Game, a dice game for ages 10 to Adult.

Contents: 11 dice (6 white d6, 5 green with math symbols); 1-minute hourglass timer, dice cup, and score sheets.

Objective: To throw the dice and get the highest score possible by arranging the dice in the time allowed, alternating numerical die with math symbol die.

Lots of rules variations provided: Educational version (use normal math rules and order of operations); Family version (calculate from left to right ignoring normal math rules); play with or without the timer; play with fewer dice; play for lowest total rather than highest. Play by yourself as a challenge, or with any number of people. Can be played in teams. Total scores for each player or team for up to 5 rounds for Grand Total.

name: Puppy Pinball
description: hungry Hippos clone with the opposite objecive. Plastic balls are released into the circular play area from a bucket above the board, the players have 2 levers each which they frantically move back and forth, which in turn moves the puppies arms, to prevent balls entering their puppies chute, The winner being the player with the least amount of balls, played over a series of 10 rounds the winner of each round reciving a bone, the player with the most bones after 10 rounds is declared the overall winner.

name: Dogs, Hogs, Frogs & Logs
description:
Dogs, Hogs, Frogs & Logs is the first in a series of games featuring the original "3-in-1" Elementary Match System designed by Richard A. Ramirez. In this system, players seek to collect cards by achieving any of the following match-types during their turn.


Spell a character's name (i.e. spell DOG, HOG, FROG, or LOG)



Add up to the number 10



Match three character images in-a-row.


Whenever any of these matches is successfully made, the player who made the match will collect all the cards constituting the match.

The DHFL Official Game Guide explains the many ways in which the game can be played.

The Official Game Guide for Dogs, Hogs, Frogs & Logs can be accessed at
http://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/dogs-hogs-frogs-amp-logs
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Math, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: The Lone Ranger: Frontier Town
description:
"Return with us now to those thrilling days of yesteryear..."

In 1948 the Lone Ranger radio program made the following announcement, "In celebration of the 15th year of this program you can get your very own model of the Lone Ranger Frontier Town. With this offer you can follow the adventures of The Lone Ranger and Tonto." That day, faithful fans of the masked man and his sidekick rushed grocery stores all across America buying up boxes of Cheerios. On each the 9 boxes of cereal were printed paper card models depicting an exact likeness of the wide-open, wild and woolly western town made famous by the Lone Ranger and Tonto. Four play maps featuring locations such as the Sawtooth Mountains, the Powderhorn River, the Overland Trail and yes even the Lone Ranger’s Secret hideout were also made available via mail-order. Once all 71 pieces were assembled children could follow along with their favorite radio adventures or play 1 of these 8 exciting scenarios.

Game No. 1 - The Race for Life!

Game Start: Rimrock Bridge
Game End: Old Spanish Fort

Summary: While camping near Rimrock Bridge, the Lone Rnager overhears a band of bad-men plotting to ride to the Old Spanish Fort to give the commanding officer false information about an attack by Comanche Indians.
One player is the Lone Ranger, the other is the band of bad-men. First to reach the fort wins the game.

Game No. 2 - The Sheriff and the Rustlers

Game Start: Town Meetin’ House
Game End: Abandoned Silver Mine

Summary: Cattle Rustlers, after gathering near the Meetin’ House, plan to go into action against Ranchers near Lone Ranger Frontier Town. Sheriff “Two-Gun” Taylor discovers their plan and heads toward Abandoned Silver Mine, so that he can climb shaft and warn the Ranchers from this high tower. Rustlers try to reach the mine first to head off the Sheriff and stop the warning. One player is Sheriff Taylor. Other is gang of Rustlers. Winner is one who reaches mine first!

Game No. 3 - Save the Bridge!

Game Start: Red Valley Desert; Sam, the Guide’s House, and Range Rider’s Inn (For three players. If only two play, start from any two of above locations.)
Game End: Lone Pine Railroad Bridge.

Summary: Tonto sends up smoke signal from Red Valley Desert that a scheme is afoot to blow up the Lone Pine Bridge and wreak the Union Pacific Frontier Train. Signal is seen by Sam, the Guide, and a cowboy at Range Rider’s Inn. One player is Tonto, one is Sam the Guide and one is cowboy. All start riding toward the bridge. First there saves the bridge!

Game No. 4 - Find a Fortune!

Game Start: Hidden Valley.
Game End: Powderhorn Land Office.

Summary: Two or three desert rat prospectors (depending on whether 2 or 3 players are in the game) have discovered a rich vein of silver ore! Each has been working alone but by a strange coincidence all have stumbled on the vein at the same time… So all start heading for the Powderhorn Land Office at full speed in order to register their claim to the land.
The silver mine belongs to the one who reaches the Land Office first.

Game No. 5 - Stop the Hold-up!

Game Start: Sawtooth Mountains and Echo Canyon (One player from each location.)
Game End: Union Pacific Railroad Station.

Summary: The Lone Ranger is on a scouting expedition up in the Sawtooth Mountains. Tonto gallops up with news that a gang of hold-up men are riding down from Echo Canyon and mean to move in on the Railroad Station and hold up all the passengers on the in bound train as it stops in Lone Ranger Frontier Town!
One player is the Lone Ranger and the other is the gang of “toughs.” Does the Lone Ranger reach the station in time to prevent the robbery? Play the game and see!

Game No. 6 - The Big Rodeo

Game Start: Old Cattle Trail Bridge and Outpost General Store. (One player from each location.)
Game End: Lazy “Y” Ranch Corral.

Summary: The Lazy “Y” is holding a big wild-west rodeo for the entertainment of the citizens of Lone Ranger Frontier Town. One of the big events is a match race for two riders – one to start at the bridge and the other from the General Store.
First rider to reach the corral is to win one of the finest cow-ponies in the Lazy “Y” string!

Game No. 7 - Hidden Gold!

Game Start: Adobe Village and Southwest Bugle. (One player from each location).
Game End: Rainbow’s End Island.

Summary: A notorious outlaw steals a precious old Treasure Map from a young Indian brave who lives in the Adobe Village. This map shows location of priceless old Indian relics buried for safekeeping on Rainbow’s End Island. A reporter for the Southwest Bugle hears about the theft and determines to beat the outlaw to the island and surprise him there!
One player is reporter who starts from the “Bugle” while the other, the outlaw, starts from the Adobe Village. First player at the Island wins the game and the Treasure!

Game No. 8 - Kidnapper’s Hide-out

Game Start: Alkali Ike’s Log Cabin, Mother Williard’s Rooming House and Rancher’s National Bank. (For three players, each to start from one of these three locations…If only two play, start from any two of the three locations.)
Game End: Rustler’s Cave.

Summary: Lone Ranger Frontier Town is startled one sunny morning when Wash Perkins, who owns the Grist Mill, discovers that Sheriff Taylor’s Indians are holding Kate captive in Rustler’s Cave for Ten thousand dollars ransom.
Wash sounds the alarm, and the first to rush to the rescue are old Alkali Ike, a cowboy staying at the rooming house, and a cashier from the bank.
One player is Alkali Ike, one is the cowboy, and one is the bank cashier. The glory for rescuing Kate Taylor goes to the one who arrives at Rustler’s Cave first!

HOW TO PLAY (General instructions printed on back of each map section)

1. Punch out game markers and circular playing discs. Place playing discs in container (such as a cup), shake well and allow each player to select one disc in turn. Each player then moves his game marker according to the directions on the disc he draws. Of course, no player may look at disc before selecting it.

2. Start each game on spot of Ground Plan colored GREEN, which is nearest the starting location indicated for that particular game...And move toward goal on circular stepping stones printed on Ground plan.

3. End each game on spot of Ground plan colored RED, which is nearest to ending location for that particular game.

4. Playing discs marked “Overtake player ahead” does not apply in all games, since some players in some games will take entirely different routes to the goal. If you are playing a game in which this disc does not apply, either remove it from play or give person who draws it another turn.

5. It is up to each player to figure out shortest route to his destination.

6. If you need more game markers for extra players simply cut them out of plain cardboard and color with pencil or crayon.
categories: American West, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Quarterback Option
description:
The ideal compact football game for the All-American armchair quarterback. An ideal game for families and parties. Can be played by 2 or 4 players.

This game has been especially designed to give "Armchair Quarterbacks"the opportunity to try their own football strategy. It is not a game of chance but creates realistic game situations in which the play outcomes depend on which player outwits his opponent.

The fold-out magnetic play board includes easy-to-read and easy-to-use scoreboards, time and play clock, indicators for "yards to go", times out, wind factors, downs and quarter, and a scale model for the actual length of a football field with each yard line marked for recording of exact yardage. magnetic markers are used as the "first down marker" by placing it 10 yards in front of the ball when there's a first down.

The spinner-play selector cards are used to select play calls and punts, field goal attempts, extra points, fumble recoveries, penalties, length of kickoff returns, onside kicks and wind conditions.

There are 42 cards used for running plays including penalties, fumbles and injuries. There are 42 pass play cards including interceptions, fumbles and penalties. The pass completion rate is nearly 50%, with an average completion gain of over 11 yards and includes possibility for touchdowns. There are over 300 different outcomes possible from the use of these 84 cards.

Nearly total realism can be simulated by advanced players. but the game is enjoyable by players of all levels.

name: Wallace & Gromit Cracking Contraptions
description:
From the box:

Get set for some brilliant teamwork as Wallace and Gromit embark on their latest career move! In this cracking game, teams of players compete to create items from modelling dough, whilst the others try to guess what's being made. As this grand adventure continues, players can steal items as they move around the board and try to avoid Preston as he seeks to steal points. The team who model and guess the most items will triumph as champion creators!

Description:

Teams take turns to roll-and-move their dough-modelled playing piece round the board, either modelling inventions out of dough or stealing inventions from another team. Inventions are graded as hard (red / 3 points), medium (yellow / 2 points) or easy (green / 1 point).

On a modelling turn, the modeller makes as many as he can from that colour in one minute. Each correctly-guessed invention moves the teams scoring piece along the scoring track by the appropriate number of spaces - first to 30 wins - and the team keep the card.

On a stealing turn, the team take a card from another team and advance that many spaces, while the other team goes back that many spaces, for a total swing of 2, 4 or 6 points.

After each turn, the team also roll-and-move the Preston piece either way round the board. If it lands on another team, or another team land on it, that teams discards a card and loses the appropriate amount of points.

A variation listed in the rules is that dough cannot be reused during a turn, limiting the size and number of models that can be made.

Game contents:

Game board
200 item cards
3 pots of modelling dough
3 modelling mats
Preston playing piece
3 playing pieces
Sand timer
Dice
Instructions
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Glitter Gulch
description: The object of Glitter Gulch is to win one million dollars gambling. Player landing upon a casino play roulette or chuck-o-luck. Players not gambling on a given turn may make side bets with one another.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: De Cao-Bang à Kaboul
description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:
De Cao-Bang à Kaboul, ou DCK, est une règle d’escarmouche moderne qui vous permettra de rejouer tous les engagements militaires à petite échelle depuis la fin de la seconde guerre mondiale jusqu’à nos jours.



(BGG user translation and description:)

In English :
De Cao-Bang à Kaboul (or DCK) - from Cao-Bang to Kabul - is a modern skirmish rule which will allow you to replay all small scale military engagements from the end of the WWII to our days.

The players take each one a group of infantry and command squads which can have vehicle support (some 10 miniatures each in the smallest scenarios).

The objectives of the game are decided by the same players or can be used those from the scenarios which came with the rulebook
The game uses a classic I go, you go turn sequence which have 4 sub-phases for each player:
a) rally
b) localization of the enemy
c) movement or fire
d) melee.
There is also an advance rules section to add optional elements to the main rules.
IN FRENCH ONLY.
categories: Book, Korean War, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Ishin-Kaiten
description:
An amateur cardgame describing the chaotic history in the end of Edo government, (Bakumatsu).

The game contains 99 cards and one small map.
The game is very similar to "Uno". Every player has a turn and try to play a card which matches either color or number to the last card played. And when any one player plays all his hand, the game ends and the victory is determined by each player's secret victory condition.

The map shows the current trend and changed its status by playing some cards. This trend strongly affects the victory condition.

name: Glendale's Powerbroker
description: Similar to Monopoly but with added elements. Players can take out loans and there are opportunities to "cheat" the other players or raid their properties. You roll and move around a board like Monopoly and land on businesses, but there is also a secondary track called the high-roller track.

name: CityProGame München
description:
Using the detailed street map of Munich (München), which is set out in four colors, each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the center as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.

Once a player manages to place all five companies on the map, the game ends and the each player caluculates the combined value of his companies to evaluate a winner.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules in 4 languages) and city information.

name: Tweeners
description:
"It's the word in-between that counts! Beat the clock... and double your score."

A party-style game of finding a word to fit between two others, that forms the second half of a common two-word phrase with the first word and the first words of a common two-word phrase with the second word.

name: Track & Field Math
description:
Track & Field Math is a game for children in grades 6 to 8 that uses a sports theme. It can be used to review for tests, brush up on a specific topic, or just for family fun.

There are eight "events" like the 100 meter dash, the pole vault, or the discus. Players roll dice to participate in the events and the first player to finish must answer the math question. Correct answers give the player a medal. The contestant with the highest medal total is declared the winner.

Includes a colorful board, 4 pawns, 120 question cards, a die, rules, score sheet, and a storage insert.

name: LAXTime
description:
From the publisher:

It's a race to be the first to assemble your winning lacrosse team. Collect your Attack Players, Midfield and Defense Line and a Goalie. Recruits and Substitutions are allowed but watch out for penalties! LaxTIME SportACTION Card Game is the next best thing to being on the field. It's fun for the entire family!

name: Beachopoly
description:
This Monopoly variant was published as a fundraiser for the Taft High School (Lincoln City, OR) 2009 Senior Class. The board features local businesses from Otis, Neotsu, Lincoln City, Glenden Beach, Lincoln Beach, and Depoe Bay instead of the traditional properties.

Houses and Hotels are replaced with green and red 'customer' chips. Chance and Community Chest cards are renamed as Fate and Beachcombing cards. Other non-property spaces on the board are also renamed (Loading Zone instead of Free Parking, etc) and each feature the name and logo of a local business. Money features the Chinook Winds Casino Resort name and logo, playing pieces match the 'monopolist' pieces from Anti-Monopoly.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Outpost Gemini
description:
Players are competing for customers who arrive in a known order, but who have different demands. Do you put your precious resources up for grabs to lure customers, or do you spend them on additional docking bays? Be wary of the government officials who aren't picky about what they take from you and only give you half as many points!

Components, rules, and example of play are available in the Files section.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Chit-Pull System, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Filmspel
description:
This game is a film quiz published by Fantoom Projecten in collaboration with the International Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR). The game contains a game board, 792 questions in 6 categories and hosts 2 to 5 players.
The object of the game is to answer questions right from each of the 6 categories, after which one final 'super' question has to be correctly answered.
The 6 categories are: Movie History, Directors, Movie Stars, General, Tiger Questions (related to the film festival) and Brain Teasers.
Players take turns, rolling dice and walking across a Trivial Pursuit-like game board on which the categories are represented. In addition, the board contains other icons that help you move across the board faster.

name: Coronation Street Quest
description: A trivia game based on the TV soap Coronation Street. Players move around the board answering questions on the programme, collecting the letters 'QUEST' from various destinations as they do so. There are also 'Cobble cards', which either help or hinder the player's progress.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Jolle Seilas
description:
Simple Norwegian roll and move game. With the help of a die your boat move forwards in this race game of small sailboats (dinghys). On the route(s) there are also 21 fields you could land on, which either represents an obstacle (eg. "You get distracted by a beautiful gal on shore. Bad flag rounding, move 4 spaces back") or a help (eg. "The wind gets stronger - roll once more").

The publisher Damm's game number 365, probably from around the 1950-/60ies.

name: Dude Dice
description:
Roll 3 specialized dice and then try to make as many words as possible from the letters showing - there are 3 letters on each face. Count the total number of letters in all the words and the highest number wins. The winner gets a "Dude" - small, ugly plastic figure - and the winner is the first player to get 3 Dudes.
Dude Dice-High Score has you doing maths with the 3 dice rather than making words.

name: Ocean Surprise
description:
Components
Game Board with Rotating Centre
4 White Boats
12 Playing Pawns (3 each of 4 color)
1 Dice
Instructions Booklet.

Objective:
To race other players through the jungle and the rotating sea board and be the first to jump into the safety boats.

Players control 3 pawns that move on the roll of one d6. Players can choose what pawn to move. There are hazards applying to certain spaces that should try to avoid. Once the pawns reach the port they jump into the rotating boats and eventually will move to the other side of the river.

The first player to reach the end of the path with the 3 pawns is declared winner.

name: Endicott Epidemic: Infectious Contagion Expansion #1 – Black Ops
description:
From the publisher's website:

MBI won’t let their mistakes haunt them any longer. They know their nuke will wipe out all traces of their crimes when the Countdown ends, but what of the small chance that a survivor escapes with the Hermit and his Intel?

Enter the MBI Black Ops squad, a team of 5 deadly Soldiers under the command of the ruthless Chrissy. Will they pick off any lucky survivors before the Countdown wipes out the rest of them? Or will they fall victim to the heroes much like the horde of Undead surrounding them all?

Introducing a new playable character, CHRISSY: the fair-haired Controller of the Black Ops squad. Ant was once his greatest student until Chrissy's thirst for innocent blood turned the young soldier against his team and into a life of isolation. Now armed with an even deadlier group of 5 Black Ops Soldiers, Chrissy has been sent into the heart of Zombie-infested Endicott with a simple mission from the heads of MBI: kill everyone and everything before it can escape the end of the Nuclear Countdown.

Hidden within the play deck amongst the flesh-craving Undead are the five Black Ops Soldiers. Uncover one, and become marked for execution. Try to fend off the Soldier with all your might until the sneaky assassins slither back into hiding within the remainder of the deck. Beware, once you are marked you run the risk of being executed sooner than you think! Take a breather from combating the Undead in order to attempt to remove the marks; but don't spend too much time to yourself - every attempt to remove a mark, whether successful or not, will cost you some of your slain Zombies.

When the time comes, Chrissy will send out the command to his Soldiers to EXECUTE! Roll the die when the command is drawn; the matching marks are instantly executed and players take damage (potentially fatal, if you have a hard time removing your marks). But that's not all - sometimes the Execute commands will allow more than one Soldier to execute their marks, spelling certain doom for any players who have unwillingly collected a variety of marks from several different Soldiers. If you fall victim to one of the Soldiers, respawning is no longer an option. You are instantly killed and any Cure cards you were holding become compromised with the Solders' evil decoy-deception. Now your allies must roll a successful Cure Retrieval value TWICE before they can take the Cure card and win the game.

Despite their advantages in both stealth and strength, the Black Ops Soldiers are still only human. If you can manage to do so, killing one will reward you dearly - not in points and not in monetary value, but with the knowledge that you and your comrades can walk the desolate streets of an apocalyptic Endicott with a bit more safety. But beware - the Zombies still run amok, and they LOVE adrenaline-pumped prey!

Contents:

18 Game Cards
88 5/8" Chits
7 Game Mats
1 Full Color 2-sided rules sheet
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies

name: Debacle at Powder River, Sept 1865
description:
The Powder River campaign of 1865 had only one purpose: to search and then destroy Indians, wherever found. There were three columns of troops descending from different forts upon the Tongue and Powder Rivers in Wyoming and Montana. In charge of it all was Brig. Gener-al Connor, whose column of left Ft. Laramie and arrived at the Tongue to build a new military fort, Fort Connor, starting in mid-August. Two other columns, one under Col. Cole with 1400 men left Omaha on July 1, and another under Col. Walker, of 600 men, left Ft. Laramie. These two columns failed to find Connor’s troops but were able to meet each other near the Black Hills and then moved through the Badlands to the Powder reaching it at the start of September. These two columns were huge affairs comprising of 1200 horses,185 wagons and crossing areas with no roads.

Contains:
8 Page Rules
1 Player Aid
280 Counters and Markers
11x17" Map

name: Carrera a la luna
description:
The game published in Girona by Dalmau Carles Pla, does not consist the date of the edition, though it is possible that it is at the beginning of the 70 ' s.
It is a game from two to four players.
There wins the player who manages to come first to the moon to the zone of landing that before has been designated.
The players move his ships for a network of connected points until they manage to land on the moon.

Components: The rules, 8 spaceships of four colors, map and 4 dice of six faces with the numeration: 9-3-3-2-2-0.

name: Ludus Magnus
description:
Each player represents the leader of one of the main Gladiatorial schools in ancient Rome, sending groups of Gladiators into the arena with hopes of survival (and freedom).

Each player has a stable of gladiators. They each pick 3 (or more) of their gladiators and send them into the arena trying to kill their opponents Gladiators. Then the next group of Gladiators are sent in, until they have all fought. Lastly, all the surviving Gladiators are returned to the arena for a final battle.

This game uses a move action/attack action allotment with a counterattack element. It was based on an Abstract theme at first, then a minor coin-flipping mechanic was added later on.

This game was produced for the One Full-Sheet Label contest.

name: Farming with Friends
description:
Want to get your feet in the mud? This is your chance!
You and your friends are hired to work on a farm.
You’ll have to do different jobs every season to produce food. The more you produce the more you'll get paid, but be careful not to overdo it, because you might not keep up!

FARMING WITH FRIENDS let’s you walk around the farm, which is divided into the four seasons. On the outer ring of the board is the sun, which will move to next month at the end of each round. Every turn you’ll have to choose what jobs you will do and how far you will advance. If you don't keep up with time you’ll be late for next season, and missing a job in the cycle of a product is something you can’t afford.

There are 6 farm products to be made: Bread, apples and milk for breakfast and meat, potatoes and cauliflower for dinner.
The game ends after 4 years or if any player has earned coins for every product. There are also bonus coins to be earned if you've helped to produce all products in a meal. The player with the most coins at the end of the game wins.

Farming with friends is an easy to learn family game that will teach you more about working with the seasons, and the origin of food.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: 7 Sachen
description:
Get your winter clothes together: Hat, scarf, gloves, bag, socks, right and left boot, but make sure that you get them in your color, and even more that you don't get the broken ones!

The wooden disks depicting these items in one of six colors each, one color for each player plus one brown, broken version of each, lie face down on the table, and each player must try to collect all items of his color. The first player to find all his items wins, but if he finds a broken item, he has to return his item of the same type to taple.

name: Air Combat: Card Game
description:
Air Combat is a card game for 2 players to simulate an air war.

The game consists in the administration of cards representing the combat aircraft from Brazil, Argentina, Chile, France, United Kingdom and the United States, and special cards, aiming to conquer territories located in Brazil northeast.

The game takes place is a hypothetical future when the Brazilian government announced the discovery of the largest underground reservoir of fresh water on earth, prompting the country to war.

The game puts in conflict 2 coalitions, one composed of the United States, United Kingdom and Argentina and another in Brazil, France and Chile.

Each player aims to conquer the territories described in the Objective Card, every round a territory is disputed by the 2 coalitions.

The 2 players have 6 cards representing aircraft squadrons (each card has a strike force) and special cards, and must use 5 cards to form a fighting force to overcome the opponent, through winning the disputed territory.

The mecanic is simple and dynamic, providing games fast and very strategic.

The game is Print & Play, and have 54 cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame

name: L Mental
description: Players take turns to place colored L-shaped tiles in order to form lines of a given color and orientation. Once there are no more tiles to place, all players reveal their objectives. Then, each line yields points according to its lenght to the respective player.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Business Card Fighters
description:
Fight it out with your friends with a character that fits on a business card (or smaller)!

BCF is a small game that requires the use of 2 dice, a deck of standard playing cards (with jokers), and 2 or more friends.

Each character has 5 stats, 25 life, a Nature, and a Vulnerability.

Players take turns playing attack cards and defense cards in an attempt to reduce the other player's life total to 0. This is done with a communal deck of cards and a character sheet. The character's stats add to the cards and based on the character's Nature, a bonus or penalty is applied to the card!

This is a game in early development which has been modified from a previous, far more complicated, set of rules. I am looking for feedback and play-testing in order to strengthen the game, reduce/simplify the rules, and make the game fun.

name: Kriegspiel, the card game
description:
Kriegspiel (the card game) is the worlds fastest (and easiest to learn) war game. The game teaches anyone the basics of card war game tactics in a way that is fast and fun.

The game modifies Rock-Paper-Scissors to Infantry-Cavalry-Artillery and adds the basics of the old card game, "War" to the concept. Players each play one card, facedown, at a time, and the winner takes the trick. The player with the most tricks at the end of the game is the winner. Due to game construction, there is always a winner, never a tie.
Kriegspiel, the card game, is the latest in the Warcoach Games "10 Minute War Game" series.

name: Koppzerbreche
description:
Koppzerbreche is a trivia game featuring questions related to the city of Darmstadt, located in the South of Hesse, Germany.

The game mechanics are very simple: each turn, a multiple choice question with four answers is read aloud by a player. All other players then simultaneously try to answer the question by secretly placing one of their four answers cards (A,B,C or D) face down on the table. Each player with the correct answer then progresses his meeple on a linear track, according to the predetermined difficulty rating of the question.

The questions are divided into the categories Science, History, Sport, Culture, People and Local. Some are simple and some are very tricky. For example, one can score if one knows that the local museum houses the original death mask of William Shakespeare, that the 1990 world-championship in solar racing was won by students of the city's university, that "Knäärze" is local slang for the end piece of a bread, or the country were the 2009 world championship in amateur boxing had been won by a local boxer.

The game is of standard quality for a German boardgame with 6 classical wooden meeples and a full-color thick cardboard board. Each of the 165 full-sized double-sided question cards features a color photo or picture in relation to its question.

name: Koolist Kojuminek
description:
From the rules:

Old classic game from Soviet Estonia. It is roll and move game with small twists.
Each player is a child trying to get home from school and the goal is to reach home first, but it is not that easy as it sounds.
On the way there are a lot of distractions, like planes flying over head and ice cream being given away for free. All these things take time and you might not reach home first.
Smarter will use trains or bus, some will try and run for it.
Be the first to reach finish and win the game.

name: Ladybird Ludo
description: Send all your ladybirds around the board to the petals of their own flower. Ladybird Ludo is played like the traditional Ludo with a few exceptions. Such as having to roll a one or two in order to move off home, until your first ladybird reaches a flower, afterwards ladybirds may move off using any number rolled. There's no bonus for rolling doubles and when moving you only count empty spaces.

name: 12 Moons
description:
The sister game to Junishi and Zodiakos,
12 Moons is an abstract strategy game inspired by the 12 animals of the Native American Zodiac. (Each player controls 6 of the 12 animals.)

The object of 12 Moons is to move one of your 6 animals into your opponents Gate, which is located at the opposite end of the board, in between your opponents Spawn Areas.

Players begin at either end of a board comprised of 19 circles arranged in a hexagonal pattern.
At the start of the game there are not any pieces on the board. Any pieces that a player wishes to use must be "spawned" in one of the Spawn Circles on that players side of the board.
Players may move the pieces that they already have on the board either by moving them into adjacent circles or by jumping over friendly pieces.
Players also may use their animals to capture their opponents animals by jumping over them.

12 Moons is a simple and fast paced abstract strategy game that is easy to learn and usually plays in under 20 minutes. It comes in a little cloth bag that also serves as the game board
and it can be carried in any pocket that is big enough to hold a pack of gum.

12 Moons is a complete game that can be expanded by combining it with its sister games Junishi, Zodiakos and Neteru.
(source : the publisher)

Integrates with:

Junishi



Zodiakos



Neteru

name: TGV: Card Game
description:
TGV is a card game for 2 players whose theme is the creation of high-speed railways in South America.

Each player represents a big company that aims to build high-speed rail linking major cities in Brazil and Latin America, where every railroad connects 4 cities.

The game consists of railroad cards, action cards and cash cards, with each round the players manage their cards trying to build its railroads and at the same time trying to sabotage the competitors railways.

TGV has the right amount of luck and strategy, with quick and dynamic games.

The game is free and Print & Play.

TGV has 54 cards and is ready for printing.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Print & Play, Trains

name: Resolution?
description:
From Box back:
Resolution? is the entertaining and enlightening game that makes child's play out of the current Savings & Loan crisis. As you play, you'll read quotes, facts and some amazing statistics on the biggest financial scandal of the century, and how we're all going to pay for it! It's a must for every taxpayer -- and future Taxpayer -- in America.

name: Loch Ness
description: Each player tries to make the best picture of Nessie. Players run around loch ness where hidden puzzle piece are laying. On the spaces you can reveal puzzel pieces or get pieces from the center. After the sixth lightning the game ends and the player with the best nessie picture wins.

name: Dordel
description: Trick taking game in the stone age. You try to get clan members and food with trick, only clan members with food count points.

name: Alexandria
description: Race game to bring your ship first in the dangerous harbor of Alexandria. On your turn you roll with three dice and try to make the best movement with the die roll.

name: V: Breaking the mothership connection
description:
When Julie got word that Dr Jenna Arlov was about to be snatch from her hiding place and taken to the LA Mothership, she and the rest of the resistance resolve to help. Unfortunaterly the Visitors' troops are on the way. The game is about getting to Doctor Arlov's hideout before the Visitors, and bring her back to the Resistance HQ.

Players (two or more) uses a dice, to choose between the boards four-pronged attacks, and to move. During the game players can be helped or attacked by skyfighters, find different vehicles and uniforms and access computers etc.

The game was published in the book "Annual 1986".

name: Bad Beer Baron, Bachelor Edition
description:
You have been invited to hang out with one of the world's most eligible bachelors, the Bad Beer Baron, in his family's palatial estate. Should you play your cards right, you could end up with a ring. But don't get cocky: Many, many beautiful women have tried to play this game — and ended up dead.

Beginning in the Foyer, each bachelorette vies to gather a six-pack of ice-cold beer and make her way to the center ring to claim the prize. The winner is the first lady to land, by precise count, on the center ring with at least six beers in her possession.
Danny Hellman
The packaging of the Bad Beer Baron Bachelor Edition board game.
The packaging of the Bad Beer Baron Bachelor Edition board game.

DIRECTIONS
The player deemed most attractive (without the aid of beer goggles) gets to roll first, followed by the player to her right and so on. Players advance counterclockwise around the board, gaining one beer each time they pass the Foyer. Additional beer may be gained, or lost, by drawing a Manservant Card and by following the instructions therein.

Each room in the mansion is a shortcut and can be accessed by landing on the orange square permitting entry to that room. However, each room carries the potential for a player's untimely demise. Upon entering the room, players must roll the die and follow instructions for that room. If/when a player is killed — and history argues strongly for "when" — she loses whatever beer she's accumulated and must return to the Foyer to start over.

Only one player is permitted at a time on any square on the pathway. (The Baron is frisky but not into the holy Trinity, if you know what we mean.) If you land on a space occupied by another player, roll the die a second time and send your rival that number of spaces in the direction of your choosing. Rooms can have more than one occupant.

This game is a work of pure fiction. Any resemblance to real people, events, actual beer barons or real dead girls is only a matter of coincidence.

No actual women were harmed in the making of this game. Several beers were obliterated, however.

name: Come-Bye
description:
A 2011 release from Luke Morris, Come-Bye offers up all the thrills and spills of sheep-herding as the players flick their sheepdog discs around to "encourage" the sheep into their fenced pens.

Come-Bye is a light dexterity game that rewards forward thinking, a steady flicking finger and brave and skilful flicks!

name: Froggy Phonics
description:
"The fun way to practice phonics skills!"

This is an educational board game with a frog theme. It is actually two study tools in one package since the two-sided board can be used to play two different games.

One game teaches beginning and ending consonants and the other game teaches beginning and ending blends. Both designs use a similar mechanic with players using a spinner to determine the required letter.

Includes the colorful board, 16 frog tokens, the spinner, and rules. Froggy Phonics is designed for 2, 3, or 4 players and can be used for team play in the classroom.

The first player to correctly place four frogs on the letter-coded lily pads is the winner.

For grades K-2.

name: Betűvarázs
description: Players move their pawns around the board according to dice rolls. At the end of their turn they can choose a letter tile from a group of letters, depending on the color of the quare they end the turn on. The winner is who can create the most sentences at the end of the game.

name: HitStory Kids
description:
From The box:
Interactive DVD game for kids, which has simple music questions and songs from a DVD.
Players try to collects 3 cards from each 3 categories, for which they roll dice. Cards will then either ask a question or refer to DVD.

Be the first player to collect 9 cards, you will win the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: People Mania: Le jeu des célébrités
description:
From the box:
Interactive DVD game around the board to find the best celebrity knowing person in the room.
Player one by one roll the dice for category and then draw card, which shows either a face or scene or some other symbol. Then using DVD remote, you can answer the question or a puzzle. Each correct answer will move you along the game board. Be the first to reach the finish and win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Kampen om Skövde
description:
From the publisher:
Kampen om Skövde is a game about the Swedish city of Skövde. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history. Players move around a track on the board and acquire properties and answer trivia questions about the featured city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lokalspelet, Kampen om stan: Falkenberg
description:
From the publisher:
This is a Monopoly clone. The publisher Lokalspelet i Skandinavien AB did a lot of these games as promotions for different cities in the 1990s.

In the middle of the board is a photo of the Falkenberg and around that is a lot of the stores in the city. You can buy stock in them, and you can get cards that ask you questions about the city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

description:
From the publisher:
