mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Of Sky & Sea
description:
10 levels of a mast aboard a seafairing ship are the stage for a political battle between the birds of the sea. The first bird to the top of the mast will be crowned with the Star Crown as the King or Queen of Sky and Sea!

Each bird has a different approach to how to get to the top. Some hope to soar above their peers with better flying, some risk it all tradeing with the rats, while others rely on their ability to fight to stay ahead. Most birds excel at fishing, which will earn them temporary bonuses, though some sacrifice this most bird-like ability in order to boost another.
publishers: At the Table Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Sushi High Battle
description:
Sushi High Battle is a game about colors, faces, and racing to the top of some ambiguous track of colors. Yes, by battle I mean race!

Sushi High Battle consists of 10 custom dice with multiple colors per die. Each is marked with a face that corresponds with a color. Also, each die has a number which indicates the turn in which you may roll it.

The game is designed for 2-5 players but more may join in the fun.

The goal is to have the most pieces on the board, in the highest places of each colored track, after all 10 dice have been rolled by all of the players.

name: Duderama
description:
Just a party game, the theme is drawn from the film “The Big Lebowski”, as well as “LebowskiFest”, the annual festival of all things Lebowski. All of the artwork is original. Printed on fabric, the board design reflects The Dude’s rug, the maguffin of the film.

Goal
Move to the center of the board and get The Dude’s rug, which is a poker chip placed in the center space. The player must then get home with the rug.

Game Mechanics
It’s a roll-and-move game. The board is laid out in a circle, with 8 starting points on the perimeter. The player may roll a single die, or for more control (to land on a more desirable space) may bowl instead. 5 bowling pins and 2 marbles are included. 1 marble is rolled and each pin knocked down equals 1 space. Each space requires its own action, or inaction. E.g. answer a trivia question and roll again.
The players may move in any direction, there is no predetermined path. Once a player gets possession of the rug, the other players must catch up and challenge for possession. This is determined by a roll-off. Each player bowls a frame, and the best score wins possession of the rug.

There is some adult content. This game is not intended for little Larrys.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Working Bee
description:
Players each control a hive and the worker bees within. Each turn players must choose between expanding their hive, creating new workers, collecting pollen and attacking other hives. Opportunities and choices exist on every turn, but timing and luck are critical.

You must decide which workers to deploy, whilst trying to out-think your opponents. Take risks by gambling for extra actions, and play the odds for Events that can both help and hinder all players.

The player whose hive and workforce is the largest after 12 turns is the winner.

Working Bee is a luck-driven strategy game for 2-4 players aged 10 and up that plays in around 45 minutes.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Backers: Amalgamations of the Spiritual Hinterlands
description:
Players take on the roll of extra-dimensional puppeteers who create and manipulate automatons in a shared environment. Backers is a creative game involving drawing, writing, and the playing of instruments.

Play consists of about five phases, called Objectives: Spiritual Amalgamation, Space Definition, Automaton Production, Dramatic Operation, and the Resulting Objectives. Via collaborative mechanics, the players create a map and characters which they then influence through a series of job rotations. Objects and characters are defined by motivations. Players may cause things and characters to interact in ways contrary to their motivations through the expenditure of points.

Backers: Amalgamations of the Spiritual Hinterlands is designed to facilitate and moderate the formation of collaborative playgrounds in a simple and comprehensive way with an eye toward personal extension balanced by a diminished role for the ego. Conditions for success are not listed in the rules and must be supplied, if necessary, by the players themselves. In the current edition, players must also provide their own musical instruments, art supplies, and, optionally, hats.

name: The Merchandiser
description: Subtitled "Sally Store Manager Success Game". This game appears to have been sold or given out at Sally Beauty Stores. the goal of the game is to have the best available product line, you do this by stocking products and cases of products. when another player lands on your product spaces they must pay you to stock that product. the winner of the game is the last player to left with money at the end.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: "dollmätsch"
description:
"dollmätsch" is an educational game (published in german). It contains 720 cards, listing 90 words in 8 diffent foreign languages (english, esperanto, polish, swedish, french, spanish, italian, and turkish), along with their phonetic transcription. The german translation printed on the back. The objective is to collect cards with the same word in different languages.

During gameplay, there are always 12 face-down stacks (german translation showing) and a good number of face-up cards (name in other language showing) in the center, plus groups of cards (with the same word in different languages) in front of the players. In his turn, a player takes any 2 cards; if their translation matches, he keeps them as a group in front of him, otherwise he puts them back face-up (thus the number of face-up cards increases over the course of the game). He may even steal a whole group of cards from another player if he can match them with one more card with the same word.

The game ends after a set time. Winner is the player who collected most cards.

Awards:
Bronze medal at the IENA Erfindermesse 2004
Auswahlliste Deutscher Lernspielpreis 2004

name: Ends 'N Blends
description:
"Ends 'N Blends expertly combines fun and learning. It is an exciting, creative game which your child will want to play again and again. The game will increase reading and spelling ability. It will stimulate interest in and understanding of words.

"Created and developed by a professional educator, Ends 'N Blends has been tested and proven successful in the home and classroom. While playing the game, hundreds of words will be formed by combining word beginnings (consonants and 'blends') with word endings ('word families'). As he plays, your child will master the use of word families and learn to read a countless number of new words independently."
(From the rules introduction.)

The game consists of a game board divided into eight columns and eleven rows. Every third 'cell' contains a word segment such as "all", "ap", "ick", "ay", "ook" and several others. There is a spinner evenly divided into two sets of the numbers 1-5 and a "Hit or Miss" section. A set of over ten dozen "Ends 'N Blends" cards or tiles each contains a single word segment such as "sn", "ight", "ot", "at", "tr", "g", "fl", "ing", and many others. Forty-two "Hit or Miss" cards carry instructions such as "Return one point marker", "Take one end 'n blend. Spin again.", "Take one end 'n blend card from each player. Spin again.", and so forth. A small box holds approximately 40 thin, transparent red discs used for points. Finally, a small booklet entitled "Your Child's Reading: Suggestions For Parents" is included.

Players use the spinner to determine the number of "Ends 'N Blends" cards/tiles to draw. The player then places these cards on the board, matching them up to the word segments there to form as many whole words as possible. He then receives one point (red disc) for each whole word. First player to fifteen wins. If the spinner points to "Hit or Miss", the player draws one of those cards and follows the instructions.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Gladiators in Rome
description:
Pen 'n' Paper game of Gladiators fighting in an arena with weapons shield and Lions.

there is an example gameboard that can be printed, or you can draw a grid to fight on.

Also this game can be factured in an RPG battle

The Gladiators Roll a D6 to Move each turn, when you move into contact with another Gladiator a clash happens, the results from a clash can target you in differrent ways , if you are disarmed it can force you into a chained Lion zone where your eaten, or it can diminsh your health by batterring your shield away.each turn you can try pick up better shilds and weapons , or chase your opponant.

name: Fflow
description:
Fflow is a collection of games intended to test and develop the creativity of the players. All the games share the same basic premise: on a turn a player will select an area on the map and answer a question from the included Book of Wonder. Depending on how well the player answers the question, he or she may occupy the space or may be forced to play from the "Wastelands" on the next turn. The goal is to be the first player to enter "Bliss", which can only be attempted once all other areas of the map have been occupied by the player.

Some questions will have a definitive answer. Others are more subjective, and the answers will be judged by the other players in a thumbs up / thumbs down / neutral manner.

Questions include:
- logic puzzles that require deductive reasoning (decoding ciphers, spot the difference, etc)
- dramatic improvisation (act out the morning ritual of Fillmore Solo, the Fidgeting Chess Master)
- philosophical issues (Why is personal beauty not enough for complete happiness?)
- exploration of the weird (If your car could think, what complaints would it have about you?)

Rules for the following variations are included in the box:

- Party Game
- Competitive Game
- Wilde (guessing game of dramatic improvisation)
- Scrawl (guessing game of doodling ideas and cartoons)
- Whizz (game of combining ideas and concepts in new ways)
- Bucky, Sensei and Nippon (competitive games where areas are scored only after a series of questions are answered)
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Voting

name: Dratz
description:
Subtitled "The Bettor Word Game", Dratz! combines word building with poker-style betting.

The game comes with a deck of 82 lettered cards of different values. Seven cards are dealt to each player, from which words will be selected in secret. When all players have chosen their words, they are arranged face down in a stack and the betting begins. On each betting round, the top card in each stack is revealed. Players may bet, call, raise or fold. The remaining player with the highest valued word wins the pot. In the event of a tie, the longest word wins.

name: Succes-s iv
description:
Succes-s iv is a two-player abstract strategy game played on a 9x9 grid with each player having 9 cubes and 9 cylinders.

Cylinders may advance forward a single square, jump over a piece occupying the square in front of it, or capture a piece diagonally in front of it.

Cubes move like cylinders, but may also capture diagonally backwards. In addition, the value of the cube may be changed, increasing its forward range. In the advanced rules, a cube may become frozen or dead if it advances behind the enemy pieces.

The goal of the game is to bring two cylinders across the board, occupying squares in the row closest to your opponent.

name: Die Civilization
description:
Die Civilization (DieCiv) is a game about civilization building through the management of resources. Players attempt to win the game through special resource victories, progressing the furthest, or through achievements.

A single game should take 60 or more minutes to play and requires two to five players. In addition to the included component sheets, you will need 10d6 for the resource dice, and 300 cubes (320 for the espionage variant) to keep track of resources (50 cubes in 6 different colors for 300 cubes, and 20 black cubes for the espionage resource).

Play starts with everyone at progress level 1 where you roll the first of the 10 dice. As you increase your progress levels, you get to roll more dice each turn, increasing your chances of gaining more resources to purchase achievements, resources, and higher progress levels. Each player can take 2 of a number of actions each turn, granting a variety of winning strategies.

The first to meet one (or more) of the several goal conditions wins!

Discussion thread: Die Civilization: Civ Building game for 2-5 players, 30+ minutes - Feedback wanted.

name: BrawlBall
description:
BrawlBall is a game about sport. And combat. But more about the sport. Just a little combat. Really.

BrawlBall is a two player game, that has been created during the One Full Sheet Label Contest. Trainers create their team by selecting a race, providing the base stats and then selecting players with different strengths and weaknesses to flesh the team out.

While it might be tempting to stomp the opposing trainer's players into the ground, the actual goal of the game is to get the ball into the opposing players' end zone while denying the opponent to do the same.

Since everything you need is on one single page, crafting this game takes less than an hour.
Due to the high flexibility during team creation (there are 49 combinations to create a single player and 11 players in a team) BrawlBall offers a high replay-ability.

name: Heroes de Armarath
description:
Heroes of Armarath is a Spanish game of role and adventures on board. It is possible to play in solitarily or up to with 12 players.
In Heroes of Armarath the players choose between one of 18 heroes who come with the game base and travel across Armarath, a land of fantastic kingdoms. Barbarians, beasts, elfs and many others creatures who give own life to a world full of adventures. What it does special to this board game is that the player is advancing in the middle of a fantastic world where the events and legends are happening parallel, independently of what the player does, but simultaneously they affect the destination of the heroe. The system of game immerses us therefore in an epic history, where nobles and necromantics hit in battles that re-draw the scene, and where conspiracies and disputes between races and clans modify the balances between the good and evil constant.
In each of the events, the players leading the Heroes of Armarath they will try of affecting the destiny of the kingdom acquiring skills, followers and equipments that improve his inventory. The goal of the game is to defeat the enemy who waits in the catacombs of the Armarath, a hard quest that demands a powerful hero.
The game is based on the Runebound play-system, but improves many aspects, like the amount of quest-cards (230), object cards (130) and game board (a detailed map of the kingdom of Armarath).

Website: armarath.blogspot.com
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing

name: Prelude to Sekigahara
description:
Issue game of SL Gamer #1.
Very small game describing the early skirmish of Sekigahara from August 22 to September 13 in 1600.

The game is very straight hex-wargame which uses regular movement/combat sequence. East army goes first.
The victory is decided by who controls Ogaki-castle, Gifu-castle, and Kiyosu-castle.

63 units
4 pages rulebook
1 map
1 playaid sheet

You must make the units with seal type sheet and prepare a die.

name: Nebula's War
description:
Game Description:
A simple Sci-Fi wargame played by two players. The players are fighting each other in order to catch the most VP in the Nebula. They have two kind of spaceships to command plus the space stations.
Players take turns moving their spaceships to get into the better position to attack each other.
The turns are limited and when the game ends, the winner is the one with the most victory points.

Nebula's War was originally created as an entry for the one full-sheet label PnP game design contest here on BGG.

name: Lines of Fire: Thanks for the support expansion
description:
This expansion was included for people who donated to the game via the kickstarter program. The expansion adds a set of tiles that can be used to help defend your castle from attack, or to gain life if needed.

Content:
10 tiles
1 set of rules

name: Je compose des mots
description:
Old classic French children game.
It is basic word and memory game where each player just takes a word tile from a pile of face down pile and then has to find a place for it in the rows of pictures.
Easier rules is to just place the starting letter, advanced rules are the whole word.
First ones to complete their line of pictures is the winner.

name: J'apprends l'heure
description:
In "Learning the hour, " the players must reconstruct a day in the hours: time of emergence, the school's taste ... To win the card, players must display the time on the clock in the colored box.
Series of pictures and player has assignment to set the more or less time for the activity. Back of the card has the range of time (example: Going to school - 07:00 - 09:00).
Be first to collect 5 cards and win.

name: Jeu du cinéma
description:
GAME OF CINEMA is sponsored by Claude Chabrol; each player is a producer filmmaker to climb, turn and operate a movie.

The board has three different circuits for periods of shooting, recording and exploitation. Each player places his pawn on his own starting box, and each receives 11 game cards and borrow money in the bank if their cards are not very favorable. Indeed, each card can earn money or indispensable to the project (provision of a technician, for example).
The first track (external) is used to prepare the film. In turn, the player removes one or more of its game cards (forming a battery backup) and moves his pawn all the rejected cards. It conforms to the indications of the box: receipt of money, draw new cards, trading cards with his opponents. During the game, everyone can pick up puzzle pieces to save money ... or technicians.
In turn, the player may expose his cards before him cards "Silver" cards "Preparation" (script, star, technician or cards ...), "Genius" substitute any card or canceling a possible incident during play
When a player has obtained 30 million, a star, a scenario, a novel, a writer and a technical team from 6 different members, it can go on the shooting circuit. On this circuit it can double its share capital if the card has "Co" and may also be insured to cover the hazards of filming. Each cell in a direction circuit: loss of one or more towers, spending money or rejection of card...
Maps "Turning" hand of cards during the game can prevent some incidents. Box "Centre National du Cinema" forced to pay 5 million in a common pot, it is picked up by the player entering the box "Advancing the CNC. After turning a lap, the player announces its release of the film (a title at random!) Receives $ 60 million and won the circuit "Exit" from the board. This circuit consists of squares where the player earns money by exposing the cells corresponding maps.
The richest player at the end of play wins.

name: Lingo Bingo
description:
Two phonics bingo games in one. The picture tiles and spinner are double-sided. To play Rhyming Bingo, use the tile and spinner sides with the black border; to play Word Beginnings Bingo, use the sides without the black border.

Rhyming Bingo: one player spins and reads the word out loud. All players check their bingo cards for a word that rhymes. 3 markers in a row wins.

Word Beginnings Bingo: Instead of matching rhyming words, match words that begin with the same sounds.

name: Enfieldopoly
description: Another in the very long line of MONOPOLY games listed here on the geek. This one from 2000 for the town of ENFIELD, CT.Normally used either as an advertizement for the town or as a small fund raiser for some town activity or need.

name: Romferd
description:
A simple Norwegian roll-and-move game. With the help of a die, you fly a space rocket in a race from Earth, around the solar system and back. On about every third of the 100 fields you meet some kind of adventure, like "You run away from giant monsters. Roll once more." or "You land on Mars. Here you take a refreshing bath in one of the channels, rest, and pass one round."

No. 805 from the publisher Saga Kunstforlag.

name: Chasing Charlie
description: Charlie Chaplin is chased around a board that looks similar to Snakes and Ladders of the time. Roll the die and move Charlie and watch his crazy adventures unfold. As players land on certain board spaces, they are either rewarded / elevated, or punished / demoted. The first player to make it to the end wins.

name: Firmenspiele
description:
This game is designed to be played in any workplace, by colleagues or representatives of different departments, in about a minute per workday. The goal is to reach four designated rooms on an office building map and then be the first to reach the "project completed" field.
On each workday, the players can move from the staircase to any empty room - the first player to show up at work can play first, the next ones in order of their appearance. A room that has been reached is marked on a personal success field. When all players have made a move, a random floor is blocked and anyone on that floor cannot go back to the staircase, thus not reach any new room in the next move (on the next workday).

The first player/team to reach the "project completed" field is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Monsieur Cinéma
description:
Game show "Mr. Cinema" of French television, hosted by Pierre Tchernia.
The goal is to earn the most money by hiring actors producing films and answering questions on the film.

The plateau is formed at the center of a track with boxes "action" and boxes for individual players where they can display maps "actors", "actresses" and "directors".
Initially, each receives a capital of 30 000 francs, and a pawn and 5 playing cards Each card represents an actor or a director, with down the list of movies about them, as well as a figure in the top corner.
At each turn the player draws a card, rejects the show and moves his pawn as many spaces shown on the card rejected. According to the box where his token arrives, it can answer a question, start a player (so the corresponding map file on his game plan), place a card on his board director or change one of his cards to another cons the deck (with a penalty of 15 000 francs).

The issues are different values, from 15 000 to 30 000 francs. When a player has collected a card, actor and director corresponding to the same film, he must stop on a box "Projection" to validate his suit and collect dividends. It can then reject all his cards and leave, and departure for a second film.
The game ends when a player has completed at least 2 movies. The richest player wins.

name: Bernard Et Bianca
description:
The goal is to bring the poor Cody from a nest perched a top a mountain to his home.
The plateau is a landscape with a mountain in the center (the nest at the top) separating the game board into 2: one side of the hut Cody, and another is departure for pawns.
Initially, tokens are placed on each square of the board (except the starting boxes and boxes Jake). At each turn the player moves his pawn one square in the direction of his choice, it then returns a token located on a square adjacent to his. Any box with token returned is impracticable; boxes passable by the pegs are empty boxes, boxes with chips and boxes not returned to Jake. The token returned can be used as a token-enabling move by 2 in 4 boxes or token "Albatross" to climb the mountain, these chips are to keep by the player who can use them next round.

Some chips are disadvantageous with either back to square one, or loss of a token already won (penalties or both!), Or the return of Cody on the mountain if the player picked it up. These chips are on the box and make it impassable. Other tokens can counteract the disadvantageous chips.
To win the game you must pick up Cody at the top of the mountain, passing through the passages between the two sides of the plate and bring it back to his cabin, avoiding many pitfalls!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fitte Helden
description:
This is a trivia card game for young children to learn about healthy food. The object is to obtain at least one card of each category. The colors of the cards correspond to different question categories.

There is no game board. Players turn the wheel to decide whet color question they will get.When the player answers correctly he receives the card. A correct answer allows the player to play again. When a player has at least one card of each category, he can play the final round to obtain bronze, silver and gold, to win the game.

name: Pràctic-car
description:
Game to learn the rules of the road. Created by the Federation of Driving Schools in Barcelona. This game is essential to practice driving test questions. You have to answer questions about letters to advance around the board. The board will meet each traffic signals, driving schools, car parks, traffic lights and a whole series of "obstacles" that we will have to overcome to reach the destination square.

---

Juego para aprender las normas de circulación.
Creado por la federación de Autoescuelas de Barcelona.
Este juego es imprescindible para practicar las preguntas del examen de conducir.
Hay que responder a unas cartas de preguntas para poder avanzar por el tablero.
En el tablero encontaremos señales de tráfico, autoescuelas, parkings, semáforos y toda una serie de "obstaculos" que deberemos de sortear para alcanzar la casilla de llegada.

name: Spinning Monsters
description:
A CCG of Monsters released for the super market companies Match, Smatch and Louis Delhaize in Belgium. Each package includes 5 cards with the entire collection existing out of 216 cards.

The rules for the game are simple: Every player takes at least 5 cards face down. Now the first player takes the first card from his deck and plays the power shown in the left upper corner, which all have a specific score. Now the other players take the first card from their own deck and compare the score of the chosen power. The player with the highest score on that characteristic wins the round. The game goes on until one person has won all the cards in the game.

There are alternate rules to play with a bigger deck untill one player has lost 20 cards; Then the one with most cards wins. Or you can play with a toll deciding the power.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: playIT!L v3: Das Wissensspiel basierend auf ITIL v3
description:
You are an IT employee of a company with a large IT-Organisation. Your company is about to introduce ITIL IT Service Management. You lead a project-group of three employees (your three pawns). During your task your coworkers confront you with difficult questions about the introduction of IT Service Management. Good that you know your stuff. Better to know your stuff really good! Your goal is to lead all your employees through your company (gameboard), so that they can do their job. You start in your department and move clockwise through the company. Guide your coworkers through the house and bring them safely back to your department! The first to return his three coworkers to his department wins playIT!L.

The game couples the mechanics of Pachisi with Knowledge and Event cards about ITIL.

Possible target groups:


You know ITIL2 and would like to learn bout ITIL3
You know nothing about ITIL and want to learn about ITIL v3
You have a ITIL Foundation education and want to refresh your knowledge
You are about to introduce ITIL and want to create some awareness about ITIL

name: Let's Go
description: Simple race game. From the box "Walt Disney's Big Track Meet with the 4 World Champions". (in this case Goofy, Donald, Mickey and Pluto). You spin the "Speedometer Dial" and move ahead by whatever you spin. There are a couple of obstacles that you must roll past in order to get over them.

name: Moving Forward
description:
This is an "executive" board game created for Burlington Socks. The object of the game is to be the first player to reach $1 million or more in sales.
You move around the game board, and follow the instructions on each space you land on, normally resulting in gaining or losing sales. You have two counters to keep track of your sales totals on tables located in the center of the board. First player to reach $1 million in sales wins.

name: The Vassar Boat Race
description:
This is a very simple race game which features Woman's Sculling.

Spin the spinner and move around the track.

Cross the finish line first to win the game

name: Dam Breakers
description: Print and Play dice game of dam busting in WW2. Play starts as your planes enters a bombing run. you roll D6 die for height, as you can drop a bomb from the correct height. This simulates the lights from front and rear of the plane converging at the correct height. Then you roll a D6 for speed and move your plane forward. every move attracts flak fire. when your bomb hits the water Roll D6s to bounce -- if you hit a torpedo net it's a miss, but if you bounce over the nets it is a hit and you reduce the dam strength. But that's not all of it -- your plane has to achieve correct height and speed to exit or you will crash.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Clown Around
description:
Rotate the clown spinner on the board. When it stops and points to a square, take the corresponding card from the pack.

The player must act what is represented on the card.

The other player will decide how well you act and use your imagination. If the show was good, they will award you the points indicated on the card.

name: Universal Power
description:
User Summary

"Universal Power is a fantasy game of chance in which 2 to 8 players compete for wealth and influence to become a world power while trying to avoid scandal."

The circular vinyl playing surface has four concentric rings. From the outermost to the innermost they are: Money, Influence, Scandal, and Power.

All players start in the Money ring. They roll and move and attempt to accumulate cash by encountering different spaces on the game board. (A healthy $500 million is required in the last step of the game, so players will spend a fair amount of time in this ring.)

When a player feels that she has the resources to deal with the hazards of the next step in the game, she moves her pawn to the Scandal ring. At this point, chance dictates the various pitfalls the player will encounter in the spaces of this area. There are Penalty and Bonus spaces in this ring that require players to draw cards from the Penalty and Bonus decks. (These generally involve gaining or loosing money.)

The Power ring provides players with the possibility of recovering funds lost in the Scandal ring.

The first player to finish their turn in the center of the Power ring with $500 cash on hand wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Buy A Week the Vacation Game
description: Players roll dice and play cards to buy and exchange vacation time shares, with the goal of visiting the most locations. From the cover: "The game that takes you around the globe and lets you experience the exciting world of resort time sharing and vacation exchange."

name: Le Contrat Impossible!
description:
Le Contrat Impossible ("the impossible contract") is a roll-and-move game set in the "Gaston Lagaffe" comics universe. One of the running gags of the Gaston Lagaffe comic books involves a businessman, Demesmaeker visiting the office building in which Gaston work to sign contracts with Gaston's boss, Prunelle. Each time the contracts are about to be signed Gaston screws up or tests one of his inventions and the contracts are ruined.

In the game, the player roll dice and move around the board, attempting to collect three Contracts cards representing Lagaffe, Demesmaeker and Prunelle. Once the three cards are gathered, the player must exchange them for a "Signed Contracts" cards and take it to the photocopier to win. Cards are drawn or taken from other players according to the board space the player lands on. If a player can't give a card to another player, he receives a "blunder" token. If he has three, he exchanges his blunder tokens for the "mega-blunder" card, which prevents him from getting a "Signed Contracts" card or using the photocopier. The only way of getting rid of a "mega-blunder" card is to wait until another player gets it.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: El Joc de Lleida
description:
The Game of Lleida (A Catalonian city) is a family game that shows how the citizens live and trade in the city. Acquire and buy the best commerce-locations and stores in Lleida. In this way you may also learn the main streets are and locate the best known places in the city. The goal of the game is to buy seven commerce or stores and return to its exit square.

The Game of Lleida is a Monopoly-like game.


El Joc de Lleida és un joc familiar que reprodueix el dia a dia del comerç a la ciutat de Lleida. Adquirint i comprant el comerços de la ciutat o els que tenen a vora de casa. D'aquesta manera s'aprenen a situar el carrers principals i els llocs més coneguts. L'objetiu del joc és comprar 7 comerços i tornar a la seva casella de sortida.

Joc de Lleida es un juego tipo Monopoly.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Story Time A Sequence Story Game
description: Each player has a pool of cards depicting a portion of a scene. On a player's turn, the player takes stock of their cards with an eye toward matching what they have with the cards that are in the center of the group. The mass of cards depicts a larger series of events, mostly involving kids at play. As there is only one correct way to piece the cards together, play is similar to putting together a puzzle. The player to get rid of all their cards first is the winner.

name: Rol D Dice
description:
Rol D Dice consists of 6 dice and a dice tray. Players play singly or in teams.
The object of the game is to get exactly 9000 points.
Each player rolls all 6 dice. Each roll must have at least one of a listed combination to count points. Each turn must reach at least 500 points to count. Players may continue rolling as long as each roll has either a one or a five. Failure to roll a one or a five means the turn passes to the left. Players may pass on any turn or on any turn after a roll.

name: Canal de Castilla
description:
A mid-eighteenth century began in Spain one of the largest and most important engineering works of the period, both Spain and Europe. The dream of uniting the Castilian plain to the sea became a reality by 207 km, which passed into history as El Canal de Castilla /Channel of Castile. The channel served primarily for transport the grain produced in Castile to the port, many industries emerged, so developed a major industrial activity. Who will be the constructor of the main channels? Who will transports in their barges the largest number of goods or passengers? Who will owns most prosperous industries? ...

Canal de Castilla is a game for 2-4 players. Players must build channels linking the villages, carrying goods and passengers through the canal. Before, they must get the necessary barges and even build flour mills. The game takes place since 1753 (start of work) until 1959 (end use). At this time, the player with the most points wins the game.

The game is also educational as it wants to teach and explore this part of the history to the public.


A mediados del siglo XVIII se inicia en España una de las mayores y más importantes obras de ingeniería de la época, tanto de España como de Europa. El sueño de unir la meseta castellana con el mar, se hizo realidad a través de 207 Km., que pasaron a la historia como El Canal de Castilla. Sirvió principalmente para llevar el grano producido en Castilla hasta el puerto, muchas industrias surgieron a su alrededor desarrollándose una importante actividad industrial, pero ¿serás tu quién construya los principales canales, quién transporte en sus barcazas el mayor número de mercancías o viajeros, quién posea las industrias más prósperas?...

Canal de Castilla es un juego para 2-4 jugadores. Los jugadores deben construir rutas que unan los pueblos transportando mercancías y viajeros por el canal. Antes han debido conseguir las barcazas necesarias e incluso construir harineras. El juego se desarrolla desde 1753 (inicio de las obras) hasta 1959 (final de su utilización). En este momento, el jugador que tenga más puntos ganará la partida.

El juego es también didáctico ya que quiere enseñar y descubrir esta parte de la historia al público.

name: Fashion Rules
description:
Players move around the board and answer the trivia questions about fashion like "Who is the most famous supermodel?" and "who started Vogue?" and collecting accessories (board pieces) to drop in your shopping bag. Collect the most accessories and you’re on your way down the catwalk, the new Boardwalk.

The object of the game is to collect all four different accessory items: shoe, scissors, camera, and sunglasses while testing your fashion knowledge. Whoever reaches the runway first and correctly answers the Strictly Fashionista question wins!

name: Olympic Tennis
description:
Olympic tennis, features complete data for all olympic tennis tournaments from 1984 onward. There are data for both singles and doubles, men and women tournaments. The system is a derivation of the one used in Head to Head tennis (TCS), but without cards for each single player.
Basically, after tossing a coin to decide who's to serve, roll a percentage dice on the service value of the player involved, and if the result is in the correct range, he wins the game. Otherwise, the chance to win the game passes to the opponent, that rolls on his Return value. If both players fails, game goes checking other values, until one player wins the game.
There are special rules for tie-break and a random event table, that may strongly modify the result of a game, a set or even the entire match.

The game comes as a pdf of 28 pages and it is sold directly by Roberto Chiavini (pumaye@gmail.com to contact

name: Wordopoly
description: Wordopoly: the game that won't leave you speechless! Circle the board and encounter foreign words, abbreviations, clichés, pithy humor, and vocabulary words from English classes of past. Does "magnanimous" mean full of spite or generous and noble? Answer correctly and advance towards the spelling bee. The first player to acquire a complete set of word definitions wins the game! This game is a great way to fall in love with language. The 770 vocabulary words included in the game are historically found with the highest frequency on the verbal portions of standardized tests such as the SAT, adding function to its fun.

name: Pricey Dice
description:
Pricey Dice is a dice game in which players try to collect as many golden dice with the highest values as possible, for as little silver as possible.

What makes Pricey Dice different from other dice games is the way in which golden dice can be payed for with silver dice. The silver dice have to be used to make each of the digits of the amount that the golden dice are worth. Players can add, subtract, divide and multiply the number of pips shown on the silver D6 dice. An example: 4 divided by 4 equals 1, whereas 4 minus 4 equals zero, and so on.

The trick is to try and get the gold using as few silver dice as possible. But beware players that try to use even less silver dice as they get the opportunity to do free rerolls!

Running out of silver? Sell off some gold at a loss to get some back... But don't sell too much because the player with the most gold wins in the end!

name: Orðamaus
description:
Orðamaus is a word card game where each card has a letter or two letters or is a wildcard and each card has a value (5, 10, 15 and 25). Use the cards to make words and add the value of the cards used when a new word is made. Included are 87 letter cards, 4 blank cards and 5 rules cards.

From the publisher: Orðamaus is a fun game for players of every age. The goal is to make words with the letters and collect points. The player with most poinst wins. The game is simple, exciting, and increases both vocabulary and understanding of the language.

name: Phonogram
description:
A word game with a difference! -- Phonogram focusses on the phonetic pronunciation of words, rather than their spelling!

Designed for EFL (English as a Foreign Language) students, Phonogram has also been a hit among English language educators as a quick and fun way to improve knowledge and use of the IPA (International Phonetic Alphabet)

Using a colour-coded selection of 210 phoneme tiles, each player works independently to create their own 'crossword' (no board required). When a player uses up all their letters, all players take a new tile from the pool. When all the tiles are gone, the first player to use up all the tiles in their hand wins.

The game is suitable for solo, group and team play, and may be adjusted to reflect different accents and even other languages that can be expressed in basic IPA phonemes.

name: Beach Breach
description:
Beach Breach is a Solitaire Beach Invasion game played with dice. Your men are invading the breach and are actual D6 Dice.

You start out with all your Men(D6s) onboard invasion boats, your task is to get to the bunkers before all your men are machinegunned. you have a small amount of shelter with some obsticles.

Actual Play is done by rotateing your D6s(men) to a number or pip(each D6 can be different) now you throw a D6 for the Machine gun and all matching Men(D6s) in the fireing zone are removed, now your remaining Men may move closer by 1 square.

2 players can play this fun game by one playing the invader and one choosing secretly the machine gun value
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jabokni
description:
Jabokni is a word game where two or more players draw playing pieces and place them on the board to form words. The first three playing pieces decide the order of the players and form the "word bank".

Each player, in turn, draws one playing piece, places it on the board and declares a word. The player scores one point per letter of the word declared. The other player(s) each declare a different word and score one point per letter of the declared word.

Play then passes to the next player and play ends when there are no more playing pieces left to play.

Jabokni consists of a board and fifteen articulated playing pieces. The playing pieces are designed so that any two playing pieces can be put together to form at least one word in the English language. The only other rules are that the playing piece laid must touch on at least two edges, the words declared on any one turn must use at least one letter from the playing piece last laid and that if the playing piece laid results in touching sets of half octagons, then the words declared must use at least one letter from each set of half octagons.

name: Husker Sports Trivia
description:
From the box:
The object of the game is to complete a score card by answering trivia questions from five different categories and be the first to cross the finish line with a completed score card. But watch out! You must avoid setbacks and potential disasters brought on by your opponents as they try to complete their score cards and cross the finish line before you.

name: Auto Ambush!
description: Auto Ambush! could be loosely described as a set collection game with an element of Slapjack. The goal of the game is to collect a set of 4 identical Hot Wheels rides; each player is limited to a hand of 4 cards, from which they simultaneously exchange any cards they wish from their hand, one card at a time, for any card on the table, including cards discarded by other players in the same round.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Neteru
description:
The sister game to Junishi, 12 Moons and Zodiakos,
Neteru is an abstract strategy game inspired by the 12 signs of the Egyptian Zodiac. (Each player controls 6 of the 12 signs.)

The object of Neteru is to move one of your 6 pieces into your opponent's Gate, which is located at the opposite end of the board, in between your opponent's Spawn Areas.

Players begin at either end of a board comprised of 23 circles.
At the start of the game there are not any pieces on the board. Any pieces that a player wishes to use must be "spawned" in one of the Spawn Circles on that player's side of the board.
Players may move the pieces that they already have on the board either by moving them into adjacent circles or by jumping over friendly pieces.
Players also may use their animals to capture their opponent's animals by jumping over them.

Neteru is a simple and fast paced abstract strategy game that is easy to learn and usually plays in under 20 minutes. It comes in a little cloth bag that also serves as the game board
and it can be carried in any pocket that is big enough to hold a pack of gum.

Neteru is a complete game that can be expanded by combining it with its sister games Junishi, 12 Moons, and Zodiakos.
(source : the publisher)

Integrates with:

12 Moons



Junishi



Zodiakos

name: Wi$eMoney
description:
Wi$eMoney is a fun learning game for students. It reduces lectures, puts teachers in a role to reinforce learning, and facilitates discussions on personal finance through problem-based learning to keep students involved and active.
Player teams compete by answering questions on banking, investing, budgeting, planning, financing, credit, and safety and identify protection and by making financial choices to distinguish between needs and wants.

Components:

Game board
Cards and game elements

name: Sovereign: An open source board game project
description:
The main objective of the game is to collect seven of one type of victory card. Players must balance their play between researching technologies, expanding cities and building units. Having only a limited number of actions per turn, it is important for players to consider their activities carefully so that they maximize their ability to collect cards. The first player to collect seven of one type of victory card wins the game.

This game is based on hex-grid map boards and players can choose which sections of the map to assemble. Currently there are maps of Europe and the Caribbean, although plans for future maps will cover the entire world. Players lay tiles down to form cities and can build military units to protect them or attack others. Cities create the wealth that a player needs to further their empire.

Players take turns to perform their moves, building their empire up while keeping a close eye on their neighbors to prevent them beating them to the end. Open play allows players to watch other players activities, and manage resources in way that can stop other players winning while not hindering their own advancement.

The game has been designed to give flexibility to the rules so that players can develop in-house versions of the rules without breaking the game. One popular alteration is in the collection of cards. Players can change the speed and dynamic of the game by changing how many and of which types of card need to be collected.

The game is fully customizable allowing players to design their own versions including army units, maps, technologies and rules. The online published version of the game can be downloaded and printed off for free.

Released under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike licence.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Bio Grafo The Biography Game of Skill and Chance
description:
75 well-known authors and one work each is known for is the basis of this Bingo-type 'educational' game. Each player gets one of 40 'GRAFO' cards, a 5 by 5 grid where each square has an author number, an author's name, and his or her image. The caller randomly pulls from the stock of 75 tokens, and reads aloud the column letter (G, R, A, F, or O) and title of a play, book, poem, or short story and optionally the author number. If the author of that work is on his or her card, a player marks that square with a translucent disk, hoping to be the first to get five in a row. Can be played in three difficulty levels:

1) Playing by the numbers. The caller reads the column letter, title, and author number. This makes the game no harder than Bingo with some trivia thrown in.

2) Playing by the book. The caller omits the author number, but players have access to a "Bio/graphics" booklet in which they can find the author of the named work.

3) Playing for mastery. Players no longer have access to the book and have to recall from memory the author of the named work.

A player calls "Grafo" when he or she covers five squares in a row on his or her card, and once verified is declared the winner.

name: Valley Forge II: A Supplement to Valley Forge
description:
Information compiled from the website tomeoftreasures.com with information from the designer.

This game is essentially an "errata section" for TSR's game Valley Forge, a game released at GenCon for the 1976 Bi-Centennial. However, this game product was self-published by the designer Dave Wesely as he was being called into the US Army. He hired former TSR employee David R. Megarry to work out the details. Combined with Valley Forge, this provides 44 pages of tactical rules.

Some copies were sold bundled with TSR's Valley Forge.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Geronimo
description:
One player rolls five dice (each side of the die bearing a different color). The result is called "Geronimo". All players will ante chips into the pot. Each player will then ante another chip and then attempt to match the Geronimo. If three of the five dice match, he may reroll the remaining two. If one of the two match, he may then take a third roll of the remaining die. If the dice match the Geronimo, the player wins the pot. During play, other combinations of dice may win the player lesser rewards from the pot.

The game is over when the pot is exhausted and the winner has the most chips.

name: Dragon Egg Omelet
description:
A simple push-your-luck dice game, Dragon Egg Omelet (or Omelette, depending on where one lives) tasks players with searching dragon nests to collect eggs required in a very rare omelet for an ornery king (with quite a specific culinary palate).

Try to gather the necessary dragon eggs before the other players without rousing the adult dragons who guard those eggs.

Components: 6 dice, 40 dragon eggs, instructions, portable carrying case.

Gameplay involves rolling sets of dragon eggs (pips) with the dice, avoiding the faces that display dragons, and pushing your luck to gain eggs and decide whether to continue rolling for more eggs or play it safe and quit for the round.

name: Dice BattleShips with Land n Air 07
description:
The game is played on a board like a large chess board, The game board included is just an example You make a board to suit the battle.

The pieces are regular dice d6. The are three different colors that represent Navy (blue), Army (green), Air Force (white). As you play your troops will suffer casualties , You rotate the dice to reduce the strength of a piece.

The object of the game is to control the board, or to eliminate the enemy. You move your troops by aiding each other -- Navy can transport Army, Air Force planes can air-lift Army, Air Force planes can land on carriers, et c.

Game-play is simply
When a unit is adjacent to an enemy unit in your turn you may attack, an attack is resolved by adding all the strengths of the attacking units in the battle, then subtracting the combined enemy strength to reach a positive or negative battle-score. The attacker and defender roll a d6 for further support and add or subtract the numbers from the battle-score total. A positive result allows the attacker to reduce the enemy force by that number, and a negative battle-score allows the defending player to do the same.

At the beginning of every turn, a d6 is rolled, this gives the current player one of six combat advantages:
1) bomb any land unit and reduce by 2.
2) move any unit by 3
3) add 1 to every combat this turn
4) build a friendly airfield , next to ant land unit
5) fighter attack reduce any plane unit by 2
6) hide any unit for 2 turns

The game also includes optional rules for mines.

name: Trivia
description: The object of the game is to correctly answer questions in specific categories. Firstly set a time limit for the game or decide to play for a certain number of cards. The first player spins the spinner to determine which category of question they should answer on that turn. The Random Choice space on the spinner means the player can choose a category. The player to their left then takes a card from the question pile and asks the question, if guessed correctly the player marks it down on their score pad and gets another question. Once they answer wrongly play passes to the next player.

name: Acting Up
description: The object of the game is to act out the words from your cards to your team and see how many they can guess. Players divide into teams and decide on a time limit for each mime. The first player from team A takes a mime card and spins the spinner, they then try to act out the words on that category card to their team, each correct guess wins a point.

name: Junior Magazin
description:
Four favorite games for children:

Footballmatch - Just like in a real football game two teams try to defeat one another by scoring the highest possible number of goals within a set course of time.

Ring Game - An easy, but very attractive game of dice by which each player tries to claim rings of the same color from the starting points of his opponents and saves them up at his own starting point. Luck at throwing the oracular die and the tactics at choosing the colored rings ensure diversified and exciting rounds. The first player who manages to place 3 rings of the same color on his starting point wins the game.

Cat and Mouse - An asymmetric game where one player plays the cat, and the rest of the players (up to 4 others) control the mice. The cat wins when she is able to capture all mice. The mice win when one mouse succeeds at arriving at the winning point.

Car Race - A game of dice for 2 to 4 players from the age of 6 on. Players take turns rolling and moving up according to the number on the dice.

name: Follow Your Heart...Get Street Smart
description: The objective of the game is to leave from home to one of four destinations and return to "Home Sweet Home" safely. There are four places and/or destinations that one may travel: playground, mall, school, playmate's house. In order to make the trip without being delayed, you must correctly answer a series of questions. Correct answers are highlighted with the category color. The player who returns home first with the correct answers is the winner!

name: Treason
description:
Treason is a 2 players game. Each participant will build up its influence in a medieval town, ultimately, resulting in the deposition of the king. As the game progresses intrigue, allegiances, conspiracy, combat, cunning and treason occur.

You must allure strong allies to your hand by doing successful quests for them; or buy favours of some society members in order to sabotage your competitor’s game. Do business with witches, knights, thieves, assassins, merchants and many other society members. Secretly conspire against your opponent. Acquire items to increase the chances of achieving success in quests or create unexpected setbacks to your opponent. The player who ends the game with the largest number of influence points (gained either by doing tasks or by performing dirty jobs) is the one that will take the King’s throne and wins the game.

No matter your background or social status, victory is only a step away.

Game play

In this game, the players draw cards from several decks – tasks, allies/quest, influence/conspiracy and store decks. The accumulation of influence is of extreme importance and the players will do this by performing assignments, dictated by tasks cards. This will increase their coins and reputation. They also have the possibility of either using their character’s skills to perform quests for members of society, by drawing quest cards, or machinate evil plans against its opponents, by drawing cards from a conspiracy deck. There’s also the possibility of buying items that will aid players perform quests by adding bonus points to base character skills, such as combat points and services that will allow to affect dramatically the other player’s game.

During a turn, each player will follow a stream of steps originated by the cards drawn from each deck. Luck and careful planning work hand in hand in this game.
Goal
The game’s goal is to increase one’s influence in this medieval society and alluring powerful allies. Players will accumulate influence (see above) by perfoming honest tasks, dirty jobs for important members of society and attracting allies to your cause. Ultimately the King’s deposition will happen as soon as he is stripped of social, military and political support.

name: Kreuz-Junge
description:
"Toste"-Spiel KREUZ-JUNGE!

The curious and multi-purpose game of all games. Educational, funny and exciting!

The game contains 6 wooden dice with playing cards symbols + numbers and special instructions like "roll again". And a rulebook with some games:

Yes and No (answer-game): If you need a answer (Yes or no) roll the special dice unless the 35(Yes) or 36(No) appears. or you roll "Try again" or "Don't roll again, today"

For the "Orakel zu Delphi" roll all dice and compare the numbers with the table in the rulebook.

The other 8 games from the rulebook can be played with more players. The games called: Kreuz-Junge, Wettspiel, Farbenkrieg, Monte Carlo, Wohnung gesucht, Die gute Sieben, Jagd nach dem Glück, Königsjagd.

The object of all those games are to roll the most points, the games varies from how those points are made. For example in the game "Die gute Sieben" all the Ace counts (One Ace is 10, 2 Ace are 100, 3 Ace are 500 and 4 Ace are 1000 points) All players roll 5 rounds and the one with the most points win.
The game "Monte Carlo" uses the numbers on the dice. All rolled even numbers counts 10, all other 0, a series of 3 numbers ( 1-2-3 or 17-18-19) counts 100 points. The player who reaches 500 points first wins.

name: The Little Big Game of Shmoozel
description:
Players are dealt a hand of ten cards, each of which is a letter of the alphabet worth a number of points (there are also a few wild cards). Players try to empty their hands by spelling five-letter (or longer) words using their letter cards. They can also add letters to their own previously played words (although they cannot rearrange the letters): for example, adding S, ED, or ING to WRECK.

Each turn players draw two cards and must discard one. Players may also take letters from the discard pile, but these must be used immediately -- and all discards prior to the one they take must be taken into their hand.

A round ends when a player goes out by spelling a word plus having one card to discard. Points from exposed words are totaled; points from letters held in the hand are subtracted unless they can be dumped into words (which are worth nothing).

A complete game consists of four rounds. Highest point total is the winner. Note: spelling SHMOOZE is worth 50 points and spelling SHMOOZELED is worth 250 points -- a bit of a balance wrecker.

name: Teen-Trepreneur
description:
The board game for business studies.

In Teen-Trepreneur students choose to run one of six businesses in the game and are given the challenge of leading it to business success! Each business is different in terms of its opening value and start-up capital; each entrepreneur has a personality and business background that will also affect the chances of success.

The objective for students is to be the first to achieve £5,000 profit. They’ll only do that if they take risks and manage sales and costs effectively. Students can run a luxurious hotel or an everyday market stall. They can even invest in the businesses run by other players!

The game contains features such as: generating sales, expenses, the stock market, investment, opening businesses abroad, loans and interest. It helps raise a young person’s understanding about how a business is started and how a business is being run in today’s world.

name: Orthocon: The Definitive Word Game
description:
Players roll and move on a board, answering spelling and word-definition questions to advance. The player that reaches one of the final spaces and correctly answers that final challenge is the winner.

There are three colors on the board corresponding to "cowardly" (yellow), "bold" (blue), and "superhuman" (red) levels of word difficulty (plus black spaces, which end a player's turn immediately). A player landing on a colored space must correctly spell AND define a word from a card corresponding to that color. If a player does both, they may roll (2 dice) and advance again to answer another challenge. If they get one part wrong, they must roll 1 die and move backward that amount (and their turn ends). If they get both wrong, they must roll 2 dice and move backward that amount (and their turn ends).

name: [yellow tail]-opoly
description:
[yellow tail]-opoly is marketing/promotional board game released by Casella Wines, who produce [yellow tail] wine. It is a wine-themed derivative of Monopoly and is similar to Wineopoly in many respects. From the game's own description:

"Buy and trade your favourite [yellow tail] wines, build your own winery and discover the little wine brand that could. Learn as you play! Each deed contains information and great Roo facts about our wines and winery. Test your [yellow tail] knowledge. Do you know how to make a [yellow tail] BUBBLES sangria? Grab another card and you could be sharing a glass with our Managing Director -- John Casella. The winery is still 100% family owned with three generations currently involved. Play by your rules because it's all about having fun! Be careful not to be sent to the WINE CELLAR -- you may never get out! So choose your token and advance to CHEERS! Who knows...you could be elected president of the [yellow tail] games club!!!"
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Boston-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

GRACEFUL, INTELLIGENT, CHEERFUL, ATHLETIC...
MEET THE BOSTON!

Boston Terriers have strong, friendly personalities. They are highly intelligent, energetic, happy-go-lucky dogs that literally live for their human companions. They are very popular in the United States, due above all to their excellent character. With patience and assertiveness, Boston’s are easily trained and will become a cherished member of any family.

Boston-opoly is a game of tail-wagging fun! Collect your favorite Bostons and play hard!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the Kennel!

Grab your token and advance to GO Bostons! Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or hanging out by the fire hydrant!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Boxer-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

BRAVE, COURAGEOUS, LOYAL, FUN-LOVING CLOWN... MEET THE BOXER!

A Boxer is all that is good in a dog! Developed in the late 19th century in Germany to act as a guard and companion, the Boxer has carried these traits admirably through its history. While they are certainly boisterous by nature, their intelligence is up there with the best of them. They fit easily into family life and thrive on being one of the "pack". Devoted and fearless, Boxers have an endless capacity to give love!

BOXER-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE BOXERS AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet... get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO BOXERS!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or dancing with your Boxer in a tutu! Whatever happens, keep your wag on!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Bulldog-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

GENTLE, COURAGEOUS, DEVOTED, AFFECTIONATE... MEET THE BULLDOG!

Known for their loose-jointed, shuffling gait and massive, short-faced head, the bulldog is a sweet tempered family companion. A medium-sized dog, they are not your typical lap dog, but would like to be! Said to have originated in the British Isles, the name "bull" was applied because of the dog’s connection with bull baiting. Bullheaded and determined, this breed can be very persistent. They do not give up easily. Bulldogs are very much a peoples’ dog, seeking out human attention and loving every bit they can get!

BULLDOG-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAILWAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE BULLDOGS AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet... get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO BULLDOGS!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or dancing with your bulldog in a tutu! Whatever happens, keep your wag on!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Eezee Kricket
description:
From the Press release at launch, Eezee Kricket is "The Teaching Learning Game."

It is a fairly simple roll-and-move game where the player moves his pawn around an 8x8 grid, following the instructions on the given square. If the square shows that the batsman is out, then the player must answer a trivia question - if he fails to answer correctly, then he is out, but if he gets it right, he continues.

The trivia questions are all cricket based, specifically pertaining to cricket in the West Indies and require at least an interest in West Indian cricket to be able to have a chance of getting them right.

name: Transport Manager 2100
description:
Transport management card game of the future!

1. Compete for better contracts to service city transportation needs.
2. Manage your transportation network using busses trains or airplanes.
3. Choose between different fuel types to find the best balance between making profit and fuel payments.
4. Bribe politicians and choose your benefits from the government.
5. Finally trade with stocks, to get extra profit and better discounts from different companies.

Turn sequence
To determine player sequence, start with politics turn. Bet to bribe ministers and choose new laws, to give your company the edge over your competitors. Next turn is "Stock market", starting with the player, who did not bribe any ministers. Buy/sell two stocks at a time. Continue with “Vehicle market” turn, starting from highest bribed minister, buy different fuel type vehicles, that are linked with cities, find best combinations, for bigger profit. Next round all players gather profit from their transportation networks and stocs NOTE: Starting from every “politics” turn players will receive three “sell company shares” cards to make some extra cash. Shares can be sold to the bank any time and cannot be bought back. Game lasts total of three rounds.

End of the game:
A player with the most amount of victory points wins the game,
Points are rewarded for:
Vehicles
Stocks
Every 1m in cash
Bribed ministers during last round
Points are reduced for every "sell company shares" card used.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding
